S43qIUQyDeYZ8ofWZfakuA.text: TIP ON ORDERING STEAK: If you want a bigger cut of meat, get it rare to medium-rare.   Otherwise, if you order your meat medium-well, you get a smaller cut in order for it to cook well in the middle  I couldn't decide on a steak that night, and I wanted a little variety.  So I ordered a combination of 2 appetizers and a soup.  Soup: Lobster bisque was awesome mainly because they weren't stingy with the lobster meat.  Often when you order a seafood soup (e.g. clam chowder) they dump a lot of potatoes or other filling in there.  Not the case with this bisque.  A must for any bisque or lobster connoisseur.  Appetizer 1: Butternut squash ravioli w/duck was very tasty, and again, not stingy with the duck, which kind of looked like pulled pork but with duck meat.  Appetizer 2: Crawfish meat w/Crystal pepper sauce over linguine could have been a small meal in itself.  And just the right amount of that Crystal Hot Sauce to give it a solid Southern kick.  This was probably my favorite.  I did have a taste of the various meats too including the T-bone and filet mignon, both of which I recommend.  You don't get anything with it, so unless you just want meat, you'll probably need to order a side dish or two.

5r4q82W5BRc7mPqfWz0hBA.text: Good food.  Great steak/beef tartare (did I spell that correctly?).  Pretty darn good service as well.  From an ambience standpoint, this place is leagues better than Prime (not too many tables, decent lighting, not a lot of room noise) but not as cool as some of the newer rooms in Vegas.  All in all, a good place to go for steak.

LF0y6aj1Zb5M4KKUmtTUpA.text: We stayed at the venetian and as a very special treat had reservations for the hubby's birthday.    We received warm friendly smiles as soon as we arrived and were quickly at our table for 4.    I ordered a Filet Mignon medium rare with country smashed potatoes.  we also had the best prepared Caesar salad ever to encounter my taste buds made table side.    The steak just literally melted in my mouth.  I was in utter awe and in an orgasmic state.  With each tantalizing bite I felt I was being lifted into food heaven.  This was hands down the best Filet Mignon I have had thus far!  Our Server was kind funny and on point.  The wine selection is impressive and we had our two bottles to the last drop:)  Hey we were celebrating remember(hubby's bday)  I satisfyingly finished my meal off with a homemade sorbet This will be a memorable moment locked away in my taste buds memory!

EVC_J3tghZw5rZX09oHlZA.text: This Emeril namesake kicks ass.  Tableside caesar isnt my favorite ive ever had but its unique.  All the steaks at our table were perfectly prepared (including a non-butterflied Medium well steak).  Ambiance was free of "BAM!", very rich, elegant, a little loud, but leaves little to be desired.   Service was excellent, insane wine list, insane coffee list, limited Emeril.  I will be back here for another special occasion or business dinner soon.

3rz3oWiqgwCdyTt-Jpjrew.text: The Gist:   The most expensive steak does NOT equal the best tasting steak.       Played in Vegas with a group of 8 other friends.  Even though there is so much good food to choose from in Vegas, all of us knew we wanted to go to a nice place for some good steak during our stay.    We've heard a lot of good things about Delmonico so it was pretty easy decision to try it out.     First things first.  Service was great.   We came late for our reservation.  No problem.   Some of us actually shared a couple steaks.  No problem.   Took pictures for us during a busy Saturday night.  No problem.  The important thing - the steak.   With 8 people around the table we were able to try various cuts.   Several guys got the bone-in rib eye.   One of the girls got the rib-eye, and I personally shared the new york strip with a friend.    I feel like I'm paying a premium for Vegas and/or Emeril.     Don't get me wrong, you'll definitely get a nice fat, juicy, flavorful steak here.     But I felt like I was getting more of my money's worth with the Kona Crusted Steak at Capital Grille (Chicago) or the Cowboy Cut at Taste of Texas (Houston).    The meat quality was much better and believe it or not, much more flavorful than Delmonico's steaks.  That being said, if you do go to Dominico's, definitely get the sautee'd mushrooms on the side.   Its a nice garlicky mix of mushrooms that compliments perfectly with the steaks!

v8QPs6AaixrqXvC5rHqUrQ.text: So when you go to a restaurant like this please expect a bit of a drawn out dinner, I think it was two and a half hours for our large party. Many said it was the best food they had in their life, and it was really wonderful. I will say that the appetizers had far more imagination than the main course which was a bit deflating.   We went after a long day at a convection and most of us were tired and slightly delirious so the service being a tad slow made the dinner feel very much like The Cook, The Thief, His Wife and Her Lover. They do the thing where they set all the plates at once and the glasses never went empty and the wine list is to die for, they had a 15000 dessert wine that dated before the Titanic.   One star is really for the main course not living up the expectations set previously.

qDKUk9U65JsvZ7gGHhmp3g.text: Even though many people don't like Emeril, I actually like him (and his show) because it's entertaining.  So, I naturally had to try this place.  I liked the service and the ambiance at the restaurant.  Food was delicious, but not to the point where I would return for a second outing.  I asked the host if I can pick up my bone-in steak with my hand and eat.  His answer: "Only if you lift up your pinky."  Ha, clever!  Food + Wine for two people came out to just under $200 before tip.  Thank you to my wonderful friend in Las Vegas for paying for this dinner!

svvRSSWYAlVeLdMTDBZUKw.text: Lobster bisque - 2 stars, lacks the BAM I was expecting from Emeril.  I've had better bisque at most average restaurants  Delmonico Ribeye Steak - 5 stars, perfectly cooked and so flavorful and juicy.  Price? Expect to hand over a Benjamin to the waiter per person with appetizer, wine, and dessert.

zhUBEwS7cbDj6W9rakGsDw.text: Excellent food and service. The only thing I did not love was the egg on my Wilted Spinach & Frisee salad. It was poached and then coated with bread crumbs and fried which cooked the yolk completly. Not good on this type of salad. Try the creamed corn it is delicious.

svbEFajZRbdMyKXWHDk8Bg.text: Our last night in Vegas & my daughter & I went to Delmonico for dinner.  The service was tops, our waiter Frank was the best!  We had the barbecue shrimp appetizer-excellent!  So tasty and the sauce--so good!  My daughter ordered the NY sirloin and I ordered the lobster bisque.  The steak was superb; like cutting butter and seasoned perfectly.  Unfortunately, I became suddenly ill totally unrelated to the food and had to leave for a bit.  When I returned Frank, our waiter seemed quite concerned and brought me a club soda.  Sadly I wasn't able to eat my meal or have the banana cream pie I had dreamed about sharing with my daughter.  I was not charged for my bisque or the club soda; which I really expected to pay for.  The care and courtesy extended to me was so appreciated!  Emeril should be proud of your employees especially Frank!  Thank you all so much!!!

pV4ycNgQ3xcULvF19ch3Pw.text: Looking for a good steakhouse while in Vegas we found this place in our hotels restaurant guide. Being a celebrity chefs place I had my doubts but will always try something at least once. Delmonico did not disappoint, they delivered on par excellent service and quality food in a classy but intimate ambiance. We have already arranged to go back in the coming Vegas trip. The steaks, as you would expect, were above expectations in taste, searing, and quality of beef. Most importantly in order to enjoy a good meal you need impeccable service along with it. It was the kind of service that is very professional and classy but in a way that makes you feel welcome and comfortable, not stiff and robotic. Its an experience you have to try for yourself that you won't regret. The NY strip will turn a vegetarian!

p7_Xg_T0fGLndzPyke2UjA.text: Ok, this is a lunch review..... I have had many burgers in my day and let me tell you, THIS IS THE BEST BURGER I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE. It takes around 20 minutes to prepare, so bring your patience with you....the beef that they use must come from heaven, because this burger is so tender juicy and flavorful.... I could eat another one right now... or maybe half... Thats about all I got through on this....  Its HUGE.....  its $18 bucks and I really didnt care at all when I paid because i felt like this was wellllll worth the money.....  and definitely order the Parmesan chips with truffle oil.... fantastic!!!

0hlQDsU5ggE4MHkNYwVSSA.text: We spent our 24th wedding anniversery in Vegas and had to make a return to Delmonico since we had not been there sice 2008. It was great then and just as great this time.  The service and the food were over the top.Worth every penny spent.  Oh and the drinks were great as well.  GET THE BREAD PUDDING ! :)

HAYiNk3sbvTut1I7CDT2bg.text: The delmonico was delicious, the potatoes were excellent, and the deserts were amazing.  After dinner I was thinking about dessert and they suggested the banana cream pie.  Normally banana cream is not my favorite, so I was somewhat skeptical, but the server said that if I did not like it they would not charge me for it. so I gave it a try.  It was amazing, I would recommend it to anyone, but you can get it at any Emeril restaurant so dont go here just for that.  Overall pricy, but very good.

7okAFCDfMpvhLDHnzGistg.text: Great ambiance.  Heirloom tomato salad appetizer was perfect way to start.  Steak was perfectly cooked and superb flavor.  Desert was delicious.  Not a cheap place, but worth it.

5Fh9uODOL-2JDgiSzUXp_A.text: Went there for my father's 80th birthday.  Excellent.  My parents both ordered the fillet mignon, which was very flavorful.  The butter on top helps.  I got the fillet medallions.  I found the sauce and crust to be slightly too overpowering on the fillet, but it was still very good.  Our waiter, Frank, was very personable and made us feel right at home.

QkuTHS6ASsQDfgMc-eIZEQ.text: Best Chateaubriand I have ever had!  Great seasoning on the meat.

Da8W7s9vZk9N5oGXSNdMgw.text: For a steak place in Vegas .. 5 stars, and this is simply why.  Steak, $52 Bone in ribeye, one of the best 20 oz steaks I've ever had Service, waiters were always very helpful Drinks and apps, good flavor and well and fair portions.  All in all, i expected to be hungry after and go to like a smaller and quicker place after just to make sure i was full, but i was so satisfied i was sleepy.   Also, i went in at 8:30 for my meal and for a table of 4 i think we left like close to 11. It wasn't that the service was slow, the atmosphere and ambiance was just right to forget time and enjoy your meal and the people your with.

YRCoTUj1LbYQSH2xNgWvVQ.text: We went here on our one date night of our vacation to Vegas. It was everything we could have wished for and more.   We had the BBQ Shrimp as an appetizer, shared a salad, he had the rib eye steak and I the Filet Mignon. both of the steaks melted in our mouths. I have never had a steak do that, and I have had a lot of steaks in my time. We had the Country Smashed Potatoes and steamed asparagus as sides. The Steamed asparagus was nothing new, but the potatoes... oh my, they were good. they were like au gratin potatoes with mozzarella cheese. yummo.   By the time we were done with all of that, sadly, we did not have room for dessert, but that didn't leave us leaving unhappy... it was quite a lovely experience.

BUnQQolOOG7xiionFbuWfw.text: There's a reason this place has been here for 10 years & is still going strong amidst the Vegas mahem of new hot restaurants with celebrity chefs.   This was my 2nd visit to Delmonico's & it's still my favorite steak restaurant of all time. I hope when I die I have a meal from here in my belly :)

tDiyguXbU0z4sDDyTGXiJg.text: I'm almost always skeptical of anything with a celebrity chef's name because they're almost always underwhelming. Those types of establishments require that celebrity chef to attach their name to drive new customers. In this business (which I'm far from expert, but know what I like), it's word of mouth that should ultimately drive good cuisine.  My father told me to come here while I was in town and I'm so glad that I did. Vegas is full of traps and this one was not a trap at all, and if it was a trap I wandered in willingly.  The "Book of Whisky" is MASSIVE. Largest whisky/single malt/irish/worldwide whiskey list I've ever seen. I partook in a nice Yamazaki 12 (world renowned shit) and felt adventurous and tried an Amrut from India which was delectable and spicy as well.   The STEAK. I put it up there with Toro Toro as #1/#2 of all time. Flavorful, crunchy char, a nice butter sauce that only Emeril himself can probably cook up, and the service to match.  I sat at the bar and my server was knowledgeable, attentive, and would come around the bar to take care of me which was unnecessary, but appreciated. Great ambience as well, very low key for Vegas, and elegant.  My new MUST DINE spot in Vegas. Will be back forever.

J8dbQ-uTluSw-lj-1hbQTw.text: Had an absolutely fantastic dinner at Delmonico before catching a show at the Wynn. We arrived 20 minutes before our reservation which allowed us time to sit in the bar lounge and grab a pre-dinner cocktail. The Lemon Drop and the Old Fashioned were phenomenal. For dinner we had spectacular service and wonderful food. We would recommend for appetizers: the gumbo and the Caesar salad (made table side, supposed to be shareable for 2-we split it 3 ways and it was the perfect amount), for dinner we each had the filet mignon-cooked perfectly and finished by everyone. Dessert we chose the banana creme pie-would highly recommend!

OF9-nVeRowj7upBC8IfzIQ.text: Lovely ambiance and decor. Excellent customer service. But for an Emeril restaurant, I expected waaaaay more flavour. Granted, I did order chicken (and I have yet to visit an upscale steakhouse who doesn't serve bland, dry chicken).   We came for thanksgiving dinner. There was a nice crowd... an older crowd. It's inside the Venetian. I ordered a loaded baked potato (or some potato dish) as a side. It looked beautiful and scrumptious but right after you get past the cheese and sour cream it's bland. I probably won't be back. But I can see why people like it.

rms3ZsceBAy1MVTw-HtzCQ.text: I've been here 2 times now and both times I haven't been disappointed.   Ordered my usual Filet Mignon. Definitely a lot of food. They definitely know how to cook their steak, a medium rare is True medium rare. For the sides we shared creamed spinach, shrimp, asparagus, and potatoes.   Since Vegas gets busy, you definitely need reservations.  If you have a big group, prepare to dine for awhile since food takes some time but totally worth the wait.   My go to steak place in Vegas

io_xUz-_FrC6LPImK6bDgw.text: Went alone to eat here and the experience was not what I expected at all the free bread was eggy and I got a French onion soup which tasted so salty I didn't even eat the first spoon. It took the waiter almost 10 mins to come back to my table and he just took the soup away not asking why I had t finished it! The beet salad was ok not anything spectacular. The bouchon cafe is probably a better bet. Do not recommend.

ihVdRCInEt4_wbxHXRjURg.text: I am very picky about steakhouses, because I'm very picky about steak. This meal was perfection from start to finish. There were three of us all together, and we started with shrimp cocktail. It was incredible! I had the fillet mignon, which was cooked just to my liking, and it had the most amazing herb butter on top. It was so good, I could have licked the plate. The other two in my group shared the bone in ribeye and loved every bite. We got steamed broccoli and smashed potatoes as sides to share, and they were fabulous. None of us wanted desert, but the banana cream pie sounded too good to pass up. It was a massive piece of pie with at least 2 whole bananas inside the slice, if not more! Best banana cream pie I have ever had! The waitstaff was very attentive, but sometimes seemed a little confused because there were so many of them waiting on the same table at once. Overall, it was fantastic and I will definitely return next time I am in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fillet mignon with herb butter. Out of this world!

Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The banana cream pie was the best I&#39;ve ever had. There had to have been at least 2 whole bananas, if not more, plus wonderfully spiced!
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The shrimp cocktail was incredible! 5 large shrimp cooked to perfection with a tangy cocktail sauce underneath.

Yp7g478qP1puRw4eBvS5mg.text: I had such high expectations for Delmonico's because I love Emeril and because of him my culinary skills are on point but sadly I couldn't give this restaurant the 5 stars I wanted too. The staff was extremely friendly and nice. They gave excellect table service and I didn't have to ask for anything.   We started our meal with some drinks. I ordered the Brooklyn Yard and my god this gin and juice concoction was so amazing I had two which is alot for this lightweight. We also ordered the BBQ Shrimp and Crispy Fried Oysters and as expected it was heavenly and I savored every bite.   For dinner I ordered off the Summer Trio menu and chose the New Orleans Gumbo, the Sirloin Strip Steak with Asparagus and the Caramel Butter Cake with Vanilla Cream. The gumbo was just alright. It was good but I felt the roux was too rich and over powered the other ingredients. Although this made me sad I can honestly say I make a kick ass gumbo that taste better but I owe that in part to the many episodes of Emeril Live I've watched, lol. The Sirloin Strip Steak was cooked perfectly but it was lacking in flavor. It tasted like plain meat, no BAM and it was definitely not kicked up a notch. But the Caramel Butter Cake with Vanilla Cream made up for the steak. It was everything a butter cake is suppose to be, buttery, fluffy and just delicious goodness. Because I am a heifer I ordered the Banana Cream Pie too as this is a signature dessert of Delmonico's and the server sweared it was the best dessert on the menu. He lied, lol. It was good but the Caramel Butter Cake was much better.   Although I didn't have a five star experience I will be back to give Delmonico's another try.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brooklyn Yard is so delicious
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Cream Pie
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel Butter Cake with Vanilla Cream

3XfGarAJtQPuckyzAahaww.text: I love fine dining and this place exceeds expectations. Went for my birthday, the guest I had and I had the truffle potato chips, amazing. Could have ate like 5 orders of them they were so good. I ordered wagyu fillet. Best steak I have. Flavor amazing, melted in your mouth and was just insanely good. Guest got the strip I think...? Or ribeye haha don't remember but whatever it was it was great too. We had twice baked potatoes, great. And the duck egg creme brulee, great except the sugar was a little too hard and tasted a little burnt in spots but that's the only complaint. The service was beyond amazing too. So attentive and very nice. Will be coming back here often

TeYfZU8b7vknNF5R_yTa_g.text: The food was okay/good and service was great.  The service made our okay meal a better experience. When my bf and I were first seated, we were asked if we were celebrating anything. We told them our anniversary and was served a complimentary amuse-bouche and sorbet dessert at the end.  Yay: -Truffle Parmesan potato chips: freshly made and amazing in flavor. You can taste all the elements of this working well together. I thought the truffle oil was going to overwhelm the dish but it was nicely perfumed throughout and complimented the freshly grated Parmesan. The chips were thin, crispy and airy. I almost ate the whole thing before my meal but had to stop myself.   Other: -Ribeye steak special: the special of the day was a petite rib eye with foie gras. The steak otherwise would have been bland had it not been for the foie gras. It was perfectly cooked to my medium rare preference.  -Ribeye: my bf got the regular ribeye without the special and it come out to be almost the same size as my petite filet. It was slightly seasoned more than mine. However when we reheated the leftover steaks, mine held up better and the foie gras melted into the meat flavoring it better than this one.  -Mashed potatoes: just regular, nothing fancy.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary dessert
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mashed potatoes
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye (without the bone)

h6agiYMNPPGNn-tZAR8XXg.text: Came to this establishment for my birthday on a recent Vegas trip...The service was absolutely awesome...Ordered the rib-eye and my gf ordered the wagu steak...Not as pricey as some of the other steak houses but the quality was there...Steaks were cooked perfect medium-rare...enjoyed the atmosphere and the private setting...Provided a complete wine list...Best birthday meal I've had in probably the past 10 years...

nrWkvyN5Gf-W3uUX5lmy_w.text: The food was great. We had:  Foie gras and grilled octopus for appetizers (both excellent) Mixed green salad (very good) French onion soup (so-so) Both my wife and I had bone-in ribeyes (excellent)  Best steakhouse in Vegas.  We would definitely go again.  Only knock is the service was only okay.

jSv46MKoAozdLvqXKNlmhA.text: The place is dimly lit and fittingly much more quiet than other places on the strip, the servers treat you like royalty. I had the Japanese wagyu fillet mignon which comes with a pretty hefty price tag of $115 however it was easily the most delectable food of and kind i have eaten and was so tender that i could cut it with the side of my fork. It was heaven on a plate that simple. This place is quite expensive but unlike most restaurants on the strip this establishment truly warrants the fee. Additionally i ordered lemondrops and the lemon cream pie both were excellent.

-9dbp_WyOGoVPkeqw1xpBw.text: Ordered the seafood tower at $130 came with oysters on the half shell, 2 lobster tails split in half which were slightly overlooked and rubbery. A handful of shrimp which tasted farm raised and lacked a good wild shrimp taste. Tuna tartare was great and the crab legs were great.  Warm wilted spinach salad ($15) came out with a deep fried soft boiled egg and bacon with candy pecans baked on it. There was spinach in there but a 2000 calorie salad isn't really that much of a salad. Still it was good.  Added to that the bone in 45 day aged ribeye ($50). That was magnificent. Huge, flavorful and all around award winning.  Had the creamed spinach ($10), creamed corn ($10) and steak fries ($10). The creamed corn want good. It was just bland. The rest were good.  Service is exceptional. Had a few Tito vodka Martina's with blue cheese olives as well Jacob were expertly made. For 5 of us the total bill was close to $1000. Be prepared to spend $$$.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The size of that $50 steak!

aPiMQUn31NfBmcTjZJ57vQ.text: Now this is the way good food is suppose to make you feel!!  Excellent! My filet was superb, melt in your mouth good and cooked to perfection. Wife ordered the Red snapper which was amazing. No fishy linger at all, just delicious! Overall this place is great and service is top notch! This steakhouse is a must

R18_e_RfcMAhVKu8Ws9QxA.text: Husband suggested that we come back here for lunch today. They started us off with two bread poppers each which were not bad. I ordered a lobster bisque soup as starter which was insanely delicious. Probably one of the better lobster bisques I've ever tasted.  It has big chunks of lobster meat in the soup.  Although the first sip of the soup seemed a little salty, the flavor is very good, strong and savory. It is one of my favorite dishes here.   My husband ordered the beef carpaccio arugula salad because the salad we normally order from here is no longer on the menu. We were not sure what to order but after we tasted the salad we loved it. It is a very large salad which almost felt like a meal and it has a very clean balanced savory taste.  My husband says that this was one of his favorite salads; me on the other hand I still like the old salad I used to older here.  maybe I'm just more old-school and like my salad plain with arugula, spinach, tomatoes and good cheese.   We ordered two entrees. One was the salmon entree which was insanely divine. It is served with a big piece of salmon fillet with grilled sweet corn and crab pieces which complimented the salmon impeccably. Both my husband and I love this dish and we both indicated that we will be ordering this again in the future when we come back here. In fact we may each order one of this salmon dish. That is how much we love this dish. It is very delicious. Any salmon lover should definitely give the salmon dish a try.  The other entree that we ordered was the lobster sliders. I did not know that this was a cold sandwich dish. I personally do not like cold sandwiches and also I only like my lobster done the traditional way so that you can taste the natural fresh sweet flavors of a good lobster. The lobster sliders had some kind of seasoning/dressing to it. Although they did not skimp on the lobster meat and they do give you a lot of big chunks of lobster meat with the sliders, the taste was not to my personal liking. I think I will stick with the salmon entree and my lobster bisque in the future.  Come check out this place when you're in town. You will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster slider coupled with lobster bisque yum yum I&#39;m in heaven.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon entree delicious
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque and their new salad on the menus - arugula and beef capachio

L903UJIU4-2zJm55gdkeLQ.text: This is one of the most amazing restaurant I've ever had. I made a reservation for Fourth of July for my boyfriend's birthday. The service was 5 stars, my water was never below one sip level. We had three servers for our table. I've been waiting for their bone in ribeye as review said it was good. It was better than I expected. We had two appetizers beef cappacio and table side  Caesar salad, halibut, delicious! And caramel cake dessert was perfect. The servers had also given us a birthday banana walnut ice cream. Highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel cake
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef cappacio
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halibut

TfyjbjEFnfSUC1ZJOlycEg.text: This is absolutely a splurge place to dine on vacation. The table service is amazing and the level of professionalism is truly impressive. I think the steak, port and lobster bisque were probably the best I have had in a long time. The waitress was excellent at recommending wines that would pair well with each course as well as my budget. To top things off it does tend to be the little things that stand out sometimes and for me a little detail about Delmonico's is that they serve these amazingly light fluffy and delicious popovers in place of your run of the mill bread basket.

kZ1QEE2xF0HAOaJogYvwrA.text: Underwhelmed! Food wasn't great and service was not the way I would expect. I wasn't happy with any of it. If I could get a refund I would. I don't want to go into details, but I guess my expectations were too high for them!

VnsKyYcLAN6keBWBsL27mg.text: Service was fabulous. Wine was great. This steakhouse is not your typical steakhouse. Great twist on flavors. Super unique while still holding the quality at a high level. Personally, many of the dishes had too many fried components for me and was a tad overwhelming but other than my personal preference on that... 5 stars all around. Classic steakhouse with a twist. I would highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. zip sauce!
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried poached egg. I love brunch so I had to get this lol

I-e7-w3aDmRis9_ErSPEWg.text: Another vegas trip, another steakhouse! Delmonico's a solid choice while in vegas. Their signature steak the bone in ribeye was juicy and flavorful with a creole seasoning. The sides a twice baked potato, creamed spinach, potato gratin, all good choices. The service, food and cocktails all great. There's so many steakhouses now in vegas but a good choice if you're at the Venetian.

9TQWWOgKctx8bqxtYIg6zg.text: From the get go, Delmonico was wonderful. We were introduced to a couple people taking care of us that evening. They made sure we were completely taken care of throughout the whole experience.  We chose a bottle of a wine for the meal and it paired perfectly. The wine list was the most extensive list I had seen in a long time. It was all broken down by style of wine and where the grapes originated from. Then we chose the house salad to pair with a half dozen oysters. The oysters were absolutely wonderful and the dressing for the house salad was great as well. I ordered crab crusted medallions and my boyfriend ordered the filet. Both came out perfectly cooked and melted in your mouth. We were too stuffed to take on the desert menu but the overall experience at Delmonico was delicious. I would recommend to anyone and everyone.

saLQQOFvjYXCCC4siEnYqw.text: HOLY hell. This place was yummy  Awesome thing, no split plate charges. My gfs and I were not yearning to eat a 22 oz steak, so it was nice to be able to split the entrees. We ordered the bone-in rib eye. YOU MUST ORDER that, especially if you're a steak eater. Medium rare, and that's how steak should always be. We also tried the Grilled Filet Mignon Medallions, which we overdone, Medium Rare my a$$, it was more like medium well-well done. but it did have a good taste. I don't believe in returning food.  The creamed corn was the shiznit. It was soooooo good. And the asparagus was good too, tender and perfectly buttered.   Of course I can't skip dessert, had the creme brulee, which as ok. A bit too much sugar on top, but overall not bad. We had a bday and was given banana sorbet - gross. :P But the brioche bread pudding w/ bourbon and ice cream. was to die for. SOOOOO delish. :D  I will return for the truffle potato chips. :D and rib eye!

70wTr8A757ul33NVBlh-Tg.text: Apparently finding a high-end restaurant on the Strip that serves lunch is more difficult than I thought. With many spots only open for dinner service I opted to dine at one of the few with a lunch menu -- Delmonico.    We started with the wild arugula salad -- shaved apple, candied walnuts tossed in champagne vinaigrette with a trio of artisan cheeses. It was a large portion that they split for us.  My wife had a steak panini served medium rare on ciabatta. The accompanying horseradish was overpowering, but the beef was still excellent. The sandwich came with some amazingly crispy and light truffle fries.  The lobster sliders I ordered was a small order of two. The Maine lobster was lightly dressed with a citrus aioli and celery leaves, helping make this some of the tastiest lobster you'll find in any sandwich in town. The Old Bay fries that they came with were tasty, but not nearly as good as the truffle fries. My only complaint about this dish is the size. Something this delicious shouldn't be constrained to two sliders per order.  4.5 Stars

CV38Bt7JYdAVdP-bGKmFvg.text: Went for dinner with my wife.   It was outstanding as always.   I had the spinach salad which was fantastic and they tweaked it to accommodate my need to be dairy free.  Had the salmon and mushrooms as a side.  Both were incredible. Some of the best I have had.  Servers were great and speedy.

GWI2xpBBwxK9-w1etLz51A.text: In a city with overrated 'celebrity' steakhouses, Delmonico was a breath of fresh air. Impeccable service, delicious salads, and unbelievably delicious steak (we got the bone-in ribeye, creamed spinach, and garlic mushrooms). Definitely will be coming back the next time we're in town.

NOROEsG5nH3fHldEoUQJAA.text: Best. Steak. Ever.  You pay for it, but that's expected at a high class restaurant.  Service is exceptional... Food is off the chart!! Would definitely return when I'm back in town.

iwx6s6yQxc7yjS7NFANZig.text: Nice atmosphere and wonderful service. I had the dinner special which was a wedge salad, a petite ribeye, and desert.     The salad was as expected. Nothing to jump up and down about. The petite ribeye was tasty. Just a minute over cooked, but overall it was good. The desert was ice cream and cake. As I'm not a cake eater I can't tell you about that, but the ice cream was good.   Overall, it was a pleasant dinner.

c8tc7Ya11zU4dXIqshkWYg.text: * Good Food * Good Service * Patrons Love People Watching* Pricey Food *  1) Crab Salad - Good stuff 2) Ahi Ahi Entree - tasted like steak mMmm.  If everything tasted like this and was not meat, I can definitely turn vegetarian  And then I ate off some of the girls' plates at the table, which include potatoes and asparagus - both were delish!

PW_UjPdLsjcCd-AkwDZLfw.text: The service was very friendly but the food failed to impress. We ordered its signature rib eye steak and the steak's exterior of the steak tasted too burned.

7YX6V9ViDRg6k6VhrVDUzQ.text: I don't usually go to fine dine restaurants while in vegas, but I make a few exceptions and this was one of them. Came here with a few buddies for a birthday. The waiter made our experience a very easy one. He offered many different suggestions and options. After we finally made our decision, the kind gentleman complimented us with bread and such. Afterwards, he poured our glasses with wine and afterwards treated the birthday girl to some lovely dessert. On to the food...  At first I was on a budget, but then I said to myself, might as well splurge a little so i ordered the filet mignon and I have to admit, it was deeeeelicious. I did not order any sides with it, and wish i had ordered some sort of baked or mash potatoes.   overall, i had a great experience and I would definitely refer someone to this place for great food and great service.

Jjz9W-wBkoBoMcB8ZQs5zQ.text: We had early reservations for a party of 9 for my 40th birthday. We were seated at a lovely table and were all surprised how we could hear everyone without having to strain. This means the acoustics in the room we were in were spot on.   Our waiter was Lamont and there were various other folks helping us out. We were all served warm buttery rolls that had both a salt and we are pretty sure bit of sugar sprinkling on them. Drinks were ordered by a few of us-I imbibed just a bit as it was my birthday after all and the drinks were good, reasonably priced and tasty.   Everything we ate was wonderful. We started with 2 orders of house made potato chips with truffle oil and Parmesan. They were yummy and the perfect combination of salt and grease to help the booze go down easily. Some of us had starters, some of us chose not to.   I had the lobster bisque to start and it was heavenly with perfectly cooked lobster and nice pieces of it. Others had the Gumbo (no seafood-heat but not hot), the heirloom tomato and Burrata cheese salad. There were also a couple of other appetizers ordered-BBQ Shrimp (delicious and unlike anything we had before) and Escargot(I was too chicken to try it). Truffle Parmesan potato chips  For mains, people had  Filets Bone In Rib-eye  Salmon Scallops Medallions of beef  Since sides are generous, we all shared: Asparagus Creamed Corn-delicious (and I make my own just as good) Creamed Spinach (the most boring) Sauteed Mushrooms-fabulous Potato Gratin Twice Baked Potatoes Grits (meh-but not for me texturally)  We were all so full, we only ordered one dessert to share and that was the infamous Banana cream pie. Worth every bite and every calorie-in fact....  Kevin and I came back here for lunch our last day in Vegas! We shared the BBQ shrimp, I had the lobster bisque again and he had the heirloom tomato salad. We also shared another slice of the banana cream pie and I would do it again in a heartbeat.   Fabulous birthday dinner and wonderful company!

X558qJ9q00Y5haplOh6Wmg.text: This was once a fantastic restaurant.  Sadly, it has fallen.  Not much attention to the customers' answers to their questions, not much attention to if the customer is enjoying what is served, long periods of absolute inattention while the 4 people that we were told will be taking care of us tonight pass by to other tables.  Asked for medium rare, and received a fairly well done steak dry and served cold on a cold plate.  After 15 minutes, my guests had finished eating, server came by to confirm everything was fine.  Sitting with my complete steak minus one bite before me I said no.  Reminded them I was looking for a bone in NY medium rare and if at all  possible bring it out before it is cold, and warm plate would be wonderful as well.  They took my plate away and returned in 10 minutes with the same steak now hot but black (for real) on the outside and thoroughly well done.  Plate was set down and off the server went to another table.  10 minutes later he saw it sitting there and asked if it was not OK.  I again repeated what I had ordered.  Then, with some attitude he said, "Let me just start over on it".  Fifteen minutes later a new steak hit the table and again over cooked.  At that point I just gave up, ate my cold baked potato and drank my wine.   For a $600 meal for three people (thats after they graciously didn't charge me for the NY, I left saying never again.  And that's a drag because this place was once a tip top steakhouse.  The best steak I ever had was here at Delmonico.

jHm_Xnh2ibH1HlfdCZ3rJg.text: I enjoyed my food good price great service but i have had better but would definetly will come here again

dT7igWKgSEpm_l23lt0mng.text: My wife and I were very excited to visit the restaurant, however, although the service was superb, the overall taste and quality of the meal was lacking and something to be desired. The "feel" and atmosphere of the restaurant was dull and drab, with chairs lining the walls towards the restaurant which seems to be very far away from the main dining area, loud noises from kids with no supervision and an atmosphere that  just wasn't romantic and inviting. If I had to do it again I would go somewhere else,  as there are many other restaurants on The Strip where you can spend in excess of  $150 and get more value. The most impressive part of the meal was the attentive wait staff, they were extremely professional, courteous and attended to our every need.  The other Emeril's restaurant at the MGM Grand was superb, I'm not sure what is going on with Delmonico. Hopefully mgmt. will do more to make the experience more enjoyable. Hope this review helps.

NIjytrgr5QOOhr2H2W9IGw.text: One of my favorite restaurants on the strip. I've come here several times and I always have excellent service and amazing food. They make your Cesar salad table side and make the dressing right in front of you. It's absolutely delicious! I've also had the filet, New York steak, ribeye, BBQ salmon, creamed corn, twice baked potato, halibut, asparagus, and mushrooms. All have been exceptional! I will come back every time I'm in town.

OP9sZXd9hNXZAspWadpAGw.text: I really wanted to love this place, but honestly...well... For starters, I was a single, attractive woman, dining alone when there was a giant computer convention at the Venetian. Why oh why would you seat me in a dark, partitioned corner?? Then my dirty martini came, and it was...warm.  And my iceberg wedge salad was tasty, but soggy.  My bone-in ribeye was enormous and glorious, but not exactly warm.  And my tawny port looked awfully ruby.  All in all my experience was uninspired.

pwHQqX_QmC47zN3M1bK0fg.text: Wow, what a huge disappointment, considering how expensive the entrees are!  My girlfriends and I were totally famished when we got into Vegas, thank goodness we had made reservations beforehand. We didn't wait long and had a drink in the lounge as we waited to be seated.  After browsing the menu, my friend and I decided to split the bone-in ribeye, medium well. Our server says it's their house specialty. The steak was completely blackened from the char and the inside was perfectly done. As I cut into it with my knife, I can tell it's going to be chewy....and indeed it was. It had almost no flavor for a dry aged meat. My friend had to ask for steak sauce and sour cream to make it more flavorful.  BUT, the sides we ordered (potato gratin and creamed corn) were awesome! AND my friend's filet mignon was the most tender I've ever had (she gave me some of hers)  The service was impeccable and friendly...but the food (at least what I ate) was not worth $52 for a steak.

q2Ve2hY4Cf2c0uEkd7Yyjg.text: The best steakhouse I've been to in all of Las Vegas the food is just amazing. The service is amazing our server Frank just made me and my family feel at home and he was extremely attentive to us. I ordered the Lobster and the rib eye. They where both superb dishes that I highly recommend. The rib eye was extremely succulent and well cooked . The lobster was incredibly juicy and the tastiest lobster I've had in my whole life. But our server Frank is what really made this place so great and unforgettable! He was the nicest  I've ever had the pleasure to meet. A big shout out to Frank, you rock!

Z1zCBAC2nIgdTnBc25wUYQ.text: You know the expression about sailors having a woman in every port. Well, on my recent trip to the USA, I had Yelpers in every town to host, entertain and amuse!  Vegas Elite Dennis T was my lunch companion when I was in town. Not only was he gracious enough to clear some time in his busy schedule to have lunch with me but I was honoured that he made our meal together his 100th review  Dennis gave me a list of tempting options for lunch. I had to watch how much I was going to have for lunch as I had a dinner reservation at Raku that evening for the kaiseki menu but the lobster sliders at Delmonico caught my eye, so that was my choice.  I had a nice time wandering through the Venetian on my way to Delmonico. The size and scale of U.S. buildings in general amaze me but the Venetian is certainly very ornate and I enjoyed looking at the menus while walking down restaurant row on the way to Delmonico  I instantly recognised Dennis from his Yelp picture and like all the Yelpers I've met, conversation flowed like we were old friends. So much so that unusually for Yelpers, we were chatting so much that ordering took awhile as we hadn't look at the menu the first few times that our waiter approached to take our order  The restaurant is certainly decked out to appeal to the higher end of customer. It was a quiet lunch service when we dined and while it provided a good ambiance for chatting, I perhaps didn't see Delmonico as the busy celebrity chef steakhouse that it is.  I had already decided on my main course of lobster sliders and using my personal rule of taking the opportunity of eating foods that I don't come across often, I paired that with an appetiser of traditional New Orleans gumbo. I'm not in any position to comment on the authenticity of the gumbo but as Emeril Lagasse started his celebrated celebrity chef trail with his first restaurant Emeril's in New Orleans, I'm guessing he can cook a good gumbo. Mine was certainly pungent with a great depth of flavour from a carefully stock. Being Asian, I was also impressed to see that the rice had been cooked well  Dennis was pleased with his appetiser of lobster bisque followed by Caesar salad  It may seem odd to eschew steak at a steakhouse. However, I've always liked the sound of lobster roll but still haven't tried one yet. I saw these lobster sliders as the nearest I could get until I make my trip to the northeast to try a real lobster roll. Well, the sliders were excellent - soft rolls containing morsels of sweet lobster meat mixed with the right amount of mayonnaise and seafood dressing.  Dennis however wasn't quite as lucky with his fillet steak, which arrived looking rather lonely on the plate. Dennis decided to order some bearnaise to correct this loneliness but it took a long time to appear and when it did, it seemed a bit watery.  In an effort to not be too piggy, Dennis and I split the banana cream pie. Well, the combination of banana, pie, whipped cream, caramel and chocolate shavings pleased my palate probably more than my arteries! I don't have a really sweet tooth but I really enjoyed this  Dennis was kind enough to give a lift back to my hotel down the Strip, which gave me a good touristy view of the sights  A friendship sealed. A celebrity chef ticked off. Lobster sliders consumed. A most successful lunch rendezvous indeed!

LvPZAT25i-WdjUJiYPMULQ.text: 5 starts (I highly recommend) Delmonicos earns a five star rating for two reasons. For one, I've never had a bad experience eating there... Their food and service has always exceeded my expectations. Secondly, their Pan Seared Foie Gras literally took my breath away because I was enjoying it so much I damn near forgot to breath. That is saying a lot because normally I don't like liver! For a quick recommendation, try their filet mignon, duck or ask for their filet medallions, it is off the menu but the flavor is amazing. For a full review read my post at: foodilistic.com/reviews/...

oy55J-NlQG0Fk8DHXzxqQA.text: This is my favorite restaurant in the United States, bar none.  Some of the best service and atmosphere I've ever seen in a restaurant, anywhere. For example....  A few days before one visit, I called to request that the Peanut Butter Cream Pie, a dessert special from a past trip, be once again on the desert menu. When we showed up for dinner, we didn't see the pie on the menu, but were informed that the chef had made and saved an ENTIRE pie just for our party. It was unbelievable.  And oh the food....  ** Warning: this meal is a marathon. If you're not a big eater, don't be afraid to share appetizers, order smaller steaks, skip the rolls, etc so that you can room for all parts of this amazing, amazing meal.  **** Appetizers **** -- Lobster bisque is the clear ungodly standout. -- All the salads are routinely excellent. -- Skip the tuna tartare and tomato soup -- they aren't as impressive. -- The free rolls are really, really excellent.  **** Wine **** -- For those that (like me) enjoy wine but aren't connoisseurs, the Fisticuffs cabernet is my go-to. It goes great with all steaks at a reasonable ($55) price.  **** Steak **** -- Ribeye is the obvious play, and is amazing (and huge), but the filet is outstanding for those who want something smaller and not quite as rich. -- Try Au Poivre style for really powerful flavor. Steak purists should do the ribeye straight up, but those who like peppery and lightly sweet flavors would love the filet au poivre. -- I am told that they serve entrees besides steak, but I have never, ever seen anyone be so misguided as to come here and fail to order a steak.  **** Sides **** -- Usually we have one person order all the sides for the group, just to make sure we get a good mix of them so everyone can try everything. They're served family-style, and are big enough for ~3 people to have some. -- Twice baked potato (which has gratuitous amounts of cheese and bacon) is incredible, albeit heavy. Two can share, but my friends insist on ordering their own. -- Mushrooms are some of the best I've had, and go perfectly with the steak. -- Broccoli or asparagus is a good choice to contrast the rich steak.  **** Desserts **** -- Oatmeal pecan pie is one of my favorite desserts anywhere. You will want a whole one yourself after one bite, so order accordingly. -- Banana cream pie is well known and hyped, for good reason. It is also enormous. -- Skip the bread pudding and peach cobblers -- they're good but not in the same league.

wrW2h80aJ5dkvL7iD8QdDQ.text: Another one of Emeril's top notch restaurants, this one being a steak connoisseur's paradise.  We booked the night before and got in before the traditional 7-7:30 dinner rush.  Service- top notch.  Mind you, everything is a la carte.I cant help but feel underdressed even though we were dressed well for the venue.  They have an insane wine list that goes on and on.  I had the bone-in ribeye which was done to perfection - medium rare.  We also had the creamed spinach and wild mushrooms.  So good we finished everything leaving little to no room for dessert.  Definitely should try the dessert since they all looked exceptional, especially Emeril's claim to fame Banana Cream Pie!

_O8CNyQfuF6fkT0eyEllzw.text: The bone in ribeye was freakin delicious!  I am glad had a good experience at my first Emeril restaurant.  Hopefully my next one will be Commanders Palace in 2 years.  woot woot.

_2gYHeuC6Kpdup4j60D4pg.text: I just want to say this restaurant is amazing! From the customer service to the staff. 2 months ago I had my waiter I believe his name was Gregory, well he by far, was the best waiter I've had. He was attentive, kind, and willing to always help and check up. This is what makes guests like myself keep coming back here. Keep it going Delmonico! -Diana Habash

BWGlCqK5pKSm7xi5IVKZcw.text: Maybe because I'm use to NY Steakhouses but I was disappointed.  I was with a party of 10 for lunch. Lunch menu was great however my steak was over cooked.   Where's the porterhouse steaks???  Wine was good but little expensive, even for Vegas.

O9LdM6RFTyZqmuL-BW2pWQ.text: Great service! Excellent menu! Their chateaubriand steak was mouth-watering!

XKBfU-QRQm1W7Ycv0fDvDw.text: Banana Cream Pie was to die for. I don't even like bananas. I've had dreams about that pie for two nights in a row.  Grilled cheese was okay. Lobster Bisque was EXCELLENT. Server had no personality. Tomato soup was good. Burger was alright. Lobster sliders were good. French fries came out cold, so we sent them back and they were very promptly replaced with fresh, hot ones.   Get the pie. Trust me.

oPwCpukxg5Mt1ql79tA-ig.text: If you are looking for the best steak you have had, and a fine dining experience, the team at Delmonicos will not let you down.  We had the table side Caesar and the rib-eye and filet, and we were in heaven.  Go here!!!!!

QNloSuA6gAZ2Xakod_BlVQ.text: I have to admit, I didn't try the steak there.  Based on everyone else in my group who was eating, they loved it though.  I ate semi light for my dinner: a crab bisque soup, spinach salad, and a baked potato.  All of it was very very good.  Being that said, that still cost me $35 easy. There really is no cheap thing to eat here, other then the sides that went for $9 a pop.  The atmosphere is pretty relaxed.  The service is good.  They paid attention to the little things that mattered like re-filling up your water when your cup is empty, and coming back every 10 minutes or so to ask if you need anything else.  Be prepared to bring a chunk of change with ya...steaks costs anywhere from $50 to $60 depending on how you want it prepped or what kind of steak you want.  I would try this place again, and see if the steak is really that damn good.

YxJwh2_8OQl3vz40XQUi2w.text: Consistent food - great atmosphere Clearly a great place to bring clients.  Service was ok , friendly and efficent

gZrc9h8vCaHWn1lXu_m5tQ.text: Pricey, but worth it. I tried the pan roasted salmon with sweet corn &  crab vinaigrette and fresh basil- of coarse with mashed potatoes :), the Cesar salad and a shared Apple Fritter desert with pecan pie.

vu3uSjYE0yghASg9-dDRjw.text: Worst dining experience ever.  Took my daughter in law to Vegas for the weekend, which was to include a "fancy" dinner at Delmonico.  Ordered our steaks medium well and they came served to us like a bloody mess.  More like steak tar tar than medium well...basically very rare.  Sent them back and never saw them again.  The waiter had also taken our sides back just to keep them warm, and we never saw them again either.  Manager kept apologizing over and over telling us it would be "just another minute," but we never got our food.  Other tables were having the same experience.  It was a Thursday evening, 7:30 p.m., not especially crowded.  We were so disappointed as we were looking forward to it so much.  Don't think I'll ever waste my time there again.  A good manager would have comped our drinks (only two) and salads, but we were charged for them.  Also charged us for the three sides until we brought it to his attention and he removed it from the bill.

CVkTL2dfXOdtpMeFhtWayw.text: My wife took me here for a fabulous dinner before the Blue Man Group show.  We got there in plenty of time and explained that we wanted to sit and enjoy our experience and planned on being there for awhile.  We were told that it was no problem and they were happy to have us as long as we like.  We were never once rushed or pushed out like at a lot of places just trying to turn tables even though we were there 2-3 hours.  The service was amazing but not to the point where you were harrassed...our drinks were never empty and plates never sat long but it seems we never noticed the waiter coming and going which is awesome.  We took our time with drinks, appetizers, and dinner and all were timed perfectly and served when we were ready.  The food was amazing as well!  I had the escargot and the bone-in ribeye which was the best steak I have ever had!  I have had a lot of steaks from so called steakhouses and top recommended restaurants, this is definitely tops!  My wife had the lobster bisque and king crab legs which were also absolutely delicious.  The prices are higher, but it goes directly with the service and quality of food and I have no problem paying for what we got.  We will definitely go back...now if we could only catch Emeril there!

suEs9dhesiQEPbvx3_RB8Q.text: WORST STEAKHOUSE I HAVE EVER BEEN TO.   So I just stopped by to have lunch by myself. I read the reviews and cannot wait to have a perfectly cooked Filet Mignon. I got the BBQ shrimp and the Filet Mignon ordered specifically MEDIUM RARE. The BBQ shrimps are four tiny shrimps that are by no means jumbo shrimps but suspiciously resembled frozen out of a bag.   And then is the Filet Mignon. They overcooked it so much that when I taste it, I almost wanted to cry. It can hardly pass for well done. I was so hungry and I waited 35 minutes for it. But I had to wash it down my throat with water. If this is MEDIUM RARE, then I will be ordering a live cow next time. The manager Michael did come by, confirmed that the steak is overcooked and asked if they can take it back. (I cannot wait for another 30 minutes for a new one. Doesn't a customer's time mean anything to you?) This is nice. But when the chef finished cooking my steak, how can he decide this is OK to serve? He must have cared so little about how his customer would think to decide to serve me this. LET ME TELL YOU. IT IS NO DIFFERENT THAN SPITTING IN MY FACE.  Paid 95 dollars for the bill. I am feeling like a complete loser right now. Good thing is at least I came alone. If I have brought my GF, she would think I want a break up. And Michael, next time this happens, just take 20 dollars off the bill. You guys can never be a top notch restaurant.

raYQuS58GGITvLd4Tqm_Dw.text: Our perfect ending to Memorial Day weekend in Vegas had to be at a great restaurant- I Yelped and found that Delmonico Steakhouse had great reviews-  There were 7 of us girls including me that decided to dine there. Our reservations were at 10pm Sunday night we got seated right away.   I do feel bad for giving 1 start because the service was EXCELLENT. However the food was soo dissapointing. We ordered calamari to share- the marinara sauce that accompanied it tasted like Ragu from a jar. Like I said 7 girls with 1 order of calamari there was more then 80% left on the plate. We then got our salads which i have nothing to complain about then again it was just greens and dressing- I ordered the cowboy ribeye which they are known for and the most popular menu item. I ordered it Medium. We also ordered creamed corn, spinich, potatoes au gratin, and asparagus.   Cowboy Ribeye Steak- WORST STEAK EVER!!! it was over cooked too chewey and tasted old- I thought maybe it was just me but I had 3 of the girls taste and they thought the same- Really dissapointed :(  Creamed Spinich- Undercooked   Potatoes Au Gratin- Good but not the best I had ever had lacked flavor  Asparagus- Cant go wrong with that  Bottle of Wine was excellent we had the Cuvee  Bottom line we were really dissapointed. I am not the type to complain so we did not let the staff know- You would think that they would notice we hardly ate anything but whatever. I know I wont be going there ever again or recommending it to anyone either.   service was good but what good is the service if the food sucked this bad :(

0w-8xQI4Wpptov5EovQsvQ.text: It wasnt the best ive had but it was good. I like my steak medium but it was alittle on the burnt side. I didnt want to complain since it was still good and edible.   The service was great.

vs3KkSVt2XJoIFmqBGVoIw.text: Not only is it not the "best" it's not even that good. I am a steak eater. I frequent great steakhouses. This is not one.  WAY over prices for quality. There are several great steaks in Vegas. Do yourself a favor and skip this one

sLCPgbt4p_q36ieNjcd4CQ.text: I was part of a group of six people having a business dinner and was really looking forward eating at this establishment. The service was very good and noise level was acceptable wherein it was easy to carry on a conversation.  I had the BBQ shrimp as my appetizer which was very good.  But as to the main entree, I was very disappointed in the quality of the NY strip.  This piece of meat was described as prime but in reality I thought it was more of a select grade ... I have had choice from the grocery store that was more tender.  Initially, I thought maybe my steak was an anomaly and did not want to complain since were invited out to dinner. However, then  another person in our party also stated his steak was very tough and was only able to eat about a quarter of his steak ... Gave up and moved on to eat only the side dishes, which were very good I may say.  We all shared the desserts ... I really enjoyed the Banana Cream pie.  Even though there were some good things about this restaurant still rated it lower based on the poor quality of prime steak I had relative to the cost of the steak ... In essence it still was not worth the dining experience even though I was not the one paying.

RBChssN2e2W83xoCxcAVgw.text: I got a chance to enjoy Delmonico Steakhouse during LV Restaurant Week. We went there for lunch and I'll take some of the blame for the experience because I ordered a a burger instead of a specialty, but it could have been better. It would have been nice to have someone ask me how to prepare it to my liking. Other than that, the staff was great and I had my very first piece of pecan pie there. I may go back again, but I'd have to be convinced.

CqzA-kOMjBSd_1hCAdFBAA.text: I wanted my 300 review to be special and this restaurant sure is special.  I have been  fortunate to dine at Delmonico's Steakhouse over a half of dozen times. I have never been disappointed.  Last weekend for the second time in my life was lucky enough to have the Chef's Table that over looks the kitchen. As with the last time I ate in the Chef's Table it rates as the top 5 meals I have ever had in my life. You don't order at the chef's table you enjoy each course that chef personally prepares for you.  Each course is better then  the previous. Some of my favorite dishes in the dining room are: Steak Tartare-very tasty served with toasted baguette. Emeril's New Orleans Barbecue Shrimp, an original menu item, that is so delicious. My favorite steak is the Bone in Rib Eye, a great piece meat that is aged in house. The service at Delmonico is second to none, what  they are noted for is that everybody at the table get there plate at the same time, a real nice touch. Great side dishes,creamed corn and twice cooked potatoes are my favorite. Service is always top notch. A can't miss I will be back soon.

i6yuwjmXmtq_iAYJlH3vMg.text: Looking for a nice steakhouse in Vegas? Yes there are plenty of them around all the hotels and to be honest, they have a good one at every single hotel, it is a matter of you choosing the one that either is more convenient for you or if there is one that you like no matter which hotel you are at.   We were at the Venitian and we came across this spot.   Here is the breakdown:  FOOD  Very tasty and tender the steaks. Cook at the right temperature and I definitely appreciate when they cook medium rare when I ask-- most time it comes rare.   The appetizers are also pretty good and I enjoyed a lot.   SERVICE  Very good service, I really enjoyed and appreciate when the waiters take time and go out of the way to make you feel welcomed. They constantly came to check on us-- however, without being annoying.  DECOR/ AMBIANCE  The decor is ok and it is a nice spot to have a finally meal without the loud noise that we normally see at other restaurants in Vegas.   OVERALL  Enjoyed the experienced and definitely the food. There wasn't that wow factor thus the four stars.

_qR0RILJZtKodE3XlFykEw.text: I have been coming here for 15 years. If anyone ever asked me "what is your fave steakhouse?" I would most definitely say Delmonico. We come from LA to Las Vegas every year for Xmas. We treat ourselves to a nice dinner while we are here. We dined on Xmas day as a party of 5. Service was great as usual. It's nice to be treated with a Welcome back!!! But the big but is that the food was not good :( Steaks were cold and dry. Fries were soggy. We were so bummed. We ordered 4 60$ steaks between us and we were all underwhelmed. My Ny was the worst. Dry, dry , dry. I felt bad for my son eating his filet Rare when he ordered medium. He begged me not to send it Bach because he was embarrassed. Unfortunately this place is not as good as it once was.

KexD0BZwoMS2p5DtClRzcg.text: Amazing. From the service to the food.  We had reservations for 6 pm. And were seated almost as soon as we walked in. Everyone was friendly and our waiter was very knowledgeable with the menu. The bread and that butter with honey is amazing.   I ordered steak, potatoes and broccoli and my bf ordered the ribs.  We both really enjoyed our food. Even the salad was amazing.  We will definitely we back when we R in town.  Bookmarked for the future (: I highly recommend this restaurant

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter with honey, this should be amazing

nk_4FCOl2cGNQlco8bJVsQ.text: A pretty good steakhouse with good food, great service and acceptable ambiance. We went there for a business dinner and enjoyed the experience as a group, but would rate this amongst the best in Vegas.   The highlight of the night was the bone-in bacon appetizer, which I highly recommend. It was outstanding and many of us wished we made that our dinner. I had the Salmon, which was ok and acceptable. There was no real difference between this entree and that of a nice salmon dish at any other mid-priced restaurant. It was good but forgettable, so don't recommend it.  It is a steakhouse after all and I was on a special diet that night. In taking with the rest of my guests, they stated their steak was average as well. The deserts were about the same and if not for the great service, it would've just been equal to dinner at any other average restaurant. For the price, I would try somewhere else.

wk3_9e6XvkOvtgv5w89DTw.text: Excellent food. The Cesar salad, potatoes au gratin, and filet mignon were terrific and cooked to order. Would have been 5 stars except for the high snoot factor of the wait staff. After they size you up for a potential tip, if you don't meet what they are looking for, service goes downhill. Big downside in a town that lives on the service industry.

AQvVKGOSSR3MnNfNshiaig.text: I dined here with my mom and sister. I got the bone in New York strip and they got the filet minon. Our steaks were cooked to perfection. Our sides were the buttered asparagus and the duck fat fingerling potatoes.  For dessert I got the banana cream pie (they serve a huge piece, I recommend sharing it) my mom got the pecan pie, and my sister got the churro.  The food was all delicious, and the service was top notch. Bathrooms were clean as well as the restaurant.  You can find this restaurant inside the Venetian on restaurant row.

ZwPhTAHSPRrTRj8LseCBDg.text: Best steak I have ever had!  Great drinks and appetizers.  Side dishes are also great but probably unnecessary since the steaks are so filling.  Servers are really nice and attentive to your needs throughout the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grandma&#39;s birthday dinner
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée!
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8 oz steak with roasted mushrooms and duck fat fingering potatoes for sides

hVHpyfVvRm4vWz1PV2ti0w.text: Completely top notch! Appears formal ish but the entire staff is amazing at welcoming you( even if you look way underdressed/casual) Mattered not to them, and that's amazing in my book! The BBQ Shrimp is FABULOUS! Really can't go wrong with any menu option. Don't venture in unless you completely expect to pay big bucks for this amazingness. It's not just dining, it's an experience. Whenever I'm in Vegas this is the spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Absolutely Perfect Ribeye!

mOdRvt2PhFXWOdZlp_QHTg.text: My wife and I celebrated our one year anniversary here and we couldn't have been happier with our choice.  First and foremost, the service is to the highest standard. It's something to be expected of a steakhouse of this quality, but that's not always the case. Michael and Drew were such a delight and enhanced our dinner experience.  Popovers are immediately served with creamy butter. These bread puffs are very light, flaky and savory.  Cocktails were good, whiskey and wine offering are extensive.  We were served complimentary crostini with a sun dried tomato bruschetta which was very scrumptious.  Our salad was the fine ripened heirloom tomato and buratta salad. WOW. I'm going back tomorrow to have this during lunch. It's beyond refreshing, fresh and flavorful. The vinegar dressing complemented the array of tomatoes, onions and burrata harmoniously. It is that good. Order it.  Our main courses were the bone in ribeye and New York steaks. We ordered them medium and they came a PERFECT medium. These were huge cuts. The creole seasoning had amazing flavor and texture. Every bite of the steak was juicy and oozing with flavor. We've been to a plethora of steakhouses and this one immediately shot up to the top of our favorites list.  To top it all off, we were served with a complimentary pumpkin spice ice cream (it tasted like a PSL in ice cream form) and hand written happy anniversary card.  Everything was phenomenal and we will definitely be coming back to the exceptional service and meals provided at Delmonico's.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary anniversary dessert
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 20oz Bone - In Ribeye  A perfect medium
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 29oz Bone - In Ribeye

IoIsnGQzd9p0uHRo-HzjRQ.text: Steaks were fantastic. Service was excellent. Can't wait to come back.   Recommend the bone-in ribeye

sx5YZOrcK_g-tDY0jvpBAQ.text: This is one of my favorite date night places in Vegas.  Be ready to spend a pretty penny and please dress nicely.  This is a great place to pamper yourself and try amazing food.  You will have 3 servers taking care of you the whole time.  We tried a few of their signature cocktails:  mojito, a basil ginger drink, and a pear delight.  All the drinks were fantastic.  We ordered 2 appetizers: prosciutto wrapped dates filled with blue cheese and ricotta stuffed squashed blossoms.  We could've stopped there and died from amazing food, but we are troopers!  Our entree we ordered was  chateaubriand for 2.  Chateaubriand steak is a meat dish cooked with a thick cut from the tenderloin filet.  They slice and finish the cooking process at your table and serve it to you with sauteed asparagus and these crispy potatoes with onions.  It is amazing and melts in your mouth.  Should we have stopped there?  Yes, we were already full!!!  But we are definitely not quitters and needed dessert!  We tried the duck egg creme brulee and the banana cream pie, which they're famous for.  Fantastic!!!!  Both were great in their own way.  The creme brulee was the right enough of creamy and sweet goodness.  The little water cookies and fruit added a surprisingly satisfying texture to it.  The banana cream pie is not like your mommas pie.  The bananas and cream are layered and makes it kind of like a layered cake.  The crust, whipped cream, chocolate shavings, and drizzled caramel meshed together well with the cold cream and bananas.  This was one of my favorite parts of the dinner and was clear they were famous for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana cream pie with chocolate shavings and caramel drizzle.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck egg creme brûlée and banana cream pie.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pear delight signature cocktail.

eEMNuwA7zm2seEDRQ32KgQ.text: As you walk to your table you notice that the place is quite minimal in design. A bit too minimal if you ask me. The night atmosphere was quietly dimmed but I didn't feel like I was in quite the right ambience to eat expensive steak. To each his or her own of course.  I will say that the service was spot on. Never was my glass empty or did I have to wait a long time for service.  I ordered the Wagyu Filet Mignon and my Girlfriend ordered the Bone-in Rib-eye. We were started off with soft, thin bread but I was not really a fan of the seasoning.   After a long while, our steaks arrived. While the insides were cooked nicely, the outsides were a bit burnt. A little too burnt, very black on the edges. On top of that, the residue left from the burnt steak surface left their markings on the plate.   The wagyu, while tender and light, lacked in serious flavour. It definitely was not worth the premium price. The Rib-eye was deemed their best meat, but it did not fully deliver as I would like. It's a shame it didn't come with any sides either. Eating just meat on a plate is very non-fancy imo.  Overall, I probably will not come back. The atmosphere felt a little too casual and the prices were a bit too high for the value and taste you get.

peE3WSrMV7DSITBUtS4_gA.text: I ordered the 9oz fillet and shared the potatoes at gratin along with the Brussel sprouts.   The ambiance is rather plain but the service and food make up for that.  We had 3 waiting staff assist us and they were great. My steak was cook perfectly and I love the charred flavor and butter on top it was delicious. The potatoes were super cheesy and delicious. The Brussel sprouts were a bit bland and cooked well.   We shared the bananas foster which was to die for and I'm not much of a dessert person.  I'll definitely go back for the steak.

zUm77c1ZEytllJWXGU5Sog.text: Exactly what I would expect from dining at a steakhouse like this. It was great and met my expectations but nothing stood out as "above and beyond" so sticking with a 4 star rating.   Sommelier provided a great wine recommendation and helped us identify some of the tasting notes we were picking up on the wine. Ask him any questions you have, he was great.   The charcuterie board wasn't my favorite as an appetizer. Filet mignon was cooked perfectly to medium rare. Side dishes were good. Dessert was great! If you like banana cream pie don't mess around and save some room for a slice after your meal!

oMDu07ghRqqscgBG7Fqr2w.text: Choosing the right steakhouse in Vegas is a tough choice, considering they are a dime a dozen. I'd say we chose the wrong one. The ambiance is nice and the service is good, as any high-class restaurant should be but the steak was sub-par. I've been to many steakhouses in my day, and let me tell you; the steak was just not good. We started off the night with some appetizers and drinks that were delicious. We ordered the lobster claws and tuna tarter, which was actually pretty good. Then we got to the steak. I have to admit, I was excited because Delmonico's is known for their steak, and I am a man who loves his red meat.   The first cut was rough and filled with cartilage / fat. It was very difficult to cut through, and I had to discard it because there was hardly any meat on it, more so just fat. After two or three bites, I started to accept my fate. I had a bad cut. The meat was underseasoned and not as juicy as medium rare should be. I thought maybe the meat was on the last days of expiration or something, but all in all, it just wasn't good. At places wehere I'm spending more than 60 bucks on a ribeye, I eat everything. I mean everything, the fat, the cartilage EVEYTHING. Because it's usually that good. At Delmonico's, I left half the plate. My advice, save your money for a better steakhouse. This one is overrated.

0tcYRAnSYJQfkf8nAiu12A.text: The filet was amazing. All the sides were great. The desserts were on point. The staff was friendly and great at their job. I really enjoyed our time here.

bFj4BZ_cExMWB0xUWVssMA.text: We eat or have whisk(e)y at Delmonico nearly every time we're in Vegas--a few/several times a year.  We love the place, but we are not going to sit in a basically empty bar (2 people at the bar) and be ignored for 10 minutes.  No "hey, be right with you"; no dropped lunch menus.  So we went two doors down and had drinks and lunch at Chica, which we've been to before a few times and is quite good, but that's a different review.  Get it together.

x4dzY-pWTI5QztyZfzoaLA.text: Excellent food and they ended up having my favorite Argentine wine too!  It's not on the menu but the chef is was able to make oyster rockefellers.  We ordered the steak, chicken breast, creamed spinach and scalloped potatoes, all were excellent!  The service was great and the staff are very attentive and friendly.  The popovers were nice and light so you don't fill up on the usual bread.  I highly recommend coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana

32fVLvC64u2apND8SDz_0A.text: Well let me just say my boyfriend and I had an awesome experience dining at this restaurant. We planned a quick last minute getaway and stayed at the Venetian hotel. We tried to get dinner reservations at The Cut restaurant since we heard good reviews however we were unable to because of the short notice. Delmonico was our second choice. As we walked in we were greeted kindly by the hostess who was nice enough to take a couple pictures of us before we sat down. This restaurant as a team of different individuals who will make your dining experience top notch. First off they have Sommelier who came right over to help us with our wine selection based on our likes. We order a bottle of Keever which is a red Cabernet. The food was exceptional and well presented. Just a little side not if you order the filet mignonette medium rare is more on the rare side. But I have to say the best part was taking our wine bottle to go! My boyfriend was embarrassed that I asked but I didn't have the heart to let good wine go to waste. I asked the waitress if they had "to go cups" and they brought out special wine glasses from the hotel which we were allowed to take outside the restaurant.   *** Don't let the lack of plain or non decor fool you they just want you to focus on the food!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lLonnkZ1-Y3hEbeCPmLJcA.text: My husband wanted a good steak so after looking up reviews we decided to try Delmonico. We both left disappointed. My husband had the aged bone in ribeye medium rare. The ribeye came more on the medium side with not much flavor. The potato side was left mostly untouched as it wasn't very good, the side of mushrooms was decent. My fish wad undercooked and the hash it came on was completely tasteless. The duck creme brulee was very heavy. The reason I gave this place 2 stars is for the ambiance and good wine list. Definitely would not comeback.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uqe43KjTaF-Ip4DiJ1CISQ.text: The food was so good & our wait staff was impeccable. It deserves 5  stars for those 2 things, but the ambiance was compromised throughout our meal... We arrived at 10pm with a reservation and all was great, however, 1/3 of the way into our meal they started tearing down all the tables and chairs to the left of us and stacking them ..... they did it quietly and respectfully but the ambiance was ruined and at the price of their menu, I think we all expect a stellar experience. The foie gras was great, and the 9oz  filet was cooked perfectly for us! The newest item on the menu was a brussel sprouts side dish and it will definitely be a crowd favorite!

2gnMmhBMRqaYt6iSNny5bg.text: Very proper waiting on you, we were one of the first to arrive.   Food was excellent, most steak houses of this caliber are--if you're looking for a typical wine and dine situation this is the place.   Ambiance was nice but nothing memorable.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum

65SyKxoE-b2UuGAxwSSN-w.text: Fine dining taken to another level.  The filet is mouth watering.   Thanks to my friend's for taking me here for a memorable birthday .

oEz1Egsu2jvLjnBWAtZ9Ew.text: There's a reason why Emeril Lagasse is such a celebrated chef. His restaurant, Delmonico Steakhouse, provided impeccable service and outstanding food.  Delmonico Steakhouse was our big dinner out in Vegas for a bachelorette weekend. 9 of us were promptly seated for our 7:30pm Sunday reservation.
