cFScDKl6_cTT8X_HvjqFxA.text: Las Vegas has steak houses everywhere you look.  Delmonico Steakhouse is one of the better ones.  I ate dinner at the bar, where a full menu is available.  Overall the meal was very good:  very good foie gras; an excellent bone-in rib eye steak with three sauces (barnaise, A-OK [like a fancy version of A-1], and a third sauce that I liked but can't remember anything about); bananas Foster ice cream pie that was good but not to die for.  A number of wines are available by the glass.

B45SjrSgVXDw2EPlFCsBoQ.text: Love going to Delmonico's almost everytime I go to Las Vegas. Great steaks, wine, and food in general. Best steak in Las Vegas!

h5zVQ94QbWUxKe-2QIBVnA.text: Overall, I'd say that this restaurant was good but not memorable. For a classic upscale steakhouse, I'd like a meal and experience that will last for awhile. I was going to rate this restaurant four stars, but after reading a few other reviews, I dropped it down to three - we simply didn't have the same experience, which is frustrating.  We dined here three days ago, and the only thing I remember about it was the cost of the bill...and the potatoes gratin. Those were...amazing.  If you're staying at the Venetian/Palazzo, and don't wish to leave the property, by all means, go forth. But if you're looking for a True old school steakhouse experience, I'd say do some more research first.

hJz3rV3dnm23R-9qzsJSbg.text: I am a huge fan of this restaurant. The steaks especially the prime bone-in rib eye, is dry aged properly on premises and done perfectly at the right temperature - it needs no improvement. Service is warm, friendly and unpretentious like you were at an old friend's place. I've been to other so-called superior steakhouses with snobby servers who just take away from an otherwise good experience. Delmonico knows its the dining experience that you remember and not exactly what you ate that made a difference.  I keep it simple and have a few sides (Apple cured kurubota bone-in BACON!) with the steak and maybe start off with the caesar salad prepared tableside. Root beer float is my favorite dessert but the Banana Cream Pie is worth trying too. There are plenty of hand crafted cocktails available on the drink menu for you to enjoy. Attire is business or smart casual (no sleeveless shirts but I think casual shorts are ok especially in the summer). You can find it in The Venetian Resort Hotel Casino and there is access from The Palazzo too!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Emeril&#39;s Banana Cream Pie
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E3zkfM1uJ3jhRTC-F5cWxQ.text: My brother and I went to Delmonico on vacation as we'd heard they had a great whiskey selection and they did not disappoint.  We had the pleasure of sampling a few bucket list whiskey selections including a William Larue Weller 2018.  We also shared an order of fries and one of chicharrones.    Our server Clint was the best!  He split the pours of the whiskeys we wanted to sample and even brought over the bottles so we could take a quick photo.  He also suggested a third whiskey that we should try which was an Emeril barrel pick of Weller 107.  Thanks Clint!

x4d1yQgTE-vE3l7VaajohQ.text: This place was amazing. I am so glad I chose Delmonico's to celebrate my birthday. To begin with, they had a hand written birthday card waiting for me, which was very thoughtful. We did not order any appetizers, so we could save room for dessert. We both ordered the 8oz. filet with the peppercorn brandy au poivre sauce. The twice baked potato and the bacon cheese grits for our sides. Our steaks were amazing and cooked perfectly. The sides were just as incredible. We loved all of it. We had the German chocolate cake and the duck egg creme brulee for dessert. The German chocolate cake was pretty good, but the creme brulee was very good. Delmonico's has dethroned Vince Young Steakhouse in Austin as our favorite steakhouse. I didn't think that was possible. Anytime we are back in Vegas, we will definitely dine here.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The filet and the bacon cheese grits.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu

oT4C3GY5EQ4FgwKtyQgIQw.text: We celebrated my sister's 40th Birthday here and she really enjoyed the entire dining experience with Delmonico's. She enjoyed the food along with her friends as well. They also gave her a complementary slice of cake.   This was my second time coming here and the servers and waiters were awesome once again. I ordered the Bone-in Ribeye this time believe its 20oz and my wife ordered the Seared Sea Scallops & Herb Gnocchi. I would have to say the Bone In Ribeye is now my FAVORITE steak to get here now. I ordered it medium rare. It so juicy, tender and flavors galore all up in your mouth lol! I pretty much smashed the whole steak and it didn't have a chance. I think it's a must try item on their menu. Thank you Delmonico's Las Vegas for another great experience and making my sister's 40th birthday dinner a memorable one for her!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Louisiana Root Beer Float!
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Sea Scallops &amp; Herb Gnocchi ( ^_^)b
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 20oz Bone In Ribeye (medium rare) TRY IT!!! ( ^_^)b

w95ZlX4TfJNfIWURubTv1A.text: Just finished up our dinner for our first anniversary. Was a beyond lackluster experience. When I made the reservation they asked if it was a special occasion but was not once mentioned by anyone there. We waited 25 mins for refills on tea and soda. When given our bill I tried to get some change with it so I could leave a better tip for them and wasn't even brought back my change so they got whatever it was instead of getting more money. Will definitely be trying a different steakhouse after this experience

Tem2XnyFpdboRx2ucz2Bhw.text: Devastatingly let down by Delmonico's. Tomato & Mozzarella Salad was mediocre at best. Sent most of it back. Tomatoes not ripe. Mozzarella not fresh. Balsamic was mostly oil, no vinegar. Delmonico steak severely under-seasoned. Chicken in chicken prosciutto was chewy from being over-cooked. No garlic in the garlic mash. As a Delmonico native, I brought my husband with promises of excellence and the best served item was the egg on my face from the disappointment.

UQC_oI9uViXTDuf5qn6UCQ.text: Been to many of Emeril Lagasse's restaurants around the country and this is yet another excellent eatery. The service is absolutely fabulous and the food, phenomenal. I had a ribeye that melted in my mouth. It was nicely charred and medium rare in the middle, just like I ordered it. My daughter had a New York Strip and she devoured it. My wife had the salmon and could not stop raving about it. We all shared a tempura lobster which was divine. Our side was a potato croquet that I absolutely have to figure out how to make at home. It is not inexpensive but it is worth the price.

hecdhbTDbQIsTin0xWqG6A.text: By far my favorite steakhouse. The Chateaubriand was amazing. They cook it table side for you. Well worth splurging when in Vegas. Make sure to ask for bearnaise sauce as it is not included. I make a trip here every time I have friends in Vegas and everyone is in love with it.

NlIFp4Tl-zQS7azEfYUiSQ.text: Wow! Wife and we're impressed. We done our a lot with customers and live in Vegas so the restaurants are top notch and overpriced. Delmonico has great price points for its food and it is delicious. Not over indulgent to over compensate for poor quality food. Most important was the customer service we received by Anthony one of the managers. He took time to educate my wife and I about port wines and paired our meal with great reds. We will be back and my customers I take to dinner as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wife and I
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Manager Anthony
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great wine. Soft and flavorful. Smooth.

5Ww7zDM0N6mtS8cuDLcAvQ.text: We came to dinner with a party of 10.  We had excellent service but slightly poor recommendations.  I got the famous gumbo and was not disappointed.  I wanted a side to compliment it and was told the roasted potatoes was better than the twice baked potatoes and was let down.  Their was mixed reviews at the table on their entrees but they all did agree the German chocolate cake was very dry this night. The banana pudding cake was big hit though.   I would come back and explore more of their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oxhDLdIHNN9FJyaQruK3ug.text: This place is amazing!     One of the best steakhouses I've ever been to.   I'll be coming back every time I am in Vegas.  Gumbo-A+ Bone in ribeye-A+ Service-A+++  Longest wine list I've ever seen!

OygdoKwPk1-RbRcydAqS4A.text: Seriously one of the best steakhouses I have been in Vegas, cane here once during lunch and once during dinner and both times the food is pretty bomb. You can make reservations on Opentable.   The menu is slightly different for lunch and dinner with some items just being able to be ordered during the set time. For lunch I had the lobster roll to check out how they made this. The bread is unique and different from other lobster rolls I have tried. The I side had chunks of meaty lobster which was pretty delicious!   Friends all got different food and enjoyed their meals. Some ordered steak and some ordered lots of different appetizers as their main course. So you can pick and choose a variety of options!   Everything seems to be pretty tasty off the menu! Dinner seems a little bit on the busier side so don't forget to make reservations.   Tip: Loved the sides and if it's possible try to get a carb and a veggie to share it's shareable!

rsPFz37hNn5qWnwcQGVc5Q.text: OMG...the best food ever!! I don't have pics because I was at a business dinner with my husband, but the food was amazing!  I had the Caesar salad which was prepared table side and was sooo good. The seabass was the best I've ever had. The brussel sprouts were out of this world. My husband's filet was cooked perfectly and seasoned to perfection. The service was outstanding, as well.  The best restaurant in Vegas. It is definitely a must try!!

VcxenO52xbCQMQXV5BjUlQ.text: Awesome dinner. I was the the only one in our party of 4 who ordered the sea bass. The waiter described it as rich. I never finish my fingers but couldn't ready eating it all. Cooked to perfection!! I savored every bite. The others in my party had the filet and ribeye and devoured then as well. If you are a brussel sprout fan you have to order theirs. They were so amazing and flavorful. We shared the donut dessert which I wasn't going to try but couldn't help myself. You can't go wrong with anything on their menu. We plan on eating here again next time we're in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6e7qCQarv-liJxeRVSVbIw.text: I have to say I wasn't impressed by the taste of the meat definitely not worth 60$ I would rather go to soho order a lot of sushi for the price I ended up paying 150$ plus tip . The mojito was good and also the fingering potatoes fried in duck fat .

Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ab3vxNcn7MtWln7OWUtRoQ.text: BEST BEST BEST EVER. We have dined over the years every time we come to Vegas. They keep the same high quality food and staff consistently. TRUE FINE DINING.    Incredible food. Great Staff. Great ambience. Great Presentation. Dress Code .. well most people dress up nicely.  You can wear jeans but you shouldn't.  T-shirts.  yeah some guys had t-shirts on.. but seems to be only with a bigger group of people.   Real tableside Caesar salad for two.  The Pork Chop.  BEST EVER..  not like any you have ever seen before. To Delmonicos.. please never change.

K6SQH8M_rmZaN8G2CT_dYw.text: First of all, if you feel like someone is underage and need to ID them then do it right away, don't uncomfortably stare at them for over 10 minutes then ask for ID after drinks have been ordered.  I'm 30 and look young, I get asked for identification a lot, however this place did it so awkward and uncomfortably.  I ordered a steak medium temperature and it was so rare I could not eat it.  My dinner was potatoes gratin and salty mushrooms, the server told us Marcus "took care of it on the bill", well thank you Marcus for not charging something I didn't even touch.

ICJnypQxXacQKQVvTiu9EQ.text: I was there with a group of 6 people, the bill was over $600. Now if the food was best of the best, I may be writting a far different review.   This restaurant experience was a HUGE disappointment!! I ordered the New Orleans BBQ Shrimp appetizer. It was so salty it wasn't eatable. That was followed by Gumbo that was also too salty eat. I then had a portion of the bone in rib eye, that was tough.   The rest of folks in my group ordered steaks. We also had cream spinach and au gratin potatoes. Not a single person in the group was pleased with the food. Particularly, when considering the price.  I left hungry, so I went back to my hotel and ordered dinner.  There are ALOT of great restaurants in Las Vegas, sadly Delmonico's is not one of them.

tGc_esmBhyR-18VJR6RL4w.text: Excellent service.  We were hosted to a private room for our team dinner during our conference, along with a special menu that was catered just for our company.  Their red wine was amazing. My steak was cooked to perfection. My banana cream pie was mouth watering. What an amazing place!   Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WwfrJ0LoOV-KEgCnk61Dow.text: The Steak was great. We ordered the Filet mignon. The drink are delicious. My husband Ordered the "No Problema" it's sort of like a Moscow Mule! The Parmesan Truffle Chips are a must have to order as an appetizer!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MzkKyb3d8Ow49NmmSuzaLA.text: My boyfriend and I dined here last week. We were able to make 6:00 reservations two days in advance for a Thursday. The seating was very prompt, they pull out your chair and place your napkin on your lap.. very fancy.   The bread is like a hollow croissant roll which is delicious! They bring one at a time but it's unlimited. The butter comes on a design on a small plate.  Our drinks were tasty, came quickly.  For an appetizer we got the king crab deviled eggs. They were good... nothing too special honestly.  Entrees were the rib eye and filet and shareable sides were the mushrooms and gratin potatoes. Steaks were cooked to perfection, mushrooms were amazing. Potatoes tasted like plain scalloped potatoes, could've used more seasoning and cheese.  Dessert was pecan pie with caramel and vanilla ice cream.. amazing.   The service was great, our waters were never once empty, plates always cleared and food came out quickly.  Over all it was a great date and experience. I would highly recommend if you haven't been. Being out of state we probably wouldn't go back because there are hundreds of other places for us to try first and we don't go to Vegas that often.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3_qPh42uXAHVEb2lKInwBg.text: Wow...was super disappointed by my dinner here. A buddy said he had the best steak in his life here, but unfortunately that wasn't anything close to my experience. Everything we had was sort of meh...  Started with french onion soup...steakhouse staple right? Wrong...it didn't have much flavor and was pretty one dimensional. Limp, flaccid, no flavor onions.  My steak...prime, dry-aged rib-eye on the bone. After being schooled by the waiter on how "they cook their steaks" and what medium rare means. I get a medium well steak instead of the medium rare that i ordered. What a waste of a good piece of meat or at least I assume it was before they over-cooked it.  Creamed spinach - another steakhouse classic they can't screw up right? It's got this weird taste and texture, not sure what it was, but didn't even eat half of it.  Very disappointing, really not worth the $$$ or even the time unforuntately. Don't bother.

gfLrI-P-oH5Y58UpL3wVAQ.text: The food was pretty good, but not as high of a level as the price.  I've had better, a lot better, and have to say I was disappointed.  A 5 star price requires 5 star food taste, that's my expectation.  The appetizers were actually a lot better than their flagship menu item, the steaks.  I ordered the Delmonico, and it lacked flavor. I don't expect to go back.

MoqL2NdUblCPAAcH0hSsdw.text: Wow what a great restaurant, expensive yes, good food yes, massive wine list, lots of choices on menu and for appetizers, I wasn't to impressed with the bacon appetizer, but the seafood tower was so much food and good, should of ordered the Petite filet, but I got the Ribeye, the pepper sauce was just ok, the reduction sauce is the way to go. To full for desert, make a reservation and don't be Ina hurry, can get loud

aGfG15DGP_zNOjF9A5EnVA.text: I have been to almost every steak house. Exceeded my expectations completely. Great recommendation on the wine, seafood tower and bone in filet.  Only thing better than the food was the service.  Outstanding.  And I never post a review

uNxMUPNIs8xMr3Tl9BRFKA.text: Amazing Food and great service. Had the 9oz filet and it was perfectly cooked. Husband and I shared the potatoes augratin and the cream corn concoction. Both supremely tasty and served hot in little dishes. Wine selection was great and service was superb. Great high end meal place. We chose to close with the banana cream pie. It was slightly less sweet than I would have preferred but overall grade is A+

ReeKroMIWoghZ2GH7ReNuQ.text: Came here with my partner on Christmas Day for dinner. The service here was very attentive, but that's my expectation for a place like this. The drinks were strong, but again, I expect that for the prices they charge. We started with bread and butter.  The bread was sweet and very light.  I didn't particularly enjoy the sweetness of the bread. For appetizers, we had the seafood tower and gumbo.  Nothing mind blowing. In fact, I've had better gumbo in New Orleans.  I had the filet mignon and my partner had the ribeye.  The steaks were cooked perfectly and the seasoning was delicious. Any sides you want with your steak order (baked potato, mushrooms, etc) is an extra charge. Again, I expect SOMETHING to go along with my steak order for the prices they charge. It was a special night, so the splurge isn't the issue.  I just don't feel like I received much value for the products we received.  You're better off going to Outback Steakhouse, in my opinion.

XpEG8qcoRWfilrnBMnI2rw.text: I would like to preface this review by saying that my husband and I enjoy fine dining. In the last two evenings in Vegas we have eaten at Sinatra and Vic and Anthony's. Both amazing places.  The reason I am only giving this place two stars is because I compare it to those fine dining establishments that we ate at previously.  For high end dining it was not very good this place is extremely expensive. The wine by the glass list is priced at least 30% higher than wine by the glass at other high-end restaurants.  We started with the foi gras appetizer as I love this dish and order it at any restaurant when available.  We were very disappointed and were unable to even finish it it was so unappetizing. The slab of foi gras was too thick and extremely slimy. I expect it to be slimy this was excessive.  Our waiter was odd. He was not helpful and he lurked around  the table not saying anything. Husband ordered fillet. I ordered the sea bass. Neither were very tasty. We ended up only eating half of our meal and then leaving.  We've eaten at a lot of high-end steakhouse is with different types of ambience. The ambience in this restaurant is strange. Save your money. There are way better restaurants in Vegas at lower price points delivering better food

Z1kXlZjCqybwy-PcXZfIqA.text: We absolutely loved this place! The food was delicious! We started with the special appetizer of the day, the lobster avocado toast. Then we had the filet mignon, the lobster tail, and potato gratin. All were cooked perfectly. Our waiter was spot on through the entire time even after a table of 20 came in. It was amazing to watch the food/table managers. These two ladies probably don't get a lot of credit but they kept that large restaurant running smoothly. We ended the evening with their delicious German chocolate cake paired perfectly with a dessert wine our waiter recommended.

RqMPApD6ileASFe8pJEdWg.text: Bam!  Emeril has done it again with his delicious steakhouse, Delmonico, located on the casino floor in restaurant row at the Venetian in Las Vegas.  We celebrated my sister's birthmonth and she received a complimentary note and ice cream dessert.  We started the night with a buttered crostini with salami on top, compliments of the chef.  We ordered the grilled octopus and bbq shrimps as appetizers, both were very tasty and prepared our tastebuds for the scintilating steak.  For sides, we had the buttered asparagus, mushrooms with multiple types, and duckfat fingerling potatos.  I had a bone-in rib eye that was well done with herb butter adorning the top which slowly seeped through the tender cut and infused the meat juices to provide for an even more flavorful bite.  For dessert we had Emeril's banana cream pie and the caramel butter cake, both so decadent and sweet, what a way to end a meal:)  The servers were very attentive and efficient.  The restroom, though it was a long hallway away and only had 2 stalls, was clean and well kept.  The ambience was classy and loud in some areas due to the archways and cavernous ceilings reminiscent of a wine cellar.  The dinner was very satisfying and the whole experience was an example of Emeril's excellence.  Thank you Delmonico Steakhouse for becoming one of my favorite strips of steak on the Las Vegas Strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in rib eye well done
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushrooms

L6_maKlneeV5VdYtFfsKgQ.text: First time to Delmonico, and there are many things to like about this restaurant. A little context: I went just before Christmas so this is a slower time for Vegas. Nonetheless, I had no problem making a reservation the afternoon of (mere hours), and the host was quite friendly over the phone. We arrived at the appointed time and were quickly whisked away to our table. While the restaurant setting is quite nice, we arrived in nice sweaters and jeans, yet did not feel conspicuous. The seating is unlike most restaurants I've patronized; each table is spaced a fair distance from the next, making it quite a delightful (and quieter) experience. Fast forward to the meal: Delicious and unique! I might pass on the truffle potato chips again, simply because they really are just potato chips and truffle oil...nothing terribly special, but this is a matter of personal taste and to each his own. The staff were professional and knowledgeable and delivered the food in a delightfully coordinated way (split plates placed simultaneously before us). We were not bothered during dinner, but there was always someone about, just in case! You can view the kitchen through glass and a quick observation assured me that our food was being prepared in a clean setting and by experienced hands. Bottom line: Delmonico is worth a visit if you value unique flavors and well-prepared dishes in a quiet (ish), professional environment.

4PRbNWjm_7c-BrauLpBm5Q.text: Perhaps my expectations were too high. Let me start off by saying, the hype about their 16 oz Bone-in Ribeye ($52) is well deserved.  It's flavorful, has exquisite marbling, and served at a medium rare perfection.  But that's where the hype ends.  Sure, the lobster bisque is good and the shrimp appetizer is tasty, but for what we paid overall, I know there are better options here in the city.    So, I would say to you -- go for their Bone-in Ribeye and leave all other expectations behind.  It's a great meal, just didn't make it to my list of favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half portion of the bone-in rib eye (2/2)
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half portion of the bone-in rib eye (1/2)
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed greens (half portion)

XH1KC-kXr0uKKsH07jr6sw.text: Pescatarian review:  We came here because we had a hotel credit to use from the Palazzo so it was our fancy meal of the trip.   I am a pescatarian so I had: -Chardonnay -Complimentary bread: lovely -Halibut with chantarelle mushrooms and black-rice risotto: the chanterelles were yummy. The halibut was well cooked and delicate. The black-rice risotto was different but overall, this dish was not real exciting.  My family's dishes:  -Chateaubriand: at $120 for 2 people, this was probably the best deal since it's the only one that came with sides of asparagus and mashed potatoes. -Filet Mignon -Rib Eye -Broccoli side -Baked potato  They thought the rub was a little too salty and the rib eye meat to not be as high quality. The filet mignon and chateaubriand got a "pretty good" otherwise.  The service here is very good. I'd say the decor is lacking. In a strip of restaurants in a 5 star hotel, it wasn't very grand and the entrance was easy to miss. It could have felt fancier.  All in all, an ok first time at an Emeril restaurant.

Lx3m3LDnJHJ0e4IjgPl1Pg.text: What sets this place apart is it's service. I'll get to that later but let's start with the food. Bone in rib eye. Yes. Get it. It's big. Charred to perfection. They cut it up for you as well. Absolutely delicious. Pumpkin Ravioli very good. Creamy. It's got a rich taste to it. Bread puffs are like Yorkshire pudding. Delicious. Don't eat too many before the meal. French onion was okay. Came a little lukewarm. Too much cheese. Could use less cheese and more bread IMO. Potato's gratin was good. Mushrooms were great but wanted more button mushrooms. Great mix of mushrooms but the seasoning was incredible. Banana cream pie was insane. Highly recommend if you like bananas. Not that much banana cream though, which I like. Still very good. Now the service. It was like every table was VIP. Our server Nicole and her assistant (I think that's what you call them) Peter were a dynamic duo. Drinks always refilled anything you need it was there. More bread, extra napkins. Everything on demand. What my family liked about Nicole the most was her honesty and knowledge of the menu. You don't get that anymore. It's hard to come by. She knew about all the dishes and gave us the information we needed to make our decisions. Highly recommend this place to people visiting.

Vw2equ6LSBeHui7fD7tong.text: We ordered their signature BONE-IN RIBEYE but it was a bit fatty. It was not so bad but I wouldn't recommend it due to its price, not really worth it (though what food is worthy its price on strip lol...) The LOBSTER BISQUE was fine, tasted similar to Joe Fortes in Vancouver. PAN SEARED FOIE GRAS was a bit toward sweet side, meaning it tasted a bit too sweet for me but also maybe I was having it as my main. I think if I didn't have the whole dish but shared it instead, it would be fine. HOWEVER, the char brussel sprouts was way too bitter!! It's like 85% black and inedible... I would have rated 2 star only but the bus boy was attentive and professional (I would not say the same about our waiter though...) Generally, I would not come back here to dine again since there wasn't really anything standing out or special. But other than the sprouts, we did not have a bad dining experience. It's an OK restaurant, but do you really want to just do OK when you go to Vegas? lol

asZLS6_pr9TtSYknAr9UNg.text: My husband and I had not been to Vegas in approximately 10 years.  It was our 24th wedding anniversary and we decided to really splurge.  I had been told by multiple people that we MUST eat here.  I don't remember telling the restaurant  when I made the reservations that it was my anniversary---but I must have.  Talk about rolling out the red carpet for us!  The service is beyond comparable to any other in their class.  We were treated like royalty--yet it was in a very down to earth sort of way.  When we walked in I was nervous that is was a very "snooty" type of place.  I couldn't have been more wrong. Everyone was so easy to talk to and helpful with choosing dishes and drinks.  My husband and I both chose the recommendations that came from our wait staff.  I use the word "staff" since multiple people helped us.  From our bone-in steaks, to the  Pinot, everything was perfect!  We had the tomato salad and then sides of cream corn and potatoes au gratin.  I can't begin to explain how delish everything was!  I'm bummed that we did not order the banana cream pie, as everyone has asked me about it, but we were absolutely stuffed.   Our server brought us a complimentary dessert with a hand written Happy Anniversary note.  Such a nice touch!  I wish I could give it more that 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hand written Happy Anniversary note.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in steak
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fRFSxMDzvqmjrANd-kX9Yg.text: Food and Service are both excellent here.  Hubs had the raw oysters to start (excellent) and I had a shrimp-lettuce salad with remoulade sauce.  Yum!  We both ordered the signature bone-in Rib eye steak.  So perfect.  charred onthe outside, perfectly pink and soft on the inside.  Oh, my.  So very very good.  And the Popovers they give you are super wonderful too.  We had no room for dessert and had to leave some steak behind.   My complaints:   Restrooms are 20 MILES FROM THE DINING ROOM! I am disabled and walking is very difficult for me.  that was hard.  Also the interior:  STARK WHITE, WHITE, WHITE.  there are alcoves built into the walls-- empty!  Not a bit of art, color, whimsy, knick knacks or anything in the place (except for the burgundy rims of the china).  All that white made me feel like I was in a medical setting-- not warm and inviting at all,  Our waiter told us that "you are supposed to be in a wine cave".  No way... really bothered me to be in that all white setting, ruined the mood in a way.  No ambience at all.  But A+ food and service really saved the day!

ss4DtNkVYfcgow-u7vyzkw.text: As reviewed and tasted it was an experience. Very classy menu, entrees and appetizers had taste and good portions. Service was exceptional, specially with big group and different orders. Servers were patient while let us enjoy the meal, no rush at all. Well lit, romantic or business type dining, very convenient location from Palazzo or Venetian. Steaks were tender, right temp and taste was...well why don't you try it. We will return some day. Thank you staff.

qE0UzPoSHV1A-Fs-CIc2Yg.text: Came for a late lunch after a friend's wedding ceremony at the Venetian Hotel gandola ride. Impeccable service and food. They even gave the newlyweds a congrats card. Ribeyes (16 oz) were worth every dollar. I loved the bread they serve before you eat, its not heavy at all. I just wish i had saved enough room to eat dessert. Oh well, next time! With all the competition on the strip and in the hotel, Delmonico lived up and surpassed the ratings and the reviews from Yelp, Opentable and even Google. We will definitely return the next time we are in Vegas.

SZWITs-n85j5D3p7J8zugw.text: Finally, after many visits to Las Vegas, I made it to Delmonico Steakhouse at the Venetian, and I loved my dinner! Ordered both the foie gras and the truffle Parmesan potato chips to start. They were both brought to the table at the same time so I knew I would need to eat the foie gras first which was quite good. The potato chips were great, and since I had ordered the wagyu ribeye for $90, I didn't want to fill up on the chips, I asked if they could box up the chips to take back to my room.  No problem, and they were delicious the next day! The wagyu ribeye is the best beef I've ever had! Perfect med-rare with great flavor and the most tender beef ever! I've had wagyu at other steakhouses in LV, but this blew away the competition!  The size was perfect for me: 6 or 8 ounces (I forgot which). Since this is white truffle season, I chose the white truffle ice cream that is vanilla ice cream stuffed with lots of small pieces of truffle. It is served as 3 balls which I figured I'd eat one or two, but it was so addictive that I ate the whole thing! Service was very friendly and attentive. Delmonico Steakhouse is now my favorite steakhouse!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmesan truffle potato chips
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato gratin

4uj4JYuwBNDzn3uUhkYYaQ.text: I have eaten here many times during my trips to Las Vegas. Each time, the service and food is impeccable.  My husband always orders the steak, I the Tartar. The tarter is the best I have EVER had.  Also, make sure you order their pecan and shortbread desert--my favorite desert I've ever had in a restaurant. Cheers to Emeril for making this spot excellent from start to finish.

hgAlRu6kGWqfxvOshigPwg.text: WOW! Had no idea this place was this good!!! Had some surf and turf and it was excellent! great service and very easy to get to from the Convention Center.

cHsv7KZDouejMVih43qRUQ.text: Had Dinner at Delmonico on 11-5-15.  Still the best Wedge Salad that I have ever had.  The rest was great and the service is outstanding!  You can't go wrong at Delmonico!

QkoSSF2T8mgYXoHk-CYREw.text: I come here often.  Still one of my favorite steakhouses in Vegas.  The restaurant ascetic is less dolled up than Cut or Carnevino, however I enjoy the simplicity of the place.  Think underground wine tunnel, that's the decor you should expect.  Love the apple cured bone in bacon and bone in rib eye.  Last visit, Service was a little sub-par.  In a town that tries to pinch you for every nickel bringing in our own wine, a 2001 Peju ($200+ bottle) from our personal cellar may have hurt his pocket.  Living here in Vegas probably raised my standard of Service, especially when you take home six figures as a Professional Server.   Yup.  It is a career here vs a job for most places in the world.  Without corkage ($35), the bill was still $300+ for 2 people.  We enjoy our food!

1i20aoQNh9-pZJ4NWM94bQ.text: Best Steak I ever eaten - Delmonico Rib Eye. It's pricey but worth it. You will not be disappointed.

oqQsexnfmYxRO-0NvxJN9A.text: My must stop at Vegas. Highly recommend to anyone who appreciate a good steak. And try the BBQ shrimp as well. You won't be disappointed.

Tp6AJ7IFoCzVLNqGf1PvzQ.text: We ate a very quiet lunch at Delmonico's on a Monday afternoon -- just a handful of other tables at 1:00 pm.  I love going to steak houses at lunch - - you usually get a great meal at a reasonable price.  I had the deconstructed steak salad -- delicious.  Medium rare with blue cheese.  Yum.  Hub's had the Lobster Sliders -- divine. We each had a glass of wine, so it was an $80 lunch, with tip.  Service was spotty.  The assistant waiter was great, but our lead waiter was very distracted and barely attended the table.  When asked about simple wine questions (what blend was the Emeril Red), had to defer to the FoH manager.  Will go back -- love Delmonico's here & in NOLA.  I've never been disappointed at any restaurant run by Emeril.

fQ__1a4w6NLK06Axqz-ISQ.text: The meal started with Ryan greeting us and taking great care of every detail. From the Lobster Bisque and wedge salad with blue cheese crumbles to the best bone-in rib-eye in years to a great and perfectly tart key lime pie, I could not be happier.  Great meal and service!

YwgrEfm7jJgEkAeSZuDS0g.text: Had the bone-in ribeye. It was good but not knock my sox off good. I can't give 5 stars because i thought pricing was a bit high and quality wasn't up there with the pricing.

46g-ED1NUMqKSXYTYg2lAg.text: Went for lunch waited almost five minutes for any type of service (was not busy). Ordered appetizers chips and gumbo they were very good. Then the  bad. We ordered two burgers one medium one medium well. Both came medium rare at best. Sent them back, they put the burgers back on the grill. Came back mine was supposed to be medium well was medium. My wife's was supposed to be medium was medium rare. Both came back on blood soaked buns WOW.  We were disappointed. It did get better the pecan pie with ice cream was very good.  Also our server was very nice once he came to the table. So for the poor burger and blood soaked bun I have to give three stars.

J8-0VE-c1zPIrFIsYhXkbQ.text: Went here over the past weekend just to try. Have been to other steakhouses like cut, Ruth cris, morels, summit house in Fullerton, and lawrys. Safe to say food was decent considering the price.   Filet mingnon was tender but good. Not great. I have liked the filet at cut much better.   Crab legs were bland but amazingly precut and offered at either a cold or hot temperature.   The lobster bisque was ok too. I think I had expected the greatness I found with McCormick's lobster bisque. Safe to say for the price I would probably go to cut again or lawrys or McCormick. Probably wouldn't want to go back here. Sorry kids. But that's just me.

_tqK-hTclbiY9SagkCZcXw.text: Phenomenal!  Came back here to celebrate a birthday and everything was what I expected and more.  My requests for a particular table were all handled without any problems.    I am usually a New York Strip guy, but I was hungry so I opted for the bone in ribeye for the first time here.  Birthday girl had the filet mignon. Sides included smashed potatoes and broccoli.   Bone in ribeye: Humongous! Probably 20oz. +  Beautifully crusted, with just the right amount of seasoning. Steak as always, cooked perfectly medium rare, which made for an amazingly juicy and flavorful experience.   Filet Mignon: Now normally I am not a filet person, but I did try a piece or maybe two.  Beautiful crust and to my surprise it also had excellent flavor.  Tender as you would expect from a great cut of Filet Mignon.  However, still not as juicy as my steak was.  Service as usual, impeccable.  Insanely large wine list, with almost every wine imaginable.  Complimentary amuse bouche and bread are also delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Ribeye

qZActShxqXszMOnI4HWleA.text: Amazing service, even better food, I can't imagine how this could ever get less than five stars unless people don't like the prices. We spent $260 for three and we did not have dessert or drinks, and I'm ok with that. Every bite was fabulous and the servers were unbeatable.

tqcalC4qhJfxA91YF4_aVw.text: Service was great, the NY Strips were very fatty which is why I'm giving 3 instead of 4 stars. I only ate a few bites but stopped because it was so fatty.

ZqMUHOJg9lGOmfqQ7RXj7A.text: This was supposed to be a very special dinner for 10 for my husband's 50th birthday. Four other couples flew in  from all over to celebrate with us and the first problem is that they seated us at a table for 9. The hostess called that morning and said 9, I corrected her and let her know there were 10 and she said she'd call me back by noon to confirm but I never heard back. Regardless, this Open Table reso said 10 so I didn't worry about it until we all sat down, realized we were one short, and had to get back up and go wait in the bar.  When were seated at a proper table, the appetizers that I'd pre-ordered were sitting out on the table, including fried oysters which had gone ice cold and soggy (very gross). We had to ask for bread long after entrees were served and it was cold, mushy things that looked like they used to be popovers (I thought I'd remembered a wonderful bread service before...?) And so on with the poor service... I've eaten here before and service and food were five stars. But the bone-in ribeyes were bland and not well-marbled, the bone-in bacon was 100% bone-in fat (of course bacon is very fatty but there was NO meat to be found at all) and the service was severely lacking in detail and common meal planning skills. I could list all the issues but you get the picture. Very disappointing. The best part of the meal was the fresh oysters in the seafood tower, very fresh and delicious.

zIZyOwRcrEXeKK8BhWHZrQ.text: I was treated to a lovely birthday dinner here and was pleasantly surprised.  The restaurant is a lot bigger than it actually looks.  Walking past it in the Venetian, you wouldn't believe it extends back to a full restaurant.  The ambiance is elegant, comfortable, but friendly.  The manager came out before our meal to greet us and wish me a happy birthday, which was rather special.  The wine list was over 100 pages long and took us quite some time to decide which bottle to get.  We had the truffle & parmesan potato chips, which were just okay, and a small charcuterie plate with homemade cheese chips. For our main courses, I ordered the filet mignon.  My date ordered the bone in ribeye with foie gras.  My steak was arguable the best steak I've ever had.  It was perfectly buttery, seared and charred on the outside but tender, moist, juicy, and pink on the inside.  I had a bite of the ribeye with foie gras, which was just savory overload. For dinner, we received a complimentary "Happy Birthday" sorbet with a candle in it.  I had a great experience there and would go back again for the steak.  I only gave 4 stars and not 5 because the other menu items (starters and sides) were very forgettable.  The steak however, was unforgettable.   Date night seal of approval!

snWa0dMG9wF6pEu7ExitpA.text: Came here for a quick dinner before the rest of our girlfriends arrived for our Vegas weekend.   Me and my friend at the at the bar and ordered the bone in ribeye to share. It came out juicy and perfectly cooked. My complaint would be it lacked seasoning, I had to add salt and pepper, without it, it tasted like it was lacking a little in flavor. I had a glass of wine, and tried a couple of their signature cocktails, a mint juliep drink and a lychee flavored one, both were very good.   Overall a decent meal but did feel a little out of place as we were leaving because me and my friend were both dressed super casual, shorts and a tee, while the rest of the people that had started to show up while we were eating were much more formal.

7_EgYjDbQteyjDr_TSB5gQ.text: Wow, all I can is wow.  I've been here many times in the past several years, but I have to say, this last time was my most favorite, most memorable and most enjoyable.    I sat at the bar and met Max Solano; to say he was a bartender is an understatement.  I've never called anyone a "mixologist" before, but if ever there was a man who deserved that title, its Max.  You can tell that his craft goes into every drink.  I sat at the bar, sipping what could have very well been the BEST Old Fashioned I've ever had and I watched him work.  He has the same passion behind the bar as a painter with a canvas, except his paint is liquor and his canvas, a glass.  With his jigger as a brush, he creates a drinkable Jackson Pollock  My steak was perfectly prepared and my time at the bar was most enjoyable.  It was a perfect finish to a long work week in Vegas.  I can't wait to go back.

Cd-OI-GOQPynP9I9PU2AMA.text: Dined there last weekend with some friends and we were utterly disappointed. Not impressed one bit. I don't understand how this restaurant received such high ratings, but I certainly would not go back nor would I recommend to anyone. From the food, the service, the ambiance - huge let down.  I would've given this place an additional star if the service wasn't so terrible.  The server was slow and was more interested in chatting.  Also, we waited at least 30 min to get our entrees(they didn't even seem busy).  After our table was cleared from apps and salads, we waited 20+ min before calling our server to check up on our food. She said it was still within the "window" and she couldn't do anything. Luckily, she spoke to her manager after another 5-10 min because that's when our food was "officially late."   What we had (from what I can recall): BBQ Shrimp - shrimps were cooked unevenly and drowned in mediocre BBQ sauce. Some were cooked well, but mine was under.  Vine-Ripened Tomato Salad - nothing special Baked Crab Stuffed Lobster - lobster tail cooked well, but tough to eat and nothing amazing NY Strip - no flavor Filet - nice crust from the Essence stuff Sauteed Garlic Mushrooms - standard Potato Gratin - bit on the dry side Creamed Corn Gratin - best side order we had on the table, but that doesn't mean much.  Dessert: Sorbet, banana cream pie, apple fritters, key lime pie. The desserts and our bottle of wine were probably the highlight of this dinner.  If you are looking for a good steakhouse on the strip, this is NOT the place. You'll probably have better luck at Mastro's, Stripsteak, Prime, or Craftsteak.

1kUjJHO_Kwthd7jCDozuYg.text: Best filet mignon of my life...cooked to perfection with cajun spices. The wine list blew my socks off...and I am a viticulture/enology geek (in normal English...I am a wine snob). This, was in fact, the most impressive part of my meal here. I couldn't stop turning the pages of the wine list (evidently the largest wine list on the West Coast). The sides are unbelievable and complementary to the steak. I highly recommend the carrot cake for dessert. Emeril sure outdid himself here.

JwmjXo-pJ_1_E8zlC2TdQQ.text: Had a very nice birthday dinner here and really, really enjoyed it. The atmosphere is simple and classic, it occurred to me that they were striving to feature the food with such simple ambiance, and they succeeded.   The service was fantastic, we had a team of servers for our party of 6 and we did not wait for a single thing throughout dinner. They did manage to find that balance between being attentive and hovering, it was perfect. Hubby and I had the table side prepared Cesar salad and it was excellent. For dinner I had the rare filet and I really enjoyed it, and the table shared the grits (my personal favorite of the entire dinner), spinach and mushrooms. For desert we had the peppermint profiteroles, which were so so (I'm not a big peppermint fan though).   I really enjoyed dinner and highly recommend it for a nice dinner in Vegas.

ITT5jKLyJnPdTTwq_4YE8Q.text: Steak and sides were tasty although not nearly as well prepared or delicious as the food at Ruth's Chris. The pecan pie desert was actually the best part of the meal and the chicory coffee was horrible. Wine list offered $40.00 bottles of wine for over $100.00. Service was excellent which it should be when your paying so much money for your food. Ruth's Chris is much better steak and sides for less money. A fun experience but will not be back for a long time.

eLvFwak244MuXrW-MX0h8A.text: Best steakhouse we've been to yet. Our wine pairing was on point. Absolutely excellent service, highly recommend!

CZIrliSFKw-ikE3aIwb4yQ.text: The first time I was here, the steak was great.  We came back today, and the steak was a bit overcooked thought it was still real good.  The garlic mushroom side order is a must.

LutE140GVeYg9ixbbYi7Ew.text: Five star service the bone in rub eye was a good size and so favor full and tender that I ate the whole thing , the strawberry shortcake was unbelievable . Unlike anything I had before, my wife loved her scallop and macadanina bread pudding. In fact. It was the olmy bread pudding I liked

pAq31fErj33YuS6PW_yeiw.text: We had scheduled our wedding dinner reception here. The whole process with them seemed difficult from the start.  Eventually we needed to start our dinner 30 minutes later than we first anticipated. We knew this at least a month before the event, but they could not accommodate us and make the change, which seemed ridiculous ... a half hour later, come on?  We ended up having the dinner reception at Postrio instead. It couldn't have turned out better and they were very easy to work with.   I've dined at both locations on separate occasions, and I have to say my food was better at Postrio both times.

vKHyTEAP28xGDCfSTaE_ug.text: I always make time to treat myself to a dinner at Delmonico's when I visit Las Vegas.  It has the best filet I have ever tasted; flavorful and tender. They are well known for their rib-eye, and although I have never eaten it, my husband loves it.  They are also known their New Orleans BBQ Shrimp appetizer and it is delicious (I try to make it at home.)  There are tasty desert selections and wine ranging from $30 to $50,000.    The front room tends to be noisy since everyone has to pass through it at some point.  Request a table by the kitchen or along the right side of the room.  And if you are a very special person, you can reserve the chefs table in the kitchen.  Either way, make reservations!

ADbl-2polwYaU9lQc8HiCg.text: Bread pudding and bone in rib eye and wine makes it 5 stars but the sides are so so ... Good not exceptional more to come...Finished dinner- still reminiscing about the bread pudding....its creamy, not to sweet, enough raisins, and ice on top- w/ pecan candied crunch- perfection.  the bone in rib eye is good- not the best I have ever had.  The reason being the ration of fat to meat was a little high- i do like marbled fat in the steak but when 1/3 of the steak is fat...i couldn't eat it w/o thinking of clogging my arteries.  Wine was exception- the Italy-"Vertigo" was yummy.  The best experience for me was spending it w/ my girl-riends esp for her 30th B-day! the service makes you feel grown up and independent!.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orgasmic bread pudding!

kiJ7Nk_y6FomgmNhKxuMAg.text: Fantastic food, great service.  Much more expensive than what we usually spend on dinner, but so yummy and worth it!  We both had steak for dinner, with sides of salad in the sherry ving., garlic smashed potatoes, and the pecan pie.  I wish we had room to finish the pecan pie, but could only get through half.

sU6fBJq3Km9QyrJ7AUtAZw.text: I've been here for a total of 3 times.. I think.. This was my FIRST ever formal ass restaurant..   My family and I got the special treatment, the taste test.. It was a 6 course meal and it was just too good. First they came out with the chips, something good to pick at until more food came out.. Soup, a refreshing trio platter that consist of fruit, crab meat, and a small salad. Then a piece of salmon topped with a thinly, crunchy slice of potato on top w/ veggies and a to die for sauce.. Then lamb with risotto. The risotto wasn't cooked to my liking but I was super full to even finish this..  I was finally excited for the dessert platter. It was a FULL plate of all the desserts they offered.. Pecan pie, bread pudding, a chocolate cake, cheesecake, and banana cake. My personal fave was their bread pudding and pecan pie.. Mmmmm  If my brother wasn't one of the chefs here we wouldve paid ridiculous amounts of money.. I havent been here in a hot sec and I really want to go back..  Very trendy and chic restaurant in the lovely Venetian hotel.. Service is  EXCEPTIONAL. If you have the money - its a MUST try and judge for yourself..

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert Platter
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fried potato chips

FSyu_SlAJBwDgCbMYlAy-g.text: This place is fantastic. A little pricey but worth it. Michael our waiter was spot on with service.  I had the wilted spinach & frisee salad and the BBQ Salmon (medium). I also got the creme brulee for desert.  My co-worker just got the NY Strip (well done), unfortunately it was not well done. However as soon as Michael saw that it was not cooked properly he immediately took it back and had it cooked completely. I would have not gotten a steak like that we'll-done but he's picky. When he got it back he said it was a very good steak, just wished there was more steak and less bone.  I would definitely go back. One of the best meals I've ever had in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wilted spinach salad - delicious!

KeQy6Z03rnjMYj7lGalPwQ.text: Long overdue review! Went back in July...and swore to myself I needed to give the place kudos because we had such a lovely experience. The food was delicious...and yes, it's a steakhouse, but I'd go back just for the banana cream pie. Oh...how I long for that pie. Anyway...the standout though has got to be the service. When our steaks came, I was disappointed to see that my steak had been overcooked - but it was clearly a busy night (and it looked like they had some crazy difficult customers that night), and I'm not usually one to complain, so I figured it still tasted good, and said nothing. But the manager, Ken, was nearby, and must've seen me sort of picking and inspecting my food, and he came by to make sure things were okay. I said they were fine, but he insisted on checking it out for me -- and in the end, even though I had already taken a few bites, he brought me a whole new steak and made sure it was cooked the way I liked before he left us to dine. That is fantastic service.   Food was delicious, foie gras was heavenly (damn you California for banning it!), and the service top notch.

wZS-PPflEIXH7DplZuCrPA.text: Walked in on a Sunday evening, no reservations. Portion sizes are excellent especially for the price and the upscale vibe. Was thinking it was going to be small portions, but not so. The bone-in ribeye and their special of the day, bison short rib, were delicious and cooked to perfection. Would definitely come back. Very trendy busy, but worth the experience: excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in ribeye and twice baked potato.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bison short ribs

1Hmy4bnxbH5oG0tjQgcc1w.text: This popular dining spot deserves its reputation as the best steakhouse in Vegas. The ribeye steak was as good as it gets. The house special bacon-wrapped quail was cooked to perfection. But the banana cream pie was horrible. It almost seemed like we were served a slice that was two weeks old - Very dry and not very creamy. Too bad the meal ended with luke warm coffee and no refills to wash down the pie. I have to say the service was uneven, like we were an afterthought once dessert was served.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lyQl_GuRSIQ0LsEO4RPlGw.text: Great ribeye steak.  Cooked perfectly.  Was a little disappointed in the "sides".  Overall good experience but would probably choose Bouchon 1st.

tBsYKz9Ec3DrSTCojDx-xw.text: Trying Delmonico was a last minute impromptu decision... My friend and I wanted to grab a quick bite before the rest of our friends arrived. We were underdressed/too casual (shorts/tank tops) to sit in the formal dining area so we just shared a steak at the bar. We started off with drinks which were good and strong. I ordered the Lychee martini which was really good, and I couldnt even taste all the alcohol I watched him pour into. We shared a bone in ribeye, medium rare plus. The steak was really juicy and cooked perfectly, but it lacked flavor... We had to ask for salt and pepper. :(  I don't know if I'd go out of my way to come back... Maybe if I stayed at Venetian and needed another quick bite again.

wYLDs07ICIQ_tuq2FMRCcA.text: A few of us went for my honeys bday recently this past weekend, we read reviews and figured we would try it. This place was ridiculous!! Omg!!! We had Fois gras and steak tar tar for apps (daalishsus), then there was a few perfectly cooked melt in your mouth ribeye steaks with daalishsus sides and an order of the butternut squash ravioli!! So buttery rich you didn't want it to end! and of course there was dessert, creme brulee and John brought the bday boy some perfect sorbet! ugh!!! Seriously where do they get off??  Then to top it off they had the nerve to provide amazing service as well! John, I assume the manager, was great very attentive, fun, well humored!! We will absolutely be returning especially since the birthday boy can't stop talking about it! Lol thank you Delmonico's staff for being awesome!

ElmeJ8CxcOoU4rsBdQk4Xg.text: I was actually disappointed a bit by my meal at Delmonico's. I got the duck and it was overcooked. The cane syrup sauce did help bring out the flavor but it was still well done and I was not given the option when I ordered the duck as to how rare/well done I would like it. I do understand that it is a steakhouse, however if it is on the menu it needs to be of equal quality as the red meat. Also, I tasted the mint ice cream profiteroles and the bread pudding served with butter pecan ice cream. Both house made ice creams were the best I'd ever tasted with a fantastic creaminess and balanced flavor, however the bread in both desserts were superfluous, didn't add anything and just weren't that spectacular. The service we received was fantastic.

erQJPR7pqK9X0nCLfg-AUQ.text: I went to Delmonico with a large group for a friend's birthday recently.  There were about 20 of us, split up over 3 circular tables.  It would have been great to have one long table, but I understand the constraint.  We were seated as soon as the birthday girls arrived after having a drink at the bar.  The service was excellent!  There were a lot of us and the staff was courteous and knowledgable about the menu and the wine list.    Let me preface my review of the food by saying that I don't eat red meat.  I know steak is their speciality, so I was knowing order what they don't go best.  I started with the shrimp cocktail, which included 4 large shrimp, cocktail sauce and some garnish.  The shrimp were cooked very well, but it was a regular shrimp cocktail.  The cajun marinade imparted a little extra kick, but nothing remarkable.  Next, I had the snapper entree.  Almost everyone else at my table ordered the rib eye, which was enormous.  Like Man vs. Food big.  The piece of snapper looked so tiny in the bowl next to the big steaks!  In all honesty though, it was a regular portion.  The lentils were a great addition, as were the brussel sprouts.  However, the fish seemed to have been sitting out for a while.  The top was dry like it had been under the heat lamps.  I understand that it's tough to coordinate one peice of fish when you have to prepare 15+ rib eyes for the same set of tables, but that snapper still cost me $40.  I didn't have dessert since we brought a cake, but the coffee at the end was good.  I'm not saying that I wouldn't return to Delmonico, but knowing there are so many other steakhouses in Vegas that have a stronger reputation for seafood, if it's my choice, I'd probably choose to go elsewhere.

UqaB6Q6kwb01Q8Lr2RI5vw.text: Wow!!!! Delmonico is absolutely my favorite restaurant, period. I've been visiting them since 2002 and try and get there whenever I'm in Vegas.  The service is second to none. I don't know what the wait staff to guest ratio is, but it has to be 2-1. I also absolutely LOVE how they put every person's plate down at the exact same time, period. You're a party of ten? Then ten of Delmonico's finest serve you all at once. And man do they now their business. I've never had a recommendation be anything but excellent!  The food.... Did I say wow???? My personal favorite is the bone-in rib eye, but all of the meat is fantastic. I order mine rare, so it is easy to get a tough steak, but not here!!! It is just lie butter.... Yum.... The BBQ shrimp are amazing, and homemade truffle potato chips??? Wow.... I could go on and on.... Creme Brule is amazing, as is the bread pudding.  I simply can't say enough about Delmonico's. It is simply worth every penny!!!!

OWRFgxvljTMuQFHbGEIekQ.text: 4.5 stars  Perfect decor, service, and noise level.   CONS: didn't like the crab n spinach special and the choc bread pudding. (Way too thick and sweet) (MINUS HALF STAR)  PROS:  -HOLY MOLY awesome lobster bisque. With lumps of lobster tail. FOODGASM? check.  -Amazing signature bone-in rib steak. OMFG juicy and flavorful from first til the last bite. REALLY HUGE portion. FOODGASM? oh yes,check!!! ding ding ding!!!  -Really good fliet and lobster. But bone in rib steak just blows my mind that I didnt want to "waste my stomach space" with the bf's entree. Surf n turf FOODGASM? ummmmmmmm... let me go back to my bone in rib steak.... OH YES!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster bisque
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. surf n turf
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bone in rib steak...oooooooh gosh... so good...

I47UgNebLhe62w5og3MvOQ.text: The place? Comfortable yet elegant. The service? Spot on. The food? Really good, but...  Something was lacking. I had been wanting to try one of Emeril Lagasse's restaurants for awhile and was really excited to dine at Delmonico, but the food didn't blow me away like I had expected it to. Their gumbo was good, but lacked a bit of salt. Their pork chops were good, but could have been a little more tender. My friend noted that the texture of the steak was a bit off. Their desserts were good, but the chocolate cake was kind of dry. Everything was "good", but nothing was great. Wait...I take that back - their dinner rolls were delicious!   Although I really enjoyed my Delmonico experience overall, I don't think I'll be returning anytime soon. (I have yet to find a steakhouse that I like better than Mastro's!)

7eSVy3Gnat8uvC7oIz0Psw.text: Had an outstanding dinner last week. It was over the top. The dry aged prime grade bone in new york was the best. try the banana cream pie. will be hard to eat out after that service.

_eEFHaxIVYbW68MBSqZNCw.text: Food: Disappointing  Service: Excellent  10 of us dined, expecting a Vegas Fine Dining experience with memorable foods. It was truly disappointing. The service was spot on, but the food was BLAH. The only Seafood options were Salmon, or Oysters on a half shell. They were cold.   The veggies were decent, but everyone was unimpressed.

0ygrSAgzIQqDADMdkqmSIw.text: Service was Horrible, Food was Cold, Drinks were Hot!  Just plain Lousy. Very Disappointing!  Go to Prime Steak House instead @ the Bellagio

Oo8W47Azb_ovMGKZrJ7x-g.text: Story to say, this is not where you should spend your money.  The waiter asked my wife how she liked her salmon cooled!  Then it came out with BBQ sauce on it and the salmon was not cooked through.  I ordered gumbo.  The shrimp was frozen and over cooked and mediocre at best.  Not what I would expect from a chef from the south.  Bad experience and would never repeat.

zNAUlbRHCS_dme-A0AL-kw.text: Potato Chips with truffles, excellent.  Lobster Bisque , flavorful and filled with lobster chunks. scallop, bacon, and shrimp appetizer special was phenomenal  5 stars for the appetizers.  Ribeye.... tha'ts another story. too much fat, and too rich for my taste. Was not impressed. Emerils name on the steak knives could not convince me that this was an awesome meal. 1 star for the steak  My suggestion. BAMM. Order appetizers and skip the main course.

h8MBjnY99hy0eXAvmbT3iQ.text: OHH.... ohhhhhhh.... omg.   Let me start off by saying that I am not a beef person. I can happily chicken every day... buuut every now and then I get that naughty craving for some good ol' American red meat! :D  So ex-roomie and I went to Vegas to visit friends of hers and I told her we could do whatever they wanted & all I wanted in return was to visit one of the famous pricey Vegas steakhouses. All agreed and so we booked a reserv. for Delmonico.   The decor was simple, but elegant... kinda mod, imho. Looked very exclusive from the outside, so I felt all fancy. :D  I have to give MAJOR props to the waiters(s), especially an awesome young gentleman who was a total sweetheart (I think his name was Andre..). Actually, I was shellshocked at the great service... most pricey restaurants are pretty snooty, but the peeps @ Delmonico were warm and super attentive.  Unfortunately, there was major drama @ my table with a couple of the girls (snide remarks,  tears, running to the bathrooms), throughout which Andre (?) remained patient. I tuned all this out because................................  ..... I WAS HAVING MINI MOMENTS OVER MY AMAZING, TENDER, SUCCULENT AND DELICIOUS BONE-IN RIBEYE!!!  holy mother. The thing was huge and ex-roomie and I actually shared it (with Andre sweetly saying that it was not a problem) and it was STILL too much. Had my steak been anything but spectacular, I would have been mortified at the shenanigans. Instead, I swiped some artichoke spears (crisp, fresh and awesome) & truffle potato chips (a little greasy but OMG, so good)  from the other ladies and dug into the side we ordered, which was the potato au gratin (again, a little heavy but OHHH... so amazingly tasty... my favorite side dish!)   Crazy delicious food, beautiful ambiance and wonderful service, and actually, with the magic of sharing, did not break the bank. I will definitely be back!!!!!

d2RB9h616DybMdWqH1TDcg.text: Great steak house. The spinach salad with bacon and a fried egg is to die for. I always get the fillet and French fries. The fries are not in the menu but are AMAZING. All in all one of my favorite steak houses in Vegas. A must try.

0FSXm71UZMptK3Vni_pgpw.text: Had a large party for a birthday dinner. All of the food was delicious. Definitely recommend the Parmesan Truffle Potato chips were AMAZING! The only negative was our waiter who gave multiple members of our party major attitude and talked down to us. If I'm spending that much on dinner, I don't feel that it's unreasonable to ask for a little more respect.

hBvlkeHHEYoJXg3lQ3a03g.text: Absolutely fantastic service, fantastic food, and wonderful atmosphere!  We will be back, without a doubt!

XF3aeMsyuCox2cpF7ISPtA.text: Loved this place! The waiter was very knowledgable to my gluten allergy! He made my dining experience wonderful!

f2fSt61c_tHWHj3Ny1SM1g.text: We were very disappointed with our meal. The waiter had absolutely no knowledge of the wine selection and therefore could not provide any recommendations. The steaks were flavorless and not cocked as requested. The side of broccoli was lukewarm and wine glasses were dirty. The best part of the meal was the caramel butter cake dessert and Fisticuffs cabernet.  We go to steakhouses quite often and Delmonico's ranks towards the very bottom of our list.

nHZ-9DiBLjewXr98JV0JmQ.text: Oh man. This place never gets old. I hit up Vegas about a dozen times a year and this is a must dine place. The succulent bone-in ribeye is amazing. The sides are a la carte and big enough to share. I suggest having the chef's specials at least once. They are always changing and are so delicious. It is a bit pricy but that's Vegas. You pay for QUALITY! So make a reservation. You can use Open Table on line or through the app. If you go for a special occasion, let them know. They will always go out of their way to do something special.

xG7S2GiMf2fi3lcygV3pBw.text: Very impressed!  We made reservations for my wife's birthday dinner & couldn't have been happier.  We shared the Chateaubriand & the filet was cooked to perfection with an amazing flavor.  The crust on the steak was perfect.  The service was fantastic & the ambience was very quiet & private.

2NbH_X8S1gPisxLtwKAWfw.text: Had the ribeye bone-in with foie gras on top. The best steak of my life.

F2DAQ7hbIPagEm-YB9udew.text: Had the occasion to eat here recently and although it was gook, it honestly didn't meet my expectations.  Of course everyone is going to have different expectations. Maybe because it's Emeril's but I was expecting just something much better.    We had a party of 6 and they seated us at this huge round table.  You had to talk very loudly in order for the other side of the table to hear you, which just contributes to the already loud atmosphere.    The food was on par for a steak house of this caliber though a little on the high side, which is premium you pay for the Lagasse name.  I can't review anything that already hasn't been said.  I had the rib eye which was good, sides I can't even remember.  Bread as others have mentioned was not memorable.  I'll have to disagree with others about the banana cream pie..  just didn't seem to have the flavor I was expecting.. just a lot of not sweet enough whipped cream.  Service was great though.  Will probably not go back.

brGiY3zMcOtyIGTN92BZzA.text: Food amazing, mushrooms and Rack of lamb were excellent. Truffle chips so addicting! I had made an advance reservation and made a comment that it was my boyfriends birthday and asked for a special table. When we arrived the hostess seated us at a table 2 feet from other guests on one side and up against a wall on the other side. When I asked her if they had a nicer table she said that the dining room was full. Then she looked around and asked what table I wanted. I told her that I had requested a nice cozy table when I made my reservation. I was disappointed in the location of the table especially since I had made that specific request. She then moved us to a table that was right next to the entrance and sound volume buttons/lighting controls of the restaurant. It also was not what I expected but at least we weren't right next to another group. Throughout dinner the managers were constantly walking by and playing with the volume buttons and lighting buttons on the wall. On a good note , our server and the food was exceptional however I have been to several fine dining restaurants and was disappointing that my small request was not granted. It's the little things that make a difference.

xYOsP5nn4H2qsOxkitftqg.text: Best steakhouse in Vegas! Be sure to ask for Lamont as your waiter for an extra special experience. We had the ribeye, filet, and New York . All amazing!

OzA6nSS2rZJU-BYgxSHGBA.text: Great steak.  Good service and atmosphere and accomodated our large group.

Euw3zTbtOdV_t5YOl8LNyA.text: Had dinner with the guys so we reserved the chef table in back with wine pairing and a tour of the restaurant. It was definitely the best dinner experience I had in Las Vegas.   One of the dishes was a quail which I normally am not fond of but they did such a good job I devoured it. The wine pairing was excellent and they were generous with their pours. I even took a full glass back to my room at the end of the night. Excellent service and food! My new favorite place!

epkTQaP_uuJaUtou8Gn8Pw.text: Just hit this place for the 3rd time in 2 years and this place never let's down.  I was there just this past weekend during a very busy time at the Venetian with 2 major conventions going on.  We were fortunate enough to get a reservation with the host we prefer at 7:30 pm.  Game on!!  Service is impeccable.  We have a specific host who takes care of us when we come in so I suggest you get to know yours cause it does make getting reservations much easier.  Not only that, but you have a better time in general when you feel you have a friend there.  And trust me, I'm no high roller.  Each section has its own host and several supporting cast.  Some hosts are better than others so again if you like yours try to stick with him/her.  They usually start you with an amuse bouche compliments of the chef.  Always different and always outstanding.  It's no meal just a way of getting your taste buds started.  The food will be brought as per normal or as you request.  You're in control so let them know what you want and they will help you better.  Even with wine selections of which they have a large selection.  The place can get a lot of hustle (not normal) so just try to sit tight and enjoy your meal.  They won't rush you so don't rush yourself.    I go straight for the steak but i hear the appetizers are fantastic.  I highly recommend the Wet/Dry Aged Bone In Rib Eye Medium.  The outside will be crusted just right with a pat of house made butter on top.  Inside will be pink and juicy (order med/rare if you want blood) and soft not chewy.  The meat will melt in your mouth as this cut has just the right amount of marbling (great now I want one).  Desert?  The steak is desert enough for me (lol).    Service is impeccable.  We have a specific host who takes care of us when we come in so I suggest you get to know yours cause it does make getting reservations much easier.  Not only that, but you have a better time in general when you feel you have a friend there.  And trust me, I'm no high roller.  Don't forget, Bone in Rib Eye!!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wet/Dry Aged Bone In Rib Eye

yMOvk-CdvBvZ589ZQbKs5w.text: Huge portions of meat, satisfying sides and about 4 servers who tend to your every need.  Great!  Sure the bill was a bit much, but I think that in addition to paying for the Emeril name, you are paying for the stellar service.  Once in a while - this works for me!  A man pushing in my chair, another refilling my water and another taking the cover off my plate - wow.  We had an array of dishes:  the bone in steak, pork chops, mashed potatoes, creamed spinach.  The sides look small, but they fill you up and you can share them family style.  Funny, my mom got seared scallops which was a small plate, but they were so delicious!  We had these large plates of meat and we were picking off her dish.  LOL.  Everything was great,  I wasn't expecting something amazing, but we did feel full and like we got a good meal.    The dessert was just okay.  We got the bread pudding and coffee. It is good to go to Vegas and try new places are there are so many quality restaurants.  Def glad I went!

FUvT6LSoRbZfcHlDGXbGaQ.text: Been here twice for lunch (once today and once during Restaurant Week) and once for dinner a long time ago....  This review is for today's Lunch experience.  So... this place exudes Power Lunch without the Noise ambiance...Soft lighting, quiet/hush talking, white table clothes, ultra professional service, a fabulous menu and high prices.  Everyone except me was in a business suit... but like I care.    My g-friend ordered sort of off the menu... the options were on the menu but the way she wanted it prepared was not.  They didn't even bat an eye... they just asked a couple questions to make sure they "did it right".  She got grilled salmon and steamed / lightly sauteed spinach.... and it came out perfect!  It looked fabulous.  I just ordered the cobb salad.  I know... I'm boring that way.  But it was a really good cobb salad... the bacon... OH!  The bacon! on my salad was The Best!  Freshly grilled skinny strips of bacon that were juicy and meaty.  I'll order it again just for the bacon "bits".  The avocado was fresh and creamy... the blue cheese crumbles were rich and blue-cheesy.  All in all, a very nice salad.    Service was very professional and attentive without being annoying. They filled our iced tea and water without us even noticing.  It was awesome.  For lunch... it's pricey ... the two of us was $52 w/o tip....but if you want a really, really nice business lunch or a lunch that is NOT noisy, crowded or typical... Go Here.  I'll be back because they have Lobster Sliders on the menu now... I gotta go back to try these.  :)

cIe1NAlsVgvnJpRld25aXg.text: Had a wonderful dinner here with my husband and friends for his birthday. All of our food was excellent, well prepared. There only reason for 4 stars is the service was a bit too slow and inconsistent. I.E. our drink order was taken at 3 different times so we all received our drinks at different times. All in all, great food, ok service.

vC7zszPwO5wFZSMIE8LtEA.text: Hmm, I thought this place was A-OK. I was surprise to learn its Emeril's restaurant. I mean, I have to say I have tasted better steaks. I got the rib-eye not knowing that it was huge and was really surprise when I saw it. I should have shared and thought the portion was great for 50 bucks. I ordered medium well, but it was redder than normal. I thought it was over seasoned. The potatoes were really good though. The service was okay--we had a big party and they accommodated us, but I felt that since we were a younger crowd than normal, they didn't give the best service they could. The server didn't really smile and forgot one of our checks and so we had to wait for a while to get it backs.  The people in my party that didn't get steak enjoyed their dishes. If I go next time, I wouldn't order steak but yet this is a steakhouse..

caARHnBdSHpXiojL4K626Q.text: I had dinner here on 2/7.  The last time I was here was over 10 years ago.  The last Vegas steakhouse that I had eaten at was CUT, so that is what I will be comparing my experience to. Service:  Very Good.  We had at least 3-4 servers taking care of us (party of 5) throughout the night.  Initially dinner was for a party of 4.  However, once we were seated, our buddy landed at the airport and decided to join us.  I informed the head server (thinking that they may not be able to accommodate) and he immediately converted the table to seat 5 (pulled out stuff from the bottom to make it a round table).  Water was constantly filled and table cleared off in appropriate fashion. Food:  We started off with the Caesar Salad and Ahi Tuna/Salmon tartare.  I thought the salad was just ok.  A tad too much dressing.  Same with the tartare.  Nothing special and pretty bland.  Most of the group got the bone in rib eye (medium rare to medium well).  All were cooked well.  I thought the medium rare tasty pretty good.  Nothing spectacular about it, just good steak.  I had the rack of lamb (medium rare) and it had decent flavors.  I would take Carvino's lamb chops over it any day.  The sides we had were decent (Potato gratin, mushrooms, and corn).  We had a nice bottle of wine that the Sommelier recommended with a price point of $85.  That was probably the best tasting thing of the night. The verdict on Delmonico's is that it is a decent steakhouse that it's reputation is based on its name more than its food.  I would choose CUT over it any day.  They have more selection of meat (cuts and quality).

P68UlvXr4yaUC-nDvSKCbA.text: Incredible meal and dining experience. In addition to a fantastic steak, the lobster bisque and twice baked potato are a must try!
