HbWJGVfjjO5PwBbwMd-O7g.text: I am of cajun decent and HAD to try Emeril's gumbo.  It wasn't "mom's", but it was excellent gumbo for Las Vegas.  It was a darker roux and rich. Everyone had steaks which were perfectly cooked and had an amazing, salty, flavorful seasoning.  The Lobster Bisque was one of the top bisque's we've ever tried! Also had to try banana's foster which we highly recommend!

kAzO29fBDChaDZAlU-aBZA.text: I love Delmonico's, I really do.  But this past weekend, it just didn't measure up.  I should have gone with my gut and given CUT a try.  We started with drinks in the bar, which was fine.  Our table for seven was ready on time, which is always nice.  Unfortunately, our service was super average compared to what I've had in the past at Delmonico's and at other comparable high end steakhouses.  My husband and I shared a salad for an appetizer.  We let the server know this when we ordered and in the past, we've had this served on two separate plates in lieu of having to divide the salad at the table.  Unfortunately, we were given to salad plates and told we could split it ourselves.    I love a good filet, and unfortunately, my filet was very average.  It was cooked to my liking, medium rare, but it was served relatively cool, which made me think that our food was sitting for a while before it was served.  My mom ordered seared ahi tuna which was served completely cold.  The outer edges were completely cooled after the searing, which again, tells me that our food sat out for a while.  My husband and my brother both ordered bone-in rib-eyes.  When the food was served, they brought one rib-eye that had been split in two.  The server went back to the kitchen and they realized they made a mistake and brought out the other rib-eye, while using tongs to take the half from my husband's plate and added it to my brother's plate.  Rookie move, seriously.  My family doesn't eat a ton of cards, so for sides we ordered two servings of the mushrooms, broccoli, and corn for my niece.  The server kept pushing for us to order a starch, which we insisted we didn't want- very bizarre, it's not like we weren't running up a pretty hefty tab.  It was my mom's birthday and I really thought Delmonico's would come through with an excellent experience.  The food was okay overall, but I really can't say that this meal met my expectations or anyone at our tables' expectations.  I've been to many Emeril restaurants, maybe they went through a recent management change??  I don't know, I wish I could explain the extremely average experience.

vgcX8ASqHFTr6poX5vTeuQ.text: I've been here once about 10 years ago.... didn't have a good experience... therefore was a little hesitant to try it again... but WOW!! this time it was completely different! Gotta get the rib eye here! Bone in or bone out... doesn't matter. Both really good. All the sides were also fantastic. If I had to pick one the mushrooms would probably be my favorite. The creamed corn was also really really good. Mashed potatoes good but not your socks off like the other things.

Ssjd9FyPOAZq76OpnKBBlg.text: Really wish I could give this a higher review but with all the competitive steakhouses in Vegas, steakhouses need to be TOP notch.  Our server was pretty inattentive. Took about 10-15 minutes to receive a wine/cocktail menu. Server was friendly though. Popup bread (complimentary) was delicious! We ordered off of the prix fix menu. Make sure you ask the server for this menu because it's only listed on a sign outside but not found anywhere on the menu. I had the tomato soup with ricotta grilled cheese. By far, best tomato soup I have ever had. My boyfriend and I also ordered different types of steaks. We ordered them to be cooked medium rare. His came out perfect- pink all the way through, juicy tender. However, mine was VERY rare- like almost a shade of blue. For a steakhouse, this is VERY disappointing. The other issue with this is after we received our food no one checked in and it took a while for me to flag down one of our servers (we had three servers/workers for our table). So my boyfriend was almost done with his steak before we were even checked on and received a new one. Manager did come over and apologize for but a steakhouse in Vegas, I feel the temperature of a steak has to be on point.   For desserts, we ordered the pecan pie. I don't even like pecan pie and it was DELICIOUS. I was pretty disappointment with my caramel butter cake. Cake was very dry but the sauce on the bottom was EXCELLENT.   Overall, okay place to have dinner. But due to the inattentive service and not consistent steak temperatures, I would consider another steak house that is more consistent.

wKMdAJTYATvJLjlR6CxInA.text: Review is for lunch. Mediocre at best. Food was bland, and anything but memorable. Ambiance non-existent (dated decor, bare walls, quite unappealing). The only value was good service, but that's far from sufficient to recommend this place. With so many choices on the Strip, this would be at the very bottom of my list.

DM7Gq--FDlKAai18IAGj8Q.text: I was disappointed.  I enjoy my steaks and enjoy most steakhouses.  My colleague talked me into going here and it was overpriced and not great.  I think your typical chain high-quality steakhouse is better than this place and actually cheaper.  Not that the price matters that much - you just notice when it is premium pricing and sub-par food.  I had the bone-in ribeye and it was enormous but wasn't really special.  Would not bother going again - I will rather try somewhere else.

WHE4Q-A17aAZIlXeLK7HZQ.text: after I had stake here, I am not satisfied any other stake house...sign. Delmonico stake is the best. Make sure to get "bone in rib eye" Simple salt & pepper, and you can taste the MEAT. Fillet minon was good, but compare to salt & pepper rib eye, I like rib eye 100 times better. The excellent cooking temperature, perfect medium rare. I have no complain.  Amazing.  Also, the simple lettuce wadge salad was amazing, too.  To make this simple dish this good is wonderful.  I highly recommend this place.  So, sad that they are not near where I live.

45l-lWw3N9uyjmlK4hLq0w.text: My first review on yelp. Only reason I'm doing this review is because of Delmonico's Steakhouse at The Venetian. We were tired of the average buffets and fast food and we really wanted to have a fancy night. So we looked up on yelp for a nice fancy restaurant. We decided on Delmonico's and called in to make reservations for two at 530. Came 530, we were still at the pool, so we called in and pushed the reservation to 630. Staff accommodated us, which was surprising. We came to restaurant at 630 and were seated immediately. The staff are on the dot with their reservations. Right after we were seated, the waiter asked what we would like to drink. I ordered a usual neat Johnny Walker Black Label and followed it with a 7&7. I believe every man should learn to love whiskey. My lady ordered a water lol. We then looked at the menu. I read all the reviews on yelp and just jumped straight to the assortment of steaks they had available. My lady ordered a New York T Bone Steak and I had the filet mignon. We also ordered the Butternut squash ravioli for the appetizer and mashed potatoes to eat with the steaks.   First came ravioli. It was 5 pieces of ravioli. My first thought was,"Damn I'm getting jipped out of 15 bucks" But when I bit into the first piece of ravioli, I literally had an mouth orgasm... No homo. It was the best ravioli I ever had in my life. Hands down. I wish I had a whole plate full of it. My lady was hella impressed as well.   Then came out the steaks. I hade mine cooked medium rare and she had hers done medium. The first bite was the best. Succulent, tender, easy to chew. Best steak I ever had in my life.

_tTxrkZYzkZupeTuFieSnQ.text: Best bone-in rib eye I've ever had in my life!! Amazing food and service. Definitely coming back.

X3isnXH8-sOT04DLXZhFWA.text: DELICIOUS.  I took my boyfriend here as part of his Vegas weekend treat (I secretly wanted to try it out too) and it did not disappoint. The service was amazing as you would expect for this type of restaurant. I made a note on our OpenTable reservation that it was for his birthday and every single person wished him a happy birthday, by name, as well as giving us lots of free goodies!   We pretty much ordered everything our hearts desired (which was a lot more than our stomachs could hold):  Truffle and parmesan potato chips - sounds simple enough, but I definitely recommend. Nice, simple appetizer that happens to be divine.  Run of the mill mixed greens and lobster bisque. The lobster bisque is a must try! Best I've had!  Filet mignon and bone-in ribeye for our main course. Very flavorful, cooked to perfection. The bone-in ribeye is HUGE, so bring your appetite for this one.  We had chocolate sorbet on the house and ordered an additional slice of banana cream pie (we were curious why Emeril's name was attached to it). That is the first time I've had banana cream pie and I feel like I could never eat it again unless it came from here.   Wonderful experience and will definitely have to make a trip back.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Emeril&#39;s banana cream pie
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate sorbet
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country smashed potatoes and buttered fresh broccoli

dOY4XofIPnzm98S9EN5Tog.text: Food was excellent!!!!  The favorites of our group were lobster, ribeye, filet, rack of lamb.  Salmon was a bit dry and halibut was just ok, but fine.  My personal standout for the many sides we got was the potatoes au gratin...I'm still dreaming!!!  Our service was just ok until the end when our server scolded someone in our group and said "sssshhhhh."   Really???  If he was ruining something for other customers (which I'm sure he wasn't--others tables were toasting with us) than a manager should've come up and said something, not her.  I mentioned to the hostess we were a lively group and to sit us accordingly.  She assured me it was not a problem.  We spent a lot of money and ended on a sour note--which is no bueno....it could've been handled so much better.  Also, they knew we were celebrating an anniversary and didn't bring a complimentary dessert??? (I think even Cheesecake Factory does that?).  It just seemed the waitress had a personality problem and didn't like us from the get go. Unfortunately, this is the second visit here where the service has fallen short.  Four stars for food.  Not in a hurry to go back.  There's no "sssshhhhh-ing in Vegas!"

_cwLrdbOfyKh7nquc6gIFw.text: We had the bacon appetizer, it was fantastic!  My filet order was a sub-par experience for an Emeril's restaurant. Sent back, too rare, came back still too red for a medium well and the sauce I'd ordered with it was now cold. The did make it right and brought me a new steak, cooked tableside to perfection with a fresh, warm brandy peppercorn sauce. Desert was fantastic!

yI1LTDV4pSXqPAmpgWnfSw.text: We arrived a little early for our table for two. We were seated within 7 minutes, although we were really early. Our wait staff team was phenomenal. The timing of the food arriving at the table was right on time. The steaks were excellent and so were the side items. This was the first steakhouse I had been to that offered grits as a side item!!  This was one of the better meals I have had in my 13 years of coming to Vegas.   I would recommend the grits and brussel sprouts as a side item.

Hs29e4KpVuOR9PrUmOC4vA.text: We celebrated our fourth wedding anniversary at this restaurant last night.  We made the reservation from home over a month ago.  First.  The atmosphere was quiet yet festive; subdued yet exciting.    We arrived a few minutes early and they we were shown to our table immediately.  Service was impeccable.  We ordered a bottle of Pinot Grigio and sparkling water.  The Caesar salad made table side was absolutely delicious.  The gentleman serving is explained every step of the process.  The filet mignon at medium rare was seasoned to perfection and cooked perfectly.  We shared a twice baked potato, that was creamy and cheesy.   We ended the meal with two cappuccinos and we shared a perfect piece of pecan pie.  An amazing evening.

EjRP8fxYne0LJQXKbaoL4w.text: Vegas definitely has top notch steakhouses and Delmonico is definitely top notch amazing steakhouse. I highly recommend this steakhouse. The atmosphere is relaxed and beautiful. The service is very polite, respectful and top notch customer service! The food is delicious and its very traditional high end dining experience that is much to desire!

VyehUmce7FrrBV1V-_a6ag.text: 3.5 stars - above average steakhouse, amazing service, loud. Food highlights: free popovers, lobster bisque.   * Popovers - 5 stars: The BEST, small, light, airy, chewy, you could almost stuff the entire thing in your mouth. I've had good popovers at NM, but like the texture and size of these more. AND they give you a huge plate of softened salted butter - WINNER. * Lobster Bisque - 4.5 stars: One of the better lobster bisque's I've had! Great overall flavor, rich and decadent. * Side of mushrooms, creamed corn, fingerling potatoes - 3.5 stars: All of these were good. 3 kinds of mushrooms cooked generously in butter, my favorite. Followed by the creamed corn, very different with a strong jalapeno flavor. Fingerling potatoes standard. * Banana Cream Pie - 3.5 stars: Emerill's famous banana cream pie is huge - stacked high with chunks of fresh banana. The cream needed more banana flavor, seemed overwhipped, and the crust could've been more buttery. Was still good though. * Key Lime Pie - 3.5 stars: Really good key lime pie on an excellent crust, a little too sweet for me though. * German chocolate cake - 2 stars: Cake tasted airy, reminded me of box cake. Prefer Duncan Hines (sorry!). * Chateaubriand - 2.5 stars: Had an incredibly tender well-seasoned Tomahawk at Beauty and Essex, and in close second was Carnevino's. The Chateaubriand is a hunk of meat for two, sliced and cooked tableside. The meat was tender, but the texture kind of reminded me of a pot roast (not a fan), and it had a bit of a weird, gamey flavor....Recommend sticking with the ribeye.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best popovers
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamed corn close up

73Tc3J6T4DCvvYDzC9di-Q.text: This review is where I am sorry that you can only assign 5 stars because there are not enough stars to convey how much I adored this meal.  The atmosphere is perfect in noise level, pleasing color palate and space.  You are relaxed when you eat here.  The staff is welcoming and prideful in the job without sounding pretentious, the perfect blend of professional and friendly.    The food-OH THE FOOD- the spinach salad, basically heaven on a plate,  tender spinach with a well balanced sherry vinaigrette and praline bacon pieces.  Let's just say, I was sorry that I offered to split it.  The filet and bone-in rib eye (our selections) were grilled to perfection, and I mean, perfection!!  Don't let the creole crust intimidate you, it is not overpowering and they're not ruining a beautiful cut with "stuff".  The twice-baked potato was hearty and delicious.  They will suggest the banana cream pie, which looks great, but I chose the pecan pie in an oatmeal shortbread crust.  This was so beyond fantastic in its tender and unique crust to the mellow nutty sweetness of the filling.  I could seriously go on and on about this meal. I love to cook and I love to eat so it is a perfect evening when I feel like there is nothing I would change about the meal or think that I could have saved a ton of money and cooked myself.  Those thoughts NEVER ran through my mind.  So, next time I am in Vegas, I will return as soon as I get off the plane.  cannot wait.

nTZOnOsOmlShBIDR3NFGEQ.text: Lovely steakhouse.  I was here as a single diner mid-week and received excellent service.  Located in the Venetian, best for a more mature crowd and corporate outings.  Very simple white decor and quiet atmosphere. No flash or gimmicks of some other steakhouses on the Strip.  My filet was prepared very well and I gobbled up my entire side of creamed corn casserole. I enjoyed a classic Manhattan at the bar before dinner while listening to a pianist in the lounge (nice touch).  I also had another bourbon drink called the Betty Crocker with walnut and banana flavoring during my meal. Unfortunately the banana flavoring came through too strong.  This is definitely a dessert cocktail, but was not listed that way on the menu.  Overall, a great dining experience.  Next time I will be sure to save room for Emeril's banana cream pie, which looks amazing.

7dbiP4ZBEdg2vAQz4AiQ2w.text: Superb restaurant. We went for lunch, and it was quiet and intimate. Impeccable service. Potato croquettes were a delicious appetizer choice (even though they are officially a side dish for the steaks). The lobster bisque was outstanding, as was the gumbo. For entrees we both had the steak medallions with onion rings, bacon, and house made Worcestershire. Superb! Desserts are incredible here -- there are so many tempting choices but we finally narrowed it down to the caramel butter cake and the butterscotch pudding. While the caramel cake was very good, the star was the butterscotch pudding. It had praline sauce on the bottom, then the pudding topped with fresh whipping cream and candied bacon with shortbread cookies on the side. I've never had a dessert so complex and delicious. The value for the amount of food and drink we got was outstanding.

Qe_udoIj938MwVrTsRtozg.text: What a beautiful steakhouse! A friend visiting from out of town wanted Emeril so we picked Delmonico and it was fabulous. The service was great, like we were his only table, and he had a crew, a team- they even referred to him as the "captain." Fancy huh!?   Ravioli app was melting in my mouth. Delicious. Fried oysters were great, and better than some Rockafeller ones I've had in New Orleans. The truffle and Parmesan chips are great, (but Wolfgang Pucks are better!) these were really thin and tasty but a bit greasy. Parmesan and potato soup absolutely creamy deliciousness.   My fried chicken was huge - split it w someone. My friends steaks were great except one was overlooked and they took it off our bill, I mean obviously she didn't eat it and they did that, but no questions no rude judgements just took care of it.   Great place!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried oysters and Ravioli Appetizer
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle and Parmesan chips
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffles yum

7g0RV48F2mCvlnvOw6BTtQ.text: Once again Emeril's Delmonico has lived up to its world class reputation! We took our friend and her husband here last night for her 40th birthday and the night couldn't have been more perfect!   Staff/Service - exceptional! I think every person on the staff we interacted with wished her a happy birthday and even brought out a small dessert at the end of dinner. The sommelier stopped by our table several times and selected a great bottle for the table. He even came back at the end of dinner to talk about what Texas wines we recommend. Truly exceptional service.   Drinks - you have to try one of their Sazeracs.   Food- blows me away how exceptional the food is here. Ribeye was cooked absolutely perfect medium rare. Charred on outside. Perfect seasoning.  Duck fat fingering potatoes were also delicious.   Couldn't have been happier to visit Delmonico and can't wait to go back!

Qs6XbVICvwKCqK_RbZ92mQ.text: Bread is a croissant: 3 I like a more meaty bread We had 3 appetizers 1. Bone in bacon: 4 2. Fried Squash: 2 3. Barbecue shrimp:3. It was shrimp with a mile bbq sauce.   For the entre I had the 20oz bone in rib eye. It was a good rib eye.

oX2vNFmcy0HS7oQxcY3Qcg.text: Went here for Valentine's Day.  The service definitely match the food which was EXCELLENT.  Ordered Emil's BBQ Shrimp for appetizer. Had the popular Bone in Rib Eye which melts in your mouth and cook to perfection.  And for dessert we shared the Cinnamon and Sugar Churro with 3 dipping sauce I personally loved the tres leche :).  Would come back again for sure .

QeatWmxYhkqXmXLE4ZNYSA.text: Hands down the best steak house! We always order bone in ribeye-juicy and always cooked right. Side dishes are to die for: mushrooms, spinach and asparagus.

eA3hnRdUFMkA5UJyIMJd0Q.text: My husband and I ate here for Thanksgiving dinner and really enjoyed our meal.   I've eaten at many steakhouses in the area and I find that each one has their own unique style. Delmonico's interior isn't highly decorated or cluttered, just a simple and clean look. I liked the simplicity.   Our waiter and his team were very attentive. Water glasses were constantly filled, plates cleared efficiently, and service moved smoothly. They were all very professional.   The meal begins with popovers that are both soft and flavorful. I began my meal with the Wilted Spinach and Frisee salad. It was anything, but the usual frisee salad because every ingredient was taken to the next level. The bacon vinaigrette had a nice smoky bacon flavor which was tossed in just the right amount with the spinach. The candied bacon was amazing. They perfectly balanced the sweet and salty. The egg on top was cooked to perfection. All of the flavors worked so well together.   It was hard to order something other than steak, but it was Thanksgiving so I had to have my traditional dinner. The Thanksgiving dinner didn't disappoint and was a very generous portion. The turkey was very moist and flavorful. The plate had a nice mix of white and dark meat. Under piles of turkey was a moist, delicious cornbread stuffing. A delicious gravy was drizzled over the turkey and stuffing. There was a small side of green beans, but those were not the best thing on the plate as they were a stringy and mushy.  My husband and I split a Twice Baked Potato because you have to have potatoes on Thanksgiving. I'm glad we split because it was definitely enough for two. The potato was flavorful and covered in a nice cheese layer.  For dessert I had the Pecan Pie and my husband had the Thanksgiving dessert special. My Pecan Pie was served like a tart in a small round, flaky crust. The crust was buttery and flaky. I don't like crust usually, but this was very good. There was plenty of gooey pecan filing and a nice heap of ice cream on top. My husband's special dessert was a trio of pumpkin cheesecake, bread pudding, and ice cream. This kind of fell flat. Nothing had much flavor and was certainly not the best representation of the dessert menu.  I can't wait to return and try more of the regular menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thanksgiving Dinner Special
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wilted Spinach &amp; Frisee Salad
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pecan Pie

HXIAQfUsX40kFNWyNxLzXg.text: Everything we expected in a celebrity chef steakhouse and more. The service was absolutely top notch. This ties with the best service I've ever had and is second to none from my experience.   We don't have a lot of experience with wines and there was no hint of pretense or haughtiness from the staff and we felt very welcome and enjoyed the experience. The dress code was casual with no jacket and tie required.  They have a huge selection of cocktails and wines and we received friendly and helpful assistance in finding a wine to our liking and were immediately offered an alternative after the first selection didn't exactly meet my wife's liking.   The bone-in ribeye was perfect and I was very pleased with the Cajun seasoning used there (Emeril's). My wife had the rack of lamb and was very pleased with it. The pieces were very meaty.   The twice baked potato is HUGE and would be easy to share. The vegetable selections are also served with plenty to share so ordering one entree for each person in a couple with a single potato and single vegetable would work sell.   I can also recommend the creme Brule which had fresh fruit on top and was a very nice dessert to share.

isUUAstPu3haOSdVgX3OKg.text: Had an amazing dining experience at this restaurant! Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a great steakhouse. Being with a big group of people, we tried A LOT of food and enjoyed every single thing we ordered. Topped off with excellent service, I could not recommend this place enough. Thanks and 100% will return in the future!

aw_5aKHlAzV0PSM7F92YFw.text: This place is top notch. We didn't order any appetizers as we wanted to make sure we had enough room to finish our steak. I mean that's the most important part of a steak house right?   Although their cuts are bigger enough to split if you wanted to order a few apps and room but for us it was all steak type of night. Let's start with the ambiance it's self: like any other high end steak house very roomy and intimate setting. Lights are dim.    The device was top notch we we greeted immediate as we sat, water came out, and wine list brought to us. It was my wife's bday so we were definitely having a glass. Their drink menu had several options of wine, cocktails, etc.    The croissant that they bring out was fluffy and buttery. The knock is they bring you just one. I could have eaten 20. I'm sure if asked I could have had another.   I ordered the bone in New York strip and I have to say it was by far the best strip I've ever had. My wife ordered the ribeye and I did try a bite. While tender and tasted well. It was slightly warmer on temp than she liked. My strip was better. But by no means was her's bad. The twice baked potato tasted awesome and we shared an order. The steak being so large we could barely eat the side.   Price point is similar to all other 4 star and up type of steak houses. It is definitely one I'd go back next time in Vegas.

-UzdyS3-vyL2zrmx6OngDA.text: It is with a heavy heart, a disappointed palate, and an empty stomach that I write this review. At around 8:40pm on a Wednesday like any other, an amazing 20 ounce bone-in ribeye was murdered by the cooks at Delmonico Steakhouse in Las Vegas, Nevada. A senseless, tragic loss really.   The LD: Husband and I went for dinner. Were seated immediately; had reservations. Place was crowded; however, several tables were empty. Servers (yes, plural; they employ a multi-function staff system) were friendly and knowledgeable.   V&S for myself, beer for hub. Both ordered the highly recommended in-house aged big ass ribeye; cooked med-rare please? Add a side of asparagus.   Drinks were delivered, as was a meh amuse bouche (didn't do much to invoke my appetite). While waiting on main course, we sat with empty drink glasses for approximately 15 minutes. "Yes, please, another round" after flagging someone down.    The highly anticipated steaks arrived. Had SO looked forward to dining (have been to Delmonico in N'Oleans and LOVED it) - salivating for the meat like Pavlov's dog.  Husband cut into his steak first and I awed at the perfection. Beautifully cooked (I know my steak temps well and am quite skilled on the grill if I may say so; #humblebrag, but I do live in Texas after all). I could immediately tell when my plate was sat down in front of me my steak was overcooked. I even whispered it to my spouse. Sure enough, borderline well-done on the edges. I optimistically had hoped it would be less done toward the thicker center and toward the bone. Nope.     When a waiter came to follow-up and ask how the steak was, I informed him mine...well, was not good. He did offer to refire; however, given the speed that my husband eats, and the amount of time it took the food to be delivered in the first place, I [foolishly] declined and stated that it was "fine."  Management comped one of the two Tito's I ordered as an apology; however, this did little to suppress my internal sadness and the most amount of disappointment I'd had since losing my ars at the blackjack tables the night before.   In all fairness, the staff at D's did try their best to accommodate. I probably should have allowed them a second chance to present a well-prepared piece of beef. It wasn't until I got home and found the $164 (w/out tip) receipt from the night in my wallet that I began to feel what can only be described as selfish-remorse (aka, sometimes referred to as "buyer's remorse").  So after a few days of ruminating (as females are sometimes known to do), I called the restaurant and told them I regretted my decisions and to thank them for at least attempting to "satisfy the customer." Without any provocation, the manager offered to send me a gift card for $50 to cover a steak during my next visit. I, of course, did not expect the offer, but happily provided my mailing address.   I have found that an unfortunate outcome of many "celebrity" chef restaurants opening in LV is that the quality of both service and food suffer. It's the nature of Sin City and the abundance of tourism - people from all over the world with very different palates - some more or less discerning than others. :'(    So, now I have a GC that I can redeem at any of Emeril's establishments. I doubt I'll be using it at Delmonico in Vegas baby, because frankly I've left the building and think I'll stick to D's in the Big Easy. Sin City killed the beefy magic for me. Cheers!  [151 in 2015]

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Da bill...not bad if steak had been right. :(
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table setting...
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Signature in house wet and dry aged ribeye...looks great, right? Overcooked. :(

xA9hyUd2yQZb2vvVfo9-Gw.text: I don't even know where to begin.  I had my first chef's table experience EVER here and IT WAS BEYOND AMAZING!!!  It was quite pricey, but it was a very memorable dinner to say the least.  I truly felt special being lead to a private room  in the kitchen of the restaurant to dine with good company!  We had blinds to cover our space from the rest of the restaurant, even had our own music in our own room!  Being able to peer into the kitchen and watch the staff prep and cook while we eat alone already had a super cool factor to it!!!  I highly recommend it for anyone that is willing to splurge on a nice private wine and dinner pairing.  Our chef (Chef Erwin) and sommelier (Dylan) for the night were fantastic and every course/pairing I had was an absolute delight to my tasting palette.  Some of my favorites from the night were the truffle and parmesan chips, pork chops, steak, and dessert (esp the banana cream pie, and chocolate decadence cake, butter cake, and flan!).  I'm sure whoever your chef is for the night won't disappoint.  This chef's table beyond exceeded my expectations and I couldn't be happier to recommend this experience to anyone.  Dooooo it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from one side of the kitchen from the chefs table
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5th course - dessert #2
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5th course - dessert plate #1

tYrSbjX3QgZGBZuQ3n8g6w.text: After the most incredible service, delicious meal, and surprise birthday treat how can you rate this fabulous restaurant anything less than five stars?  We opted to celebrate my partners birthday celebration at Del's and it was definitely the best decision EVER. Although Las Vegas traffic sucked and it took 40 min to get there from Cosmopolitan.   We had the best crew serving us tonight, be sure to ask for Braden, Selina, and JoJo. Amazing folks with a great sense of humor and honest recommendations.   GET the chateaubriand and if you like spices, add the au poivre. Worth every penny and then some. Skip an appetizer unless you have multiple people in your party, the steak will fill you up and then some! We didn't have room for dessert but was treated to an ice cream waffle cone with a delicious flavor to celebrate the man's birthday.   Oh yeah, don't be shocked by the 100 page wine list or the bottles ranging up to $37,000. You can find some reasonably priced options! We will be back!

-EAuqk9cQvPzUWAXxODvKg.text: Very nice steak place inside The Venetian. Typical overpriced Las Vegas fair, but very good meal. Mixed greens salad was the best I've ever had ($14). Ribeye from some named farm/ranch was very good, but nothing out of the ordinary from any other $60 steak place/chain. I do not recommend the peppercorn sauce($6). Brussel sprouts were the best I've ever had ($11). So burnt, so crunchy, so sweet, so good. Wines by the glass list is excellent, and oh-so overpriced.  Dining at the bar as a solo male should, the female bartender from Boston/Philly with no Northeastern accent was a True professional, while the male bartender's (generally poliI-can't-smile issues were of negative note. Piano entertainment was excellent. Buzz on an early Friday night was great.

Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One out rib-eye medium.

ZQyRR_a3zmmeb7LpMZN4fQ.text: I had their 6oz. 100% Japanese Wagyu Filet Mignon and it was absolutely delicious and silky! I can't get over the fact of how tender, juicy and flavourful it was! The dish is plated with turnips and au jus. We also got a side of asparagus and duck fat potato fingerlings which were very delicious as well. Their raspberry sorbet is amazing and tastes nothing like you've ever tried before! The restaurant is situated inside The Venetian and is quite large, the tables and decor were also wonderful. The staff were very friendly and helpful as well!

Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 100% Japanese Wagyu steak

spSMLZ3I9igizoHTJa7xLw.text: This might be the easiest review I've ever written because it writes itself. I can honestly say this was the best meal I've ever had.  Out of the hustle and bustle that is below The Venetian, there is a delicious oasis who awaits anyone who dares to enter (and open their wallets). There are (I'm sure) other fabulous restaurants in Restaurant Row, but walking into Emeril Lagasse's Delmonico Steakhouse was like taking a port key to a wine cavern in Italy. In the bar area was someone playing a grand piano for guests to enjoy while they sip cocktails, and the muted earth tones relax and ease away the stress of the strip. With that said you may need to pull out your phone flashlight to read the menu but it's all part of the ambience. I don't know how the filter out all of the noise of the casino but it's truly amazing.  A member of my party knew the sommelier so we had a pretty unbelievable table with a view of the kitchen. But I couldn't tear my eyes off of the wine menu to observe the magic. The wine list is literally 100 pages long (pro tip: flip to the very back for wines by the glass), and some of the wines are over $1000 a bottle. But there are reasonably priced options as well. The sommelier was super helpful and gave wonderful recommendations so don't hesitate to ask.  As for the food, you cannot go wrong. They do have gluten free options and can make some of the sides gluten free as well, just let your server know. The steak was the best steak I've ever tasted. Do not miss it served Oscar Style either: with crab meat and asparagus. The brussels were amazing with their sweet maple bacon glaze and roasted to perfection, and can you really order a steak and not get sauteed mushrooms? A side can feed 2, maybe 3 people so just order one to share if it's a small party.   It was my boyfriend's birthday and he got the bananas foster pie (pictured below), and again, perfection. I wish I didn't sound like such a broken record but it's been like 2 weeks and I'm still dreaming about it. Romantic and classy while still feeling relaxed and not so upscale that I felt uncomfortable, I would come back to Vegas just to come here again. Worth every penny!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kbaiJRPm8O50_pfgAJwhWg.text: This is located on the first floor, just past the fountain/LOVE art, heading towards to Venetian.   We had 5:30 reservations and were seated right away. Our server asked if we were attending a show so she knew how much time we had.   We were celebrating my birthday and they had a card waiting for me which was a nice touch.   They started us with a potato soup amuse bouche which was really good. They also brought out turnovers and they refilled those for us  I got a pear cocktail that was very good.   Our server said they're known for the bone in ribeye, but the NY strip was her favorite. My boyfriend got the ribeye and I got the petit filet. We got the potato croquettes and creamed corn for sides and everything was really good.   We were too full for dessert, but they brought us a mango sorbet with a candle for my birthday. We came back after our show and got the German chocolate cake at the bar.   Our service was very friendly and attentive.

fTVcHJ8frI7HbF8B8bkqcQ.text: Located in The Venetian, in Restaurant Row.  My husband & I decided to have a dinner here after our wedding.  I had called inquiring about specials they could do for a wedding & they said that that they would give us a bottle of wine & their best dessert enough for everyone to congratulate us on our big day.  None of those things happened.  The day before our wedding we went to the restaurant & had asked if we could bring in 2 large wedding arrangements & they said they would set a table to display them next to our table.  This was not done either.  Okay...  So I already had a sour taste in my mouth & we did not even start dinner yet.  They did not keep their word about anything & of course I was upset because they said certain things would happen & they did not, & they knew it was for a wedding.  Our servers were nice & prompt though.  EMERIL'S NEW ORLEANS BARBECUE SHRIMP:  Flavorful. Ahi Tuna:  Fresh & tasty. 100% JAPANESE WAGYU (6oz Filet Mignon):  Had to go big but it was a bust.  Very tender yet very bland. COUNTRY SMASHED POTATOES:  BUTTERED FRESH ASPARAGUS:   Brussels Sprouts:

2EcQ_qN9T3xI7wl7ljTXrA.text: I love steak but  Delmonico Steakhouse was just average.  Initially we wanted to celebrate at a different restaurant.  They were fully booked so this was pretty much plan b.  It was a disappointment.    We were about 15 minutes late for our reservation due to waiting for the Uber ride.  When we arrived, the ambience was nice.  The dim lighting always set the romantic vibe.  The decor was fairly plain except the white linen boosted the sophisticated appeal.    The maitre d' was a bit obnoxious.  You would think someone in his role would be a little more friendly.  You want your patrons to feel welcomed.  Service was not that great.    We ordered the ribeye medium rare and it was undercooked.  Sending it back would have ruined the steak.  At least the meat was tender.  The flavor was lacking.  We also had three side dishes: creamed corn, garlic sauteed mushrooms, and garlic smashed potatoes.  All 3 tasted good.    In such a well renowned establishment, steak is expected to be superior.  I was not impressed!  On our future visit to Vegas, we will bypass this restaurant!!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Celebrating with steak.  Cheers!

HtpKMEJkEw9ObC9uWnYYTg.text: This place is much larger.  than it appears from the outside. Service is very upscale. Staff is extremely friendly.   Meets we're cooked to perfection. Just needs a bit of salt.   Grilled octopus was recommended but I thought it was missing a bit of flavor such as lemon and salt.   First time having foie Pan Seared Foie Gras. Tasted like bone marrow. My husband and I liked it.   Both the Delmonico Creamed Spinach and Buttered Fresh Broccoli were cooked well. I was a huge fan of the Delmonico Creamed Spinach

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-Ul9X3cc8YfSJ0-xIt2CZg.text: What's a Vegas trip without splurging? I finally got convinced to live a little because I don't believe in spending the big bucks for a great meal. This is one of the few Emeril Lagasse's restaurants in Vegas and at one point won the best steakhouse award. BAAM! I was worried the vibe at the restaurant was going to be snobby but to my surprise it wasn't. Everyone is there for a hearty meaty juicy plate of goodness! We ordered the ribeye as well as the New York strip with sides of mashed potatoes and creamed spinach. It was cooked perfectly to the T when I asked for medium rare; not too overcooked or too bloody, just perfection. The sides were a great addition to the meal because I'm not a carnivore I need my potatoes. Yes the total bill was horrific at the end but I must admit it was the best steak I've had in a while. Hey, you're in Vegas! Eat, sleep, gamble, and repeat!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1xVmRlKtICMfD6wWRRO6HQ.text: What happened Delmonico?  It has been probably close to 18 years since I have last been here and it was only because every time I tried to make a reservation at the last minute, there was no room.  I was so excited to get a reservation for the next day Friday in a busy September. When I got there, the first thing that was odd was the look/feel and location. It felt a bit boring and in need of a refreshing design. I felt totally distracted for some reason by the decor and ambiance.   Food wise, pretty darn good.  For starters we had the Artisanal Cheeses and shrimp cocktail. For entrees We had the bone in Ribeye, the Filet Mignon and Salmon. We also had sides of mushrooms and asparagus.  The meats were cooked to perfection, tasty and juicy.   Service was pretty darn good as well. From the waiter to the support staff I must say everyone is very well trained and pleasant.  Found the promptness if service and clearing the dishes was good but nearly too fast. Lingering is good too!  Dessert!  The  Emeril's Banana Cream Pie was awesome!  Will I go back?  Sure when my client is staying at the Venetian or Palazzo perhaps. It's not too convenient and for locals getting there is a challenge. Del Frisco's or the Golden Steer are much easier to get to and with similar service and food.   Definitely check it out. You won't be disappointed.

60Y3zgfqkgRcpor47PAvYw.text: Wanting a good steak while in Vegas, we decided to try Delmonico Steakhouse. We parked at the Palazzo ( free valet parking) and walked through the hotel to our destination . We were greeted n seated as soon as we walked in. Our server was very nice. We got waters n popovers ( complimentary) while we looked over the menu for drinks and dinner. The popovers were so light n flaky. I enjoyed them so much that I had two before any food came!!! This may have been a mistake for me since I don't eat much to begin with but they were so good. We got the Parmesan truffle chips to pick on while we had a few drinks. They were deliciously addicting!! Hubby got the rib eye and I got a New York strip with foie gras. Both of our steaks were cooked perfectly to how we asked for it to be!!! My foie gras on the other hand was a little burnt and had that burnt taste that lingered. For our sides we got the garlic mashed potatoes which was very tasty and the creamed spinach which was okay but not better than the one at my favorite place to get creamed spinach.  Although we were both very full and had to get take out boxes, I had to try the banana cream pie!!! It was huge and  very delicious!!! Not overly sweet and full of bananas! I enjoyed it very much!!! Service was good, atmosphere was good, and food was great!

dEXNHC2IKFExCklGvfTE3A.text: Ate at Delmonico's before we saw Jackson Browne last night at the Venetian. It was excellent all around! Food and service were outstanding!hint- the lobster bisque is amazing. Katherine at the bar was awesome. Very attentive and had great pre-show suggestions. And her specialty cocktails were the best. She treated all her guests with the same attention- very much appreciated. Thanks for a great experience- we will be back .

N_3TsVtpYOAM8X_9jK1IMw.text: I was so looking forward to this meal. Came here on Christmas with my mom. Ummmmmmmm...everything was severely under seasoned. It was like they ran out of salt and just didn't tell anyone. The service was great, but wow....what a big miss. Maybe the chef was in a bad mood because he had to work on Christmas. If so....I could taste his tears in my food. But then again....tears are salty and that would add flavor..so...I guess not. Emeril, get your house in order, please.

zhwOupNrN1_wRl0Jh5dZCQ.text: This is a great steakhouse and we were able to get a reservation pretty easily but we also came in at 9:30 the ambience was very nice it's definitely a place you wanna go to impress I really enjoyed their chicken breast it was excellent it was fried and I never had a chicken breast so succulent  The maitre d' Thomas was very nice and was able to get the mixologist to make us special rose and lavender martinis and they came out sensational I thought the cheesy grits were so nice and either creamed corn side was very nice and so was the mash potatoes I didn't take much pictures But I definitely recommend this restaurant

HKoJJRfnSG5genvGbchfwQ.text: Previously (about a year ago), we had a good experience at Delmonicos, so we had gone back.  This time around, the experience was a train wreck.  Several of us went (my wife and I had invited extended family), and we decided to order many smaller dishes to share/sample, rather than a whole course each.  As soon as our server noticed that we were not ordering a "main entree" we all noticed a HUGE shift in service and attitude.  Suddenly our server had a poor attitude, stopped talking to us, and the level of service went from a 9 to a 2.    What is strange is that we were ordering so many smaller items to be shared, as well as several bottles of pricey wine, that the check would be significant nevertheless, and so if it was the TIP that the server was worried about (and we could tell it was!), then they were pathetic to decide to neglect our entire table for that reason.  To add insult to injury, we had a family member who flew in internationally for her birthday celebration, and this was her dinner.  Delmonico's server either out of neglect, or out of spite, decided to ignore this occasion (even though we had told her in private before we all sat down!) and there was no mention of it, no cake, nothing.  My wife and I travel significantly, and we are huge foodies.  We will spend any amount of money on great food, great service, and great experiences.  We are great tippers, usually tipping 25% or more.  We are embarrassed and ashamed that we invited extended family to be a part of this (supposed) birthday celebration, and that people flew in from out of the country just for this celebration... only for the experience to be subpar and lackluster.  I feel that Delmonico's really dropped the ball on this one.  We are not planning on returning, as there are so many other phenomenal nearby options for great dining experiences, and also great customer service.

Frm61VRUFrXeJdQCzR6P8Q.text: This place was amazing. From the start the service was so good. The recommendations from our server were amazing. The bourbon list is very good. They had several I have been looking for.  The pop over bread was so tasty. The bbq shrimp are excellent and the wilted lettuce salad was amazing. I then had the smashed potatoes and wagyu filet.  The steak was so rich I couldn't finish it all. The potatoes were amazing.  This place is a must try!

ElUa5sDuKj0O9QE-Jkxqkg.text: The 20oz Porterhouse was a sweet deal especially when they let us split it between 4 people! They even sliced it up for us so we could better share it among ourselves. I asked for a medium rare and this thing came out on the bloodier side which I enjoy immensely, but others I was sharing with did not. I even relished chomping on the T-bone at the end, ya know, with the best feminine manners possible. ;) It should be noted that although delicious, the sliced meat did not stay warm for very long. Our friend's bone-in ribeye was also rather cold.  We also went for some sides and shared the cost. I ordered the *Sauteed Garlic Mushrooms* for my share. They give you A LOT and as they should for $14. Among all our sides, the tastiest was the *Creamed Corn Gratinee*. For dessert, we opted out, but the waiters were kind enough to note that there were two February babies at the table and brought out a complimentary dessert with a candle for each of us. It was a simple sorbet with cantaloupe, but definitely a nice touch.   The dessert at the end was icing on the cake, so I will leave them with 4-stars despite our cold steaks. Ambiance was romantic, but you don't necessarily have to dress up to eat here.

mPj5Z5fHkCGBK-lpOdcfbg.text: DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND ORDER DESSERT.  You will thank me later.   Amazing food, chic atmosphere and non pretentious waiting staff.   Me and my husband were just walk ins without reservations and they managed to seat us right away. Our dress attire was a little more informal, neither of us had jackets. The other people dining seemed to be more dressy. The atmosphere was upscale.   The food was killer, you are immediately presented with these bread poppers which are too die for.  As a starter we had the Fig Foie Gras, it was salty and sweet and the Foie Gras was cooked perfectly it was a very buttery texture on puff pastry or alike. We also got the stereotypical Caesar salad which was table-side. I'm not going to lie It wasn't the best, I hate to be a stickler but my husband and I often go to steakhouses and this is kind of his staple salad.    For the mains my husband and I both got the bone in Ribeye medium rare, the steak was cooked to perfection See pics**  Sides were cheese mashed potatoes and Mushrooms. Both were very good.    Dessert was killer I MEAN KILLER. You have to get the banana cream cake. It is life changing. I will be back for an awesome steak but the cake is nothing short of perfection. Do yourself a favor and get the banana cream cake.

LDSx14TN82sxti_4ZxoHiQ.text: Great service good food. I will definitely be going back. I had filet mignon with asparagus, mashed potatoes. My boyfriend had the rack of lam

okY46W5wI-ePaTRwMK2yXw.text: Had dinner here last Wednesday. We were a party of 7. As a big party we ordered up a lot of food and it was all pretty good. We had a seafood tower excellent. Octopus, bbq shrimp charcuterie plate all great appetizers. I had the beef carpaccio salad my goodness that was so delicious I highly recommend that. 2 bottles of wine, grappa , lattes dessert, various beers and highballs. All the food was great and liquor strong. We were all well dressed business men in suits and dress shirts but man our service was lacking. Renee our bearded server sucked not very friendly, no smiles no hospitality. I had to ask for some more bread 3times before I got any. I will say the other helpers were 100% friendlier and nicer than Renee I wish those ladies were our server. Anyways just disappointed in our server after we spent over 1400 on dinner and drinks. If you go the food is great request a different server Renee's hospitality sucks

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood tower and bbq shrimp and Moscow mule

DhF-Dxx3AL9nnqJVSt5RLA.text: Came here for our anniversary and had he best time. The entire staff signed a card for us and our table was covered in rose petals. The manager came over to congratulate us and gave us her card in case we ever needed anything in the future. The food was amazing!! The place was beautiful. We will definitely be back!!

0LVYw2iCUSr1TVgzBnl_HA.text: Came here per a friend's recommendation. My friend and I had the bbq shrimp appetizer which was tasty. We ordered the bone in rib eye with a side of mushrooms and spinach.  The steaks are HUGE and topped with butter. Butter makes everything taste better. We both couldn't finish our steaks but it was pretty darn good.

-7O72HqM4eJF0NMCgdLjCQ.text: My client took me here after the MAGIC Show and it was phenomenal! The steak danced in my mouth. Well not really but you get the picture. The salads and sides (asparagus, potatoes) were excellent. They also have a fine wine selection. This place takes steak on another level! Highly recommended!

gtBpN0WZK_6AtT_SCYf3XQ.text: Love, Love, Love Delmonico's. My husband and I eat here every time we visit Vegas.  The service has always been consistently great-call you by name, never a water glass left half full, and servers who know and understand the menu.  The food, well, that's what really keeps us going back.  Last visit, we had the Chateaubriand for 2-it was perfect.  The sides that came with were delicious and we had the beer/cheese dip with pretzel bread for a starter and it was heaven in a bowl.  I like the wine selection-our server paired our steak with an appropriate red-not too full, but not too sweet , either.  I also love that they've always sent out an amuse-bouche(a nice, little bite) from the chef before you order-it's the little things that add up! Emeril-you've done it right again! We're going to actually try Carnevino, Batali's latest,  on our trip next month for something new, but I know we'll always visit Delmonico's!

UDgx6jFh9mIBuJoc5PfonA.text: Yum! I loved this place! Order the Louisiana version of the Lemon drop! That is really good! The food was great! The mashed potatoes were awesome and my steak was great. It didn't get cooked the way I asked for it to be but it was good nonetheless. Our server was great and because it was my birthday, she gave me a chocolate martini on the house that was so good!!! I would definitely go again!

7EUKe99kg7XKBEwU4zXAEQ.text: Located in the Venetian, this place like all the other Las Vegas spots is real swanky, as opposed to the usual clubby feel (dark woods, naugahyde booths) that most steakhouses have.  This place has a really tasty steak, the Delmonico. It's a bone in rib-eye that's really tender and tasty. Sides were unremarkable.  I'd do it again, it's a nice place.

mNXglIne0uKvXn5Gwhd_ig.text: While on an extended stay at the Palazzo we decided to try Delmonico. I made a reservation through Open Table. We were seated promptly but at a table that was less than desirable where the waiter had to stand behind me while serving us. He was quite pushy and brusque. My wife ordered the half duck as she loves duck. Right after we were served the waiter returned and asked if everything was OK, My wife had taken one bite from the duck leg and she said that things were OK. But as she continued to work on the rest of the duck it seemed to become very tough like it had been over microwaived. She signaled the waiter over and rather than handling it professionally he asked in a rather accusing manner why she had said the duck was OK when first asked. This made us feel very uncomfortable. The waiter did remove the duck and did not charge us for it. However, we just wanted some excellent food. I'll never return to any of Emeril's restaurants based on this encounter. If you want a good meal while at the Venetian / Palazzo go to Bouchon where you'll be treated well and the food is great. Just to be balanced I will say that the rib eye that I had was good.

RAvz3wP8dG5tbrhrhwPN7w.text: This is a great place for steak!  I love the red meat and this was on par with the best I've had.  Not quite as flashy as some of the other steak joints, but who cares when the food is great.  We had some apps to start: chips were awesome and the tartar was fantastic.  Moving on to the bone in Ribeye was a 10. It was cooked to perfection and the crust from the sear was just right.  A little bit of butter on top and wala perfection.  The wine list is pretty comprehensive as well.  Prices were surprisingly reasonable.

mooflnxfcfuQCNJWLgbh0A.text: My 4th time going to the restaurant and it didn't disappoint. Made reservations for 9pm but I forgot where it was. Made the mad scramble for 2 blocks. When I called the woman who answered said no problem. The bartender was exceptional, stearing me towards a good whiskey. Of course the steak itself. To describe the steak would only cheapen the experience. Very worth the money.

aEwsnmIoIsC-KTBrIgM4og.text: YOUR MILEAGE MAY VARY.  lately this place seems to go in either extreme- feast or famine. sometimes, the food is absolutely incredible and everything is jusssssst right. othertimes, it just falls flat on its face. in all fairness, it's a really large restaurant and i suppose it's inevitable for some things to get lost in the cracks here and there. still, the first 3-4 times i ate here, everything was flawless... so i know what it could be.

jOwsItYTTPImEAeNyz6vSw.text: This place was the bomb-digity!  One of the best meals I've ever had.  I know they are known for the bone-in ribeye but go with the filet oscar style.   My crew and I were out for my bachelor party and we had a 10:30PM dinner and we ended up staying there till about 1 in the morning.  The wait staff was awesome, not pushy at all and very helpful.  Even joked with us a little bit.  We were definitely the last ones in the place but they were happy to let us stay as long as we wanted.  Highly recommend this place, very classy.

4gMK8C8WUi8ZQXAIjgQk7A.text: Best steak of my life!  We stayed at Aria over the weekend and asked around for a dinner recommendation.  Hands down this place rocked!  The service was amazing, the food was fantastic..... I am an Emeril fan so I was excited to try it out.  The prices was very reasonable especially for being a top rated Vegas strip restaurant. Excited to try the other locations in NYC and NO now!

yVKixGwfxhTsnev6eOV3pQ.text: I am going to preface this review by saying that we were given free desserts and a special appetizer from the chef. This was due to my sister knowing the general manager as she was a Vegas concierge for many years. That being said, I thought the meal experience was outstanding.  We were celebrating an anniversary and there were seven of us including a 7 year old. The waiter brought the aforementioned free appetizer, a steak and blue cheese  croquette and foie grae with cherry compote. Not bad. I started with the baby greens with fried mozzarella. The lettuce was decent, the mozzarella cold and disappointing.   I asked a waiter, not ours, what she recommends and she said easily the Rib Eye in Bone. It saved the meal. As juicy as any steak I've ever had, and spiced to perfection with a dollop of butter melting on top. My wife enjoyed the 2 pound lobster and had started with the Lobster Bisque which she also devoured. The sides were OK. I had the Twice Baked potato with bacon and cheese, but also sampled the french fries, which they specially made for the 7 year old, and they were quite good.  Dessert, since it was free, was a virtual sampler platter. The pecan pie was excellent. The bread pudding was disapponting - I've never tried it with cubed up bread with sauce on top and not enough to reach the bottom and served with Oreo ice cream and chocolate Magic Shell. I sampled three flavors of ice cream and gelato and disliked them all, they tasted like ice milk.  The service was impeccable. Never a want. And the price was not bad, $325 for 7 people but if I included the freebies then it would have touched $400. Bottom line is I'd go back if staying at the Venetian but would try others if not.

8nSES3htOx-tJvDdXw-HxQ.text: Delmonico Steakhouse is the BEST steakhouse I have ever been to. HANDS DOWN. NOTHING else compares. I have been going to this steakhouse for the past 8 years. Pretty much every time I visit Vegas; we find a way to to have dinner there. I have tried the pork chops for dinner. But my "go to" entree is ALWAYS the RIB EYE. It is done to PERFECTION. Always EXPERTLY cooked and seasoned. TENDER and almost MELTS IN YOUR MOUTH. The sign of an EXCELLENT STEAKHOUSE - is that your steak is ALWAYS cooked to order and does not need much in the area of extra sauces. Your steak comes with an assortment of Emeril's sauces. I have never needed them and prefer to eat the steak "as is". Service is IMPECCABLE. Your drinks are brought quickly. Your water glass is never empty. Entrees and side dishes are delectable beyond your dreams. Also, the most AMAZING Banana Cream Pie I have ever had the pleasure of eating in my Life. TRUST ME. Spending money at Delmonico Steakhouse is WELL SPENT and I doubt you will be disappointed. It is a True dining EXPERIENCE.

8pSmBpi5_Zo2afoXXon0tA.text: BY FAR my favorite steakhouse in the country.  The steak is seasoned perfectly, no sauce required.  All sides we ordered were great and I think we ordered every side on the menu, you must get truffle and parmesan chips!  The service is incredible, a completely orchestrated dinner service is always impressive when your at a table of 9 and each plate hits the table at the same time.  Servers/staff are watching every movement and are very good at anticipating needs and requests.  The dining room has a modern minimalist look but very nice, you dont hear this much but the tables and chairs were really nice.  When in Vegas make sure you go to Delmonico.

I1Tf_yqW0C8op1z8ykSIjg.text: Hmm.  I can't put my finger on why, but I just wasn't blown away by Delmonico.  The food and service were both certainly good, but....I don't know....something was lacking.  It may have been the atmosphere.  Everything seemed very bland and sort of old - for instance, the leather dining chairs all had cracks and chips in them, which isn't what I expect from a place of this caliber.  I guess it just wasn't a very special experience.

MNQnuMTEdAxbyWP-xnOk_Q.text: I took my wife and daughter here during spring break. Whow. We each ordered a different kind of steak. Each came out exactly as ordered and at exactly the same time! The steaks were a lot bigger than expected and we had to ask for doggie boxes. (We finished it off the next day!) Great wine selection. Great service.  My only complaint is the table are too close together and if the people next to you do not bump you, the waiter does as he passes between tables. That was a real pain. They need to rearrange the seating. Ask for a corner table to avoid this problem. If they fix that, I would give them five stars.

J4C3Ns8XzDhP7AcxxUUq-Q.text: Went there for the thanksgiving dinner. What a mistake! Dry turkey with horrible tasting green beans. Also ordered mojitos and they were the worse I've had. I do not know about the rest of the menu but the thanksgiving dinner was overpriced and gross. The two stars are for the dinner roles and the parmesan chips.

jQeYAZdOT5TkQPHatojkvg.text: Simply delicious!  I went with a group from work while attending a meeting and everyone seemed impressed with the food. We started off with a few appetizers including the calamari which was a little on the salty side, roasted butternut squash ravioli with duck and the crab cakes.   I had the spinach and radicchio salad with apple rosemary vinaigrette and warm pistachio crusted goat cheesecake. Yep, that's right, you heard me... a goat cheese cake. It was fantastic.   For my entree I was worried because I had already filled up on the appetizers and my delicious salad but I managed to eat my Filet Mignon medallions with a bacon peppercorn sauce.  We split a few sides as a table including the broccoli, asparagus and some delicious corn dish. I have no idea who ordered it but for the love of all that is holy, you have to get this corn dish. It was phenomenal. The broccoli not so much... too al dente for me!  For dessert there were a few orders of the bread pudding and banana cream pie which no one seemed to complain about. The service was a little slow but maybe it was because the place was packed. There was way too much time in between courses. Oh and it took at least 30 minutes to get drinks each round. Maybe go early before the rush hits or just don't go with a party of 13 like we did.

aQQIcQfFYawLYU85oGRxhQ.text: Oh.  My.  Lord.  Best steak I've ever had, super tender and tasty even though relatively unadorned.  I thought Mesa Grill was good (and it is) but this hunk of cow takes the cake.  The ambiance is nice although the decor is a bit spartan, the wine list is far more than my gin-drinking brain could ever comprehend, and to top it all off the service was on another level:  There were like three dudes running around bringing us stuff and clearing plates all night.  And you wanna know about attention to detail?  The one thing Vegas has heretofore *never* gotten right was the after-dinner espresso.  Never hot enough, or no head of crema, or just awful tasting.  But Delmonico's brew was not only good tasting, but they actually warmed up the cup!  (The coffee snobs among you will know what I'm on about here.)

lNG6US60bCeXJr0js1QkWw.text: Very good food! You have to try the banana cream pie. It is awesome! I had the bone in rib eye and it was delicious even though it was pretty fatty. The price is very high so come prepared to spend some $$$.

abyg4eOIdxAZYI0AcDdaRw.text: Well?  I stay at the Palazzo or Venetian a few times a year, and try to eat at DelMonico once a year.  Recently went with a few coworkers, and a good friend of mine-  My liver.  We both waddled out feeling the need for a good workout...  But that would be for the next afternoon of course.  For starters, a Caesar.  Got to lay a good foundation.  Next, why would the thick cut bacon NOT be chosen for an appetizer?  We each ate an order.  Ha.  Excellent.  Full already?  Ok.  A buddy of mine shared his bone-in Ribeye, medium rare, and it was done perfectly.  Firm, but marbled and juicy.  I ate the lobster tail which must have weighed a pound.  The breadcrumbs were a nice touch, and I drizzled each bite with some butter.  Heavenly.  Yes, I'll be back.

BZvg4KgHcx3wDLa6l6E7Hg.text: Celebrated my daughter's birthday here as it was her desire to dine here again, and everything was fabulous! My daughter & my husband shared the Chateaubriand with asparagus & mashed potatoes, and I ordered the Filet Mignon Au Poivre which was wonderful... Starters equalled Lobster Bisque & Butternut Squash Ravioli which were excellent as well... Impeccable service & the highest Quality food & preparation were greatly appreciated for a special occasion for our family! Thank you for a memorable evening! Banana Cream Pie for Bday dessert was ridiculously great & enough for many to share!

kkhYWvavmo7srY1AOGzv5g.text: Food was amazing!! Portions were big (especially steak).  One of the better steakhouses in Vegas.  A bit pricey but at least the food is delicious!

4VYFnLe-kXGMUPa9XqyWrA.text: This has to be one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. Been there many times and each time it is fantastic.  The food is really excellent. Some of the best steaks you will ever have. There has been nothing ive had here that has been short of excellent. Its traditional, with a hint of cajon for some little extra spice and flavor.  Some of the best service of anywhere in Vegas. I always love when the food is served to the entire table at one.  If I am in the mood for steak, I would pick Delmonico. Emril knows what he is doing with this one.

_vfwLwgNheukOCnU42kscA.text: Steak! My first trip to Vegas was this past summer with a group of friends. We ate here one night and it's the best steak I have every had in my life. I started with the lobster bisque and for dinner had the boneless ribeye medium rare with a bunch of different sides for the table, no room for desert though. Also two of my friends ordered the Caesar Salad which they make table side (for two people).    Lobster bisque... very very tasty and rich. If you don't like rich foods then you should not order this. It also has nice size chunks of lobster in it.   Boneless ribeye, medium rare...Amazing. It was cooked to perfection, just the way medium rare should be. It was well cooked and well seasoned, there's no need to dip it in ketchup or steak sauce. It was a pretty decent size cut of meat too, I can't remember the ounces but I left stuffed.   Caesar salad...I'm not a fan of rabbit food but watching the person make it table side it looked really good. In a matter of about 5-8 minutes he made two servings of what I was told was the best Caesar salad ever,  At this restaurant, the steak doesn't come with anything, you have to order the sides separately, I think we ordered asparagus, wild sauteed wild mushrooms and twice baked potato. All was cooked to perfection.   The Service...it was the outstanding. There are three people per table, so you are always attended to and the waiter is well versed in the menu and the drinks. I wasn't too sure what I wanted so I asked him for a recommendation and he asked me a few questions and based on those answers brought a drink out, which was good. I can't remember the name but it was good. I think it had 3 different kinds of liquor in it but it didn't taste like it at all, not overwhelming, good blend, good bartender.   It is expensive but well worth the money. The food, the service, the atmosphere and best of all since it is Vegas no need to really dress up, my kind of place. Definitely have to go there again when I go back during Christmas.

8oPJDrI9MdOGnIWBy9Gg_Q.text: Came here twice in a single week so I had to augment and order different items.  I started the week off with the bone in new york, it was a tad bit too salty for my taste.  Nothing to really say about it.  Midweek I had to go for some seafood, sure it's a steakhouse, but the bbq salmon it was.  Nothing too special, overall I'm not too fond of Delmonico.

lfiLH9-jT7gysJMYY4LORg.text: Amazing.... wine is great from a wide range, great side dishes, and on-point steak/lobster! I had the steak and my wife had the lobster

sZALQ4UQBGazhIhT2WwSeA.text: The Japanese Wagyu steak is so tender...it melts in your mouth! It is the best Wagyu in town! Love the bone in rib eye and escargot here so I would come back!!

gG3RkfO4BHscYZVx5X7tzw.text: Me and my wife have been here 4 years in a row for our anniversary. Last nite was simply incredible. Best steak of my life.

o0-RC89Sap03i82gL2g7nA.text: Impeccable service & the ambiance was right on. We had the cowboy ribeye and was top notch, the au gratin potatoes were recommended and was not let down and the mushrooms were OH SO GOOD! We were over stuffed but had to try the infamous banana cream pie.... AMAZING.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Cream Pie!
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner!

nik4rM7-3oRMxSUwOgs3Ug.text: At least 4.5 stars. Let me start by staying that I thought this was a great place. The ambiance was fantastic and maybe I enjoyed myself so much because we went here with a group of 18 or so right after my husband and I got married in the Venetian but here's the breakdown.   The appitizers were really great, the parmesan chips were thin and had wonderful flavor. We talked about stealing a basket as we left. The bbq shrimp was done perfectly and a great twist.   My brother had the soft shell crab and that may have been my favorite thing I had. It was fantastic but I don't have much comparison since that was actually the first time I've had soft shell crab. Nevertheless, it had great flavor and I would order it again. My husband and I split a steak and got the cesear salad. The salad was really nice and fresh. The steak was great, and probably in the top 3 I have ever had.   We had a bunch of wine and tried a few different kinds and they were all great. The manager came over and talked to us about the wines and was very informative and nice.   The reason why this didn't get 5 stars from me was because for the price, you just expect a little more from the steaks. This was still one of the best dinners I have ever had and I would absolutely go back.

Voxz7AA_QJ1JO5XCIC10Dw.text: Wonderful experience! Classic service, friendly wait staff, perfectly mixed cocktails, and flavorful food. Our salads were absolutely perfect, the dressings on both were incredible. Our steaks were juicy and cooked to perfection - both of us got the rib-eye and all its flavorful goodness was all over the plate. I was however, surprised at the lack of ambiance in this place. It's got really nothing going for it but tables and good service and good food. I guess you don't need much more than that, but it's Vegas for goodness' sakes. Liven up the decor a bit! But go, please. You won't regret it.

-QMNsRIEMeT0B1zEoivd3g.text: This is probably one of my favorite places for steak, bread pudding, or when I wanna eat at the bar alone. Here is a summary of one of my experiences that I shared with one of my foodie friends when we ate here.   We ordered the Caesar Salad which was spectacularly prepared fresh able side by the maitre 'd. It was like $30 but probably THE best salad of my life! Next was the bone in rib eye which was so perfectly seasoned and cooked! I'm a huge fan of sides so I got the creamed spinach, a Idaho baked potato, creamed corn, and asparagus. YES, there were amazing left overs!  For dessert of course it was the White Chocolate Macadamia nut Bread Pudding! If anyone knows Emril's shows or books you know this is like his signature item. I have also had the Duck Egg Creme Brulee which is heavenly as well. But my go to is the bread pudding!  This is a place you probably wouldn't wanna eat at daily, but it is a place to take special friends who enjoy good food at it's best or for an awesome night of self spoiling! :)  *Lobster bique, the butternut squash ravioli and the fried chicken are killer too!

FPsRFs-kfSNzATU0f7gcAQ.text: I have eaten at this restaurant twice. The first meal was memorable and I never forgot it. As a result, I was so excited to go back last week. I had the truffle chips for an appetizer which were good but they didn't fit in with that kind of restaurant. My friend had a shrimp appetizer that was the favorite of the waiter's but we both found it very strange. It was supposed to be something creole and the shrimp was covered with an unattractive brown sauce. Odd.  We both had a filet mignon. I ordered mine medium rare. I couldn't finish the last 15% of it because it was rare. Disgusting. It was fine but not worth $50. It came with a  sauce that made it delicious though. Without the sauce it would have been a big disappointment.  We ordered a side of double baked potatoes. That was the best part of the meal.  We each ordered a dessert. I had the banana cream pie. It was gorgeous but it was all bananas (which I LOVE) but with little cream. It was fine. My friend had the creme brulee and it was delicious.  Service was very nice. Overall at $312 I won't be going back simply because it isn't worth the money.

c8YSMA8mGqb9i0p2iJ_ivw.text: Pros: 1. Was at a chefs table overlooking the kitchen shielded though 2. Excellent all around for 6 people 3. Excellent service, our famous chef and two servers 4. It was fun for all 5 Love the black grilled carrots, very tasty said from the amazon jungle 6. I could have rated it 4 1/2 stars, I really enjoyed the evening at LAS 7. Deserts were off the chart, an indulgence for all  Cons: 1. Lamb from Colorado was OK, not great it was medium cooked, so it was a little chewy since I prefer medium rare. 2. Really none   I recommend it highly. Damage was reasonable, we will be back!

mSvS9wppVpJqKlL1c076qw.text: I cannot say enough about this place. The steak was no doubt the absolute best I've ever had, the shrimp was excellent as well. Had a fabulous wine. ordered a variety of desserts  my favorite was the banana cream pie. Can't wait to go back!

qT4i_UPPgvQ3EZ6i6i7D2g.text: Yes!! The food and service were incredible. Our server Michael J was top notch. Exactly what you want when dining at a fine steak house. Watching Michael and his team work was like a well choreographed show.  The steaks were cooked perfectly, appetizers great, salads also very good. Well done guys! We will be back.

Xx6obtR7ddCmsPMksKV0FA.text: I'd say it's probably the best steakhouse i ever had!  Though it doesn't come with a view (like most of the nice restaurants in Vegas), but the settings, decorations alone are very nice.  A romantic get-away with very very nice food - from the perfectly seasoned steaks, their special steak sauces, each one of its side dishes, even the bread (the butter! yum!)...  They have its own wine celler, and their wine list is prob. the best I see in LV.  Been there a couple times and will definitely go back again - when I have a little extra cash... :)

Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sides
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. foie gras

jMt1kywOn9nLZNoe55Y_lA.text: Had an all around fine meal at Delmonico on our recent trip to Las Vegas.  I also went to Wolfgang Puck's CUT and gave it 4 stars on this trip.  The only real difference was that Delmonico cooked my NY Strip perfectly medium rare vs. just a bit over at Puck's place.  The rest of the meal from service to apps to salads was first rate.  The gumbo was yummy with a dark brick roux used and plenty of chicken, seafood and andouille to complement.  They put a big ole hunk of Maitre d butter on each steak and this, along with the Cajun seasoning (am assuming Emeril's trademark Essence) and the natural juices from the prime, aged beef lead to a wonderful liquid on your plate for dipping each tender bite.  Service was as attentive and on point as one would expect at these prices.  Sorry Wolfgang, Emeril wins this showdown by .5 of a star!

C4HkBgIY67jpQI8y9u3fVw.text: We ate dinner for our Anniversary and lunch on our final day. Food was so tasty and my hubby is still raving about the Bone-in steak, the salmon was moist and succulent. Jumbo prawn cocktail, lobster bisque, lobster sliders, specialty drinks Tale of Two Cherries Oysters on half shell... I can go on and on Rene, Lamont and Dominique were top notch service experts!!  #vegasfinedining #betterthandelicious
