E5ZQzrRLICRBgIRErpJT9g.text: The food was average at best.  The exceptionally high prices and the quality of the dishes do not match up.  Wife and I chose Delmonico based on reviews.  We left disappointed. The service is what you would expect to find at any high end restaurant.  All of our dishes lacked flavor and the quality of the ingredients were not there as well.  I am really not sure how this place is so well reviewed.  Coming from Boston we could go out every night for three months for a fantastic dinner and never revisit the same restaurant.  With that maybe we are spoiled.  Our bill for the two of us at the end of the night was $250.  Being generous I would say that dinner was worth maybe a third of the cost.    The next night we sat at the bar at Seablue in the MGM for a couple of cocktails. I got talking with the bartender and told him about dinner the previous night.  He said "ooh, I wouldn't go there.  I was there years ago and found it to be extremely overpriced and the food just not that good.  I've heard lots of people say not great things about their Delmonico visit." Coincidentally, if you are in the MGM during happy hour visit the Seablue. Shrimp Cocktail are $1 each and are huge.  Coming from the east coast I wouldn't eat shrimp in the desert but on the bartenders recommendation we got some. They were excellent.  If the restaurant wasn't in the Venetian and visited by thousands of tourists I would guess it would go out of business rather quickly.

lhFIVOusQEUzun2Bjq8HWw.text: Will NEVER dine at Delmonico's again.  Probably will never dine in an Emeril restaurant again.  They scammed our group with a ridiculous corkage fee - $400 to serve us 3 bottles of our own wine.  We paid $25 per bottle corkage at Christmas in this restaurant.  Delmonico's is disingenuous.

XabIdq6nDdg8NYicLBTZ9A.text: The boy picked Delmonico's because he loves steak ad I didn't want to leave the hotel. Now, in all honesty, I wasn't my normal foodie self, I wasn't really that hungry, so maybe I'm not giving it a fair review....but.... We arrived 5 minutes late for our reservation, and were greeted by the host with a little attitude, but in all fairness, I was in heels hiking miles to get to this place, give me a break! After he made a point of stating the time, and the time our reservation was, we were escorted to our table. The decor almost feels cave-like, which worked for a steakhouse. The place was packed and it took a little longer than fine dining protocol allows for to get our menus. Our waitress was a sweetheart and made suggestions for us, although she seemed swamped with tables.  I decided on the lobster bisque and the petite fillet Mignon. The lobster bisque was ok, nothing special, which was sad, since I watch the food network 24/7 and love Emeril, (I expected more from his restaurant). My fillet was a little overcooked for medium rare, and really had nothing special about it. No flavor to set it apart from a fillet I'd get from Costco and make on the grill myself. The boy loved his steak, so I guess the meal was a success, but having been to N9NE, I wouldn't come back here. The prices are high, and the food is just good, not world changing like Vegas fine dining should be.

HztzwhTh8-jbRsOEeXnGjA.text: we got here at 730pm with reservations at 8pm, so we waited for a little bit in their "lounge." here, i asked for water, and the waitress gracefully brought me a glass, even though we were probably expected to order an alcoholic beverage. we waited about 15 minutes in their lounge, and then a waitress took us to our seats. the restaurant was surprisingly large, and we were seated in the middle of the back room. i was surprised at the decor, it was rather.. plain.  plain white walls with dim lighting.. it kind of felt like we were just being seated in a large room. after sitting, the waiter explained to us about the menu, and then left a very large book of alcoholic beverages for us to look over as well.  the menu wasnt too large, which was good for indecisive people like us. :)  to start, we ordered a Lobster Bisque ($12.50) to share, esp after reading the rave reviews about it here. like i said, not hyped. it was sensational. it was so smooth, creamy, and rich, mMm.. i'm drooling right now just thinking about it. for our entrees, i ordered the Colorado Rack of Lamb ($48) with a side of Roasted Fingerling Potatoes ($9), and the friend ordered one of their specials of the night--Blue Cheese covered Bone-in Filet with Bacon ($55) with a side of Sauteed Garlic Mushrooms ($9). i'll start with the sides. the potatoes were okay.. nothing too spectacular.. a little bit on the salty side.. but it was a good side if you need veggies (or veggie-related) along with your meat. the mushrooms were good. tasty, cooked nicely, and i dont even like mushrooms! i ordered the lamb cooked to medium, and it was still slightly too red for me, but it was good nonetheless. a little bit on the fatty side, but it was tasty, and came with a popover.. which is this egg-battered bread thing that went really well with the lamb sauce. i actually had a bite of the friend's steak before i dug into my lamb, and boy.. that steak was FABULOUS! the blue cheese, bacon, steak, and tangy sauce that came with it made the steak utterly orgasmic. perfect blend of flavors. the meat practically melts in your mouth. friend got the steak in medium rare, but it seemed slightly more cooked than it should've been. it definitely didnt take away the tenderness though, this was the best steak i've had in my life (and i only took a couple of bites from it). this was one of the specials though, so it probably wont always be available. just writing about it right now is making my stomach grumble. i was craving to see what their desserts would taste like. we decided to go with the Chocolate Bread Pudding ($10). it was really chocolate-y, but for chocolate-lovers like me, it was perfect. it was the cherry on top of an already great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Bread Pudding
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Colorado Rack of Lamb with Popover
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue Cheese Covered Bone-In Steak with Bacon

B5YFFW1UFRiTDq4qsGjYbw.text: Just as good the second time around!  Near perfect steak dinner, but not perfect.  This place is worth a repeat visit.  I really have to compliment the wait staff at this restaurant.  It seemed like there were more workers than patrons the night we were there.    Caesar Salad - I was very tempted to order an appetizer, but my gf reminded me we were about to eat over a pound of meat so we decided to share the caesar salad.  It was prepared table side by our waiter.  It was decent and a nice way to prepare my stomach for the main course.  Bone-in Ribeye - Mine was cooked perfectly and well seasoned.  My particular cut was very, very tender.  My gf order the exact same steak and it wasn't nearly as good.  I had to share parts of my steak with her and we took the rest of hers to go.  Hers wasn't bad, it just wasn't as good as mine.    Sides - We ordered the creamed corn and asparagus.   The corn was very good.  It had a nice crust on the top and went well with my steak.  The asparagus was pretty plain.  I had to throw salt and pepper on it otherwise it was completely tasteless.    Dessert - We ordered the banana cream pie.  I have no idea why we chose it, but I'm glad we did.  I would have usually ordered something chocolaty with ice cream but the banana cream pie sounded good.  Well, it was good.  Really good.  When it came out, I thought it was going to be way too sweet with all the caramel and chocolate shavings, but it wasn't.  We weren't even hungry after our meal, but we managed to put the entire dessert down.    Overall, the food was good.  I have to give it 4 stars for the boring asparagus and inconsistent steak.  The wait staff was awesome.  They can have 5 stars.

yUuvx3kPkLyTUKEA0Y8q9A.text: WOW! Incredible all around! They had such great, great food. The service was exceptional everyone must get served at the same time, and when you get a salad (we got caesar) they make it table side. I can't think of one thing to complain about. I had a perfect experience here!

AYUDFCiDti7a_eguNHefnQ.text: bleh at best... i really wouldnt give the food any better ratings then outback... the only highlight of this meal was the service... they, i have to admit were really good. id save your money and go somewhere that actually has good food.

OCsK6QUkKfJX9dpeq8hssw.text: This place is located in the Venetian.  Went for a prix fixe dinner that offered one starter, entree and a dessert.  We both got the bbq shrimp as the starter.  The shrimp didn't come out carmelized from being cooked on a bbq, it was served with bbq sauce.  They were good.   One of us got the little fillet and the other got the salmon entrees.  Both meals were great.  We were disappointed with the desserts.  The chocolate cake was hard.  The banana creme pie was also a little hard; appeared like it was layers of banana and cheesecake.  Not what I expected.  So, minus one star for the dessert.

cZCkMrQcQ-i9Bawi1VMhuw.text: Delicious gumbo, chateaubriand, asparagus, and the most amazing mashed potatoes!  I thought the chateaubriand was a good value at $105 for two people, as it came with sides and was cooked to order at our table.  The wine was good, the service was great, all of the staff was friendly.  I think my favorite part was the warm dinner rolls.  I loved their wine list too.  I will definitely eat here next time I'm staying at the Venetian.

73D-pv8Uh9PK-18kGvUgVw.text: I had fillet, it was wonderful.  Great service, nice atmosphere.  The sides were pretty good, especially wild mushrooms:) The chef overcooked my BF's steak, so they quickly offered him a substitute.  Great wine list:) Enjoy!!!!

HE_9xs3W1eM4RbcPv7X1lQ.text: I was able to sample many menu items on my first and only visit to Delmonico's to date.   The things I loved were the Parmesan chip appetizer, the caesar salad, the soft shell crab and the BBQ shrimp app.  The Caesar salad was probably the best I've ever had.  The chips were thin cut and perfectly crispy.  The BBQ shrimps were cooked just right and the bbq sauce was mild and great for the shrimp.  The crab was excellent - perfectly cooked and had great flavor. I also tried the NY strip, it was cooked correctly and had a nice crust.  It was not the best steak I've ever had, but you can tell it was done with care and quality.  The appetizers were very good because each one had something that made it special...I would like to see that with the steaks as well.  I would say the service is what i was most disappointed in.  Not that it was bad, but it just wasn't what you expect from a place of this caliber (and price).

eoVc0TTcUeyj2RsPzRqGew.text: Wonderful service, awesome steak and sides. They were very accommodating to my gluten allergy. Wonderful experience.

oM9BqbGmR6_s8qNigHO99Q.text: Ok, someone that doesn't eat meat has no business writing a review for a steakhouse but I went here a few months back with a group of friends and had a wonderful dining experience so I thought I would share.  My fish was eh, ok, but hey, it's a steakhouse.  What do you expect.  Everyone else raved about their steaks and the appetizers and sides were incredible.  Wine list was amazing and the best was this chocolate something or other desert.  OMG.  I had an orgasm right there at the table, I swear.  Great place, great service. great time.  4 stars.

SHu0YvqhizULZlhDcpj-Wg.text: is it okay not to rave about this place? apologies to emeril. i think you're cool. really, i do.  visited the land of sin about a month ago and went to dinner at Delmonico. i was impressed with the steak, but extremely underwhelmed with the appetizers and sides.  shared a new york strip steak, cooked medium rare, with a friend. de-f'ing-licious. i didn't really like or crave steak until a recent trip to puerto rico (a food story for another time) but now i think i've learned to appreciate the awesomeness of a giant hunk of meat. the waiter was nice enough to split the steak onto two places, and it was sooooo good.  however. the appetizers and sides were another story.  - truffle parmesan potato chips - supposedly a specialty, but i found these too oily (yea yea, i know. truffle oil.) and too rich. - bbq shrimp w/ rosemary biscuit - came with 4 (i think) sizable shrimp, but i found it too salty, and really nothing special. - creamed spinach - very ehhhh. i've had better. - sauteed garlic mushrooms - okay, so you can't go wrong with garlic & mushrooms. these were a bit oily too, but pretty good none-the-less.

2FMegs55Ug4OuRtNDuBHrw.text: Outstanding.  The bone-in ribeye was cooked perfectly and totally delicious. The bar has the best whiskey selection I've seen.  Service was prompt, and we had an amazing time.  Awesome meal, exactly as it should be.

noZs6hJQzxoQFNKuDCgTqg.text: We stayed at the Palazzo and wanted to have a nice dinner at one of the restaurants in the hotel. I checked Yelp and found Delmonico had a really good review and made reservations for 9:30pm on Friday. The place was pretty full, with more and more guests still coming in.  Considering the price of the meal and the Yelp description we put on our "dressy" clothes. After we were seated a group of 6 came in wearing t-shirts, baseball caps, shorts, and flip flops. Oh well, that's Vegas for you.  Instead of the usual bread basket, the wait staff would place a warm roll on your plate when needed. It was one of the best rolls I've had in a while. A warm soft roll with a sprinkle of salt on top. We ordered for an appetizer, the Ahi Tuna & Salmon Tartare Cucumber Salad and Wasabi Aioli. I thought it was a bit salty, but the bf thought otherwise. We still scarfed it down. Because it was a busy night, we did have to wait a bit between the appetizer and our entrees. But the wait staff was very attentive most other times.   The bf ordered the Filet Mignon. He said it was very tasty and melted in his mouth. I ordered the Roasted Rack of Colorado Lamb, Fresh Herb Popover and Black Truffle Reduction. By far the best lamb I have ever had. Previous times when I ordered lamb, it had a gamey taste. For a second, I thought I was eating filet mignon. The Black Truffle reduction has a nice addition. It did not cover up the taste of the lamb. The popover was light and airy and tasted of rosemary.  We shared the New Orleans Style Creamed Spinach as a side. It was rich, creamy and delicious. I didn't get to finish my cocktail by the end, so the waiter placed it in a "to-go" cup. The "to-go" cup being a hotel glass.   If I had the money to splurge again, I'd definitely go back.

747Q3wZ1bSETIkKU90Mubw.text: I've had better BBQ shrimp at other Emiril's places, sauce here seemed over cooked, perhaps slightly burnt. Steaks were crazy expensive ($50!) and nothing special.  Sorry.  I can get a better steak in Houston (where I'm from) at a dozen or more places for half the price.  I'm sure the meat was high quality, and it was cooked properly... but it just wasn't anything special.  Not worthy of the $ anyway.  Service was a bit obsequious as well (which got annoying).  Overall it was a nice dinner, but for not a good value for the $.  There are many steak places in LV now, I'll try something else next time.

r7YJnyLpKG99znGIWgrROQ.text: Had one of the best meals I every had. Was celebrating both mine and my nephews b'days in LV. Awesome food even better service. Bone-in ribeye rocked the table.

oM6bqGRnR0S2KolckDy3Wg.text: Worth every penny, just for the mashed potatoes alone.  That said, the steak is, of course, fantastic.

qGnixsaG24jU6aT9wWjeMA.text: Hands down best steak (ribeye) I've ever ever had. Nice seasoning and aged steak. Try garlic sauteed wild mushrooms and potato gratin. Yummy. Wish I was eating it right now.. Drool...

0Th5G-uyjyQqonBJk9-fSg.text: Soo pricey but what a delicious meal.  My filet was a perfect medium rare and the spices they had for the charring made it one of the best steaks i've had in my life

nopOcrH0uT3iF6d29oQtjg.text: We have eaten here every time we are in vegas.Consistently top notch food drinks and desserts.Felt like a king and queen for 2 hours. Cannot say one bad thing about this place . Emeril has it down to a fine art! You will not be disappointed!

H8UtSo-Q5gw_tEO1q-L5xA.text: This is not the Delmonicos restaurant of NY. This is an Emeril Lagasse steakhouse. There is no decoration to speak of. Just a large open room with many tables and many people chatting and laughing. We ordered the bone-in ribeye and it was prepared to perfection, but a tad bit too salty for my friend's taste. I loved mine, but you need to be a full-on caveman to eat the whole damn thing. We had the creamed spinach which was coarse and tough to chew and the au gratin potatoes were really good. The sommelier was great and recommended a very nice blend. We were so stuffed, we chose not to have dessert, but they looked quite good. This is a very nice, fancy steakhouse, but CUT still gets my vote for the best one around.

3PjT8n8rpkwLRuObXLmm3w.text: We went in with high hopes after a friend recommended Delmonico but we left just a bit disappointed.  The ambiance was really nice and we were given a great table without a reservation but the food left a little to be desired.    My friend and I both started with lobster bisque, which was good but a little thin.  We noticed right away too that she had 2 tiny little pieces of lobster in hers, but I had almost an entire small claw.  I was happy until I realized it was tough and rubbery.  I actually had to use a knife and fork to cut it into bite sized pieces.  My husband ordered the wedge salad as a starter and it was 80% white/yellow core.  Not what you would expect in a place as pricey as this.  I ordered the fillet and it was cooked perfectly but it was not a great cut of meat.  Maybe I have high standards, but I think a $30+ fillet should be butter knife soft, but this one was kind of fibrous and hard to cut with a steak knife.  I didn't really care for the seasoning either, but that's a personal preference, not something I can count against the restaurant.  My husband's rib eye was really fatty but he loved his twice baked potato.  I had the corn gratin for my side and it was tasty but again, not my style.    Our server was efficient but pretty standoffish.  When we first sat down, we ordered a bottle of "Emerel's Blend" wine and he nicely suggested that we might want to try something else, but other than that, his interaction with us was a bit cold.    Maybe it was an off night, but I really expected more from a $400+ dinner.

VGqJMCXEHs3C2Jp7x9ISeQ.text: I've watched Emeril on the FoodNetwork Channel for years.. I even used to tape his shows through my VCR (yes VHS tapes). I have heard of this place through a friend that told me that everytime his brother goes to Vegas he eats here. So, when I found out that it was Emeril's Restaurant, I was even more eager to try this place! Well, I finally had the chance to experience this restaurant, whose owner is one of the most enthusiastic and giddy chef's around!   I had made reservations a couple hours prior and when we got there we were seated within seconds. Place was pretty occupied with plenty of men dressed in suits, a few couples and  loud crowds that had their drunken voices echoing throughout the restaurant. All the staff members were well postured with every movement from pouring drinks to picking up finished plates off the table. The place is contemporary, a minimalist dream with large and very comfortable dining chairs.  The order:  Vine-Ripened Tomato Salad: Tomatoes were juicy, plump and tasted so fresh. The tomatoes combined with the red onion, fresh mozzarella, extra virgin olive oil and balsamic vinegar = 4.5/5 stars  Lobster Bisque: Wow! I've had this dish a couple other times at other fancy restaurants and this one just blew those away! The flavor of the soup was smooth and had just the right amount of lobster flavor, not rich at all. Came with a few pieces of lobster.. what a tease!   Potato Gratin: came in a mini pan with the whole top completely lightly crusted brown. I grabbed my fork, broke into the soft crust and scooped up bite with a little bit of everything on it (crust,  potato and cheese). One of the better potato side dishes I've ever had!  Creamed Corn Gratinee: also came in a mini pan with a crumble/breaded top layer. The breading went well with the corn but overall it was just good.  Bone In Rib Steak: Server asked me if I wanted Emeril's Essence and slice of butter placed on my steak. I told him that I wanted it the way it should be served.. Shortly, the steak was finally served with a thin slice of butter with the evident Emeril Magic Dust "BAM!" sprinkled over  the meat. It was a healthy portion and did look Fantasteak! Not the softest steaks I've had but had a Nice Chew, not the juiciest but was far from dry, overall had a very well rounded quality to it. No Complaints!   Emeril's Banana Cream Pie: Came Tall with layers whip cream, generous amount of banana slices, banana cream and thin crust. There was also chocolate sprinkled/shavings  on top and caramel spread on the bottom. A great way to finish a fine dinner!   *Also had a glass of some French Honey Wine to compliment the pie, it was on the sweeter side but worth trying.  Being A FAN of Emeril For Years, Had High Expectations.. The Place Delivered but Not with Flying Colors..

nTm9JjcTVDl25BPfHGmy1Q.text: Steak was very good, sides were ok, and our waiter was helpful but didn't look to be overly excited about working.

ICnIa2QhiQrGo2HVATQZDQ.text: This is what every restaurant aspires to be....perfect Everything is perfect each and every-time. I have been going for what? ten years maybe? Their steaks are always cooked to what exactly you ask for. I LOVE THIS PLACE!

XwnN7pgWitExf-AxFZhWjA.text: Service - Exceptional 5 stars  Classic high end steak house service, Head waiter assisted by 2 servers for your table.  Fast drinks, table clean-up, staff comes back often to make sure you are OK.  Soups and Apps  5 stars - Our party enjoyed the steak tar-tare and our lobster bisques.  Very good Quality.  Steaks - OK 3 Stars.  The only reason I rated three starts for the review.  If you are a patron of New York steakhouses such as Peter Lugers or S and W,  or excellent national steakhouses such as Shula's, like myself, you may not enjoy the steak cuts.  My New York Strip was fairly tough, and required some heavy cutting considering the $50 price.  If you can't cut a $50med. rare steak with a serrated butter knife, I don't want to eat it.  It probably has some good marbling as it was juicy and moist, but it had some tough fibers that were definitely not meat or bands of marbling.  This may be expected in a ribeye where tendonous material often lines the outer rim of the steak.  Overall, a great dining experience with great service, but 3 stars because of meat cuts.

nHxffUbCiVF_FbBUEaQ86Q.text: We had a great meal last night because service was first class. I wouldn't order the bone in ribeye I didn't think it had a good flavor. Steak tartare was delicious and the cream of corn.

ZqfrSWkYt-5riJ-3rbE_0A.text: This is the steak house that delivers. Food was prepared to a T and the service was outstanding . Really great time at dinner   There were 4 of us and everyone seemed to have picked the right meal. Really impressive    And did I mention the service??? The name carries itself from new Orleans and this place really carries on the tradition   And they even have the cane root beer from Abita Springs

KqkLLoD_1omowURLNafEwA.text: Minimalist decor, maximalist flavor!  the dry-aged ribeye steak was a marvel of cut and cure, and flawlessly prepared with a lump of butter oozing over the edges (as if the marbled steak didn't have enough cholesterol to make me reach for a double hit of pravastatin!) I generally order beef cooked medium-well which tends to dry out the meat; however the chefs here knew what they were doing and delivered the most fork tender medium well i have ever eaten!  The maitre'd oversaw the dining sequence and operation with panache, though the grim-faced waiters could have used a few lessons on how to develop an engaging personality.  The prices were reasonable for Vegas top flight restaurants.

9yeKn5X3TGsz9bPElVZ2nA.text: "Everything taste good except for the steak and foie gas~ seriously, not even outback quality. Lobster bisque and pecan pie saved the day.. Don't come if u want decent steak. Like Gordon's steakhouse, this place is overrated~~~" I am giving 3 starts just because of the amazing lobster bisque  and the surprisingly good pecan pie. Also, the service is too good to deserve a two star. Me and my friend paid 80d/person to eat here and we didn't get the expected experience. I know we all expected vegas to be overpriced but I would rather pay for some other restaurant that would worth it.

DkD4_8E11QAf07BCRUS5wA.text: Had dinner at Delmonico a few days ago and a few things surprised me. I felt like I was sitting in a ball room rather than a restaurant and although we ordered a bottle of white wine and a bottle of red wine, both bottles were opened in front of us without offering us to taste before pouring the glasses.  Lobster Bisque was amazing.   Actual dinners were ok.

jlSEJ406F3D2dVB97kTU9w.text: I was very pleased with this restaurant.    We were celebrating an anniversary and both maitre D and wait staff greeted us with "Happy Anniversary". The restaurant itself was lovely, comfortable, and busy, but not noisy. We certainly had privacy at our table.  The staff was helpful and considerate. The food was excellent and plentiful. Lots of variety and the staff was respectful of allergies/dietary restrictions. It was pricey, but we spent far less than we anticipated.  My only regret is that we didn't have enough room for one of their fabulous desserts.  I would not hesitate to dine there again.

2WLCuFeSrZRPbs5SwjMIiQ.text: A trip to Las Vegas just isn't a trip to Vegas without a stop at Delmonico. So I think I've been to Delmonico six or seven times and the operative word is consistency. Always great service, always great food and just overall my favorite steakhouse.  So what isn't to like about Emeril's house of meat?  A very well stocked bar, a nice wine list and perfectly cooked steaks.  I started with the lettuce wedges with fresh blue cheese and got the rib eye. I don't know how they do it but the steaks always have this crispy, char on the outside but have a good juicy center with lots of flavor.  We shared the grits, corn and mushrooms as sides and they were tasty good.  Like I said, this is a special occasion place and Delmonico has yet to disappoint.   Thanks Emeril for always making my trip to Vegas!

eM4hAkgeEOpAwps1Ieg0Cg.text: Typical day in Vegas couldn't decide where to eat (too many choices). Decided to go to Delmonico Steakhouse in the Venetian. Service was pretty prompt as usual with this place. We ordered the Caesar Salad that was prepared table side, I believe I ordered a  bone in rib-eye and my girlfriend ordered the salmon. All of the food was prepared well and service was perfection. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to my friends and family.

ubX6iG-vBMyYxexr4ZrE3g.text: Almost done catching up with my reviews. Here is my last one for tonight. After going to Carnevino the night before, Delmonicos kind of took the back seat for me. However, we were with a big group and everyone else loved the food. Bone in rib eye, tenderloin medalions, sirloin, to lamb we had everything on the table. Absolutely no complaints about the food.   However, we were seated kind of in the corner round table which was fine but some of us were facing a glass enclosed small room that had stacks of chairs. What is that room? Was it seriously storage space we were starring at? I didn't expect to see a stack of black chairs in a glass case room throughout my whole dinner from a high end restaurant.   Coming from a delicous dessert finish with Afrogato the night before, I asked the waitress if it could be made. She said sure it could. I was very excited only to realize when the bill came that she charged $8 for a shot of Espresso and $10 for scoop of ice cream. WOW.

WdBFbFRYx8qwyJetHUPbdw.text: I've been to Delmonico a couple times, and it has been good both times.  Everything was pretty tasty, but I can't say there was anything in particular that wowed me. Actually, I take that back... there is a banana dessert that is absolutely spectacular. But that's not really enough to make me excited about returning here. The service is consistently very good. I think I'm just not a fan of the decor and ambiance here. It's great for a business lunch, but I would never choose Delmonico for a romantic dinner or night out with friends. The interior is just really boring.

R5XfXA6zNkwHK5SnQrL-Zg.text: My boyfriend and I dined at Delmonico's on a trip to Vegas  in July 2013 - for dinner on the 4th of July.  The restaurant we had originally planned to go to that night was completely booked, so based on the great Yelp rating we chose Delmonico's instead.    Prior to our trip, we were so excited to try this place out.  Our reservations were at 8pm and we showed up a few minutes early, expecting the place to be packed.  I should mention that the location is very odd and not easy to find.  However, once we found it we started wondering if we were  in the right place...  Both of us have dined in nice steakhouses many times and expected that familiar 5 star experience.  From the second we walked in the door it was clear that Delmonico's was not that kind of place.  The entrance was very dark - no one was at the hostess stand and the bar/lounge area was completely empty.  The restaurant looked closed.   Then, the hostess showed up with another employee - they finished their casual, not work related, conversation before greeting us.  They looked up our reservation and sat us right away so I was ready to let go of my first impression and enjoy a great meal.  Unfortunately, that was just the start.    The hostess led us into a mostly empty room with very dim lighting.  We thought it was weird but went along with it.  As we sat down, we realized that the only other table in the room was a large party with serval children - who were playing games and watching movies on their iPads! We were shocked that this behavior was allowed in such a place.  We looked into the other dining room which was mostly full and seemed very lively, full of adults.  When our waiter came over we asked to move to that room (pointing out the distractions at the other table), which they accommodated.  Finally in the environment we were hoping for, we felt relieved as our new waiter handed us a wine list.  The waiter brought the wine and as he poured the glasses, he spilled an entire glass in front of me, on the table.  Did he find us a new table? Did he bring a new (full) bottle of wine? No. Instead he picked the glass up and continued pouring and brought a white napkin to place in front of me to cover the wine stained/wet area.  At this point, we considered leaving but it was past 8:30 and we wanted to try the steak, so we stayed.  We ordered the table side Caesar salad and the chateaubriand to split.  The salad was the highlight of the meal - if you go here, make sure to order it.  The steak was ok, slightly undercooked and we have definitely had better.  After the meal, we decided to skip desert here and go upstairs to Otto instead.  I did use the restroom during the meal.  This was another disappointment.  The restrooms are located down a long hallway, which was also where they stored the extra chairs (stacks of them).  You felt like you were in an area of the restaurant that shouldn't be customer facing - cluttered, scuffs all over the walls and baseboards.   Overall, the experience at Delmonico's was anything but 5 star.  With so many wonderful restaurants in vegas at this price point, there is no reason to choose Delmonico's.

uJqihdFls-Rmmu02Er2RLw.text: Good food, but not what I expected from an Emeril restaurant.  I've been to his restaurants in Miami and New Orleans, and those were both 5-star experiences; however, the food at Delmonico was not as good as my previous experiences.  It was good, just not 5-star good.  I had the rib-eye, which was perfectly cooked.  But the grits left A LOT to be desired, which was disappointing considering that grits is a staple of southern cooking.  The service was good, although the main server seemed a bit distracted at times.  At that price point, my experience is that servers are almost falling all over you.  With all of the wonderful choices of restaurants in Vegas, I think I'll try somewhere different next time.

VcJ7QDmIh026uREBDrIp_A.text: Perfect service every time! Everything is good and some things great! We were a party of 3 and two ordered ribeyes and I ordered bone in filet. We all ordered the spinach salad. All items are Ordered alacarte but all of the side items are plenty to split 2/3 ways easily. This time we got the corn it is creamy with a tiny kick of chili peppers and a crunch on top of Panko crumbs. The corn is absolutely delicious! The asparagus is just plain steamed asparagus but it is good too. I have had the spinach, the potatoes, the mushrooms, and the grits in the past, all great but this corn was soooo very good. The popovers are served just after drink orders but they are not replenished or served in a basket. Your back up server will just make one round so they are served fresh and warm. If you want more you will have to ask.  This time we were not served a complimentary mini appetizer as we had always been served in the past years. We did see other tables served this though. Perhaps because we delayed our ordering due to waiting on drinks and our conversation time.  Dessert was the pecan pie. This pecan pie is not the icky sweet oozy gooey pie that I am used to. This one is more tart like, not so sweet or gooey st all. The crust is more cookie like. It was good but I would probably not get this again.  We will stick to the delicious duck egg brulee or the banana cream pie next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pecan Pie
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pop overs

aCob4vPeQnyL9umAufsSng.text: Located at the Venetian Hotel and a Emeril Lagasse establishment. I made reservations for four persons BC our vendor wanted to treat us to dinner.  We started off with drinks at the beautiful bar and made our way to the plush dinning area. I started off with the gumbo which was superb. For dinner what better choice then the dry aged in house ribeye?  For sides we enjoyed garlic mushrooms, asparagus, NOLA creamed spinach and for dessert I savored the a entire Emeril's banana cream pie slice (it was huge and delish). My co worker from Phoenix enjoyed the bone in filet and he ended his meal with  key lime pie which he also raved about.   This was definitely a meal that was memorable and thank you to the entire staff at Delmonico Steakhouse. It's great knowing I can get a solid NOLA influenced meal with having to go to NOLA!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana cream pie
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. root beer float
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. rack of lamb &amp; Ahi tuna

m5YdFg2nkEr2V8PLfdZ0oQ.text: I can't complaint anything: the steak is delicious, service is very good,  the waiters are very friendly and helpful, the bread is the best I tasted in steakhouses. When we want to box the leftovers, the takeout package is very well prepaired. This steakhouse will be on our must have list in Vegas !

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

heZd0W3HuPJxZBrCYD3wDw.text: Lousy steak.   The service was great - Todd, Jennifer, and Nicole were very attentive and personable. Our biggest complaint was the food. The heirloom tomato salad was good which isn't saying much, but the steak was underwhelming.  The rack of lamb was probably the best dish we ordered, despite being a steakhouse.   We ordered two bone in rib eyes, a bone in New York strip, and a rack of lamb. The steaks were under seasoned and lacked that beefy flavor you'd expect from a steak.  We were told that the steaks were wet aged then dry aged, but couldn't taste any of that nuttiness that comes from dry aging. The meat was tender, but didn't have much else going for it.   We've eaten a handful of Emeril Lagasse's restaurants before, but this one really missed the mark.

fhSYExTIGS9vvzRYWeBjWQ.text: Great place. The service was spectacular. My filet mignon was delicious. My daughter was really happy with her meal. She also had filet mignon. We had the banana cream pie cake and a German chocolate cake and it was so good. The Cabernet was perfect. We were here to celebrate a special occasion and we will definitely return. We didn't plan to come here initially but we were treated bad at a neighbor restaurant, Wolfgang Puck Cut. We left that place and came to Delmonico and we were taken care of. The service is really the best we have ever had.

HGegJEZMSilsyt7RNcxwCw.text: We had a great experience!  Super friendly and attentive servers.  We had the Filet and Ribeye, cooked to perfection.  If you're looking for a great steak, you can't go wrong here.

JZbyR32y9MqGp8E6XTCffg.text: Service was excellent. I had the bbq salmon and my boyfriend had the filet and both were delicious!

VC9G1487LgCSTlQoC2DDGg.text: Had a great time here.  The private room in the back overlooking the kitchen was a great touch. The service was amazing. The bone in ribeye was fantastic. Cooked perfectly and was tender and flavorful. A scoop of melting butter sat on top of the ribeye. Everything was great. I loved the twice baked potato. It was tremendous. The portion was huge and had an amazing taste. Highly recommend it. Great wine list. Great variety. The lower priced wines were good and the more expensive wines were vast and impressive. The sommelier was so helpful and knowledgeable. We had a great discussion and were able to identify the best wine for me, for this meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twice Baked Potato
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone - In Ribeye Steak

0Qc1THNHSapDL7cv-ZzW5g.text: What can I say.. Wowzers! Probably one of the best steak houses I've been too. Service was absolutely flawless and dinner was excellent . Ordered seafood tower, wedge, wagyu filet, chateaubriand, bacon grits and sauteed  mushrooms Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome fresh seafood tower, @ Delmonicos Las Vegas
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet w shaved truffles at Delmonicos, Las Vegas

uGbiUywpqmS0bPBQAe0sBA.text: My absolute favorite place to eat in Vegas. My husband and I shared the bone in rib eye, which is my favorite steak. The side dishes, especially the potato gratin are amazing.  Their banana cream pie is also a favorite of mine, but this last time we went it wasn't up to par. Excellent service!

u-xJIBf0B6ZJP9zj9ozI4Q.text: First off the service here is top notch, very welcoming and friendly. Servers here make you feel like they genuinely care about if you're enjoying your meal.   Ambiance is very classy and  slightly dim which is perfect.  Dress to impress!  Appetizer  BBQ Shrimp - these were super tasty with Cajun spices and the shrimp sit it a nice broth. Shrimps were cooked perfectly.  Meals: Filet Mignon-cooked and seasoned perfectly juicy and full of flavor.  Good crust on the outside.   Rack of Lamb- very disappointing,  I've ordered lamb at other top restaurants with no problems but this one has way too much fat the first 3 pieces I cut were 85% fat.  I was a little bummed and I hardly ever mention dissatisfaction or send a plate back but my gf urged me since we are paying top $$ for our meals.   Without hesitation after mentioning how the lamb was not up to par the manager. immediately came out inspected the lamb and agreed it was more fatty then usual and allowed me to swap out my lamb with a bone in NY Strip.  The strip was cooked beautifully! Good crust on the outside and perfect medium rare on inside not to mention flavor was om point.  Sides: (here's where I knock down a star) Creamed spinach- was good but not great it lacked a little bit of flavor and a bit bland.   Au Gratin- see above with creamed spinach.  It lacked that wow factor and was a little runny.   Despite the sub par sides the filet and NY strip were both excellent and the impeccable service makes me give 4 stars.   Cheers   PS cocktails were good a little on the strong side which I like but not too strong to make you cringe,  good flavor.

4bQrVUiRZ642odcKCS0OhQ.text: If you're looking for craptastic service and mediocre food at caviar prices, check out the Delmonico inside the Venetian!  It started with the cocktail waitress who was so sassy it became bitchy, snipping short responses when our client asked a question. Then came our dinner server who was borderline rude. "Are your seafood options listed here the only meat-free options you have? Most of them have sausage or some sort of meat in them," I inquired. "Yep," was all he said before moving on... didn't even offer to remove an ingredient or help me out in any way.  The food was pretty tasteless. An heirloom tomato salad had the most bang for the appetizer buck, but at $18 for four slices of tomato and a splooge of burrata, I could concoct a very similar version from my local farmer's market for a fraction of the price. And it's not that price is that huge of a factor here; if you're going to Delmonico you are aware of the beefy tab that will come at the end of your meal... but when the service spits you aside, it's not worth it.  If you're wondering why two stars and not one - the second star is for the wine list, which shone brighter than the boring white walls inside this sub-standard steak joint.

F2hzf4Asc_AMg88-0OJYSQ.text: We had dinner reservations to celebrate a special event. We started off with a few drinks.  Fried Soft-Shell Crab: An appetizer with poached egg, frisee salad and lemon truffle vinaigrette. Lightly breaded and fried. Not greasy, not fatty and the shell was definitely soft. The citrusy salad compliments the dish. One of the best soft-shell crab versions I've had. We got 2 orders of these - they were that good. 5/5  Filet Mignon: Since I'm not a fan of animal fat, this is what I normally get. Some people may find it boring but I like my steak simple and lean. Very tender and cooked to a perfect medium-rare. This piece of meat didn't photograph very well since it looks so dark from all the pepper but it tasted good. 4/5  Chateaubriand: The second most tender and lean cut of meat. We got mashed potatoes and asparagus on the side. 4/5  Bone-In Ribeye: Dry-aged prime with butter on top. Superb! 4/5  Foie Gras: This was a side item. Perfectly seared and mildly sweet. You don't really need to do much to make foie gras taste good. KISS (keep it simple, stupid!) 4.5/5  Mushrooms with Garlic: This side was really good. I love mushrooms and garlic. The mushrooms did not have just a hint of garlic. They were deliciously garlicky. 5/5  Grits: This has bacon and good melted cheese which makes this more interesting than it should be. I wouldn't normally eat grits but this was good. 4/5  Creme Brulee: I've been feeling tired of this dessert. I didn't find joy in eating this. Plain, ordinary and too safe. 2/5  Delmonico Coquetel: Gin, sparkling dessert wine, five spice-infused simple syrup, ruby red grapefruit and lime juices. Their signature cocktail...but why? Our server was right, I should've not wasted my time on this. It was too sweet and it just didn't taste right. I took a few sips and our server knew it was time for a different drink. 2/5  A Tale of Two Cities: Cherry vodka, elderflower liqueur, black cherry juice and citrus juices. This was deliciously amazing if you like cherry. 5/5  Another drink we had was a martini with bleu cheese-stuffed olives. Since I'm not a fan of martini, olives or bleu cheese - it would not be fair for me to rate this. We got a free chocolate gelato and it was good. Service was good. Our server gave us recommendations and what to stay away from. Honesty is always appreciated.

I-4d8XKcH2Cq-6i8MSx8SA.text: If you are a bourbon fan, you will think you have hit the jackpot of all bourbon collections.  Even Rip Van Winkle bourbon is available for the drinking.    Top notch steak house with incredible care taken in the preparation and display of the dishes.  The chateaubriand is outstanding and the sides were all very amazing including the creamed corn and perfectly cooked asparagus.  Don't forget to try the banana cream pie (it's quite large so you may want to split it)!  Service was also top notch.  A team of servers was always available to ensure you could ask questions and ensure you were satisfied with your meal.    This place is good for just about any occasion.  They also do tastings if arranged ahead of time of off-menu items such as stuffed quail or other dishes. Highly recommended....you won't be disappointed.
