thfv2PiDUNcbBqfp5g5Qbg.text: The food was absolutely amazing! Went here for my brother's 21st birthday and the service is top tier bar none. My family and I are kinda snobby so our standards are pretty high. Our server and the busser were phenomenally attentive and made sure we were satisfied every step of the way.  One complaint (and it almost made us not want to keep our reservation): The hostess "Claudette" was very abrupt and discourteous to my mother who has a little bit of hearing loss. She seemed to get frustrated with her and walked away from us.

AyTXvws4xt5sS27sbNarwg.text: Really enjoyed our dinner last night. We enjoyed a delicious meat platter special starter then moved onto wilted spinach salad for the wife and tomato soup for me. Both outstanding. For the entree my wife had the bone in filet which was the best steak she has ever had. It was perfectly prepared and melt in your mouth tender.  We shared a creamed corn side dish that we both loved. My steak was a little on the tough side but the wait staff and manager were very attentive and took care of the issue.  Great food, attentive staff and a great place for dinner

2ZroQOookOSDSqo8-Vs7dQ.text: Lissa G and I stopped in for lunch.  We've been meaning to go to Delmonico's for years since we are often in Las Vegas and always stay at the Palazzo.  We ate at the bar and watched some of the New Year's Eve college football game.  I think the volume was on the TV but we really couldn't hear it, hopefully other times they just have some music playing.  I was kind of mixed on the food. The French Onion Soup is a must try! The broth was so deep and rich that you could taste the hours of preparation and simmering. The Tomato and Burrata dish was fine, as was the Ribeye Steak we ordered. Again, not bad, just ok when I compare them to their competitors in the hotel, like Carnavino or Bouchon where we often go for lunch.  We will have to try dinner next time but if you are going don't miss the onion soup!

vyaZbtXU6GxrCV96CLAEDw.text: All the years we've been staying at the Palazzo, and we finally make it to Delmonico! Sort of. For our personal experience, maybe 3.5 stars, but I'd go back, as I think some things were specific to our visit and I think the restaurant can do better.   Jim G. and I stopped in at the bar for a spot of lunch. The bartender was often friendly, but sometimes seemed a bit confused or overwhelmed.  Turned out, he was new. Some of that is forgivable, but it wasn't busy at the bar, so some of it suggests that he's maybe not the best bartender in general.  Perhaps he was having an off day.    The cocktails were interesting and well-crafted but, in some cases (like the Bronte Sisters), the focus seemed so much on presentation that the actual drink part of the drink was missing. The full copper mug of crushed ice left me with a tiny, tiny drink for $16. The wine list is incredibly extensive and led me to a surprising error.  The way it's printed, it sometimes leads the eye to the wrong price, as the name of the wine and the price don't visually seem to be on the same line.  The wine we ordered was great, as I knew it would be, but it was not at the great price I thought it was. Nice surprise for us on the bill when it was 2.5x more! Technically, not their fault, but it feels like it wasn't an accident on their part. It was lunch; not like I already had been drinking!  Onion soup was awesome! Get some, for real! Very dark roux, super flavorful cheese. We shared a steak which was not quite the size our bartender told us it would be (ounces aren't on the menu) but was prepared nicely. The steaks (all except Wagyu) are prepared cajun style, so expect a different flavor profile than your traditional steak.   Good food, but the bar needs more energy (maybe a bit of music?) and a bit of tweaking with the bartender. Maybe an evening trip will do the place more justice.

s5g97Tg5jqFtKP6xfiZ0sQ.text: Excellent and very attentive wait staff. The food was nicely executed, but I just was not impressed with my ribeye steak. I ordered it medium rare and found it to be on the dry side. It was also not that hot, same goes for my baked potato. My main entree could have been  served hotter, but I guess since we were in a large group, our food just ended up that way.   I really liked the spinach & frisee salad, tuna & salmon tartare, and the creme brulee was very good. The raspberry sorbet was bland and didn't taste that flavorful.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye was DRY
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach frisée salad
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna and salmon tartare

f8dozFXtQRtM3pIjw2tNqQ.text: What better way to celebrate a big 3-0 than with a mean piece of steak! It was my good friend's birthday and we had two tables reserved for our big group. I must say, service was stellar. Staff was knowledgeable with their menu and very patient with us when placing our orders in as we were all quite indecisive and had so many questions.     Starting off with some bread and aperitif, I chose a glass of Blue label Chimay as my poison. Ahhhh...a wonderful prelude to an evening of indulgence. For appetizers, I had their OYSTER ROCKEFELLER. This baked aphrodisiac was not as cheesy as I hoped it would be but they were fresh and of good quality. I can't complain.   Next came the main show, BONE-IN RIBEYE which my man and I split. Split plating was beautifully done with the perfect portion for each of us. No fee for split plate, thank you. I like my meat cooked medium and it came as pink as I expected it to be. A dollop of butter topped off my steak but that for me was unnecessary. It had quite a chew to it which was unlikely coming from Chef Emeril Lagasse's kitchen. Did it taste bad? No, not at all. I just think that being in Vegas where you are surrounded by a plethora of dining options of the same caliber, you need to live up to your name. Sadly, I wasn't as impressed by this dish compared to other fellow Yelpers.   My side of choice was the CREAMED SPINACH. Now we're talking! It tasted sensational with that silky feel of butter and cream. Finally, Chef Emeril's True colors are coming out. And on a sweet note, we ended the evening with EMERIL'S BANANA CREAM PIE. Can I say, WOW!? I will have to say this was the best banana cream pie I've had to date. Hats off to you, Chef! This my friends, earned Delmonico Steakhouse the 4 stars I'm giving them.   Would I come back? Sure! I'll skip the steak and try his southern specialties instead. But more importantly, I shall not forget EMERIL'S BANANA CREAM PIE. It's to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters Rockefeller
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in rib eye (split plate)

R1snlMnx0Yu-eymiT0nvEA.text: I could describe many above average facets of the meal I had at Delmonico, but the only one that really matters is that I walked out of this restaurant saying that this was the best steak I have ever had.  The Kansas City cut (bone-in NY Strip) here is just so unbelievably perfect.  It is seared on the outside with a beautiful medium rare on the inside.  The texture is perfect.  The juiciness of the meat is perfect.  The salty flavor addition from the bone is perfect.  And what really made it for me was the seasoning on the steak itself.  Every bite had a little peppery bite that was the perfect combination of dancing around the edges of your tongue without being overbearing.  Yes.  A confluence of the perfection of all the individual elements that matter yields the distinction of Best Steak I Have Ever Had.

t5k7b3uoNR7csY509C3qYA.text: Five star food. The service? Not so much.   While in Vegas, my boyfriend and I decided it was time to splurge a bit and eat some tasty, tasty cow. We were seeing Blue Man Group that night, and this place was located right next to the theatre. And it's an Emeril restaurant. Awesome, right?  We were seated promptly for our 830 reservation. I sat down and the guy put my napkin on my lap and stepped on my foot in the process. No big deal; I'm a klutz too. Shortly thereafter, a waiter appeared, informed us that we'd have three servers that night. He then asked us if we'd like bottled or tap water, and then asked if we wanted a wine list. We answered and he went off to take care of it. Not 30 seconds later someone else (one of our other servers, I assume) showed up and gave us the exact same spiel. We answered the same way.   Soon after, the first guy appeared with the wine list, which was literally 25 pages long. Ok, I both love me some wine and understand that this is a nice place, but a wine list that long is overwhelming. Yes, they had a page with Kevin's (the sommelier, I assume) picks, but still.   20 minutes after we received the wine list, our server finally showed up to take our wine and food orders. We decided to split a ribeye and some potato gratin. I also got the gumbo, which was served promptly along with our wine.   As I said before, everything was delicious. The wine was great, the gumbo was extremely flavorful, the ribeye was tender and wonderful, and I also loved the potato gratin. However, when we got our food, I asked the server if he could give us the check a little early so we wouldn't have to rush to make our show (we were cutting it close, especially with the time it took for the server to come take our order). He insisted we'd have plenty of time and refused to give us the check. This is because he wanted to offer us dessert after our meal. Fine. Whatever. Still annoying.   I'm hoping that this was just an off night, because it seems that most of the reviews here are very complimentary of the service. I'd be willing to give this place another shot, because the food was really that good (and actually kind of reasonably priced for what you get if you split a steak like we did).   So, we'll see...

eEIjRsMK34SdDUb2NtaO_Q.text: Stayed at the Venetian and they were advertising how good this restaurant was, so we decided to try it. I was a bit unsure...because the front of the restaurant looked empty (good places are always full!). So we still made reservations and when we arrived we discovered that the actual restaurant portion of the steak house was in a different area and it was a full night!. Our waiter recommended the bone in rib eye which is aged and is their signature plate, and the mashed potatoes. This steak was the best!!! I could not believe how good it was. It was seared and just so good. One order of mashed potatoes is really big so our waiter recommended we shared. We did not even finish that 1 order of tasty mashed potatoes. The service was attentive, and since I love martinis they made me a peach martini.

A5PsAqQYUR03DpV-30wKAA.text: Its a fancy steakhouse in Vegas.  Sure it was great, the food was good the service was superb and the wine selection was almost too much to deal with, but its expensive.  hey its a fancy steakhouse in Vegas.  So it lives up to its name.  If you are looking for a great night out for steak this is as good a selection as any.  Just be prepared to pay about $100-$150/person if you are going to be on wine.

GRQ0MyrYQOyoHmqbqz0k3g.text: I came here with HIGH expectations, and Delmonico's did not disappoint.   Each steak ran between $45-55 a la carte, which isn't that extraordinary considering it was a Saturday night in Las Vegas.   I had the bone-in rib eye, which was HUGE. Sadly, I couldn't finish it, which is pretty extraordinary for me. We all ordered several sides (potato gratin, asparagus, baked potatoes, etc), each of which cost $9.   Aside from the monstrously huge (and tasty!) portions, I think the most memorable feature of Delmonico's was the ambiance and atmosphere. The staff is incredibly helpful, and ensure an enjoyable experience overall.   Don't miss out!

QimE20If9mBlowb8dxnAjw.text: It takes a lot for me to give 5 Yelp stars to a restaurant. I'm the type of Yelper that just loves to find things to hate about the restaurants I dine in. I love being critical, what can I say. But, as much as it pains me to say this, I didn't find one thing I hated about Delmonico Steakhouse. (ARGH!!)  The lobster bisque. Excellent. Best lobster bisque I've ever had in my life. Hands down. Add a little bit of cracked pepper on top and you have a wonderful tasting starter complete with its generous portion of lobster meat. I should've asked for a second order of it.  My ribeye was perfectly cooked and flavorful. Ribeye is usually a cut of meat with a good amount of fat on it. My ribeye had the perfect balance of meat and fat. Fat means flavor, people! I was glad I didn't have to cut off too much of it from my meat. We ordered a side of roasted fingerling potatoes (w/ whole garlic and fresh herbs) and buttered fresh broccoli. These sides complimented my ribeye very well, but I'm being a little biased here because broccoli and fingerling potatoes are my favorite veggies (#1 and #2, respectively). I couldn't finish the massive 16 oz. piece of meat and the sides, so I took them all to go. I wound up eating the rest of it for breakfast the next morning. Can you say best breakfast ever? Yes.  Apart from a patron at the restaurant that was loud and sounded like Mr. Krabs from Spongebob Squarepants, my dining experience here was top notch! I couldn't ask for more from the food, service, and ambiance. You're welcome, Delmonico Steakhouse...

VjOQz8cQdLHzU6l0dQ6HCQ.text: Impressive table side carved steak. Probably the best dessert I've had thus far....The Banana cream pie

X_tj_myRsqIGBYBufnNLqg.text: I believe its a little overhyped, the place isn't as wonderful as I was told.  The service was definitely on par, however the quality of the food leaves something to be desired.    The name carries weight due to its reputation in other cities however when I tried it here, it didn't live up to its own reputation.    The chicken and salmon were decent at best, a friend had the steak which was pretty good but the side dishes failed.    overall not bad, but your money could be spent in better locations on the strip

kIv-GAbZ3bxVPpjzi9vqAA.text: The food in this restaurant was excellent.  We went with a large group.  They did not rush us.

KM19pcdy6t9c_3EOfycB5w.text: The decor is plain but that's not why you come here. You go to Delmonico for the great steaks, sides and yummy desserts. This place is almost always five stars for me but this last visit I made then mistake and deviated from my normal order of filet mignon and did the surf and turf special instead. The lobster was good (not sure if I would say amazing since it was slathered in bearnaise sauce) but the steak was only so-so; not up to normal Delmonico quality. Covering it in the amazing house steak sauce did help but I wouldn't recommend ordering the surf and turf.

xCpq6ZiyO5JfDa1HWRdOjA.text: Came out for our anniversary, the steaks were wonderful HUGE cuts if you want to spend money on this Restaurant, then this will be the place to do so. The aged steaks which i ordered medium came out as expected. Better come VERY hungry due to the sizes of the servings!

fOaAK9xdO6y2qAU56D3sVw.text: While staying at the Palazzo in Vegas during the CES & AEE convention's I had a great dinner at Delmonico's with a few new friends on a Friday night. We did not make a reservation for the 4 of us, but the maitre' d Marty put a table together for us in about a 5 min wait. The place was packed! I guess it's the perk of being with "high rollers" aka "corporate cocks". No, but seriously we had unbelievable service thanks to Marty's personal touch & our beautiful hostess Corrine.  Our C.C's did the pleasure of doing the ordering for us ladies. I must give my C.C's credit because these 2 men had great taste! We started with a very nice bottle of Pinot Noir, Emeril's New Orleans Barbecue Shrimp, Truffle Parmesan Potato Chips, Lobster Bisque, a really good salad that was not on the menu per the request of my C.C friend Richard. The lobster bisque was interesting, the chef bakes the lobster into a tasty biscuit that you can dip or crumble into the creamy bisque.  We also had Butternut Squash Ravioli both dishes brought me back to Delmonico's for 2nd's on Sunday night. Again, I was lucky enough to have Corrine as my hostess the 2nd time around. Thanks Corrine : ) Our main course we had a very fine bottle of Cabernet not on the wine list but one of our Maitre' d Marty's personal fav's! We each had the Bone In Ribeye Steak's they were huge!! Gigantor!!!  I ate maybe a 1/4 of it!!  To compliment our BIG juicy rib eyes we had Vegetables of the Day & New Orleans Creamed Spinach. D'lish! We had sooo much food I thought I was going to burst! All though we were all stuffed some how we managed to end our meal with some coffee & dessert's,  Emeril's Banana Cream Pie (my personal fav. FYI I love cream pies ; p) & Chocolate Peanut Butter Torte. So sinful..... but not as sinful as two women in vegas baby!!  What happens in Vegas stay's in Vegas!!! Let's just say our date's were not cheap and our bill was not small $$$$.

cYJjGasWb-lGBGQ8mOFCvQ.text: Located on Restaurant Row in the Venetian is Delmonico's Steakhouse. This place is nice, very nice. The lounge area was spacious, plentiful amount of seating, with a bar area. Not a bad place to hang out if there is a wait for your table. You are not able to see inside the restaurant from the lounge area.   We had a table of 13 and we were separated into 2 tables. The seats were very very comfortable. I believe they do accommodate large parties all in one table, but I guess for that time slot on that day, this was our only choice. Reservations are highly recommended here and book in advance if you have a large party.   Our waiter or host shall I call him was very informative about just about everything! He recommended what was the best things on the menu, where to party after dinner, what wines were great, along with how I should get my steak cooked! He was simply awesome.   I order the BONE IN RIB STEAK which is also originally what the server recommended. The price for a good steak does not come cheap, this one was worth all $52.00. Medium rare was perfect. The steak is huge it almost took up the whole entire plate, tender, moist, juicy, perfect temperature, minimal fat, butter came on top of the steak like a pancake, very easy to cut, bone was just this big straight across: ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  so it was very easy to get every last piece off the bone.   I strongly suggest you order the steak with a nice red wine. Your taste buds will be in heaven.   The sides are a bit deceiving if you look at the pictures of the sides. For some reason I was expecting a huge pot, but dont let the pictures fool you! The side order of sauteed mushrooms was very delicious. I put that to the side because I did not want to share with anyone. The truffle potato chips was very greasy, save your $10 and order another side instead.   The calamari was okay. Not worth the $14. Marinara sauce came on top of the calamari already, so if you did not eat it fast enough, it could get soggy real quickly.   THEY HAVE THE BEST WARM BREAD HERE EVER! TEST YOURSELF AND SEE IF YOU CAN RESIST JUST ONE!   I can finally say I ate at one of Emeril's restaurants! Seeing you on the Food Network making all those different mouth watering dishes is for real! Definitely a must try if you are a steak lover.

Xsl5tTuaUlgNMuBnefWEeQ.text: I ordered the halibut (as did my cousin) and it was dry. The entire dish had zero flavor until I added salt and pepper (I NEVER salt my food after cooking). The sides we had were good- wild mushrooms and creamed spinach. Our husbands steaks were good but nothing to write home about. Servers were attentive but they get a big zero for 1 reason- we told them our fish was dry in a very nice/hushed manor and they still charged us for it. Our bill was $1500 and they couldn't part with 2 $40 entrees. Wow! We won't be back. There's too much amazing food out there and much classier service.

gWlJTvhz4X660yGjh_AKTw.text: This was an excellent experience from the front desk to the last bite of dessert. The appetizers that we ordered from the nightly specials menu were creative and delicious. The steaks were perfectly cooked and excellent quality. I didn't love the seasonal onions but they were as described and just not cooked to my taste. The desserts were excellent, the creme brulee was perfect. I loved the list of espressos and enjoyed topping off my meal with one. The wine list had moderately priced items and the staff were extremely helpful without being fussy.  This was a great experience and I highly recommend it!

_aGkaA7F2wLdOCdZla704w.text: Located in the restaurant/shopping area between the Venetian and Palazzo, this is a great steak place.  Went with a group of friends and we all had 1 thing on our mind.  Steak.    We didn't order any alcohol since we were kind of recovering a bit from the night before.    For appetizers, I had the tuna and salmon tartare which was good.  Bunch of my friends had lobster bisque which was rich but very good as well.  The rolls came with a small amount of butter on them and would taste great in the bisque, I'm sure.  For steaks, everyone went with either the New York or Filet.  I had the filet topped with seared foie gras.  The combination of the two was excellent and very flavorful.  I sadly had to leave some foie gras left over because it was too much.  I tried the New York and that was great as well.    For sides we had the potatoes au gratin asparagus.  I didn't have any of the sides, but everyone seemed pretty pleased with them.  Unfortunately, no dessert really jumped out at me.  Everyone split the banana cream pie, but I passed on that since I'm not a fan of bananas.  Service was great.  It was pretty loud though, so I couldn't really hear 2 of my friends who were across the table.  Overall though, excellent meal.

Rkj1-DFdh_9mnSCnaRIYaw.text: Delmonico's is easily a 5-star restaurant, but not because there is a famous name (Emeril Lagasse) associated with the restaurant -- but because the food is simply exceptional. This is fine dining without the pretentiousness of stuffy, overpriced, mini-portion restaurants.   We happened to be staying at the Venetian Hotel & Casino and made reservations to Delmonico's, which is on the premises. There was about a 1-minute wait and we were quickly whisked away to a candlelit table. The restaurant itself is very simple yet elegant; nothing over the top, flashy or obnoxious. The lighting is perfect; not too dark and the wait staff is extremely attentive and prompt.  Delmonico's is known for their steak; the bone-in rib eye steak. This slab of meat is prime and comes with a nice price tag. If you're at Delmonico's -- ya might as well go for it, chump!  For starters, I had the Lobster Bisque Soup; thick, creamy and packed with flavor. I absolutely loved it! Best Lobster Bisque I have ever had. It came adorned with a polenta type cake in the middle. I am not sure if it was polenta or dried shrimp cake -  or even bread, but it didn't matter as it all happily made its way down my belly.   We also tried the crab meat cake; fresh chunks of crab atop a puff pastry and dressed with tomatoes, lima beans, asparagus and all sorts of good spring veggies. Amazing!   I decided to try the Rack of Lamb with the Twice Baked Potatoes. Jeff went with the Rib Eye Steak and Baked Potato. The Lamb was head-spinning! Topped with a rich sauce and truffles! Perfectly cooked and moist and tender and gaaaaaaaaaaaaahhhh! I can't rave enough. The steak was just as good -- even the fatty pieces were delicious.   The food, the service, the atmosphere, the attention to detail, the $25 corking fee -- all was worth the price. Definitely a place to experience while out in SIN CITY!

q7cYZhhgSWEuHJQ02Ib8zg.text: Dinner at Delmonico Steakhouse on 3/17/2013, to celebrate husbands birthday while visiting Las Vegas from Miami, Fl. The dinner experience was awful. Sent steak back, not cooked as requested. Waited 20 mins for waiter to bring steak back. When plate was returned steak was dry, burned and the items left on dinner plate where ice cold. Husband ate dinner alone while I waited for my $52 steak. An apology was never extended. Dinner was definitely not worth the $200 check. Very Disappointed! Will not recommend to friends or family! Pricey, Poor Quality Steak and Bad service!

tEte_4Y9yxdybHGTSrpjZw.text: D is for Delmonico's!  I love steak!  I love Rib Eye Steak the most so I order it everywhere.  This ranks as the 3rd best Rib Eye flavor wise I've had behind Fleming's and Joe's Stone Crab IMO.  I had the mushrooms for sides which were good but not fantastic!  The Banana Cream Pie was exceptional.  Very thick and rich!  When you visit, dress like a High Roller!  =)

AGWpwTWuFvvviVek43VANA.text: Quite delicious! I wouldn't say that this Steakhouse is creative or unique, but what I will say is that it's classic, delicious and savory. The decor is comfortable, quietly & minimally luxurious and the service was very good without being intruding. I was dining with my family (sister, mom, father and my husband Russ).   For an appetizer, I ordered the Lobster Bisque which was very good but not super memorable and for the entree, I ordered the Surf and Turf. Perfection. I found everything to be just as I ordered it and savored every last piece of my meal. We got the Bacon-Cheddar Polenta which was remarkably good and the mashed potatoes (which I didn't try) and also, the creamed spinach. It may not be revolutionary, but Delmonico's does good food just right :D  I wouldn't say that I really "stepped out of my box" with what I ordered, but I will say that they have a wonderful wine list, a nice group of people working for them, and tasty food. This is the perfect place to dine with a small group or family where everyone can get something they like. It's more of a safe bet while dining in Vegas - but a good one. It's also located in the Venetian - which is as they say - a "feast for the eyes" I like!

Mx1Rlmg500zGrKlsbMZcSQ.text: Food: 5 stars Staff: 5 stars Value: 4 stars  It can be hard to find a restaurant that serves chateaubriand, so when we saw it being advertised at Delmonicos, we dropped our previous dinner plans to eat here. The staff were very friendly, from the hostess stand to our waitress. My wife and I shared the chateaubriand which came with asparagus and frites. All were excellent! This was the most expensive chateaubriand we ever ate, but I expect that premium would be added to a meal served at any restaurant on the strip with a famous head chef/owner.

eYIj1cJi0pBBCC79QXa9jw.text: This should of been better. Great service no complaints just wish the back of the house was as good as the front. Made birthday reservations and notified staff when i called. Did not get any assistance to make the night special even though the table next to me did with a birthday dessert.... no big deal. We ordered the pan seared foie gras for starters which was amazing and flavorful. We had the creamed spinach which lacked flavor but was not overcooked like most places. Down to business we both ordered bone in aged ribeyes. It was unexpectedly disappointing because I've been to the original delmonico's and was pleased. We ordered the same steak cooked to the same temp(medium well) and the steaks tasted like they were cooked at two completely different restaurants. Tender, cooked to the right temp but my steak had almost no flavor at all it was like i needed my own seasoning rack at the table after i received it. The other ribeye though far from perfect was a lot more tolerable. This was definitely not the experience or steak you would expect to get from a delmonico's or any restaurant with a average bill over 200 dollars. I would probably not return to this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan seared foie gras with fig and buttermilk waffle

j7CW-ZG-3nwY-cgGi6pNIA.text: One of new favorite spots in Vegas! I can't wait to come back again. My boyfriend and I were in town for some racing at the Las Vegas Motorspeedway. Each night we were in town, we would uber out to the strip for a good dinner. Last Sunday, since it was our last night in Vegas, we decided to splurge and was craving a really good steak.   We called ahead and asked the restaurant if it was ok to be casually dressed since we didn't bring any dressy clothes since we weren't planning on going  anywhere too fancy. The restaurant told us that it was completely fine and to just in.  I was able to make reservations and when we arrived, we were seated instantly. Frank, who I think is the manager, greeted us instantly. He was very professional, positive, with great energy. For sure, my bf and I wanted the rib eye steak and we were having a hard time deciding on what to get for our sides. Frank recommended the creamed corn and the potatoes au gratin. On top of that, he also recommended a great bottle of wine to go with it. We ended up ordering what he recommended to us and were not disappointed at all.  Our steaks were cooked to perfection. The creamed corn had a hint of spice, which I thought were jalapenos, but ended up being pablano peppers. Delicious! And the potato au gratins were to die for and had so much flavor to them. In addition to that, the bottle of wine that we ordered was exactly what we were looking for. To end the night off, we ordered dessert as well and went with the duck egg creme brulee (which was fabulous!) and the butter cake with the caramel (I forgot what it was called).  We would like to thank Frank for the wonderful hospitality and his recommendations as well as the entire staff. Thank you for making our night enjoyable! We will be returning again the next time we are in town for some racing.

GBmEe0lRd0ftjzOWIO6GpA.text: My husband and I had a fabulous experience.  On the weekends they have a 3 course lunch for $38!    For the appetizer, I chose the French Onion Soup which was so cheesy and delicious.  My husband had the Beef Carpaccio which was the best I have ever eaten, and we have had some really good Carpaccio before.  It was a large portion of thinly sliced high quality beef that literally melted in my mouth.  Fresh arugula and Parmesan thinly sliced but what makes this special is the crispy capers.  They add a wonderful texture to each bite.  I will dream about going back for this dish.  Second course we both ordered the Angus Tenderloin Sandwich which is delicious and piled with high with roasted mushrooms.  By this point we were full and could only eat half of it.  We took the rest to go because we wanted to make room for dessert!  3rd course was dessert.  My husband had the Pecan pie which was expertly made.  I had Emeril's Bananna Creme Pie.  Amazing!  Service was exceptional and attentive but not intrusive.  Professionals for sure.  We will be going back for sure.  I highly recommend eating here and take advantage of the lunch special!

sU0xfv006s57kZcsWFDAzg.text: I went to Delmonico with the intent of trying a couple of interesting whiskies and having a snack from the bar. The ambience and decor are understated and generally pleasant. Our server Clint was excellent. He made fantastic recommendations and offered exemplary service. Overall a wonderful experience with good food, great whiskey, and excellent service.

fb2k6YX8J2xvSyjsGHQXHw.text: Excellent actually. Service, food, ambiance, were top notch. Steaks cooked perfectly. Drinks made well.  Wine recommendation on target. One would expect prices on the strip to be higher than elsewhere, but really it was in-line with other premium steakhouses.  Would return!

yaFTCtMPJa0KQazre0hdsQ.text: Okay this is strictly for the bar area. I had been craving Emeril's banana cream pie for months and I finally got to fill my craving. We decided to just do dessert since we had a late lunch / early dinner. The bar was empty on a Sunday night! How can this be at such a great restaurant. However score for us. I got banana cream pie and the hubs got the key lime pie. Our server was soooo funny and talked to us like we were all old pals or something. We felt so welcomed by him. I think his name was Clint????? I can't remember but he was so friendly and nice and had some suggestions on the dessert menu. We just got the two treats. Everything was great from start to finish including the service. Overall I will come back next time to the restaurant and get some steaks and treats!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Emeril&#39;s Banana Cream Pie
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Key lime

IYhkUW6YOr3kB2Aky06_uw.text: Didn't expect to enjoy dining here as much as I did.  Sure, I knew it was Emeril Lagasse's place, so had to be better than average. Yes, it's "ouch" level expensive.  But from the courtesy of the wait staff, the thoughtful birthday card for my husband, the delectable steak, pork chop, and pecan pie, (and complimentary birthday dessert), warm and inviting dining room with lush carpet, and elegant white tablecloth simplicity, it all worked out to nothing you could complain about.  A special night out.  Thus, 5 stars.

UVxth3LK-gCk32JOmhYy_Q.text: So I realize this is a steakhouse... but I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass.  and I don't regret it. Very moist fish with a yummy fennel salad and fingerling potatoes. I would probably order this again were it not for the fact that I would want to try more of everything else.  The staff was very good. Courteous. Dressed impeccably  well and very organized. The restaurant itself feels like you're in a private cellar. Linen cloths were very clean and pressed and there is nothing else to distract from the mood set by the place... definitely nothing to distract from the food.  The only reason for the deduction in a star is because I could not get comfortable. While I loved the look of the place, it felt very uptight. So for another guest, they may feel more comfortable than I did and this may not matter at all.   All in all a very good restaurant with solid food.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0RFRQ2NOCUKmbm1QAewA8A.text: Wonderful dinner exceptional service! We had to try The famous truffle potato chips and they did not disappoint. So light and crispy with a little hint of truffle and cheese they just melt in your mouth. My dining companion had the bone in Ribeye which was seared  on the outside and cooked to perfection on the inside as I got to sample it . I ordered a carpaccio and was surprised at how huge the portion was but ate every last bite the arugula salad on top was just the perfect accompaniment to the beef! The baked potato was slightly cold other then that it was good . Very attentive service we had 3 different people helping us . Sadly no room for dessert!

eDN8rfsuYIWoDilb8F_aQg.text: We were looking for a steak restaurant in Las Vegas and decided to give this place a try as we were staying in Venetian. We made a reservation for 7 pm and we were seated at a table near the back of the restaurant. Service was prompt and attentive. I was expecting the piano and live music to be playing as they had a large lounge area in the front but this was not happening. The restaurant was quite empty. We were celebrating an event and received a handwritten note from the restaurant. Received a tiny amuse bouche cucumber with smoked salmon paste. I was a bit surprised when one server mentioned they would now take away the decoration plates as these were not used for the meal. I would've expected the plates to be placed on top of the charger or decoration plate as they called it. Menu had good selections as expected. We ordered the big eye tuna with caviar, tableside Caesar salad, ribeye steak 16 oz and the Piedmontese filet mignon. Also ordered sides creamed spinach, and Brussels sprouts. I liked the tuna appetizer it was beautifully presented and big chunks of sashimi grade tuna with condiments. Flavor was a little lacking. Our server was fine but I can only describe the feeling as abrupt and brusque and my whole dining experience felt rushed and a bit stressful. As the meal progressed it did not seem to be a relaxing dining experience. The steaks came and were done as expected. Piedmontese filet was seared well and great flavor rosemary and garlic infused. The steak was tender and favourful. No complaints with the other ribeye steak. One thing that stands out is the plates they used. White plates and the sides were all darkened and the China had come off from overuse. I think if I'm going to pay $60 for a steak I'd like to see it served on better quality plates. Cutlery also very basic. The sides were really nothing memorable. Creamed spinach came in a little pot. The Brussels sprouts were supposed to be with bacon in it but there was hardly any flavor and tiny bits of bacon on the bottom. There was no Mac and cheese on the menu which was strange for a steak house. They put together for my little one Alfredo pasta with some cheese. We received a complimentary scoop of ice cream for celebrating our event. Dessert menu did not really entice but we ordered the root beer float. I did not really see the Louisiana influence that was supposedly the theme of this restaurant reflected in the menu or entrees. The restaurant felt like a casual steak place. Overall standard pricey steakhouse in Las Vegas that did not impress me enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FjJjlG7mhgDVco6RtzutrQ.text: We had our wedding dinner here and I was a little worried because there were some negative reviews.   We arrived on time but still had to wait about 15 minutes for our table and we sat in the piano Lounge area and had a drink called happily ever after which was appropriate.  When I made the reservation I told them it was our wedding dinner and they gave us a nice table in the corner of the restaurant that was more private. Service was excellent and the food was phenomenal. We ordered Caesar salad for two people which was prepared at the table side. We also ordered Chateaubriand which was cooked to Perfection and just the right portion. The steak was soft and delicious and seasoned just right. There was no need for sauce or anything. We didn't want to eat too much because it was New Year's Eve and we didn't want to get food coma and be able to drink a few cocktails to bring in the New Year. We got our banana cream pie to go so we could eat it after midnight. Not sure how much the dinner was because my husband wouldn't let me see the bill but I'm guessing over $250 but it was worth it. The only super minor critique I could give is that they did not refill our water and they did not clean up the bread crumbs on the table which high-end restaurants seem to do. They were also comments that it was dungeon feeling and needed upgrading which I totally disagreed with. It is classy and more than lived up to my expectations

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chateaubriand carved tableside

bIqMQg5OLmj_gk-MEWMjqA.text: My husband and I dined here for dinner last night. The staff was courteous, attentive and answered all of our questions. We ordered lobster deviled eggs as an appetizer, they were savory and chilled perfectly. As main courses we had the salmon and bone in rib eye steak with potatoes gratin and cream spinach. My salmon was very flavorful and fresh, it wasn't fishy or dry. My husband said his steak was the best he's had, which was a surprise because he's picky about steak. The potatoes gratin were the favorite side as they were cheesy and flavorful. The spinach side was creamy and rich. Dessert was amazing! We shared a piece of banana cream pie, we were both very impressed because it was packed with bananas and topped with caramel sauce, whipped cream, and chocolate. Dessert was the best way to end a very good meal. The food portions are more than enough to fill you up, you will not leave hungry. Our first time visiting was an excellent experience, the staff is very professional and the food is high quality. The food was well worth the money and we will be returning.

uOj5yB4nwD0NSnahgK-Eyg.text: Time to splurge and allow yourself to fall into a deep state of pleasure.   After trials with off strip, inexpensive eats, we decided to make this meal a good one and it was definitely good alright.   I don't usually give five stars, but I don't see what holds it back, so here it is.   First, this place is pretty large and accommodates reservations pretty easily. I suppose it's not new and hot, so it's relatively simple to get a table during a desired time.   We had solid service. Everyone was so nice, even after we decline getting wine after many minutes of searching through the list and talking to a sommelier. Yep, we were those people.   We ordered:  the ribeye (25oz) which was split for us two the wilted spinach salad barbecue shrimp appetizer  Roasted fingerling potatoes key lime pie desert.  The wilted salad wasn't wilted bc we asked for the dressing on the side, but it was pretty good. I didn't love it bc of the bacon fat vinaigrette, but the fried egg was an interesting touch. The portion is quite small, so not really that shareable if you're wanting to get some greens in your diet.   The barbecue shrimp was fantastic. It comes at a hefty price of $18 for five shrimp, but it's pretty worth it. The shrimp were juicy and plump and very flavorful. It's more Cajun/new orleans style, so don't think it's some traditional southern sweet BBQ.   The steak was delectable. It had a perfect crisp layer on the outside and a good medium rare redness on the inside. For the most part, it was really a good marbled piece of meat. Even at 12 oz each, I could barely finish it, but I was riding on the potatoes...  Which were pretty bomb too. Steeped with garlic and herbs and butter, these potatoes were cute and perfectly seasoned and cooked. Just soft enough to melt in your mouth but cooked enough to have some of a give when you take your initial bite. Definitely recommend these.   And of course, seriously, the best is for last: the key lime pie. Trust me, I'm not a huge sweet tooth (even though I love love ice cream - it doesn't necessarily mean I love super sweet things!) and I don't often tend to like tart flavor profiles, but this was the damn best key lime pie I've ever had. We were recommended several things like the banana something something and blah blah blah and we both just happened to lock our eyes on the key lime - maybe we needed a refreshing dessert - but it was a good choice. By no means do I not think the others are good too - I bet they are - but this was the best choice for us! It was the right amount of tartness with the sweet (though it was a bit heavy on the sugar for my liking) and the strawberry glaze was so complementary. The crust was buttery and delicious and it all paired so well together! Goodness, the ghrelin hormones are starting to rise and they're making me hungry for this dessert!   Delmonico's is a great steak place, maybe one of the best. Don't hesitate to come here for a satisfying carnivorous meal!

s8UJ0QYu4HAmgf4Za8sZqw.text: We're not gamblers so this is the one thing we wanted to do passing through Vegas. Loved it. We do not typically enjoy fancy restaurants with wait staff filling your water glass every time you take a sip. That did not happen here. Mark was super easy to talk to and the service was spot on. Now for the food. I know this is a steakhouse and my bone in filet was delicious but, if we ever get back here, I would order the double cut pork chop. Amazing!

3E5XQ--wbGt-MIvkhbsjLw.text: Awesome steakhouse. One of the best meals we have had.  We got the creekstone 20 ounce bone in ribeye and the 16 oz NY strip steak. The ribeye was cooked medium rare and the steip steak medium well. Both perfectly cooked to temperature. For sides we had potatoe gratin. All was perfect. Bread and butter was complimentary.  Self parking here is free here at the venetian. Make reservations as hhis place is extremely busy walk ins may take hrs to be accomidated

Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium NY strip steak

1j02ud2uoSIyK5LILhPuwQ.text: Outstanding!  Unlike Joe' crab shack and prime steakhouse I was treated great here. Had the lobster bisque, which was fantastic, the ribeye, cooked to perfection, and the duck fat fingerling potatoes.  Emeril should be an round of this place!

TXfM6til3OKv8arAY9MMjg.text: Oh how I wanted tonight to be magical! I even put in my fake hair in preparation for looking radiant while I ate my amazing food. A dinner that easily equals that of a monthly mortgage payment. The atmosphere is amazing, you feel like you have entered a special dining room only celebrities are allowed to know exists. Waiters and waitresses swarm you like flys to honey, never allowing your drink to reach 3/4 full. The menu is amazing, littered with fancy words with French origins, and buzzy trendy words like grass fed and organic. They offer an impressive array of sauces to top your steaks, as well as a long list of sides. The sides are served family style. The Brussel sprouts were ahhhhmazing. The mashed potatoes and mushrooms were average at best. The crab appetizer was over cooked. The chips with trufffle oil were very good. The French onion soup was a disaster. Never have I ever seen French onion soup with so much cheese. Literally we couldn't find soup under the cheese. Once I dug halfway to the hellmouth I did find some broth and 3 small onions. Things went really south when we received our steaks. All steaks weren't cooked to order. All but one was acceptable for the customer. One was ordered medium well and came out medium rare. We did send it back. Not sure what route it took to the kitchen, but what should have taken 5 minutes to up cook a steak that had already been cut in half somehow took long enough for the remaining party to finish their dinner. I'm very sad, it is a good thing I'm headed to the slots, perhaps my night will turn around. I sure hope this isn't a prediction of my slot luck!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sides

a4gt6fRxb5jChfego0MOPQ.text: Since my favorite steak house closed down in Vegas, this steak house was highly recommended to me and I AM BEYOND SATISFIED that I came here for dinner. The ribeye was cooked to perfection and full of flavor. Service was excellent

TlFX4xEFhf6P4nBcEJcHkw.text: What took me so long to dine at this place!   Delmonico definitely is my one of my fav steakhouse in Vegas.  Original plan was going to Harvest in Bellagio however there was an incident on the strip, so here we were, detoured to Caesar Palace.  We were seated quickly on a Friday late night, woohoo, it's gonna be a good night.  I like their menu, it was short and sweet only 2 pages, took us only 2 mins to pick our food.  We had applewood bacon, barbecue shrimp, lobster bisque, gumbo, bone in filet which was the house special of the day and also rack of lambs with chimichurri sauce.    The applewood bacon was indeed a thick cut of pork belly, which was quick greasy, the flavor is good but it was so oily I couldn't have more than one bite, I didn't care much about it.    The star of the night was the barbecue shrimp, highly recommend by the waiter, glad we took his advice, it was so delish! It was not the usual bbq sauce that u had before, this New Orleans style bbq sauce had a little tarted, smoky, spice, touch of sweet. Oh man... I literally licked the plate! Oops ... Not very lady like!   Lobster bisque was another surprise, it was rich and velvety with punch of flavors, came with chunks of lobster meats... It was perfect.  Comparing to the lobster bisque, gumbo was just ok, I was a little disappointed Coz gumbo was such a authentic plate represent Cajun creole cuisine. Besides the saltiness, there's not much flavor on the plate.  Oh yes...

Mp65doMbJ4H2O81ewpQ3_g.text: Never get between a girl and her BONE-IN RIBEYE....NEVER!  When deciding on restaurant for my friend's BIG 3-OH B-Day dinner, it was between CUT, N9NE, and Delmonico's. After YELPING and looking over all the menus, Delmonico's was the winner because it was conveniently located in The Venetian (we were staying at the Palazzo), decently priced compared to CUT, and had rave reviews about the bone-in ribeye.   RESERVATIONS:  Making reservations was quick and simple. You can make reservations directly through the restaurant as opposed to The Wynn Restaurants where you have to call their restaurant hotline number and the wait is 20+ minutes.  On Friday, March 4, 2010, our party of 9 arrived around 7:15 PM. As we were escorted to our table, we couldn't help but notice the shape of our table. A round table was connected to a rectangular table which errr, resembled a male part. Don't know if it was intentional since I told them it was my male's friend's b-day party? Anyhow, it made for a good laugh.   FOOD: *Lobster Bisque ($12.50): Rich, velvety smooth with generous chunks of sweet tender lobster equals YUMMYNESS! The only complaint is it was a bit too salty for my taste. Four of my friends also had the bisque and complained about the same thing.  *16 oz Bone-in Ribeye ($52): One word...WOW! The bone-in ribeye, aged for 8 weeks was one the most flavorful steaks I've ever tasted! The ribeye was cooked to a perfect medium rare with nice charred crust and a pink center. You can tell that the marbling slowly melted and basted the meat during the cooking process producing a rich, amazingly tender, and savory cut of meat. Aside from the Kobe from Craftsteak, this is hands-down the best steak ever; and for the price point, you really can't go wrong. If there weren't anyone watching, I would have literally grabbed the ribeye by the bone and gone to town cave-man style--it was THAT good!  *Creamed Spinach ($9): DELISH! The spinach was extremely fresh and maintained a vibrant green in the velvety and savory sauce. It was well-seasoned w/o being too salty and complemented the steak perfectly.   *Creamed Corn Gratinee ($9): OMG good--it tasted like a mac & cheese made with corn. The creamed corn was sweet and tender and was topped with a panko breadcrumb crust which gave a nice crunch to the dish. It was an explosion of flavor and texture combos in your mouth...sweet, savory, buttery, and crunchy.  SERVICE: Impeccable service, although a little pretentious at times. I guess you would expect nothing less from an upscale restaurant like Delmonico's. When it came down to serving our entrees, it was like a symphony as the waiters/waitresses served our dishes in-synch with one another to create a "ta-daa" moment.  I would have given Delmonico's a 4.5 star rating, however, they allowed Freed's to deliver a b-day cake and didn't charge a slicing fee.  AMBIANCE/DECOR:  Normally steakhouses have a very "dark" ambiance. However, Delmonico's was the complete opposite. It was well-lit with Ivory walls and ceilings with accent cobblestone walls, crisp white linens and chestnut furniture created a very simple, yet elegant feel.  I'm ALL about splurging when on vacation. Go big OR go home right? And, when you're in Vegas, you definitely have to go BIG--so, what are you waiting for? Go on and get your Bone-In Ribeye ON!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamed Spinach--the way all veggies should be eaten!
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in Ribeye---OH YAH!

RVD-yWGYhXTrNUyob6_XEQ.text: Still my favorite steakhouse so far!  Ribeye amazing, spinach and au gratin well done.  Great service and they welcomed us back.  Still deserves a 5 star on all points from food to service to ambiance.

oPa1ei1HxGNHGtkZU8THyQ.text: I had the bone-in rib-eye, which is the best steak I've had in my life. Deliciously juicy, tender, full of beef flavor, with just the right amount of bite, the thought of this steak is making me salivate while writing this review.  My friend had his with the foie gras. If you like foie gras at all, DO THIS. It might seem a bit odd to pair these two together, but when I tried it, it set off little fireworks off my taste buds.

zJyuQJSdB70pZ6hZgl6Ppg.text: I'm still dreaming about this meal. We don't often spend this kind of money on a dinner out, but this was a special night out in Vegas, so why not? Let me tell you, it was worth every penny.   Top items include: Delmonico cocktail. It was heaven, but I love gin and grapefruit and it was a perfect mix.   The truffle chips. Oh my goodness they were so good.   The steak my husband ordered melted in your mouth. It was perfectly cooked to order and had fantastic taste.   I ordered seared scallops, a special. Totally amazing.   We went with our servers recommendation on dessert, the flourless chocolate torte. I'm still pining over it.   Above all, the service was phenomenal. We had a table of 8 and we always had an attentive server ready to answer any questions, provide recommendations that were always spot on, or even help us find a lost card.   Great spot!

q_JxLG7c8-sEvvyzbiX1UA.text: If it was not for the price I probably would consider giving it three stars... 1) wine here is overpriced ALOT 2) we ordered bone-in rib eye as median but got almost well-done 3) lamb was tasteless 4) service was mediocre. Overall I had a really hard time giving more than 2 stars for a restaurant that's supposed to be such high-end but has no idea how to cook steak median...

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bone-in rib eye; supposed to be cooked median but over-cooked

uib8fDEAF0xiiPHY5KrpRQ.text: I REALLY wanted to love Delmonicos. I made reservations weeks ahead of time and booked our room at venetian because of Delmonicos. The food was good. It just wasn't amazing.  I could have made everything we ordered at home.  It just wasn't special.  The service was really awkward.  We were seated at a table by the area they prep the plates before bringing them to the table. That was annoying.  Even more obnoxious was how the servers would lean against the wall 2 feet from our table and stare. Lastly our desert menu was plopped down on the table and then the server walked away.   Womp Womp!!!!

t9DX4GwoLjRPQlTjXJ1ziA.text: We have been twice now, and really enjoy Delmonico. It's the little things in service - for example, my friend was wearing a black skirt, and they took away her napkin. She was confused and asked for a napkin and they said oh, we're grabbing you a black one. Just so that she didn't get white threads on her skirt...   The lobster bisque is AMAZING - best I've had, anywhere EVER. The bread is also crazy delicious! It's these weird puffy rolls that are so flaky and good.   I had filet which is normally excellent. I did have one time where for some reason mine was medium and my friend's was medium rare, though we had ordered opposite. We didn't care much though and just switched our steaks :-)  I think they confused the orders in the kitchen.   The service is great - we had Michael Jackson (for real, that was his name) last night and he was super helpful and friendly.   Oh yeah and the bread pudding. OMG...   For the lobster bisque, the bread and bread pudding (plus service) I would give it five starts. The four is because though the steaks are good, I have admittedly had many that are much better. I would still absolutely go back (and really enjoy it) I just can't say it's a "to die for" steak.

P9cItYSLMdchY9Q9H4BU6A.text: Great customer service but not so great steaks .  My husband ordered the $50 bone in rib eye and it was soo chewy and full of fat .  I ordered New York steak and it was okay for $60.  I rather go to Mastro where it beats all the steakhouse restaurants I ever been to.  Don't waste your money and time here.

XDCQ3PHpjTEn5ppqT-YjEw.text: My family dined at Delmonico this past week to celebrate all the birthdays and anniversaries my son-in-law missed while being deployed with the navy for 9 months. The chef and manager sent us the nicest appetizers to thank him for his service. Our meals were amazing. We had the most gracious service and never had to ask for anything. We don't get there as often as we would like but will definately return when in town and we will recommend Delmonico to all our friends & family. Emeril, you are blessed to have such wonderful employees. God bless.

iG2COk7ZTTcfIddUOjc5MA.text: Always fantastic. This place is a real gem in Las Vegas.

A4n462mLrximfNPPebCSsw.text: A first class steak house and pricey. Everything is a la carte. I ordered a glass of wine, the wedge salad, filet mignon and a twice baked potato and it was a little over $100. The filet was excellent. A couple  at my table ordered the Cesar salad for two and it was prepared table side, it looked so good! The only reason for not giving the restaurant a five star rating was the noise level. We arrived about 9:30 pm and it was a Friday night and there were many bachelor party tables. Having a casual conversation was difficult.

q5yn_6QqAIbhzogn90XeVA.text: Loved Delmonico!! Everything was amazing. The Banana Creme Pie was to die for and the truffle fries & brussel sprouts are some of the best I've ever had.

PMUUtaAMVOD_TAiBc2u7OQ.text: Best house rib eye steak I have ever had.  The service is excellent.  Absolutely will come here again!!

L4Dur7bDYbQ6btWXtpGt6A.text: In my opinion it's not fit for a foodie. Meal was very good but not superb. However, service was great. I wasn't impressed by their BBQ shrimp which was highly recommended as their signature appetizer.  Fish was cooked perfectly but most of the food only had 2 dimensions.  I expected more complexity and excitement in their flavors. Overall great for a cocktail and a good meal but Las Vegas has so many places in this category. I would love a large well known restaurant on the strip to go above and beyond.   If you aren't adventurous and just want a good meal with all your great basics on the menu this is perfect. It's a crowd pleaser but definitely lacking in excitement.   If I were to rate the food it would only be 3 stars but the service is very good so I gave them 4 stars. I will be back for drinks but it wouldn't be my first choice for food.

8ibsaxqCDMogYpmTqlVtTg.text: How does one spell grossly overrated...Delmonico's!!! First, I have seen more originality in a Denny's restaurant in terms of decor. This place is as boring to the eye as watching paint dry...that should have been my clue to exit right!!! There is no color, no cool lighting, no cool art, no great looking floors...nope, a two year old could have designed a more interesting restaurant.  Now let's talk food. It is 3am and I'm on the toilet, let's start there!!! They hand me a steak they claim is prime beef. The only thing prime was the price...52 bucks! The meat was not only tough, but like the decor, it had no taste...NONE. Cosco has better steaks then that thing they brought me.   So they do take it back a I ordered rack of lamb for, yes, 55 bucks!!! Now those little four rib racks were excellent...but not 55 bucks worth of excellence.  Where's the MEAT!   Then it is time to go to the bathroom...you won't believe it...a dirty, filthy two stall bathroom!!! And the road to the bathroom, and I purposely used the word road, was a journey in itself. How is it that a place that charges 55 bucks for a rack of lamb can have such a piece of s@&t bathroom?   And as I sit here on the toilet at 3am all I can tell you is if you think this place is great, then you are from Hoboken NJ because this is a grossly over rated restaurant with horrible food, decor, bathrooms, etc. the owner is laughing to the bank with the fools who go here...AVOID this place.   The restaurant manage reached out to me...good for them...but I'm not interested.  You get ONE chance to make your reputation, and Mr. Celebrity Chef, you lost it here.  AWFUL PLACE!  GROSSLY OVER PRICED!  DON'T WAIST TIME OR MONEY HERE!

EOPXZYXYj8kiOPJRvoq3vg.text: The restaurant looks like it needs an upgrade. The finishes are starting to wear and the bathrooms were not nicely appointed. The restaurant was nicely spread out, though. Tables were spaced so there was plenty of room to move and afforded some privacy.  The food, unfortunately, was mediocre. I opted for the pork chops at medium temperature. They were tasty, but very overdone and dry. The appetizers and salads were lovely, though.

c0PL2SjEXjEOpx4xKHqLZw.text: A-okay! Was at this restaurant this past Saturday for a bday dinner.   The atmosphere was cool and what you'd expect from a high end steakhouse. However it is located in the Venetian hotel which has seriously gone downhill from the last time I was there (maybe '05-'06).  Service was great, and friendly too. However the food was ehhh, on the border of "ok." I ordered a filet cooked medium, but I got well (even burnt along edges). My bf ordered the ribeye cooked medium, and he got a True medium - a little pink inside, nicely cooked outside & edges. Our table shared mushrooms (wouldn't recommend, bland), country mashed and au gratin potatoes (both ok), corn (tasty!), and creamed spinach... Only thing was, we never got it. I think we were so busy eating and talking that we didn't realize it till afterwards. I guess it happens.  So all in all, this place is ok. It doesn't rank above the norm, nor would I drag it down... It's a middle of the road type steakhouse. With so many amazing options in Las Vegas, I'd recommend you try another one before here (STK, Chef Ramsey's).

Yb0ZJG-YOGCk2LX-yAXKig.text: I came here for a bachelor party, and there were some mixed reviews in my crowd.  Most would give this place a 3-star review, but I thought that it deserved a 4-star review.  Most in my crowd thought that the steaks were poorly decorated.  But I was not sure what they expected - steak is steak.  And my filet tasted well enough.  It was cooked well for a medium rare plus, which is hard to do.  So I was impressed enough.  I also shared salmon with someone, but that definitely could have used more salt.  That surprised me considering that this is Emerald's restaurant, where butter and salt is what he *BAM!* loves.  But I had some sides here that I thought were pretty amazing.  The buttered and gratin'd corn here is delicious.  My friends other hand, felt underwhelmed by their mushrooms and asparagus, which I guess I would have to tend to agree.  They did have an excellent wine list, however.  I got some bottles of Shafer Relentless for less than double the retail price, which is a great deal considering that I was at an upper-end steakhouse.  Lastly, what is noteworthy is that this tends to be a pretty good scene.  So not a bad place for a bachelor's party.

4pLvDjkQd7co8BEZ1nJyCw.text: The lobster bisque was wonderful!! Ahi tuna was a tad fishy.. But still edible. Service was nice. I didn't really appreciate the seating... Since we sat next to a cleaning station. Not impressed. Wanted something equivalent to mastros but it wasn't even remotely close. It just looks nice but tasted... Mediocre. The ribeye would of been better if I made it myself. They were seriously off their game.. Was hoping to be "wowed" but I definitely had better.. This isn't a must have. Only eat here for convenience if you are staying at the hotel.

Z7Z6AMxJ_gMtgl1Wbl1cMw.text: Previous to this review, I thought of Delmonicos as a 5 Star Place, but there have been some changes that I really dislike. Mostly the bread. They replaced those amazing Parker House rolls with some nasty Navajo Fry Bread, it's nasty, and greasy, and I don't like it.    Other than the bread f*** up, I like Delmonicos. The chateaubriand for 2 for $100 is a great deal! This is the real reason I come here. It comes with asparagus and garlic smashed potatoes. I add an order of sauteed mushrooms and am in heaven.   The service and atmosphere are also top quality, but because of the rolls being gone, I am giving this place a 3 star rating until they bring them back.

lhYu27iOBKf_WIYfFBkDNQ.text: The steak was delicious and the sides amazing defiantly worth the price and defiantly enjoyed my meal and experience. Service was excellent defiantly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aCfnliu5FVx9CKDTngG3CQ.text: I'll start this review off for you skimmers out there that don't read long reviews. The bone-in rib-eye is the greatest steak experience you will ever have, hands down. Just eat it. Go. Do it.  Now for you that are still with me, here's my full-on, cash money, baller review...for what it's worth:  Delmonico must have a good database manager behind the scenes, because it had been a long time since my last dinner there (prob 5-6 years), yet they immediately greeted me and remembered my patronage (2 visits prior).  What a great feeling (and rather impressive to my gf) that the host and hostess and wait-staff greet you like you're a goddamn king touring the countryside.   This trip to Las Vegas was during a getaway weekend and to see long time friends, but we had a little dinner the night before some festivities for just us. I wanted to visit Delmonico again, because I had remembered such a positive experience with food and service the times before.  So we are greeted by the sommelier and our lead waiter, who throw out a few drinks and possible pairings, review the specials, roll over some changes in the menu (all from memory mind you). We knew we were eating steaks and heartier dishes, so we opted for a bottle of a good Sonoma Cab Sauv we recognized.    The chef paid his compliments with an amuse bouche' of a olive oiled crustini with duck fat and a mushroom.  It was a delicious little oily, fatty, salty bite that told the taste buds "hey bitches...I'm comin' for you...get ready!"  We were treated to some hot brioche popovers and full-fat butter, and I had to oblige at least one...cannot say no...(it's completely un-American to pass up on such things).  We decided to start the evening by sharing an heirloom tomato and burrata cheese salad (faux caprese), and a table-side Lobster bisque. The salad was graciously split onto two plates for us, and was perfectly portioned with greens, veg, cheese, and a light dressing (that was not overpowering). The bisque was poured at our table with huge chunks of lobster, and a smooth velvet-like texture. Flavors were perfect and the temp was outstanding. I had mine and finished my gf's (she always worries about getting to full before the main meal comes).  I had ordered the bone-in rib-eye au poivre and my lady chose the Filet Medallions. I must impress upon you again that the Bone-in Rib-eye IS the way to go. It is perfectly broiled at high temp, with amazing peppercorn seasoning and having it with the mushrooms sauce and onions is the bomb-sauce. There is nothing like it. It is a HUGE cut of meat, with great crusting outside, perfect marbling, and the bone-in flavor. The hot-reddish/pink medium to medium-rare center makes for a tender, juicy, and magnificent steak.  I honestly didn't even partake of her medallions much, because I didn't need to, and wouldn't cheat on my rib-eye.  I let the lady try some of mine and she immediately agreed its the best steak, anywhere, ever. We had a side of asparagus as well, which I felt very bad for because I gave it very little love. I hate leaving soldiers on the battlefield but I wanted to win the war with that steak and had a long night ahead of me of shows and clubs and didn't want terrible meat sweats...so I had to be courteous of tummy room.  Now that we've effectively covered food, let me give a swag at the service. Top notch. All the way around. Polite, informed, friendly, attentive enough without being intrusive. Well-trained veteran folks throughout...no schmucks looking to hump tables as a side gig, these are True to form, real career servers who take pride in their appearance, their posture, plating, timing, knowledge, and truly love their career...these folks work years before graduating to a place like Delmonico or Craftsteak, etc. These guys get huge tips and get to work with fine chefs in multi-million dollar restaurants...they're the cream of the wait staff crop.  Total wine, apps, dinner (no dessert, saved room for later on) was what I expected at ~$300. Well worth it to treat ourselves and enjoy a top-notch meal.    Look folks, even if you're not an Emeril fan (yes he owns the Delmonico name), you can still love this place. A) he's no longer the executive chef of either location, B) the experience is always good here and the place stands alone on its merits, and C) that damned rib-eye is scheduled for my last meal on planet Earth (someday).   Trust me folks...when in Vegas...eat like a damned king. Treat yourself to amazing service, amazing food, and good times...ENJOY!!

aVtfGJVkSJCDRAS4vaTYbQ.text: Excellent service. Great salad.  Wine delicious.  Steak was awful.  Ordered bone in ribeye and it came out completely burnt on top.  They said it was char but sorry it was burnt and that was all you could taste. They replaced it with a version a little less burnt but still burnt.  It was not edible.  Without asking they did not charge me for the steak which was appreciated. Everyone else's dinners and sides were great. If you order a steak here be sure to ask how they prepare it first.

JUIgurYbYhojYGMDre9OYw.text: I'm a big fan of Emeril's cooking and love his steakhouse within The Venetian hotel. I always stay at adjoining The Palazzo and love walking through both hotels to arrive at the restaurant. The filets are amazing! Perfectly cooked medium rare just the way I like it and wonderfully seasoned. Service is excellent with an extensive wine list. The BBQ shrimp is delicious and do try desserts. We had a fantastic dinner here. Thank you Emeril!

ew134qXI9xaAXbqQraCZ-w.text: Once again Delmonico killed it. Great salads, steaks, and deserts. Our waiter was super. This is a must when in Vegas.

7KaybpuFzDa70iohQwI2RQ.text: Greeting- yes Vibe- Flintstones cave Price- expensive Parking- at Venetian hotel Service- professional food Ribeye was delicious Potato fries are very good Vegetable sides are typical and tasty Dessert- best banana cream pie! WIGB? Yes

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana cream pie $10
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana cream pie

Gaui0CeTQru_ocOZ2FG5dA.text: Excellent food. top service to be expected at this level. Had the filet mignon it was Excellent and well prepared. Fantastic sides also a Great wine selections. Top pick

BTfitvhi9bHsi-BP4VHd_Q.text: What can I say about Delmonico's. We stayed at The Venetian and had to go to Emeril's place.  It was everything we expected and more. From the BBQ shrimp, or the deviled eggs to the amazing cuts of steak.  It was all so delicious.  But, you have to save room for the famous Banana cream pie!!  What an ending. We will be back!!!

WdYZMA0dkrsm-KKX_CxexQ.text: First off, to make the most of your experience, you should know what to expect from Delmonico service by doing your Yelp homework. This place doesn't get a full 5 stars because of the service.   It's been a while since I've felt so insulted by a server. I don't even know his name since he didn't introduce himself, so I know him as the big guy with a beard. He was unfriendly and wrote us off immediately when the table next to us wanted to share half of their seafood tower with us (it's massive and delicious by the way... thank you amazing strangers from New Mexico!).  We were celebrating an anniversary and greeted warmly by the host stand, but while other Yelpers say that their servers brought them a scoop of sorbet to celebrate, we got nothing. So hold your server accountable to giving you the experience you deserve for the price tag you pay. He would have gotten 30% if he wasn't such a douche.  ONTO THE FOOD! - Bone-in ribeye: Duh, do as all 1100 Yelp reviews say and get this! Fantastic marbling with an amazing crust. And yes... share a steak and order some other stuff!   - Fingerling potatoes- a light hint of rosemary and more potatoes than a patch on a farm. Really tasty and beautiful. Sides all seem easily shareable for four people.  - Creamed spinach- Not too heavy on seasoning, but perfectly delicious and enjoyable. Perfect with the ribeye.  - Lobster bisque- if you get this, I would highly recommend sharing. It's too rich and heavy to eat a whole bowl.  - Penis-shaped pop-overs (as another Yelp reviewer notes)- Try a bite, but save room for appetizers!  At the end of the day, I would certainly come back for the food. You will end up ordering too much because everything sounds delicious; next time we'll be trying BBQ shrimp and truffled potato chips too!

JCFj_-YnoUjJhyif-a87KA.text: Great service from the get go! The steak fish are delicious but please save room for emerils banana cream pie omg it's  the best. When in Vegas always make sure to eat at emerils restaurants.

dhhPldw5RAC__sfXF85iwQ.text: This is one of Chef Emeril Lagasse's brilliant work. Great upscale yet modern American steak house serving Prime American beef along with Piedmontese and Wagyu steaks, Kurobuta pork, lobster and seafood tower, and Foie Gras. Great environment, amazing food, superb service and to go with excellent collection of wine. My wife and I are regular here and we always invite our friends and business contacts to dinner we never had a bad meal or service. Just try to make a reservation because they get fully booked.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Piedmontese Steak, creamy mash potato and sauteed mushroom.

Y3fIFDjLMg0JB1jNd6w8kg.text: So this review is going to be two sided since we had mixed experiences. Let me start out by saying this is my 3rd Emeril's restaurant in Vegas. The other two places Fish House and Table 10 are always on the half priced ticket booth so a discount is always possible but given this is a steakhouse in The Venetian no discount. We came here on Dec 30th before our Marroon 5 concert. Securing a reservation over the phone a few days ahead of time was easy. We had wine, appetizers,2 main entrees,2 side dishes and a dessert.  The service and customer service here is exceptional.   We tried the lobster bisque, pasta special appetizer, BBQ shrimp, Cajun Ribeye, Filet Mignon, Gratin potatoes, Mushrooms and the Choc cake.  Most of the food was delicious but a few fell short like the Ribeye and choc cake. the ribeye was overcooked, not that tender and lacking seasoning. The choc cake was dry and previously frozen. The special pasta appetizer was good but not excellent or anything I would mention ordering again.  The filet was delicious and the demi glaze sauce was the highlight. The BBQ shimp were delicious along with the little biscuit that comes with it. The lobster bisque was creamy and seasoned well. My server let me try a sample before deciding on a main appetizer.   When asked about our dining experience- we were completely honest with the manager and our server. The main issue was how long we waited for our meal and the $55 ribeye didn't live up to his name. They also forgot to put in one of our appetizers. However, this place gets a four instead of a three because of the amazing customer service we received as a guest. They expedited our food and when we received the bill the ribeye, 2 appetizers, and the cake was taken off our entire bill which to me speaks volumes about how great their customer relations and service is. They have a name to live up to . We had a mixed dining experience but I would probably come back and give this place another chance due to the outstanding customer service. Keep up the good work.

t5RUcOFXcdB-9mNDIalsUA.text: Fantastic evening. Had the bone in rib eye and it was cooked perfectly. I usually ask for steak sauce but not this time. Also had the BBQ shrimp for a appetizer. I would definitely go back again. Side note: Larry our waiter was great. Guess he could tell we were from Hawaii when we ask questions about the menu. He's from Kaneohe but moved here 17 years ago.

YsE60237i5fOFd-Mw2JSVg.text: I don't leave a 5 star review if it's not deserved. Boy do they deserve a 5 star review! I had the 8oz fillet and it was just perfection! The flavor, how it was grilled a perfect medium! You have to try your steak with their red wine reduction! The wife wanted salmon with lobster sauce which they don't offer. Did they say sorry we don't have lobster sauce? NO! They said we will be happy to make you a creamy lobster sauce and she said it was the best she had ever eaten. Now coming from my wife, that's saying something! She is the pickiest eater in the world! And salmon is a tricky fish to grill because it dries out fast and it was juicy and moist as hell! (I had to try a bite) and they used huge chunks of main lobster in the sauce! AT NO EXTRA CHARGE!!!!!!  The garlic mash (or as they call it, smashed) potato was good and the BBQ shrimp app was really good also. Bottom line, you would be a fool not to try this place out. It was well worth the $145 we spent there!!!!!

5S-r3d9UZobHxP9seQfZqA.text: I don't get all the great reviews.  Listen - I'm a big Emerill fan, but this place is 10 years past a remodel - and in massive need of a menu overhaul.  I mean - many of these dishes were things he used to cook on his tv show 25 years ago.  I took hubby here to kick off our Vegas birthday celebration weekend and we were both really disappointed.  Atmosphere is stark and old.  Service is attentive but clumsy.  I mean how many people can ask me if my glass of wine is ok - while serving us terrible food.  We started with an a Crispy Octopus app which was good.  Hubby had the 30.00 Foie Gras app which he says was terrible - tasted like overcooked canned cat food.  Terrible.  Our entrees were th BBQ Salmon and the Fried Chicken.  The Salmon was really just so so - kind of outdated and way too much bbq sauce.  Hubby said the Fried Chicken and waffles were just bland and dry.  When Fried Chicken is 36.00 is had better at least be moist.  (he was just about choking on it.)  Finally - they brought him a baby scoop of Mango Sorbet with a candle for his bday.  Sadly, they actually brought it while I was in the bathroom.  When I got back to the table, they re-lit the candle again.  Awkward.    Final bill for two apps, Salmon, Fried Chicken, and two glasses of wine - $250.00  So - definitely will not be returning anytime soon.  The place was mostly empty on a Thursday night - now we know why.  Sorry Emerill - but bad bad bad.  (*two stars instead of one because the fresh popover bread was good.)

oP_NL0j-tTTLhwXaOEiTQA.text: After eating at Delmonico, I seriously didn't want to eat for days! I ordered the bone-in ribeye and my my, it was humongous. I finished the whole thing (no, not the bone also). It was a really delicious piece of meat. It was cooked medium rare perfectly.
