kPuftR83B22mGf88_eO7_g.text: If my son was writing this review, he would have given it 50 stars. He says it is the best meal he's ever had. He said the Lobster Bisque was incredible and his steak was so perfect, he ate it all until he was nearly sick. I, however, am the writer of this review, so it's only getting four stars because my steak was not great... not as great as everyone else's at the table. The guys all got the standard filet mignon, but I tried the Piedmontese (I think I spelled that correctly). Although theirs and mine were both listed on the menu as 6 oz., mine was considerably smaller. Theirs was also truly medium rare, but mine - ordered the same way - was medium and a bit dry. I had to use the butter from the side dish of mushrooms to help eat the steak (OMG those mushrooms were amazing!!!). I was so jealous of the guys at our table.   Also, we'd heard incredible things about the potato croquettes, but they were just okay. I will say, though, that we LOVED the truffle potato chips. Mom & Dad loved the asparagus. I wasn't a huge fan. It didn't have a lot of flavor, and I simply prefer stalks that aren't reminiscent of tree stalks.   They did surprise us with delicious chocolate sorbet at the end of our meal to celebrate Mom & Dad's anniversary and our son's 21st birthday.  Oh and son and I ordered glasses of Moscato. It was the best we'd ever had. When the darling waiter told me what it was, the name was so long, I told him I'd never remember all that. He wrote it down on a card and gave it to me before we left. So thoughtful.

ltXu4sJyTruhIqKqef-r8w.text: This restaurant was amazing ! It's seriously so fancy and so nice and we were seated right away . The service you receive is amazing and everyone is so proper. The bread they serve as a starter is amazing . I was able to get their chicken dinner and it was so good and cooked exactly how i liked it . My fiance was able to get their ribeye dinner and he also loved it . I recommend this restaurant to anyone in Las Vegas , it was worth the money and i could definitely see myself going back .

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Herb Marinated All Natural Chicken Breast

8djCjkkkFHT419raTYuPOA.text: Our event started at 2 pm in the Delmonico's private room which is located somewhat in the middle of the restaurant. It is a beautifully, elegant, simple, well-decorated restaurant. Perfect for hosting dinner parties.  After the event, we all left the room so that the staff could convert it into a fine-dining experience, which they did.  The tables were set, the lights were adjusted, and the guests were welcomed back into the room for a night filled with pleasure beyond words. The night was magical.   The Domaine Serene 2014 Yamhill Cuvee Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley) was by far one of the best reds I've ever allowed to grace my pallet. Unbelievable how smooth, delicious, and perfect that wine was. If you're a wine enthusiast and you haven't had a bottle of this wine as yet, trust me, you'll be quite pleased.  Before I could get into my first drink really good, our Sommelier came around our table and introduced us to a few more delicious wines that went well with my seafood.  The food was amazing! I didn't take many pictures of the main course or of much else because after our seafood tower showed up and a couple of glasses of wine I put my phone aside and just enjoyed the moment.   The service was exceptional. The staff took care of our every need. All the guests left with a lasting impression.  I admire and loved watching Chef Emeril LaGasse on the cooking network and to have dined in one of his fine restaurants, I was honored.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Delmonico.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another favorite!
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Couldn&#39;t figure out which glass was mine. Found out they were all mine.

AcjvDChb8MsvrwXxuwJkaQ.text: Forgot how amazing this place was. Came years ago and not sure why it took me so long to come back.  We dined in pretty late and staff was super cool about it. Our server Jai was phenomenal.  Our dinner began with drinks and champagne :)  For our starters we had: -Truffle parmesan potato chips, Apple cured bone in bacon, Sea food tower & crawfish fritters.  The potato chips were addicting, I honestly wanted to take some home in my purse. Cure bacon was okay, a bit too sweet for my taste. The sea food tower was amazing, probably one of the best ones I've had. And the crawfish fritters were different but tasty, served on a bed of fresh grilled corn and cherry tomatoes.   Entrees: Bone in rib eye and Pork chop. Rib eye was cooked to perfection and seasoned well. Never had pork chops at a restaurant before and this was for sure a game changer. The reduced sauced it was cooked in was amazing.  For sides we did, Potato gratin, creamed corn, and grilled asparagus.  Only thing I loved was the creamed corn, asparagus and potatoes were okay, nothing special.   Dessert: Banana pie and Pecan pie. Honestly I am chocolate person, so I did not care for either one.   This steakhouse is one of the most under rated steak houses here in Las Vegas. I don't think they get enough credit for their amazing food & service.

Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Parmesan Potato Chips &amp; Apple Cured Kurobuta Bone - In Bacon

ty99MZD4EABbcqhQU_H0nQ.text: This is one of my favorite steak restaurants anywhere. The Gumbo is so so good, but filling. The fresh bread/rolls are also filling. I ordered the filet mignon with the butter peppercorn sauce. The bacon cheese potatoes are a must.

RSzqDtnls7fupjp586OaAQ.text: This review is written after 3 times here. So you can say, I really love this place. I stay at the Palazzo pretty often whenever I am in town so I do like this steakhouse. Granted, I've come here 3 times with 3 different parties and ordered different things each time, I'm basing my review on my most recent experience this past weekend.   We did make reservations for 9 pm I believe. We came in pretty buzzed and ordered a few things.   Shishito Peppers- Way too salty for any of our tastes. We didn't finish this.   Cheese Plate- Delicious. They really enjoyed the the fresh honey while I really enjoyed the different cheeses.  Fois Gras- OUR FAVORITE, most definitely. So buttery and tasted so good with just the perfect amount of sauce. Highly recommend if you enjoy fois gras. Can't go wrong.  Ribeye- It was great!!!! So tender and fatty. We got it medium rare and actually split this between two people. I rarely eat red meats but I always crave the steak here.  New York- Not as marbled or fatty like ribeye but it was good.  Ask for their steak sauces!! I love the horse radish one. It was just sooooo good, gave a great kick and flavor to the steak.   Corn side is recommended, had a textured crust on top. Asparagus was not flavorful, but it was the only greens for the dinner. I didn't mind it too much. They thought it was extremely weak in flavor.  No drinks or dessert but dinner was about $200 or so, might have been more.   HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halves of the ribeye, shishito peppers, corn (recommend), asparagus, cheese platter, and comp bread.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shishito peppers, cheese platter, and fois gras.

3JIkwUAzZOSkhbS6d439Xw.text: If I ever go to Death Row and am asked what I want my last meal to be... holy crap... seriously... anything on this menu will be on my request form. I understand that joking about that may be a bit taboo - what people do to end up on death row - but dear lord... if you tasted their bone in ribeye, creamed corn or potato croquets (fancy tater tots) you'd second guess what you would consider moral if it meant you could devour this ambrosia again.   Do yourself a favor... bring a date, order anything on the menu... and after the first bite, try to keep the moaning to a minimum - apparently that is frowned upon with some patrons. Just make sure you're well satisfied before you get the check. It'll take the sting off.  If you get Ryan as your head server/ambassador, we highly suggest ordering the bananas foster. You'll quickly learn why we have a love/hate relationship with him. Absolutely amazing! You don't think you'll have room? Shut your mouth... yes you do...  YES (clap)! YOU (clap)!  DO (clap)!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Didn&#39;t have a chance...

4RRFUDit8qIqk8MCqcJ74Q.text: One of my fav restaurants. We were party of three and we ordered Seafood Tower, Prime Rib, Octopus and believe me , that's enough food for 3. The bread is out of this world . Definitely we will back again .

4qgNLGYV6NDwh_IuNPlddA.text: Absolutely divine! Started with scallop appetizer which was in the special. My entree was the rib eye with foie gras. Just amazing! Major kudos to the chef Rick Rainwater. Our wait staff was just as amazing but I have never in my life had as good a ribeye EVER. And topped with perfect foie? I can't say enough.  Emeril has outdone himself with staff and expectation. And the drinks? Chock full of deliciousness and alcohol! Kudos to the mixologist and our bartender! If we have the opportunity to come again before leave..... MUST DO!! Just OMG!

poQ9P__U9W7sJ2nr6igERA.text: Delmonico Steakhouse is located at the Venetian. It is a beautiful restaurant. It's the perfect anniversary/birthday date night restaurant.  This review is based on my most current experience.   I came here for a private mixer/ event.  I have to give a big THANK YOU to the staff here. There I was, the pregnant lady, not being able to eat the yummy medium rare roast or seared tuna.   The staff cutting the roast asked if I wanted to have the chefs cook the tuna and and roast so I would be able to eat something. On top of that, he also helped serve me mushrooms vegetables. I was able to eat so good that night, because I was also offered the lobster bisque and other pupus. The food was amazing, even though I usually enjoy seared ahi and medium rare steak, but these are the things you have to do when you are pregnant.   my husband and I ate here before and I was impressed with the food quality.  This time around, I was really impressed on the level of service the staff showed to me and to the other guests that evening. It really shows how much they want their customers to enjoy not only the food but the experience.   Overall, everyone enjoyed the food, the atmosphere and the service. Talk about classy dining! I will definitely be back!

ERMN7lO_8yHMHBwQ0gtvig.text: So this is one of my wife's and my favorite steak house. Do yourself a favor and eat here. Everything is always spot on and if it's not, they fix it without question.  If you ask for Michael Jackson as your server, he and Drew (his assistant and overall sexy guy) will take care of you from start to finish with your meal. Tell him Sterling sent you.   P.S. have the BONE IN BACON. Just sayin'!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OZagfKGXFtm9-Zsghxa4iw.text: We were staying at the Venetian so this on-property steakhouse was a simple choice. We've dined at a few Emeril establishments including this one several year's ago.   I would rate this visit at 3.5 stars. The experience was not bad, but there is an incredible amount of fine dining in Vegas so the competition at this level is tough.   The Emeril's New Orleans Barbecue Shrimp was just okay. Nothing special. Shrimp was a touch overdone. The Caesar Salad prepared tableside was nice, but the romaine leafs were pale. Our filet and ribeyes were cooked to correct temperature, but a bit underseasoned. Creamed corn and potato gratin were good sides. Finished with Emeril's Banana Cream Pie which was excellent.  Service was as expected for the level of dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Emeril&#39;s Banana Cream Pie

jne6mYE9Ar8hbWwgM_3B7A.text: From the reservations, table arrangements, pairing of wine, quality of fine food and plate display this place is phenomenal. Our waiter new the menu and his preparation of our fresh salad right at our table made our experience unforgettable. We enjoyed having our first year anniversary and look forward to visiting this amazing place again.

Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complementary dessert
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad freshly made at our table

JiO_hkoqOcidxNXqT8KuBw.text: We dined here for a birthday. Upon checking in we were asked to have a seat in the lounge while our table was being prepared. A cocktail server asked if we would like to order drinks but we were being seated right away so we declined. There was a live pianist playing in the lounge as well. The hostess seated us at a nice table and gave a birthday card from the restaurant to the guest of honor.   We ordered a beer and the pear martini. The beer was poured into a glass at the table and the pear martini was chilled and refreshing. Our server made some suggestions and told us what the most popular dishes were. We went with most of his suggestions.   We started off with the BBQ shrimp appetizer and a wedge salad. The BBQ shrimp was 5 shrimp served with a mini rosemary biscuit. The shrimp were tender and had a nice spicy BBQ sauce ladled on top. The rosemary biscuit was nice to eat after the shrimp and balanced out the appetizer well. The wedge salad was fresh and crisp. Both dishes were great to start with and were not too filling. They also brought fluffy and hot popover bread to enjoy with butter. Pillowy soft and a little sweet.   For our entree we shared the bone in ribeye which is their signature cut of meat. It was marbled well and cooked to perfection and topped with an herbed butter. They presented the ribeye as a whole and offered to split it for us. We had them split it and the portions were served on hot dinner plates. The flavor was so good we did not feel the need to order any sauces to compliment the steak, but I'm sure a sauce would have gone well with it too.   For our side dishes we ordered the charred Brussels sprouts which were crisp and served with chopped bacon. The flavor was excellent and it went well with the steak. For the starch we ordered the potato croquettes which were oversized tater tots with shredded potatoes inside topped with cheese, bacon, sour cream and chives. Those were like little bites of heaven and we actually fought over the leftovers at home the next day. They had a large selection of side dishes that we would have loved to try but we were satisfied with our selections.   Although we were stuffed from dinner we couldn't resist ordering dessert. I had been stalking other reviews and pictures of the banana cream pie. It was a heaping slice of pie with a sweet graham cracker crust, layers of fresh bananas and chilled banana cream topped with whipped cream and chocolate curls. It was a perfect ending to a perfect meal.   I would definitely love to return and try other things off of the menu but would duplicate what we had that night because everything was so good. If you're looking for a nice steakhouse on the strip to celebrate a special occasion, you can't go wrong at Delmonico.

1BRet-9Ts7hYv3qCw5b9oA.text: This place is an utter disaster, the likes of which have not often been seen at a high end steakhouse or an Emeril Lagasse establishment.  * The wagyu fillet was requested "medium rare, on the rare side" and it came well done, nearly charred.   * The prosciutto wrapped dated featured cold goat cheese in the middle. Absolutely unpalatable.  * The croquettes were largely forgettable and tasted like frozen food.   * Dessert took and I kid you not, 35 minutes to be served. The pecan pie was poorly executed & the lemon trifle was edible, but not breath taking.   * THE PIECE DE RESISTANCE: I requested a decaf French roast coffee and was served caffeinated coffee. The server promptly apologized for the mix up. This could have cost me a precious night of sleep.  The staff made my head spin as they ran around with confused looks on their faces, loudly speaking to each other over the unbearable cacophony heard throughout the restaurant.   THE WORST.

5GfpUQS2as0stLXTyKmWOA.text: Overall, I thought the food was excellent. I would definitely suggest ordering the seafood tower, any of the steaks, brussel sprouts, and the bacon appetizer. The wine menu is extensive, giving you plenty of options. The only things I wish they had on the menu was a bone-in filet and a mac n cheese side item. The service was outstanding by the staff. My only complaint on this restaurant is it was too loud in the dining area as the low ceilings create loud acoustics. Overall, it's a great restaurant for anyone who wants a great steak in Las Vegas.

2aoFUTVNeYTk77VG9LoChQ.text: Food was good. Wagyu steak looked amazing Slightly on the pricier side. However service was prompt They have a lot of selections to choose from. The ambience here is phenomenal as it takes you back to the roots. Would definitely come back if there was more availability of their lunch menu into their dinner menu. Staff was very pleasant to deal with and they even remembered us from last time which is great knowing you are being acknowledged

I1mdMjE-uBRuzVsvUMGjCA.text: Very Nice Steakhouse Inside Venetian Along Restaurant Row. Started Our Evening in The Bar then Moved to the Main Dining Room. Business Casual Ambiance.       Lounge/Bar is Awesome! Very comfortable and Spacious, Live Piano Music Really Sets the Mood! The Bartender Paul was Top Notch, Personable and Professional! Food available at the Bar as well, Look Forward To Dining Here Our Next Visit.       Main Dining Room is Elegant and Vibrant but also quite loud for a Steakhouse. Our Waiter Tom was Really quite Attentive & Helpful With Menu Selections.       FOOD/DRINKS: Appreciate the Whiskey/Scotch List With Many Favorable/Unique Selections Available! The Side Dish of Creamed Corn was a definite winner! Along With Boston Creampie For Dessert was Perfect!

6eoj4f1XTc6ZjoW12Oij2w.text: Delmonico still ranks as one of the best in Vegas!   I used to be in Vegas every few months for the various fashion conferences, where I'd fly in from NYC and peruse the Trade Shows, dine like a champ, and party like a Rock Star.    Delmonico at the time was always one of my favorites.      I stopped through here last month and dined at the bar.  The service was great, and I enjoyed seeing their selection of Whiskey and Scotch, along with their DEEP selection of Bourbons.  Now Bourbon is not my thing, but I could appreciate their assortment.      I used to dine on their blackened Rib Eye here, but in my older age I am more a NY Strip guy.  Theirs did not disappoint.   The Maitre'd Butter as it melted over the seasoned steak was outstanding.     In Vegas dining establishments come and go.  This joint has been around nearly 20 years and when you eat here you can see and taste why.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An outstanding Bone - In NY Strip Steak

c6q1uV0WbD1y-gPNCmn2aA.text: Romantic, excellent service great appetizers and wine but the Steak didn't hold a candle to III Forks in Dallas or Peter Luger's in NY.  I would say the steak would rank in the low end of my top 20 list but for the price of the top of my list. Everything else was excellent so 4 stars...

tKFDdiQ7rGMsdxgvIz2Sxg.text: Delminoco's has excellent food and service. We went for my boyfriends birthday and he received a nice hand written letter plus delicious sorbet. I had the filet mignon which was cooked exactly as I wanted it (medium, pink throughout) and well seasoned. The Brussels sprouts with bacon are wonderful. We also had the wedge salad and I really liked that it had crab in it, that was a unique touch. The service was excellent throughout our meal! Definitely come here if you want a great meal.

J6n6iee5PS5a70RS2sAzQA.text: "Too much of anything is bad, but too much good whiskey is barely enough" - M. Twain  Loaded with more whiskey than most whiskey drinkers will ever try, I think Delmonico still boasts the largest selection of whiskey in Vegas...I know they did in the recent past. Either way, there are a plethora of whiskey options to elevate your safe, Emeril, food choices while at Delmonico.   Delmonico is also home to a fantastic craft cocktail program...seriously one of the best in town...and also the reason that you should visit every so often. This as actually rather troublesome for me because given their range of whiskeys I'm forced to choose between flights whiskey, pours of favorites that you can't find most places and excellent craft cocktails...and the craft cocktails include every type of spirit, so even the problematic non-whiskey lovers can enjoy something amazing.  Suffice it to say, Delmonico is home to 5 star adult beverages with typical 3.5 star Emeril Lagasse food.

YnHForo-cE3X-yki6EVGyg.text: We reserved for Delmonico Steakhouse days prior to us arriving as it would be my family's NYE dinner. The place itself is pretty reminiscent of Flemming's but more upscale since it's a fine dining restaurant. It was bigger than I thought as it had many rooms behind the piano bar area which is what onlookers usually see and it's located in the Venetian/Palazzo.  The Food:  Appetizers: Salmon Mousse, Duck Ravioli, and Parmesan Truffle chips. The Salmon Mousse and Duck Ravioli were perhaps something that one had to get acquired to. They were still very good however, and they had caviar on top of the Mousse. My favorite was the Parmesan Truffle Chips. Honestly, you can't go wrong with this, hence why most of the reviews speak so highly of it.  Entree: Surf and Turf - It was a NYE special that included a Wagyu Steak and Lobster. It's just as delicious as it sounds and left everyone at the table satisfied with praise for the chef.  Dessert: Root Beer Float, Caramel Cake, Triple Chocolate German Cake, Key Lime Pie - all very very good and not overwhelmingly sweet. The perfect refreshing end to a rich dinner. The best of the four was the Caramel Cake - it was sweet, fluffy, and savory.  The service was very quick and waiters were super attentive. I could definitely tell they were busy that night but honestly I have to hand it to them for working so hard on NYE.

anM3uWHIkkj_22pQBleSXQ.text: Wow! One of the best steaks I ever had! My wife and I went for our anniversary. The staff was very professional and very attentive. We mentioned our anniversary when we made reservations, and they gave us a nice card and an appetizer on the house. This is definitely one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas and a must when you visit there. The steak was phenomenal and my wife loved the scallops. The spinach and brussell sprout sides were amazing. They gave us a gelato to cleanse our palates with chocolate drizzled on the dish saying "Happy Anniversary", what a classy touch. Will definitely be back again next year!

jDpTiAR5GxTxEei0kuQctw.text: If you want a perfectly executed, consistent steak, this place is where you go.  Everything is the gold standard.   I had a medium rare ribeye that was wonderful.  Sides were great and the bread.... so good that you can just eat the bread alone.  My biggest issue, it's boring.  Really boring.  If you've had an expense account like me due to work, you eat at these places every month and although it's great, it gets boring.   Same type of people, same type of customers, dressed the same way.     I know... first world problems.

QmN5AoBv9XLSujZMJzCX0w.text: My wife & I went here for my birthday dinner. Everything we ordered was very good. We ordered the Truffle & Parmesan Potato Chips & Heirloom Tomato Soup for starters. Both were very good. For our main course I had the Bone In Ribeye & my wife had the Petite Filet Mignon. Both were cooked to our desired doneness and were very delicious. The sides were also good especially the Creamed Corn Gratinee. I was surprised with a complimentary birthday banana ice cream. We also ordered the Banana Cream Pie. Both were pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Smashed Potatoes
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary Birthday ice cream
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Emeril&#39;s Banana Cream Pie

hqI0becdIb2oLUbdxWwNFw.text: Went back to Delmonico and had the tasting menu with wine pairing.  A great culinary experience!  This is a pricey option but a good value if you are looking for a splurge. Jeff the chef was friendly, talented, and personally brought out the courses. Sommelier Dylan --i think that's his name -- was friendly and informative and was spot on with pairing. The courses were delicious and generous. The other staff provided impeccable service. I would definitely do this again.

BFl-7I0xOB7uzdvKLX-Uww.text: My date and I and the surf and turf. It was cooked perfectly. Service was good. It is the best steakhouse I have eaten.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food and great service

pSHJpti6SfYIK3XhHzvrXg.text: This steakhouse is sub par and the only reason why it is receiving two stars is bc of the great customer service they have. We ordered half a dozen oyster and only received 5. Our ribeye was super bland and the quality of meat was not very good quality for a steakhouse. The garlic mushrooms and sea bass were decent.   The only reason why we notice we only received 5 oysters was my father an I were both sharing so that meant we got 3 each. So we typically cheers when we have one and after the second one we notice and notify our server assistant and he then said ok. We wait ten minutes for them to bring out 1 oyster. It was laughable.   I never been to a steakhouse where there is the average salt and pepper sitting on the table. But I'm assuming it's there bc how bland the food is. Typically a good steakhouse does not have these items on the table bc the steaks are full of flavor. My ribeye was far from flavorful. My ribeye was tough and flavorless. Any other steakhouses on their off day would make a better steak than here.   All in all my sea bass was alright nothing special and the mushrooms were decent. I would not recommend this place to anyone. It was between cut steakhouse and here and I went here bc cut was commitment for the time we wanted to have dinner. No surprise.  I would recommend the steakhouse at circus circus, sw at the Wynn, joes steak at seafood at Caesar's or prime at the bellagio.

r2FYRrtadqbKvNHRQ1NeLA.text: Spot on.   Great food. Great experience. The staff always treats you very well, with respect, dignity and sincerity. We're all equals here and it shows.  It might be pricey for some folks, but you DO get what you pay for. Probably the best steak I ever had. Period.

UCbPbLRfF2n6in-nuwOS6Q.text: My boyfriend and I had NYE dinner at Delmonico and loved it! We chose this place because they were one of the few restaurants that had their regular menu on NYE. The atmosphere is very classy and romantic with fairly dim lights. The service was good. Our waiter did his job quite well.   The food was very good. We got their Bone In Ribeye which was massive. Very juicy and tender and perfectly seasoned. My bf loved it. I got their BBQ Salmon and it was so good! I recommend this dish! Esp since its a dish you can't get anywhere else but here! Definitely get it if you like salmon! For sides we got their creamed spinach and fingerling potatoes. Both were good! I loved the garlic that accompanied the potatoes. Nom Nom. We ended the night with Banana Cream Pie which was so good! Best banana cream pie ever!  Definitely loved Delmonico and will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in ribeye, tomato and burrata salad, fingering potato, creamed spinach, BBQ salmon, banana cream pie :)

nGtACcrQLEhz7H1V5HRfkQ.text: Very bland room, very bland sides, steak was tasty but over cooked....the fire alarm went off twice and we were told it happens all the time...service was average at best but the head server, though very nice was full of apologies!! Too many steakhouses in that town to go back...

ylIsq2eIlEAYpTBK1l7Wkw.text: Very professional from start to finish. We were seated in a room off the main dining area that afforded some quiet and privacy that I understand is lacking in some areas of the restaurant. Stuffed dates (get them, they will not disappoint), Piedmontese and angus filets, potatoes gratin. Perfectly cooked, warm plates, wonderful wine paring. So much food. Sides are huge!  Service impeccable. Took about 1.5 hours. Not rushed but well timed. Not that easy to find in the maze that is the Venetian but worth the trip through the casino and stores to get there and definitely worth the price paid. I'd return.

bpZCKfrkWkkFvIF7Wdi0Mg.text: We came here to celebrate our 1st year anniversary as well as my birthday. It was a choice between here and another notable, tv chef's steakhouse. I couldn't be happier with our decision to come. The service was impeccable. The little touches; from our separate birthday and anniversary cards, to a little special bite from the chef, to the delicious complimentary lime sorbet. The wine was amazing. We enjoyed the decor and ambiance. It wasn't too loud and the decor, was by no means over the top, but it wasn't boring. Understated, and classy is how I would describe it. Very romantic. My husband and I shared the 20oz ribeye and it was cooked to perfection, and just enough for two people. The creamed corn corn was out of this world, with a hint of spicy (jalapenos). And the fried Brussels were to die for. Also the BBQ shrimp? Do yourself a favor...get them. But the best part? The banana cream pie! Uhg I wish I could go back in time for just that little (huge) slice of Heaven. When it hits your table, you're gonna think,  "there is no possible way that I'm going to finish this thing." But trust me, you'll find a way. Would come back here every time we visit Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 of The 20oz Bone - In Ribeye and Creamed Corn Gratinée with Charred Brussels Sprouts
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omggggg the Emeril &#39;s BBQ Shrimp
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s the little things

5xDZgOPU0NApF-vHnfQ3pg.text: Excellent restaurant, highly recommend. Food was better than any 5 star restaurant in Vegas.

3cnTdE45VrsS0o4cVhfGog.text: Located inside my favorite hotel Venetian, Delmonico is one of Emeril's restaurant. When you walk in, the decor is very minimal but sophisticated with arched ceilings that makes you feel like you're inside a European gallery.   We ordered the following: -Deviled eggs: delicious! Very creamy, topped with King Crab meat is a plus. -truffle potato chips: good sharable appetizer.  -New Orleans style barbecue shrimp: if you're into Cajun style barbecue shrimp, definitely order this dish. A bit different from the ones we had in New Orleans but still good.  -Lobster bisque: has good amount of chunky Lobster meat, but not the best I've had.  -ribeye: due to pregnancy, I had to order a well done steak. My steak came close to medium well, pink in the inside. I sent the steak back, it came back still not completely well done. Sent it back for the second time and the steak came back as beef jerky.. I expected at least the second time around for them to make a new one as I know the effect of cooking a piece of steak multiple times. Of course I wasn't expecting a well done steak to be juicy and tender but I have had a properly cooked well done steak before that's was not super tough! Flavor on the steak was pretty good, but could not taste the dry aged flavor as much. In the end, the restaurant took this off the bill, which was a nice gesture.  -sides: Creamy corn (very good), mushrooms (a bit salty but good flavor), twice baked potatoes (good).   Overall, I would give this restaurant 3 and a half stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushrooms
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea bass
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamed corn

zwhQh7xRqEFlMr5ZDErIgg.text: My husband and I came out to Vegas for a mini vacation. Along the way he wanted to try a good steak dinner and boy we found it!   I ordered the bone out ribeye and my husband ordered the Japanese Wagyu. Side dishes were the mushrooms and steak fries. 2 bottles of Syrah for drinks and banana cream pie for dessert.   Everyone from the hostess to the bussers and servers were nothing short of gracious. Our server was John and he was outstanding with his wine recommendations and overall service.   Our steaks were cooked perfectly, our glasses were never empty. Definitely an experience to remember. Delmonico's will be a destination for us every time we come to the city.

ho7ZJ6cCt9tCwhjQHUrjDw.text: My experience at Delmonico was fabulous in every way. Service (especially with my large group) was superb. My last visit was my second time dining here. I must say, both of my visits have been an outstanding five-star dining extravaganza.   The restaurant was bustling for the Global Gaming Expo this past fall. We had reservations and were seated right away at a large table to accommodate our group of 9 guests. We were seated off the main dining room in a dimply lit secluded area that helped enhanced conversation and provided a more intimate dining experience.   We were promptly served our craft cocktails and wine as we browsed the menu for our dinner options. We all had a really tough time deciding on the dishes since everything looked and sounded incredible. Out waitress was on top of her game and cheerfully provided her recommendations to the group.  We ended up ordering a mix of entrees/ sides/ starters/ cocktails/ wine and sweets including a handful of Bone-In Rib-eyes (check out the photo- holy guacamole..) Bone-In NY Strips, Twice Baked Potatoes, Asparagus, Wild Mushrooms, Potato Au Gratin, Lobster Bisque, Wedge Salads with blue cheese crumbles, Banana Cream Pie, and coffee to top it off.   My guests and I were blown away by the food and service experience. Our favorite dish of the night was, you guessed it, the Bone-In Rib-eye steaks. They were seasoned perfectly with an awesome rub with hints of Cajun inspiration and topped with dab of butter. Yum. It is the best steak I've had to date. Simply divine!   The sides were large and intended to be shared and passed. We enjoyed the classic steak and potato combos and broke it up with some mixed green salads, asparagus and mushrooms. Everything was cooked perfectly and tasted heavenly. We stuffed ourselves in a Thanksgiving fashion and had a wonderful and memorable evening.   I will undoubtedly be returning for another amazing experience in the future! Kudos to the entire staff for making this an amazing dining experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pistachio ice cream with chocolate cake
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana cream pie for the table...
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib-Eye - Bone in

sTdmx2PjNhoQ-SpjU6pD2w.text: This is our third visit to Delmonico's Steakhouse. It is always a must during our Vegas trip. This year we celebrated my husband's 40th Birthday with dinner at Delmonico's and they didn't disappoint. I had the bone in NY strip with a side of creamed corn. The steak was made to perfection and I'm not sure what they do to the creamed corn but it is delicious. My brother in law tried the sea bass. He raved about it. The service here is wonderful. Their attention to detail make all the difference. In our opinion it is an expensive dinner that is well worth the money for a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Emeril&#39;s Banana Cream Pie
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary Banana sherbet for the birthday guy
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in NY Bone - In NY Strip Steak

fjlJ2g97E6y7JRZ9Dc55Rw.text: Came here as a recommendation from my brother and his wife. They had only been here for their lunch, but we came for their dinner.  Easy to make a reservation through yelp via open table. Confirmed.  Came here and ordered their famous bone-in-ribeye. Had the oysters and shrimp for appetizer. Cream spinach as a side to share.   Oysters: Sort of like the Rockerfeller oysters... I liked it. Not the best but it was good.  Shrimp: The sauce was Louisiana style, good but the shrimp was cooked too long. It came out a little 'old'.   Bone in Ribeye: The flavors were strong and was there. It had that distinct iron? grilled tast to it. Juicy as well but too chewy for me. Some parts were a bit dry.But it is huge!  Creme spinach: Too salty for me but other then that, good.  Food: a-ok, 3 stars. Service: 5 stars.  Why? We told them we were going to catch the show for Ka at the MGM Grand and seating started at 7:30. They made sure everything came out fast and had our check ready for us so we would leave in time. I didn't feel rushed at all, and they were glad to help us out. Thank you! :)  I would recommend going there once.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They call it baked oysters but pretty much Rockerfeller oysters :)
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Louisiana style shrimp with a mini biscuit,

iE8Nu8Rwx-QCCZKO-RHbfg.text: We have been to many steakhouses in Vegas, NYC and around the country and this rates right with the best of them.  My wife and I shared an appitizer of tomato and Mazzarella which was very good. She had the rib eye and I had the filet mignon. Both were cooked perfectly and tasted so good. For dessert we had their famous banana cream pie. I highly recommend it and it is enough for two. Also-their espresso was excellent.   The atmosphere is loud and full of energy. The decor us somewhat plain but nice and clean. Our server was very good and professional. This is a Vegas restaurant I would come back to.

jyZ4QLaOlGO0_2dOFdB6xg.text: I absolutely love treated myself to an awesome steak dinner at least once a month. Was there last week for March Madness and came here with my boyfriend and a couple other friends. Our server, Frank, was amazing!!! We all felt really comfortable with him and felt at home. He made our experience very memorable. We talked about music, life, our home heritage and all sorts of stuff. I hope he's working next time we are in town. As for the food I ordered the wagyu filet which was thee best piece of meat I've ever had!!!

4rdQe8sI1wmj4MG4wiCrGw.text: I recently stayed two nights in Vegas. I went to B&B one night and Delmonico the second. The food was excellent quality at both places. But the service and the atmosphere fell very short at Delmonico's. I was dining alone so maybe the server didn't think he needed to attend to me but the night before I had amazing service at B&B so I had an expectation of what a $100 dining experience should be like.   I told the server I would like a glass of red wine when my steak was delivered. I waited ten minutes before it was brought out. I used to wait tables... for a decade. I'm a reasonable patron. I think fine dining demands something above diner level service.  So despite a delicious steak and a tasty martini, the rowdy classless crowd and the crappy service will keep me from coming back.

Pb03P-HvQK3tEnTVxC2xHg.text: This restaurant was top notch. The food was tremendous and so was the service. The atmosphere was sophisticated and simple at the same time. I highly recommend this restaurant for a formal dinner.

s31EJGwccCMGeXjHEVZSng.text: Great ambiance. Great Service. things we ordered 3.5  -Emeril's New Orleans Barbecue Shrimp: This was not good. I would have rather had just shrimp and salt. -Ahi Tuna & Salmon Tartare: This was average. It was tasty, I enjoyed it but nothing stood out from it.  -Truffle and Parmesan Potato Chips: Guys at our table couldn't get enough of it. It was really good. The truffle oil was amazing! -Caesar Salad Prepared Tableside for Two: This was okay. It was kinda cool they made it for you on the side fresh. Small portion for the cost.  -Bone-in Ribeye: This was very juicy, had tons of flavor. There were some spots where it was very chewy but still very good.  The portion size was very big. Some of the guys could not finish it. -New Orleans Creamed Spinach- I didnt like it at first but I acquired the taste and thought it was tasty by the last bite I had. -Creamed Corn Gratinee - VERY GOOD. first item to go at our table Sauteed Garlic Wild Mushrooms- great mushrooms, hard to mess it up. but a good compliment to the steak  -Pecan Pie - First off I like pecna -Emeril's Banana Cream Pie - This was good one of the better banana cream pie I had, but the pecan pie was just too good that this just tasted alright.

7KZwMWoHInoCiwW7DOWbNA.text: Marginal at best.  No atmosphere, bare cream walls.  One bathroom, not too clean for a large restaurant.  Maybe it was an off night, but I found it not great at all.  I have read all of the reviews and I dont get it.

jXEaaJIF7LCp3ffm2cKXsg.text: We have eaten here multiple times over the years.  We have enjoyed the chef's table on 3 different occasions, including a family dinner the night before my sister-in-law got married.    The service is wonderful and we have never had bad service in the dining room, bar or chef's table.   The food is spectacular.  If you are a carnivore - thls is will be a religious experience.   The steaks, lamb chops, foie gras, fresh raw oysters, and   A couple of things not to miss:         Appetizers: N.O. barbecue shrimp,  truffle, parmesan potato chips         Entrees:  American Buffalo ribeye, the bone-in ribeye, lamb chops         Dessert:  brioche bread pudding, Delmonico chocolate cake  Wine List:  I swear the darn book weighs 10 pounds.  They have an extensive wine list and it can be intimidating.  I have found the sommelier  has always been approachable (some restaurants have sommeliers that are kind of snotty or stand offish) and helpful.  Adult Beverages:  I like champagne and wine but they have some really nice cocktails and I would suggest trying one or two.        The Lady Lychee      A Tale of Two Cherries      La Flor Mayor - for a little kick    They also have an impressive list of whiskey & whisky.  There are several seating areas of the restaurant, so you can have an intimate meal, a family get together or enjoy a group of friends.  I enjoy sitting on the long bench because it is comfy and I can people watch.  If you have a special event, reserve the Chef's Table but show up hungry because they are going to FEED YOU!  No tasting size dishes and they will toss in a surprise or two.  Like the time we had a wonderful ribeye main course, and thinking we were getting dessert, in walks another main course!  A spectacular lamb chop that was the best I have ever eaten.    And if you are just looking for some munchies and a drink - visit the bar.  Michelle is a great bartender and the food is the best bar food you will find.  Or need your Emeril dessert fix - pop into the bar and have a dessert with a vintage cocktail.

P6X2rCNxNdqskWizcylcKg.text: UPDATE -   Delmonico / Emeril's staff reached out to me via Yelp a couple of days after I posted the review, and I ended up having a good conversation with their Director of Operations in Las Vegas.  Mike told me he reviewed the events of the evening with the staff at Delmonico, including the mistakes that were made and ways to ensure it doesn't happen in the future.  He asked that I give them another chance and let him know when I'm going to be in Vegas again, which I most certainly will.   I'm very impressed with their response and how they took the review as an opportunity to improve.   ORIGINAL REVIEW -   One of the worst high end Las Vegas restaurant experiences I've ever had.  Dinner started out alright.  Larger party of 15, restaurant spread us across 2 tables instead of handling us as one; acceptable, but not thrilling. Initial greeting with menus and wine lists was prompt and fast.   After that, follow up service to get drink orders and appetizers was very slow. Orders were finally taken and again, return to deliver the drinks took a while.   When time came to order, my wife and I were among the first in the group.  I ordered a tableside Caesar for 2, a Special bone in filet medium rare for my wife and a special bone in filet blue (think less cooked than rare, if you don't know it) for myself.   The pop-overs are fantastic, and the tableside Caesar was great. The gentleman who prepared it was kind enough to give me a couple of hints how they do the Caesar dressing which I'm looking forward to trying in my own Caesar dressing.   At this point, the wheels came off the bus. I finished my glass of wine with the Caesar and tried repeatedly to signal our waiter John for another glass and failed. My wife got into trying to get his attention as well and failed multiple times before finally succeeding.   Rough bus, meet out of control bus. Dinner arrives, and my wife and I are simultaneously served Bone In Ribeyes. Hers medium rare, mine blue (our order was Filets - medium rare and blue). We promptly object and are corrected at first by the waitstaff that we got what we ordered (we never order Ribeyes as we both like our steaks too rare for a ribeye's flavor to come out).  The waiter comes over after some confusion and tells me he brought me what I ordered. After some quick discussion our incorrect steaks are removed and we're told our Special of the evening, Bone In Filets, are on their way.   Not minutes later, we're told they've sold out of the special and we can have regular filets. Since the rest of our group has already been eating we just say fine, whatever, bring us a medium rare and a blue filet.   Three different people drop by to apologize to us, a total of 8 times across them. Frankly it creeped us out a bit.   When our new steaks finally arrived, they sat them down saying "here is your medium and rare filets".  When we cut in to them, we did get 1 medium and 1 rare filet but 0 medium rare and 0 blue filets. We just accepted them and went forth.    The flavor of the filets were good, as was the texture and seasoning.   After the steak disaster, I did not have to struggle to get another glass of wine fortunately!!  I can't say the side of grits with cheese and bacon was all that great since it sat there getting cold and congealing the whole time they were figuring out the steak issue.   We passed on dessert, having lost all confidence on the restaurant. We did order a decaf coffee and a 10 year tawny port for me. The waiter offered to buy the port for me, i.e. comp it, but that seems a small consolation compared to blowing the whole main course in such an epic fashion.   Can't recommend you avoid Delmonico enough. With so many other options around here, don't risk wasting your hard earned dollar (or luckily won one) here.

ndYpjttFsZErShaqFUfR-g.text: Went to Vegas with the husband to celebrate our 10 year anniversary and take that honeymoon that had been postponed for far too long.  One of the reasons we booked at the Venetian was to dine at Delmonico Steakhouse.  We originally made a reservation for lunch on Sunday but moved it to dinner as the husband was worried lunch service didn't offer all the varieties of steak.  Made the mistake of booking for 9 pm on Monday, August 20th.  The hotel was packed with a new rush of guests as was the restaurant.  Enjoyed a drink in the bar before being seated and were then led to a small table where we were introduced to Josh, our primary server.  Josh informed us that we would have 3 servers that evening one of which would be a sommelier.    We perused the wine list and then Lamont came over and asked "if anyone had explained the menu" to us - a jarring question in a fine dining establishment.  We decided to start with wine by the glass as we didn't want a full bottle at that point.  I asked Lamont about a blend on the list -- I inquired as to what was in the blend.  He asked me what I meant.  I clarified by saying what types of wines are used to make the blend.  He rattled off one variety and then said "and I think a Cabernet is in there".  Lamont made no offer to explain or recommend any other wines.  We ordered two glasses of Malbec, our appetizer and entrees.  My husband asked Lamont if he could get a side of garlic butter.  Lamont said no - they don't have garlic butter.  Really?!  This is an Emeril Lagasse restaurant!  He asked for a side of plain butter and we sent Lamont on his way.    A food runner, or possibly our third server (he never introduced himself), delivered a complimentary appetizer of tuna atop a crostini which I enjoyed but the husband did not.  Josh came back with our wines.  We inquired as to whether Lamont was the sommelier that Josh had mentioned earlier and he affirmed that he was.  We expressed our surprise and disbelief yet Josh did not follow up with any inquiry as to why we asked the question.  At this point I had to talk my husband out of storming out of the restaurant.  Josh did not alert the floor manager of our question or our discontent.  It is unclear if this was because of poor training or due to the staff not being able to handle when the restaurant is full.  Our salad with arugula, granny smith apples, prosciutto and champagne vinaigrette arrived and was very tasty.  We started to move past the negativity and then waited and waited for our entrees.  The husband ordered another glass of Malbec and asked for more bread, which never came.  The steaks were quite good but the extra butter was not delivered.  The twice baked potato was yummy and the side of mushrooms was divine.    The espresso creme brulee and pecan pie desserts were very good and we appreciated the complimentary banana gelato with 'Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate on the plate but it still wasn't enough to make up for the fact that our servers' poor performance ruined an experience we looked forward to for months.  I would have given Delmonico Steakhouse one star due to the service but gave it two because of the food.  We expected much more.  I suggest you go somewhere else.  FYI - Delmonico Steakhouse is a large restaurant that seats approximately 100 patrons.  The women's restroom has 2 stalls.

xv_OaO7A4Q_svmGpPNA8sQ.text: I'm a simple dude.  I'm a thrifty dude.  When you combine the two, it's a wonder when I spend $40 on an entire night out.  So it was a significant deal for me to set foot into a place where a plate of food is on par with my average bar tab.  It was a special occasion so I shelved my cheap-skate side for the evening.  Thank god I did.  My wife and I arrived early and had a drink at the bar.  The bartenders were exactly what I look for in one: chill, conversational, intelligent but not lording their smarts over you, and just nice dudes.  Our drinks were great (though I did have to swat at one fruit fly, but that happens).  Dinner was unlike anything I'd ever had before.  Here's why: - Three servers throughout the course of our evening, and all of them were great - I was able to get a black napkin without asking - The table was perfectly sized; I didn't feel like I was going to nail someone with an elbow when they were sitting next to me - My wife ordered a Cesar salad which we split.  The thing was hand-prepared at our table and it was amazing - I ordered duck.  I'd never had duck before and felt this was a perfect opportunity to do so.  I expected a breast or perhaps a thigh--not a half of a duck.  From bite one to cleaning the bones, it was spectacular -Everyone at the table completely cleaned their plates (or had the intention of doing so if we didn't run out of time before our show--not for the sake of service, rather solid conversation).  Not one dissatisfied customer  Should I come into a small fortune in the future, I'll certainly come back.  Until then, I'll just have to dream.

wA9wTqRd_oiuQFk8xlVpxg.text: All I can say is -- get rid of the salt! Wow, food was just okay but the salt level was overboard.

C-bI45l6hz8fvX-NcoUZzA.text: It was above average, not great. Went with my daughter and we both had the filet mignon, the steaks tasted great but were cooked inconsistently. The surprise hit was the appetizer - tuna carpaccio which was simply amazing and made the meal.

CyZFXdnTCgpnKHNtIiKvaQ.text: The service was great. The appetizer bread was stale. The lunchtime burger was good but definitely overpriced, much better burgers at umami burger. The lobster sliders were decent.

asXfvqaOplmAuKqRRPQlWQ.text: i had the bbq salmon and it was wow perfect, yummmmm...the service was excellent also, side of their garlic mashed potatoes were fantastic also, definitely be going back

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ SALMON W/ SIDE GARLIC MASHED POTATOES WERE TO DIE FOR, YUMMMMY...PINA COLADA IT WAS THE BEST SALMON EVER

faBb7mhauXe4NkiMSO2YmQ.text: Been here 4 times now. Was in the process of making this place one of those restaurants you gotta visit every time you come into town. Well, I don't feel that way so much any more after our last two visits Service is outstanding.  No complaints when you're pampered.  But there are tons of staff which may explain the prices here. Looked to me like a 3 person team was assigned to 3 tables. Doesn't include the guy bringing the food or the floaters moving about  The quality of the food is merely average. 3 of us went, total bill was $360, no drinks.  The BBQ salmon was good, but the overpowering BBQ sauce hid the salmon flavor. My better half had the rack of lamb which she sent back for more cooking because it was raw in the middle. It came back hotter but nearly as raw. She gave up 1/2 through because of all the fat and the rawness. I tried a rib and found it average.  Costco has rack of lamb. Not as meaty but more flavorful than Delmonico.  But that depends on the chef. I had the bone in rib eye, asked for it med rare but it was mostly raw. The tail end was all fat. The flavor was average. For me, part of the cooking process is to turn a steak into a masterpiece. It starts with a prime cut of beef. Apparently, they were out of prime quality steers. This steak had no marbling, just huge fatty areas and lots of tough connective tissue. The tenderness and the tastiness you find in the outer rim of a rib eye wasn't there.  I had to saw through every piece of this steak. Maybe I had a crappy knife.  We had the cream corn and smashed potatoes, both were average.  Everything here I could have made at home with better quality and with way more flavor for 1/4 the price. So I'll leave with Foodie's Helpful hints: Start with better quality ingredients. Learn what blue, rare, medium rare and so on are. Learn the point when to remove fish from the heat so it retains its natural flavors and moistness. Don't drown anything in sauce.  Spend some time in the kitchen outside working hours, experimenting, getting the broil and grill times right. Add alittle spice to the popovers might make them really stand out. Allow those steaks to sit outside the refrigerator to warm up before plopping them on a grill. It makes a huge difference  Add fresh corn to the creamed corn. Maybe that will add a little crunch instead of leaving a baby food texture. Liven up your tired old spuds. Liven up all your food. Overall the food quality is 2 stars. The service adds another star.   From now on, we will come here only for the $12 slice of Banana Cream Pie, which is to die for unless the quality starts slipping.

FCqZjJ909VxTQ2EjgmdJPQ.text: Fantastic experience. It was our third wedding anniversary. The wait staff was excellent and the Chateaubriand was incredible. The French Onion soup was to die for. I would highly recommend this place, especially for a special occasion.

7dVUVdmWIIXQ5KtF_Plgqw.text: This is my third time I would say in the last 6 years that I have eaten here. Celebrated my brother-in-laws 30th birthday and the STEAKS were awesome. I had the bone-in New York steak medium. It had a perfect char and cooked how a steak needs to be. I am a big fan of the New York because it is a leaner cut. The bone-in Ribeye steak medium rare was what my brother-in-law had and that just melted like butter in your mouth. The creme of corn was outstanding!  The Smashed potatoes were fine. Overall experience was superb and the service has never failed me.

01ZZ9LUOJGeFQmi-P7WsOw.text: Delmonicos is a great restaurant, there is no doubt about that. I ordered a Bone in Rib eye medium rare.  The steak was cooked to perfection.  I felt it lack the salt and pepper seasoning on the crust.  I ended up having to get some finishing salt to give it a little more flavor.    I will go there again if I stay at the Palazzo, but I still have a preference to a couple other steaks houses.  service was great, food was great. just thought the steak could have been a little better seasoned.

-2QZjEm6coyl3YQ7YHeOXA.text: Was excited to go here since it was Emerille's Steakhouse.  We had reservations for 8PM and waited at the bar while they got our table ready. The waiter was really nice and friendly.  They brought us bread which they placed individually on our plates. I started with the spinach and arugula salad, which was super good. I was glad to have had that in my stomach, since it took a while to get our steaks.  I ordered the filet, medium and a side of asparagus.  The steak was seared a little too much and tasted a little burnt.  They also topped it off with a pad of butter.  By no means was it a bad steak, but for the price, I guess I expected more.  The asparagus was good but also very buttery.  Good food, but I have definitely had better.

R-Dncvwg2hoeUnAozD8yaw.text: My girlfriends and I decided to treat ourselves to a nice dinner while in Vegas. Located in the Venetian, the restaurant itself is gorgeous in its simplicity. We were seated promptly, our drinks came in a heart beat, and the staff was very efficient and friendly.   However, I recently had the best steak of my life in Havasu and I find that every steak I've had since then has been found wanting... My medium rare ribeye didn't have as much marbling as I like. It wasn't as succulent. It wasn't as tender. It wasn't seasoned enough. It didn't compare.  Perhaps my expectations of Emeril's restaurant were too high. But of the two appetizers, two sides, two cocktails, and steak that I had that night, the Potatoes Gratin was my  favorite dish, which is unfortunate because steak should always be the best part of the meal

fV3nIvIpvlsY0CxmtJyV4g.text: Beyond food coma...it's food paralysis!  The itis ain't got nothin' on this.  I had my preconceptions of the food here but I put them away for a short time and figured I'll try anything once.  Dinner started with some bread with butter and munched on the truffle and parmesan potato chips.  They were very oily, warm, crunchy, savory, and tangy in flavor.  We did not make a dent in them.  The appetizer was soon followed by the lobster bisque and traditional New Orleans gumbo with chicken and andouille sausage.  The lobster bisque was really intense in flavor.  It had an almost bitter flavor but so rich like condensed sweet buttery lobster in sea water.  The protein that night was the bone-in ribeye which we split.  Perfectly cooked to medium, it had a nice crust on the outside and had a big glob of butter on top.  I immediately scraped the butter off and put it on the side but a lot of it had already melted onto the plate or penetrated the meat.  The meat was thick, tender, juicy, had perfect grill marks on the outside, and smelled floral due to the either rosemary or thyme sprigs.  Accompanying the main dish was the seared foie gras.  Yes, I had to try the duck (or goose) liver.  It was indeed buttery, silky, melt in your mouth tender and a good sized piece at that.  Like everything else here, it was seared in butter and had a salty, buttery crust to it.  As for the sides, we had sauteed garlic wild mushrooms and the creamed corn gratinee.  The mushrooms were delightful.  I loved forking up different varieties that I had no idea what they were.  They just tasted great.  The garlicky, buttery flavor and tender yet almost slippery texture makes this dish my favorite of the night.  The creamed corn also exhibited buttery flavor so much I think it was in a bath of butter and heavy cream.  You couldn't have all this great food without wine and they have an impressive wine menu indeed.  I went with that I know and got the syrah.  Toward the end of the meal it hit me.  The wall...of carbs, butter, salt, cholesterol, all in a sluggish soup coursing though my veins like molasses.  I feel my heart straining to pump the blood with heavy thumps and I feel the arteries of my wrist bumping against the table.  My body starts to get lethargic - I don't wanna move, no I can't move - as I gaze blankly over the huge leftovers of corn and butter.  This is beyond food coma, I need a blood transfusion I thought.  Need I be more dramatic?  My preconceptions were right.  On the bright side, the service is impeccable here and everyone seems to to take their job seriously and sincerely.  It is a bit of a formal atmosphere but you don't feel like you're in Las Vegas for the short time you're there.

oE7r4Sdkm9mH8Bqe5t9glg.text: too many places to eat in vegas! but, im not the type of girl who can ever turn down steak, so off to delmonico's it was  what i ate: - heirloom tomato and burrata salad: caprese salad, all grown up! the heirloom tomatoes were delicious, juicy, and flavorful. the burrata cheese, gooey, creamy, the perfect delicate match to the tomatoes. the syrupy sharp balsamic vinegar reduction made everything go POP with flavor. my only gripe was that i wish there was more basil to bring in the fresh flavor. regardless, this was pretty damn good - [special of the day] beef medallions with mushrooms and parm: the beef had a nice bite to it, the mushrooms and sauce were to die for, but i wondered if i should have just opted for a nice steak - baked potato w/everything on it [side]: cheesy perfection - haricots verts [side]: perfectly cooked string beans with garlic and almonds - mushrooms [side]: a nice mix of mushrooms, this would make any mushroom lover happy - banana cream pie: i love banana cream pie, but lets be honest, all banana cream pies pretty much taste the same, right? wrong! this banana cream pie was perfectly layered. oh man, i could have eaten this entire thing all by myself, but sharing is caring! - coffee: coffee lovers beware! the coffee is so good (french pressed) that im tempted to just come back for a slice of the banana cream pie and coffee next time im in town!  pros: - food: food was perfect. everything was delicious - service: friendly, polite, helpful. our server helped me pick out a GREAT wine in the price point i wanted - free bruschetta starter. when i called to make the rez i let them know it was for a birthday - free banana sorbet for the birthday girl - bathrooms were clean and well stocked! my stall even had a lil basket of tampons. how thoughtful! ;)  cons: - good food and good service comes with a price... but, to be honest, considering how much we ate, and having a bottle of wine, it was not any more expensive than i thought it would be. our entire meal, plus tax and tip came out about $500, which is very reasonable cause it was for five girls... it also helped that i won a few bills gambling earlier that day :P - reservations: i was able to get a rez for a late dinner, which is what i wanted anyways, but if youre planning on being in vegas, it would be smart to call to make a rez ahead of time if you like eating your dinner at the regular dinner time - loud: im not sure if its due to the dome shaped ceilings, but voices CARRIED. i guess you have to expect that though from a steak house - full of dates and GUYS  would i come again? if i won some extra cash gambling and craving steak, YES!

QRAcv6_RflqgWbJ0ZV55sA.text: I had the privilege of coming here in honor of two fo my friends' birthdays last month. Being the type of guy who rarely eats at anywhere higher than a two $ sign establishment, I'd have to say this is by far the best dining experience I've ever had in my life, so far.  Our night started off with a VERY informative waiter showing us the ropes. It makes sense why these servers make the money they make, they are extremely good at their job and know the menu and wine pairings like the back of their hand. ..at least the server we had was of this caliber.  For starters, we had the Truffle Parmesean potato chips. These things are incredible. It's one of those dishes where you just want to savor each bite one chip at a time. SO GOOD.  We also tried the Lobster Bisque. Best Lobster Bisque I've ever had. Very smooth, rich in lobster flavor, and not too overly salty. Some fresh cracked pepper makes it just absolutely perfect.  My two friends went for the chateaubriand. An exquisite cut of tenderloin(same cut as filet mignon) SO tender that it just nearly melts in your mouth.  I had the Bone in Rib-eye. Quite possibly the best steak I've ever had in my life. I ordered it medium rare. It was cooked perfectly, and once I had a taste, I just had to close my eyes and shut down all my other senses so that I can thorougly enjoy this. It was quite a big steak, but with the price I paid and the epic state of mind I was in, I finished it knowing that I couldn't leave all that buttery meaty goodness behind unfinished.  That on top of a bottle of wine and a few sides, our meal came out to be.. well.. expensive. But SO WORTH IT.

hnjdgRQZA-MmR_r-db_qAQ.text: Last time I ate at this fine establishment, I uttered the words, "This is the best meal of my life."  I got this Linguine with pesto, chicken and pine nuts (yes I know, I ordered pasta at a steakhouse), but it was well worth it!  Emeril knows what he's doing no matter what the dish you order.    Their tartar is absolutely fantastic as well.   Service is unlike nothing I've ever experienced.  Even though it's pricey and fancy, even if you can get here just once in your life, it's worth it!!!  PS - Good beers and wines!

0s99-R5RdMJYbW7k8Kvk2A.text: The steaks here are perfectly cooked!   I topped by bone-in ribeye with a serving of seared foie gras. The meal was rich, decadent, and as everything I imagined it to be! I even split the steak and left very, very full. The foie gras reminded me of when I ate my way through eastern Europe 4 years ago. I've had a really tough time finding comparable seared foie gras State-side until I came here.  All of the sides were delicious. I think I had the creamed corn, spinach, and mushrooms.  Skip the BBQ shrimp. It was a big disappointment coming from a man who prides himself in creole/cajun cooking.  The restaurant itself is really intimate. The ceilings are low and vaulted, so it's like you're in an underground church or something. My one gripe is that it's a little noisy because of the set up.   Of course, the service was wonderful, as expected. We were a group of 12 or so girls, there for a bachelorette party, and they handled us efficiently and graciously.  It's a great place to go if you're up on poker and want to splurge on a big slice of meat!

XMDu82T-8ALsCiwsNJKasg.text: Delmonico's in The Venetian is without a shadow of a doubt serving up the best steaks in vegas.  The staff are attentive without being intrusive, the wine list is glorious and 'The Whisky Bible' went down a treat with a table full of Scot's.  Great steak, great service, first class restaurant.

CA-TNm0XSrp0tWXcHil8uA.text: I usually love Delmonicos but my last trip kept me wanting more. Maybe I was too hungover to thoroughly enjoy my meal, but on this blurry Saturday night everything was very mediocre for me. We started off with the steak tartare and the bbq shrimp. The steak tartare was very good. It was fresh, clean and delicious. The bbq shrimp was good, but for $18 for 4 shrimps, I wanted them to be a party in my mouth, and in this case, they were not. I ordered a medium rare rib eye. It was cooked to absolute perfection. Nice crust and juicy pink center. I marveled at the perfection of my steak. Although it was slightly under seasoned it was still juicy and delicious.  Delmonico's is probably one of the best if not thee best steakhouses I've been to. Their service is spectacular and on point every time I've been. They really do hire the best of the best. Attentive but not overbearing servers.  Delmonicos puts out some amazing and good quality food. If you go, you must try their lobster bisque, it's luscious, creamy and definitely worth the calories. Potato gratin is definitely one of their best sides also. And of course, don't every steer from what you came for, the STEAK!  Emeril, you slightly let me down this time, but I still remember how good you've been to me the last times. I'll be back to let you redeem yourself.

q39xICBr6bGmy9L05Y35Lg.text: I had expected this Emeril restaurant to be MUCH better than Mortons or Ruth Chris.  Very disappointed as it was just on par. Having tried dozens of steak houses, this was clearly NOT a good performer.  If this is your first time, or have a taste bud for Dennys, this is your gig.  The $57 bone-in rib eye I had was so not tender, cooked raw, just poor when compared to the other non-celebrity famous steak houses (i.e. Metropolitan in Seattle).  The waitor forgot 1/2 my requests, and it was clearly priced as a tourist trap.  Nothing like Emeril restaurant in New Orleans.  Should have known that this be a tourist trap :(  Its too bad, as I really like Emeril and think brings down the name brand he has built up in the past.

yqEwItzFhapeBHWX-3ljPQ.text: Wow, first time. Only place I'd put on Ruth Chris ribeye level. The creamed corn with the bread crumb crust served warm in a pan. Delicious. Asparagus was cooked nicely but bland. Iceberg wedge was good, could easily be shared. Service was perfect. Environment is a little generic and mass market like and a little loud. Large leather Seats are comfy but you really need to be 6ft plus to eat at the table easily. This is the spot for a good ribeye and some yummy creamed corn, hands down.

mJmGzPCPepPPJ0HT4WcClg.text: Hands down, the best meal I've ever had.  My boyfriend and I were 20minutes late to our reservation, but they stil accommodated us within 2minutes after getting there. We had THREE servers: one for wine, one for food, and one for.. I don't even know, just to make us feel like royalty!  We ordered the bone-in rib-eye and the filet mignon. Although the bone-in rib-eye is the most popular steak at the restaurant, my personal favorite is the filet mignon just for its AMAZING tenderness. I'm really bad at describing taste with words, so all I will say is this: perfection. And you HAVE to pair the steaks with the house red wine. It transformed our meal even more.  And for dessert, we got the banana cream pie.. and I wanted to cry. That honestly the best way for me to describe my experience. I took one bite, and wanted to cry. "It was the best tasting dessert I had ever had in my life" is an understatement.  Finally, I loved the look of the restaurant. It wasn't as dimly lit was I thought it would be, which I actually was pleasantly surprised about because I'm tired of not being able to see my food. The design is very minimalist but still very sophisticated.. but not TOO sophisticated that regular folks like my boyfriend and I didn't feel out of place.  Although it was incredibly expensive, the food and the overall experience was so incredible that even my boyfriend, who can be pretty frugal sometimes, said that Delmonico's HAS to be a place we go back to EVERY year. I can't wait for the next time. :)

WLG9JSYS3WyaYFDG_JXzJQ.text: My visit to Delmonico Steakhouse was in August for our annual Wedding Anniversary trip.  A few days ago, we received a postcard from Delmonico Steakhouse - from our waiter Michael Jackson :o) What a nice surprise!!  It was just a short note to say thank you for visiting their establishment and hope to see us soon.    A little late - But here's my review....  Let me start off by saying.. I wasn't too sure about visiting Delmonico Steakhouse since there are sooooo many restaurants that I want to try every time I go to Vegas.  I think we've been to almost ALL the Steak houses in Vegas.  CUT and CRAFT.. some of our favorites.  Upon arrival.. we were seated within 3 minutes - which is a GREAT start.  People that know me are well aware that I do not like waiting.   We were directed to a nice booth area and my husband and I were able to sit by each other to "people watch".   Immediately we were welcomed by our waiter, Michael Jackson.  We started off with 2 glasses of Chardonnay - Light and smooth.  Since I wanted to try so many of the sides and apps.. I decided that I'd just share the steak with my husband..    Sooo Here's what we got: 1. Spinach Frisee Salad with Poached Egg and Candied Bacon Review:  I was pleasantly surprised that the poached egg was encased in Panko crust and DEEP FRIED.  The candied Bacon.. Amazeballs  2. Baked Oysters Review:  6 lovely oysters Baked with Garlic/parsley/Parmeson  - What's not to love!!  3. Fried Potato Chips with Truffle oil and Garlic Review: AMAZEBALLS!!! NOM NOM NOM  Need I say more  4. Creamed Corn Review:  Creamy, Sweet but great texture  5. Grilled Asparagus Review:  Grilled and seasoned to perfection  6. Bone in Rib-Eye Review:  Seared perfectly.  Light Shade of pink - Just how we like it.  7. Pecan Tart Review:  Amazing  We will definitely frequent Delmonico Steakhouse.  The Service, The Quality, The Experience..   Ask for Michael Jackson!!

CHWY-UyHYquonx16s9_32g.text: Great food. Great service too if you're a high roller, no so much for the average diner like me.  The table next to ours had someone on staff stopping by to check on the every few minutes, chat them up, pour more wine, etc.  Our table of six received very mechanical service. Food was dropped off, and no one bothered to ask how the food was or of any of us would like another drink (two of us sat with an empty glass from the middle of the meal onward).  Fine dining is about the overall experience, and Delmonico let me down with poor service.  This was my second visit. I tried to give then a second chance, but this visit only confirmed the poor service from my first.  I will not be going back.

PJLBGBr2IU4rN4RTdEFH0w.text: 4.5 Stars  Delmonico does not disappoint!   I had the wonderful luck of visiting Delmonico for my birthday dinner in Vegas. I was beside myself with excitement to try an Emeril restaurant!  Prior to our 8:30 reservation, we sat in the lounge to take pictures and have a drink. Our hostess came to get us when our table was ready.  We were greeted by our friendly waitress (her name escapes me) and were all seated quickly. She took our drink orders and delivered them quickly. She let me peruse the VAST wine list at my leisure and explained the specials of the evening and gave the market price of the items on the menu.   I decided on the bone-in rib steak with broccoli and bacon cheddar grits. In the meantime, I ordered a bottle of Klinker Brick Zin and our EVER observant, and discreet waitress whispered in my ear to inquire on the preference on whether I would like her to present the bottle just to me or would I like her to present it to the rest of my drunk and (embarrassingly) rowdy guests. What a professional. I won't even get into how I handled the two of my 4 dinner partners and their TERRIBLE manners, but let's just say I won't be seeing them anymore.   Finally, dinner arrived. My steak was beautiful. Well, cooked, not quite as rare as I had hoped, ah well. A rare steak seems to throw cooks, I don't get it. The sides were HUGE and beautiful. The broccoli was fresh and not over steamed so they still had a slight crunch to them. My bacon and cheddar grits were so rich and savory. I could only have a few bites of them before my stomach couldn't take anymore. Delmonico was nice enough to deliver chocolate ice cream at the end and wish me a happy birthday! What a lovely ending to a chaotic dinner!   I hope to enjoy Delmonico again soon, and with better dinner partners!
