We were seated promptly when we arrived, the meal started with a mushroom and creme cheese pastry. Even though I do not care for either ingredient I finished my whole thing! All dishes were beautifully presented, perfectly seasoned and dressed, and absolutely delicious. The service here was impeccable. We had multiple servers and they all worked as a team. We never had to ask for anything because they were always on top of it. Here is an example of the service, Joe was debating between two dessert wines after deciding on one, and they also brought him a sample of the other option. Bam! Great service, great food and great atmosphere! For pictures visit my blog at staci.writesthisblog.com...

6VYgC_yK-PQCXFsqXLSxsA.text: Yes Yes Yes! I'm probably repeating all the great things people said already but it is True. My husband and I were there this past weekend and we were satisfied 100%! And after reading the reviews I'm not sure why people minus the 5th star because of the price. In my opinion if you are looking for an amazing fine dining experience you must be wiling to spend the money. We were here for about three hours and we enjoyed every bit of it. We let our waiter know in advance that we were in no rush and he made sure to plan the timing of our appetizers and main just right. We were watching the blue man group after dinner and wanted to drink a few drinks before we left.  Every time we went to the bathroom they folded our napkins, refilled our drinks before we even had time to ask, and our waiter was extremely knowledgeable about the menu --- that alone just shows the attention to detail. In addition to the lobster bisque, french escargot, cream corn gratinne, creole gulf shirmp cocktail...:) I had the hot Alaskan King Crab Legs and my husband had the Bone in RibEye. He said "it is the best steak he has ever had" ( please take in consideration that we had travel all over the world).  The noise was moderate, besides I'm in Vegas and I wanted to dine in a lively and happy place not a quiet boring place.  Even though the dining room was open it is still cozy and romantic and easy to have a private conversation.    It has become one of our favorite places to go and we will definitely come back again!

rAYfU6tXFysAeztKeCmyfQ.text: Omg if you want a really big, soft, juicy steak seasoned and cooked perfectly you have got to come here! My gf and I both got what they are known for which is their bone in rib eye. Just a heads up though, only get this is you are starving because this piece of meat is HUGE! I swear it must've been a 12oz! I almost forgot to mention that we also had the lobster bisque and this was also delicious! Words cannot describe how good the food is here, even the service is awesome! If you are starving and craving for some really good food you HAVE to try this place! The only downfall is their chairs don't have wheels on them so you can't be rolled out!

0BIlHKq5vvSdORcyIUI_SA.text: Bone in Ribeye Filet - 5 Star Green Bean Almodine - 5 Star Wine pairing - 5 Star Pecan pie - 5 Star  5 Star place with 5 Star food and staff. I had the special bone-in Ribeye filet with wine pairing. The food and service fabulous. After dinner the chef even came out to talk to me.   This was the best food and restaurant experience I have ever had.

PMC7QNTTmeDomzdc35_a9g.text: This was probably the highlight on my last Vegas trip.  I read a few reviews from some of my favorite Yelpers about their experience in this place. Truth to be told, I was little envy, but was also very excited to finally get to go here after missing out two years ago.  I'm not really big on name of a chef nor do I care about so much about the branding of the place. Here's the funny thing.... I was excited in going to Dan Marino's place only because it was in HOOTERS.   See, it really doesn't amount to much.  My dining companion and I made a lunchtime reservation after realizing we couldn't squeezed all the places we wanted to go on this trip. We had already set up a reservation for dinner at Bouchon (at the same hotel at the Venetian) later on the night, so we compromised and reserved a table for Delmonico's for lunch.  It was an adventure finding place along the restaurant row. We had a harder time finding Bouchon later on the evening, but to get it out the way....this place is next to Aquaknox and the entrance is all the way towards the end of the hall.  The place was specular. Very classy and refine by the elegance of the look to the place. it's a bit more than what I expected for a fine dining. I guess I was assuming steakhouse in the form of Morton's, but this place outdone itself by making it more classier and upscale than any of the Morton's.  For lunch, it was casual. Not dressy as it was listed in the profile.  The lunch menu was very limited. I was almost going to be sorely disappointed because the menu's best item was dry beef sirloin. However my mood was lifted when the waitress presented us with steak menu that normally is on the dinner, but will be serve at lunch as well.   That was a big relief because I did not want to get stuck with dry aged beef. I proceeded to order Filet Mignon for myself while my partner in crime decided to take one of their special.   The coolest thing I saw on the menu was a Truffle Parmesan Potato Chip for appetizer. It was a great start to a great meal because I just couldn't get enough of that chip. What amazed me even more was the fact that it was a seasoned POTATO CHIP. Who else would be insane enough to order that for appetizer for $9?  Yeah...us!  We have gotten great service throughout our meal and gotten constant check up from the staff. Anywhere from our wait staff to refill our water and house baked bread (which included the butter with a shade of letter "D") to the chef who came to make sure that the steak was to my liking after changing for the better.  I had ordered it Medium Well, the chef changed it to Medium/Medium rare because the meat was excellent cut that day and I guessed he didn't want to overcook the meat to lose the flavor. Honestly, that was a good decision on his part because the steak was that good. I savored every bite and the meat didn't drip of blood. That would have been too much, but luckily it wasn't.  The other thing I highly recommend to get was their creme of corn and lobster soup. That was rich in texture, very creamy without being too diluted. That soup itself would make a great meal if they decided to offer it in the menu as a large bowl. The soup was that good.  For $70, that was a fine meal and I have no regret. Even though the slot machines that was not far away was calling me all day.  Our table was part of the wine tasting lounge. They have a few table that has an open window wall that overlooked the mall of restaurants. it makes it a nice people watching opportunity that scenesters would love. The bar and the lounge sofas are a bit high class for a normal wine tasters, but for the quiet soothing atmosphere this place presents, these things goes very well in that room.  There is a bigger dining room, but I think dinner would filled it up more. I suggest getting the table there next to the window so that people can watch you eat with jealousy....just kidding!  To my amazement, I didn't utter the famous catchphrase "Bam!" I might as well since I had a wonderful meal with steak that was cooked just right. if it was a romantic dinner, I would have gave it an awesome "Bam!"   I would definitely try to make it back here again next time when I'm in Vegas. -------------------- Quality: ***** Decor: ***** Service:**** Amenity: **** Ambiance: *****

0Q1IjWjtd4waWdYkotRqNw.text: Honestly, I wanted to like this place. This was not our first time there but it will be our last. The Cesar salad was the highlight of the meal and still one of the best I've ever had. The steak was just OK. The sides were quite good but it is a steakhouse so I was expecting something much better. The deserts were not bad just not mind blowing. For the price, unfortunately it was not worth it.

o7YgusT6OFe08TGMFOJr_w.text: EXCELLENT!! Everything was perfect...Ambiance, Service, especially the food.  Wished I had a bigger appetite to hold more food.   There were 3 of us girls sharing the Vine-Ripened Tomato Salad with the Burrata Cheese ~ Excellent!   We weren't very hungry so we shared the Chateaubriand among the 3 of us. It was a perfect size for 3 people.  The portions were well divided with enough sides and steak to go around for 3 people.    We wished we had a bigger appetite to order dessert and try Truffle Potato Chips. Can't wait til my next Vegas trip to try out more of the menu.

iEtHTMajc4meROKcECM9DA.text: Went there for a bachelor dinner with 7 guys.The hostess was very accommodating on a Sunday night as we were able to push back our reservation from 730-830 because we had too much fun earlier in the afternoon. Unbelievable meal . Steaks were all excellent , sides (family style) delicious and the seafood tower app was fresh and  adequate for the 5 of us eating seafood . One friend had the lamb chops and was very satisfied. The service was by far the best part , in all honesty . Frank and his assistants were all on point . Strongly recommend for a high end meal, especially if staying at Venetian or The Palazzo .

HiIihbk22n8l4KPtvhca0Q.text: What kind of retard spends $60 on a steak? ^^^ This kind (noob.yelp.com) This place is SOOOOOOOOOO good. I have nothing negative to say whatsoever about the food. The restaurant design/ambiance is on point and so are the waiters/waitresses. I like their waiting room (piano, drinks, seats, TVs, and all). Seriously though, I could eat their steak for breakfast, lunch, dinner, AND dessert. That good. Trust.

DEuf8OY5hQX-xugpb88nlg.text: I am in love. In love with the ceasar salad prepared at our table by our very likable  waiter, in love with the steak medallions topped with lobster and drizzled with a wonderful bearnaise sauce... in fact I would be hard pressed to find anything to criticize about the experience we had here last week. Finally, the banana cream pie was nothing short of the totally perfect end to our evening. Fine wine, fine company, fine service and more than fine food. Dare I say it one more time??? In LOVE haha

FrY9I5MfsHDRbkqcc5hkiA.text: What a wonderful food experience!!  Our waiter Ryan was perfect and treated us well. Give the Parmesan Truffle Potato chips a try, you will love them. Lobster Bisque was good as was our steaks.  Side dishes are large so split the order.  The decor is lovely and it was a nice quiet atmosphere. Wish we had room for dessert but maybe next time.  There's definitely lots of places to eat in Vegas but I have to say come to Delmonico Steakhouse. It's well worth every penny.

oWsl8QN-Wxm5730niq_pQw.text: AMAZING. The food speaks for it's self &I the service was beyond amazing. Will not be disappointed.

F73Eqx7HBPKt8uwiN7InPA.text: Best bone in ribeye I've ever had. Drinks were great. Wine list is exceptional. Recommend to anyone looking for a top shelf steakhouse in Vegas.

ISG5xa7JdG_jrZLQjzw3CQ.text: BAM!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Emeril has done good!  ITs located in the venetian casino level on restaurant row on the way to the palazzo. the place has a cute bar area where we had to wait for the rest of our party but eventually the hostess sat us first. we had to sit at 2 seperate tables because we had 13people BUT they didnt charge gratuity...although we gave more regardless...  from the start our server was beyond nice and welcoming. he helped ben choose his martini, he helped me and a friend chose our red wine which was yummy and we devoured our calamari, filet mignon, bonein ribeye, truffle chips and mushrooms!!!  the bread they bring out one by one on your plate was SO soft, warm and goooood with the butter, calamari was wonderful even with olives (which im not a big fan of) it was yummy, the filetmignon was cooked well all the way around perfectly seasoned. the ribeye was a REAL winner though super yummmy and HUGGE (obviously hence the place being called delmonico...). the mushrooms were perfect and the truffle chips were delish altho a little TOO greasy for me.   alll the food runners and our server was so nice and the atmosphere like many steakhouses wasnt stuck up but actually really relaxed while still being rather nice. at the end he asked us where we were heading and suggested many different places to check out even tho we were so picky on tryin to decide which bar to head too. he also brought out two desserts with a candle for the two bday boys at our table!  at the end our table of 6 had a bill of near $450  (5 of us got filet or ribeye $45-$55) Ben F and I ate $190 worth hahahah it was a wonderful meal...in a wonderful atmosphere! check it out when in need of a fabulous steak + great wine.

mgn_MBt6ONSMCOyco6dSgQ.text: A 5  rating for a 5 restaurant. Located in between the beautiful Palazzo and Venetian Hotel, this restaurant and their staff truly were amazing. From the moment we walked in, every staff member was attentive to our needs. They truly took care of us (party of 7), the waiter was amazing and truly enjoys his job. The food was amazing! Everyone enjoyed their meals and salads/soups. We had a slight small incident with my mom who slipped as we were walking in, and every couple of minutes the manager in charge, Tyler, came and checked on my mom several times. Despite the fall, the restaurant is amazing, we were happy we choose DelMonicos for our dinner!! Keep up the great job!

ptmt6BIPu21oGBQsUGTlQw.text: They are known for their bone-in ribeye so I had to try that.  I ordered mine medium rare and it was a little undercooked but still very tasty.  The steak was good but not the best I've had.  What was really amazing was the white fish.  This was the first time I tried the white fish and I will order this again.  I also tried the New Orleans bbq shrimp which was good and the au gratin potatoes.  The sides are huge and we had a hard time finishing one side.  Service was excellent and the restaurant had a nice modern contemporary look which I liked.  Overall, a good steakhouse and I had a good experience here.

UyvH-_prOg7Fdrps6Uhjiw.text: We love this place.  We dined here on March 5, 2015.  It holds a special place in our hearts.  We started with the caesar salad for two which was prepared table side, so fresh and good.  The steaks are always better than we remember.  We had the bone in ribeyes medium rare and they melted in our mouths.  The desserts are always fantastic too.  We went here on our yearly Vegas trip which we do for our half anniversary every year.  Can not say enough about this restaurant!  Love love.  There was one not so great side dish and it seemed like it was only ours....the potato au gratin was burnt and dry, not a good combo and we should have sent it back.  Everyone else's that went by our table looked fantastic.  Our bad, we should have sent it back....but o well...just don't order that dish.  We had a great evening and the service was excellent as always.

FL4hkXCgu6sjllHJ6MUCEg.text: I guess the 4th time is the charm!!  My brother was nice enough to get us a gift certificate here so even though we didn't really want to come back here again we decided to order things we wouldn't normally get at a steakhouse.  Stuff like chateaubriand which was fn awesome and way better than anything else I had there the last 3 times.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Creme Pie
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chateaubriand...SO FN GOOD!!
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. seafood bisque

gCyTELZY3e-4d2ZDmVSfhA.text: Great restaurant! The people were extremely kind and the food was excellent. Thanks to the Indianapolis Colts beating the Chiefs, house money paid the bill but I'd be more than happy to spend my "hard earned" cash here as well!

bHMxqjTDchcYo8pqwrUYqQ.text: I'm not a chaser of celebrity chefs...and wasn't excited to hit up Emerils joint in V-town. But I have to say. I was diggin' this place.   The atmosphere is pretty chill and classy. It made me want to sip cognac and smoke a cigar ( and I don't like either of those). This place definitely exudes a mid-western meets Palm Springs sort of vibe. You know... big comfy, light taupe leather chairs, with hearty dark wood tables and high nicely lit ceilings.   My food was good. The Foie Gras was amazing, the endive  salad was nice but not out of this world and the lamb special was good too. With very hearty servings of meat I couldn't finish my lamb, though if it were outrageously good I probably would have.   And yes if offered to me, I sampled the dishes from around the table). Of note: the bone-in rib eye was very nice and the fondue was ridiculously good. I passed on the fish. (Come on Craig - who orders fish at a steakhouse?) Between the foie gras, fondue and lamb, it's amazing I walked out on my own. Never fear... red wine was there to save my ateries. (Whew! )  We passed on dessert. So no report there.  We sat a few tables away from D. Rodman. It's amazing how grown men in their 50's will say shout out stupid stuff like: "Yo D.R.? Can I get a Whoop Whoop?" when they're in the presence of an ex pro athlete. Funny stuff.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EPkI68FHML9YSz6AULNNeQ.text: While at Vegas, our friends out of the blue, wanted to go eat at a nice restaurant for dinner since it was fight night and all the clubs would have a long line. They made the reservations around 4pm for a 9:30pm dinner, so making reservations last minute isn't a problem.  Though we arrived on time, we had to wait at least 15 minutes to get seated, so we just waited at the bar. I thought the bar area looked better than the actual dining area itself. It was modern and sleek, with a piano situated at the far side of the room.  Our hostess took us into the dining area, where we were immediately greeted by our smiling waitress. Very attentive, nice, and down to earth, explained the specials and menu to us. Meanwhile, the busboys/girls gave us hot bread, which my Filipino friends said tasted like Filipino bread. It was topped with finely grated cheese and salt, and they loved it. Our waters were constantly refilled before it was even half empty.  We all ordered either the rib-eye off the bone ($42), or the bone in rib-eye ($46). 14 to 16 oz. for the rib-eye. I tried both the steaks and they tasted the same to me. It was dry-aged 14 days, which you could tell when you sliced the meat with your knife. Tender, flavorful, delicious! I loved that the sides were encrusted with pepper and salt. My other friend ordered the filet-mignon, which she could not finish. I loved how it melted in your mouth and it was also very flavorful. We got the country smashed potatoes, the baked idaho potato, and the roasted fingerling potatoes. The roasted fingerling potatoes tasted the best. I thought it was perfect the way it was salted. The other 2 potatoes didn't stand out to me.   Decor was minimal and sort of disappointing. The bathrooms were kind of disgusting to me because it seemed as if they didn't clean it much. The meal was delicious, but I still love Mastro's more!   At the end of our meal, one of the waiters kept coming by our table asking us if we needed help with our bill (because we had a party of 9). He came FIVE TIMES. It was SUPER annoying and it seemed that he was afraid we'd dine and run or something just because it was taking awhile for us to figure out how to calculate tax and tip and collecting money from people.  I'd definitely come here again, but after I try other steakhouses in Vegas!

EV5jzqf2oah3FOauNBBkMA.text: Best place for a killer steak in the venetian. Always on my top list when visiting or dining with friends/clients.  Amazing food, amazing service. Wish we had more stars, I'd still give it 100%

Lkqk75-P4zD1LWVxBuin8w.text: WOW. This place did not disappoint. I had a pretty high expectation, especially after seeing 5 reviews (yeah out of 600+ lol) that said the steak might be better than Mastro's my most favorite steakhouse.   Being a True tubby at heart, I was the only one who ordered 2 appetizers lol. I had the BBQ shrimp (it's aight), wilted spinach & frisee (super delicious), and I tried the ravioli too (my friends loved it but it's aight for me maybe because I wasn't feeling like pasta).   I had the Chateaubriand for my main and I lovvvveee the Creole seasoning on it. It was served with a huge handful of asparagus that looked really fresh and mash, which tasted delicious with the creole juice/sauce. My medium-rare steak was cooked perfectly and was super delish. Mastro's steak still wins though!  We also had a side of grits (good) and creamed corn (yummy). And for dessert, as usual we had a buffet of it. The best ones (in order): Bourbon bread pudding, pecan pie, espresso Creme brulee. The chocolate cheesecake just wasn't my thing. My hubby also had their Blue Mountain coffee and he seemed to like it.   I'm happy this is a chain (lol) because Delmonico is going to my regular/Yum Yum list!!

9ytV9HuJmzG2WJp48wRhjQ.text: I am not absolutely dying to go back, but I grew up in Las Vegas and can say that this one of the finer fine dining establishments. My mom, her boyfriend, my sister, and I ate here for a special occasion post-Phantom and there wasn't a single mentionable flaw in the experience. Everything was fresh, perfectly cooked to order, and tasted great. The service was attentive (though perhaps the tiniest bit slow toward the end of our meal) and friendly.   The ambiance was nice, excluding the "old ladies' night out" table nearby making a lot of drunken noise (they were just enjoying themselves but boy did one of them have a memorable cackle!) and would be suitable for a nice date.  I recommend the caesar composed tableside as well as the tomato salads to begin with. I enjoyed my seared tuna and the steak and scallops I tasted were excellent, as was the tiramisu for dessert .

9LL1BC-bljUjDupd90CGZA.text: Delmonico is a favorite. Time after time it delivers stellar food and superb service.  The Caesar salad for two is a must, as is the bone in ribeye. We've also enjoyed daily specials that have served up surf and turf, and some of the tastiest lamb chops we've ever tasted. We've sampled a bunch of other dishes, as well. The only disappointment has been at dessert and that was banana cream pie. It was served partially frozen. Ever since we tend to skip dessert and treat ourselves to Jamaican Blue Mountain French pressed coffee, instead. It is wonderful.

Z0v9wzNMee4TT_zNryZn9g.text: To start with our luncheon last week, the front hostess was way rude and young. Then was our waiter who seemed to be rude and showing no sings of enjoying his job at this restaurant. Both my husband and I were talking about how people that work in this kind of environment in Vegas have become more and more rude and complacent with customers in the past years. Will not go back. Food was OK!

GeqQ_40blABu9YvxjBGzPg.text: Disappointing or too high of expectations?   When I am spending $50 for a steak (Bone-in Ribeye) which was recommended by the waiter was the best steak on the menu I have particularly high expectations. The dishes are all a la carte so I also ordered a side of Asparagus, Potatoes AuGratin and Garlic Mushrooms.   The steak was a large serving (14 oz) but I found it lacked in flavor for my expectations. I have had better steak at high end restaurants....

-oOG6KY0rPY51DsmpwG6hA.text: Great Steakhouse. I was delighted to come and try this place. I haven't heard too much about what the steak was like hear but I heard all good things about it.   As we sat down we were great by two men who were going to be our servers and our waiters for the day. I ended up ordering a Bone In rib Steak. I think it was the most expensive steak on the menu. I wasn't too sure about the size but my friends that came before said that it was a good size and that some of them couldn't finish it.   When I finally got the steak. It had a little piece of butter on the top and it looked good. I usually have my steak medium and it was perfect. I loved it. We also ordered some sides of grits, spinach and mushrooms. Those were ok to me. I loved the steak though. I wasn't able to eat the last 3 oz or so. I think it was well over 16 oz steak with the bone. I think everyone finished theirs except for me. I did notice that my friend said the my steak looked bigger. I couldn't complain at all. All in all we spend about $80 for dinner. I didn't order anything besides the steak and splitting the appetizers.   It was well worth it. I have spent more at other places and not even felt like I was eating enough. This takes the cake.   I liked how the servers were prompt with filling up my water and attentive to our needs. They would even fold your dinner napkin if you left the table. Awesome. I felt somewhat cramped on our circular table, but what do you expect from a large group of 9 guys.

gmoE6LWdibnUAg07ETG8Kg.text: By FAR one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.  I have eaten here many times for dinner and was able to have lunch as well.  Lunch was just as good and less expensive here as dinner.  What I love most about this place is the variety on the menu.  It is all typical steakhouse fare but with lots of choices and executed very well.  The typical blue cheese wedge is so decadent with large chunks of cheese and caramelized bacon, all other wedge salads will not do it for you in the future.  The lobster bisque is sweet and creamy and is a must have each time you go.    Important hint: don't pass up dessert - a True quality restaurant will have a well rounded and exciting dessert menu.  Delmonico's never fails.  My favorite is anything chocolate/peanut butter or Baily's Irish cream inspired.  This restaurant always seems to have something like this on their menu.  Desserts are rich, gooey with a multitude of flavor combos.  Just what I like :)

4Ph6dJlfjDtH3LBGRwd08A.text: I ate the duck and it was nicely done. The other people I was with had steak and salmon.. They also enjoyed their meals.

1TRLqp_pLZnRunlVZcA7nQ.text: This place was delicious and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  My favorite favorite thing was the Lobster Bisque.  It had a empanada like thing in the soup packed with lobster.   If only I could find that here....

-9HWRNoGZOort6u95kC27w.text: Nestled back in the row of restaurants in the Venetian Hotel and Casino, Delmonico Steakhouse owned and operated by Chef Emeril Lagasse.  Offering up Orleans-style eats in a comfortable setting.  High back armless leather chairs and white linen set tables are scattered amongst white walls with pillars and great sloping arches.  A uniquely curved ceiling provided an interesting twist on the events of the night, as I was able to clearly listen in on several conversations from other tables as if they were seated next to me.  I only wonder if they were listening in on us?  On the way to our table we passed by a wall of wine encased in glass.  It was impressive to say the least and perusing their wine list hinted to the fact that it wasn't the only wall of wine in the establishment.  After calling for a nice bottle of champagne we ordered off of the menu and enjoyed an amuse buche.  A sort of pre-appetizer, a bite or two of something tasty, like something you might get at a cocktail party.  The wait staff was at our side at all times to make sure we had ample amounts of liquids and dinner breads.  We made a little joke how I was not able to finish my meal because the waitress kept calling for my bread dish to be refilled..."Would you like some more bread sir?"  If she had asked how I was feeling I would have responded "Better!"  I would had surely thrown in an extra hundred on the gratuity if she followed through with the Python joke or offered a thin wafer mint.  I could go through all the parts of the meal but we know from previous reviews that the food is above board in the field of taste.  My only comment in regard to anything on the menu would be to the quality of the beef.  I am by no means a steak snob but I know quality beef when I taste it.  Having tasted beef from different locations around the world from Kansas to Kobe, Delmonico Steakhouse has much room to improve their quality of steak.  No matter how well seasoned or prepared the order was, if you start out with average prime beef you will be eating average prime beef and for that they lose one star.  If you do happen to stop by and eat at Delmonico, I suggest the sorbet desert, the multitude of tasty wines and the special... whatever it is.  Be prepared for the price, because this place is proud of their food.  Four guests, champagne dinner with desert was well over $100 per person.  Will we be back?  But of course!  Las Vegas is the place for over indulgences.  What happens in Vegas... along with your money, stays in Vegas so enjoy it while you are there.

vgc2ePHx9qyGOkAIzuRpaw.text: My ribeye was a tiny bit drier than I like, and our bottle of wine was a twist off.  I was very surprised that they even carried this at such a "high end" restaurant.  The only saving grace was their truffle and parmesan potato chips.  Although it looked like dish from the local sports bar, it tasted great.  I had the greatest time having dinner here, but I'd have to say it was about the company and not the food.  Totally not worth the money.

-8t63nMvQKH-Bj1OSQx54Q.text: Man.. I'm drooling just thinking about the wonderful birthday meal I had here (courtesy of dearest Hubby).  I loved how the theme of the restaurant was very New Orleans/Cajun inspired.  Before we even ordered, we got to try these ox tail thingies, compliments of the chef. Pretty good.  We started with the BBQ shrimp. Delish.  I had the filet, and Hubby had the bone-in filet. According to him, it was extremely good, and he liked it better than the bone-in at Fleming's. I absolutely loved my filet. It had a cajun spice flavor, and it was so good that I didn't even want to dip it in Emeril's version of A1 sauce (yeah.. it's an Emeril restaurant.. didn't know that till I looked at the menu, and I admit initially I was a little turned off by that).  We shared asparagus and mushrooms as sides, and their mushrooms were superb. They didn't use the button mushrooms that most steakhouses use. Instead, I think they were shiitake mushrooms, or some sort of mushrooms that tasted similar/looked similar to shiitake mushrooms. Either way, very good.  We ended the meal with a complimentary sorbet that was yum, and we also ordered their dessert of the night, which was a blackberry cheesecake that was yum as well.  Lastly, according to Hubby, they had a great wine selection.

tcLOK95oermLvOEom0fAeg.text: Oooohhhhhhhhhhh this place is orgasmic!  I can't even begin to tell you how in love I am with this establishment.  It's amazing.    The boyfriend and I were in Vegas for our anniversary and he made reservations at Delmonico.  I was excited :)   When we were being lead to our seats, we oohed and awwed about how beautiful the restaurant was.  The ceilings and structure reminded us of the Conciergerie in France.  Very pretty.    Anyway, we were seated and given a very extensive wine list--some wines upward of $3000.  We opted for a glass of wine.  We opened the menu and no more than 5 minutes later, we knew exactly what we were going to order--scallops and gnocchi in basil butter sauce, lobster bisque, and two bone in ny strips cooked medium rare.  No sides--we wanted the beef.    About 10 minutes after we ordered, the waiter brought out a complimentary amuse-bouche.  Two puff pastries with bleu cheese mousse and walnuts.  They wanted to wish us a happy anniversary! How wonderful is that?  My bf was very surprised--when he had booked the reservation they asked him if it was for a special occassion.  He was very surprised they did something about it.  Well, it was delicious.  Now we were even more enthusiastic about the food.  The lobster bisque came next, and it was fantastic.  Creamy and perfectly seasoned.  The scallops (2 huge scallops to be exact) came next and were wonderful.  Perfectly seared on the outside and tender on the inside.    And the steak...oh boy.  It's huge!  It came out seared on the outside with a dollop of herbed butter.  I couldn't wait to get at it. It was perfectly red on the inside.  This was hands down the best steak I've ever had in my life.  It was seared so perfectly, that the fat around the edges of the steak were crispy (yes, I actually a good helping of the fat. It's better than butter!)  The food was amazing and we ate as much as we could--leaving behind almost nothing at all.    Still, we wanted dessert.  Pecan pie a la mode with caramel sauce. Fanfreakingtastic!!!  Delicious! The waiter told us it was the best pecan pie he had had in his life, and I concur.  Yummy!   I only have high praises for this place.  Aside from the food, the staff was attentive and gracious.  We can't wait to go back--even if the $200 bill hurt a bit.

v87UTFds94GzrnJFLaPVZg.text: Almost perfect except when they screwed up my steak order and made it well instead of medium. Staff was very understanding and quickly replaced my steak with the correct order (seriously, my table mates maybe got another one or two bites in before I had a new plate...so quick!) otherwise everything went well. At the end of the meal, my cousin asked for a tour of the kitchen (she's a CIA grad) and they let her check it out.

U8I_yBhRUQ3u02lMVPAKpA.text: The original New Orleans Delmonicos gave me some of earliest foodie education.  WAY back before it was bought by Emeril, it was a Garden District favorite.  Many of the old, wealthy families of New Orleans dined there.  It was not on the tourist trail.  I was distraught when Emeril bought Delmonicos.  I thought he was cheesy and obnoxious, and I just knew he was going to ruin this Southern matriarch.  I could not bring myself to go there and view the damage.  Then I found out a Delmonicos had opened in Vegas.  Who cared if it is cheesy I thought...we're in Vegas, home of cheesiness!  So, Sugar Bear and I checked it out in 2001.    We were delighted to see that there was a strict dress code.  Our meal was splendifferous.  The presentation--stunning.  The restaurant--breathtaking.  I could not believe it!  Delmonicos had not been ruined by Emeril after all.  He had taken my favorite old school restaurant from New Orleans and made her into a youthful Southern Belle again.  We were dazzled.  We returned to Delmonicos a year later to celebrate our wedding.  Perfect.  We've been several times since, and have always loved our meals.  It has been disappointing that the dress code has become lax.  Last time we were there, we saw jeans and shorts.  Downgrade for a place that previously required a coat.  I guess dress codes don't really fly with the younger crowd, and this Southern lady has had to ride with the times.    If you are in Vegas, or New Orleans, this is not a place to miss!

7cRwmpHoc5fpjnsu0q-iRg.text: A very disappointing experience overall. We went there for New Years Eve 2011/12 and were very disappointed to find that there were no decorations at all, and nothing had been done to bring out any kind of party atmosphere. The food was OK, but what really let the restaurant down was the service. Our waiter did not know the cocktail list. We had to spell the names of the cocktails we wanted for him to be able to order them for us. Same went for the wine, and once we got the wine, he didn't poor it for us a single time throughout the night, not even to taste when he first opened the bottle. Clearing the table was slow, and no one came to offer dessert, coffee or anything else after we had finished our main course. Getting the bill also took some time, and not a single person acknowledged us when we got up to leave, not a "thank you" or even a "good bye". We felt like we were being ignored, or forgotten, as we could see the people at the table next to us being looked after a lot better than we were. There was no reason for them to treat us this way. I work in service myself and I always make a point to be nice, pleasant and polite when at a restaurant, and if an honest mistake is made, I am normally very forgiving, but this was too much. We expected much better and I would not recommend this restaurant at all.

_kls6-37hXO4_7nIaDpixA.text: Went here for our 1 year wedding anniversary and we were very pleased with our visit with some exceptions...  We ordered:  Appetizer: Calamari I liked it, but it was way too much for 2 people.  I think I could have done it without the olives - I let the husband order this one.  I would have picked something different.    Salad: It was the special - arugula, figs, and mousse foie gras The husband was a bit iffy, but because I let him pick the appetizer, he couldn't say much.  Holy crap, that was a yummy fricken salad even the husband liked it!!  I would so order that again.  Main Courses: husband - bone-in ribeye.  me - bone-in new york steak. BOTH were yummy!  They were both cooked to order.  The only thing we didn't like about it was the butter that came on top of both of them.  We didn't think it was neccessary.       Side dish: Fingerling potatoes with halves garlic.   This was a waste.  We didn't really eat any of them because they were way too salty.  I love me some salt too, but it was just way too much for heart to handle.  We should have asked for something different, but I didn't want to wait.  We did have a show to catch.  Thumbs up: They did recognize our anniversary and gave us a complimentary dish before our salad came out.  I forgot what it was, but it consisted of a chip of some sort, with a slice of beef on top.  It tasted it like it had ginger, soy, and some more stuff and also sesame seeds.  It was really good!  I wish we had more or could have swapped it out with the calamari.

JBOv1U9TyHPSjVJnq4xP9g.text: Hints: Bone-In Rib Steaks Bone-In Rib Steaks Bone-In Rib Steaks Bone-In Rib Steaks Bone-In Rib Steaks Bone-In Rib Steaks Ok, you should get it by now.  More Hints:  The mushroom sauce is too salty for my taste bud. Service is always excellent every time I come here for dinner. Bone-In Rib Steaks is always cooked to perfection, everything else here is just average .  One last Hint:  Bone-In Rib Steaks

ATCuZ2OEpz5lAq0jmsoYNA.text: We were very disappointed with Delmonicos steakhouse. I ordered my steak medium to medium rare and it was overcooked and burnt on the outside.  My fiance's steak was also sub par. Our sides came out cold.  Dessert was just ok. The worst part was the bathroom- it was filthy and I was disgusted (garbage had overflowed all over the floor).  Definitely not worth the $300+ we paid.  We will not return.

QhyN-HDYajcBdfeMBcFP0w.text: The good:  Really great service.  Bone in ribeye was cooked perfectly medium rare. Corn was good.   The bad:  "Signature" barbeque shrimp. Just tasted like crappy BBQ sauce on a regular shrimp. Actually just prefer lemon and butter.  Lobster bisque. eh.  Not a bad experience really but if capital grille in Vegas is anything like the one in NY I'd rather go there and get their lobster mac n cheese and delmonico steak.

miW64R3yPbSWwCJtjKqv9g.text: So, I've always thought Emeril was a lot of talk and no action, but I was wrong to judge without experiencing Emeril's cooking.   On our first night in Vegas, we made last-minute reservations for 9:30.   The restaurant is in kind of a weird place.  It's literally in the corner of the basement.  Granted, there are restaurants next to it, it still felt like it was at the edge of the earth.   Inside is relaxed.  It's dimly lit and the ceilings are low (again, more basement feel), but overall, it's very nice.  We were starved, so we went right to the entrees, but they were delicious.  My boyfriend, the meat-eater in the group, had the filet, which he claims is the best cut of filet he has ever had.  He says it was cooked to perfection and it was absolutely perfect.  And, he's had quite a few steaks.  I had bacon-wrapped sea bass with pesto, roasted tomatoes, and some potato goodness, that I can't remember.  I mean, in all honesty, I wasn't expecting to be impressed, so I didn't pay much attention to the intricacies of the dish.  But, it was amazing.  The fish was cooked perfectly, the flavors were a perfect compliment to each other.  It was perfect.    And, for dessert, we shared the banana cream pie, which I knew was legendary, and quite frankly, it was the only thing that disappointed me.  It was good, but I think I expected more.  Regardless...this was a great meal, and well worth every penny.  5 stars for food, minus one for weird location and ambiance.

-79slJ5_z6FVKG86yQAPaA.text: 2012 Fall Restaurant Week Lunch #2.   Whether you're visiting Delmonico on a regular night, special occasion, or during Restaurant Week as I did, from the amazing lunch I had with extraordinary service and exceptional food, I'd recommend it to anyone. 4.5 stars at least.  We seem to be the first party seated for lunch. Our two servers worked well together, being knowledgeable, catering, and attentive from beginning to end. Even as more customers started to come in and they had more to attend to, they still did an amazing job making sure we were taken care of.  What we put in our tummies: (pictures posted)  1st Course Traditional New Orleans Chicken & Andouille Sausage Gumbo  2nd Course Butternut Squash Ravioli Prime Cheeseburger w/ Bacon  3rd Course Emeril's Banana Cream Pie Pecan Pie  I'm no expert on gumbo, but I found it very tasty. Still steaming in individual serving pots, it was poured over rice table-side. Very nice touch. The burger was an enormous 11oz, well-seasoned, cooked medium as requested, hearty and meaty as burgers should be. Fries were just...fries. It was my first experience with butternut squash ravioli, and I loved it. Sage brown butter, toasted hazelnuts, and parmesan cheese made these raviolis sweet and flavorful.  The highlight of the food was unquestionably the desserts. I never order banana cream pie, but I'm a big believer in trying whatever is the signature item, especially when it's written "Emeril's Banana Cream Pie." I'm sure it's not made very traditionally, but OH MY GOSH. Made with sweet bananas, the pie filling felt more like a cheesecake. Topped with chocolate shavings, amazing crust, this dessert will be what I think of from this day forward when anyone says banana cream pie. You think the way I described it, how could the pecan pie even compete?! Well, it did! Served warm and moist, it was decadent and comforting.  I was beginning to wonder if the Restaurant Week event and menus were affecting my experiences at these places I've been eagerly wanting to try. I was very excited to participate, awaiting delicious gourmet food at a great price at a fine-dining establishment, helping a worthy cause.   Personally, I'm very happy to say Delmonico made me want to become a repeat customer, again and again. It's so hard not to give 5 stars, but I would want to experience dining here on a non-Restaurant Week to confidently say it was as amazing as I remembered this lunch.   I'm very much looking forward to coming back. And soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Emeril&#39;s Banana Cream Pie. Been craving this!
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Layer Cake w/ coconut ice cream &amp; toasted almonds
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Orleans Chicken &amp; Sausage Gumbo

_3JLawYwN8RQoV6gNVTlNQ.text: Food: (3/5) "For quality and taste, go to another steakhouse" The bone in ribeye ($55) was mediocre, not as good and tenderized as I expected.  I come from Northern California and steakhouses like Flemings or Alexander's offer far better steaks. I even thought that Texas Roadhouse was a better steak and better cooked. Price for the ribeye is average for a steakhouse. Ordered it medium-rare and came in a bit over cooked. I didn't find much of the broiled flavor to it.   Service: (3/5) - "Not worth the $100 gratuity.." The waiter was not very sociable and a bit to dry. We initially got the attention/service you'd expect from a restaurant like this, but   during the middle of the dinner our waiter disappeared on us. The first time we needed him it took us a while to get him, and the second time I couldn't wait anymore and directly stood up to find him.   Environment: (5/5) "the best amenity in this restaurant" Pretty decor. Well dressed staff. Nice colors. Very comfy.I'm

T5lfxT2yp53OY6baIvV3_g.text: Delmonico serves up superb cuts of meat!  I'd recommend going with the bone-in ribeye... so tender, juicy, and flavorful!  And don't skimp on the sides, order at least 2-3 even if it's just for a party of 2.  I loved the caesar salad.  There's something nice about slicing your own leaves of romaine in a salad.  The service here is nice and efficient.  It's what you would expect when dining at a restaurant of this calibre.

e-rkMqQ3CRIXRfI_9kQTAQ.text: I stumbled into Delmonico Steakhouse after going to the wrong place as suggested by my friend. He told me to go to Emeril's in Vegas, so I did. However, the only place that houses Emeril's name is the Fish House.  My friend challenged me that Demonico had the best Caesar salad after I claimed I had found the holy grail. So I had to try it here. First off, they make it from scratch, tableside here. They even have you inspect it before putting salad in.  Previously I thought I had good Caesar salad, but this was on a different level. The salads that I've had before were either good or bad. The flavor was just that. however this salad actually had *waves* of flavor. you could distinctly taste the pepper fade in and out, the egg fade in and out, sardines fade in and out, and other flavors until it mellowed out on your palette. WTF, are you serious? I didn't even know salad dressing could do that. I give the salad a 5/5  My lady and I shared the lamb. I am not a huge lamb eater because I generally find it too fatty and I don't like fatty texture. This was good though and I did enjoy it all. It could have been a little more charred on the outside as I found that part to be the most tasty. I probably would have been better off with something a little more traditional like steak, I suppose. I'll give them lamb a 4/5  For dessert I got this cheesecake that was akin to a smore. It was seriously yum. I was stuffed before I started it, and I still ate it - it was that good. I will give it a 5/5.  What was magnificent with this place was the service. I am very particular with service and how often the service visits your table. I was a little scared at first of this place when they announced that we would be attended by three different people. Of crap I thought, they are going to be down my throat every bite. But really, they worked it like a charm. They came when they needed to and didn't come when they didn't need to come - all three of them. My water was constantly full as well. I really appreciated this.  I want to go back here next time I am in town and do a few things differently. First, don't eat 3 hours before arriving. I was not all that hungry when I arrived and I felt like I was doing myself a disservice. Second, try something more to my liking such as chicken or steak. I have to give it a 4.5 but yelp doesn't allow a half mark. I feel that the main part of the meal was the weakest which is the main reason you are there so I am rounding down to 4-stars. Maybe if I enjoyed the main course a little more (not that it was bad) then I would have given it a straight 5-stars.  I'll be back.

HzVqwNdF4yVSZQxpMe2ITg.text: We agree that this was the best filet mignon we ever had. Beautiful crust on the outside and cooked perfectly on the inside. The service was impeccable of course. Side dishes of potatoes and creamed spinach were delicious.  The entire wait staff was very attentive; we never had to get their attention. They seemed to show up at the exact moment we needed them.  Delmonico's will be a must dine on our next trip.

JchiFvzJdVoxN2Sfx5ohMQ.text: If you're looking for good steak, you go to Delmonico.  This place is classy as hell and I loved it. The waiter was very nice and knowledgeable and a funny guy.  The bone in ribeye was perfect. Medium rare, juice oozed out, flavor exploded. Exactly what you want. The grits were good too, but the cheesy potato side was a standout.  We had a hair in our dessert and our waiter brought over the manager, comped the dessert and gave us another dessert on top of that! The caramel cake and the creme brulee were good ways to end the night.  Honestly, I want to live in the steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in ribeye

-cHz-QqaPDMvKKtMPDXNQA.text: The steak melts in your mouth. This restaurant is superb. The food is wonderful. The service is fantastic. You should make a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious fantastic incredible fillet
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The atmosphere is beautiful and the service is excellent.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lobster bisque is beyond words! It is a must try!

-_v74X2wIQ5BBul7zaFIJQ.text: Been wanting to go here for a long time so when a media contact/vendor asked me to lunch here I didn't hesitate!  The ambiance was lovely, low light, tasteful decorations, great big leather chairs.  We had water, bbq shrimp, lobster sliders, steak medallions with side of garlic mashed, chocolate layer cake with coconut ice cream for dessert.    BBQ shrimp was delicious!  Had a homemade bbq sauce that was just tangy, sweet and rich enough.  Large shrimp came with about five I think very yummy.    My entree was the something something steak medallions - (sorry it's not on the lunch menu online and I can't remember exactly what it was called) it was EXTRAORDINARY.  I think after looking through the photos they were the Filet Mignon Medallions - I am a red meat junkie and before this Carnevino was the best steak I ever had - this one ranks right up there.  Perfectly medium rare, flavorful with delicious meaty mushrooms, and as tender as a steak could be.  Just delicious.  Be warned it doesn't come with ANYTHING - just the meat so be sure and order a side dish or two.  I ordered the garlic mashed potatoes which come in this cool metal pan/dish thing.  They are a very large portion so that was good.  The mashed potatoes were soooooooooooooo creamy.  Very very good.    We ordered the chocolate layer cake with coconut ice cream for dessert.  This is why I gave only four stars - the cake a'ight.  Nothing special.  It was enormous though so you'll get the bang for your buck.  My sister is a pastry chef so I might be a little extra picky on my dessert but there you have it.    For what we ordered plus my vendor ordered an additional 3-scoop bowl of coconut ice cream on the side it came to $91.  It's pricey - so be sure to eat the warm bread they give you at the beginning so you can be full, lol.  But the portion sizes were generous, the service was INCREDIBLE and the food delish.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Layer cake with coconut ice cream

0Hz22ZV34xX4oSYfQtocWA.text: Juicy ribeye and tuna salmon tartare   The service was very good here. I really loved the ribeye, tuna salmon tartare, and their complimentary bread. The price is decent for an upscale dining restaurant.   I tried other dishes my friends got and they weren't as good. My friends didn't really enjoy their filet mignon. I tried the pork chop and I thought the sauce was very salty. The bacon appetizer was good but tasted a bit salty as well. The creamed corn was very good but I didn't really like the bread crumbs on top of it. The creamed spinach was just ok. The potato side dish was just ok too.   If you have an occasion you are celebrating they give you a sorbet. They also gave us a small mousse type dish for being there for the first time so that was nice. The decor is simple and had a nice ambiance. It's a nice place to try in Venetian regardless.

8Iu2gO-SMC0egqQuaqhTIw.text: I have had the best meal of MY LIFE, on 3 separate occasions at Emeril Lagasse's Delmonicos.  I loved how I have never been let down when I have gone there.  I really enjoy steak, and his bone-in ribeye was the best I have EVER had - the crust on the medium-rare perfection was amazing.    That being said, I expect a great steak at any steakhouse I go to, so that's not enough to make this my best meal ever.  However, the sides and dessert we equally amazing! The creamed spinach is unlike any other I've ever had, the mushroom were succulent, and the football sized baked potato really hit the spot.  The service was great, the ambiance is perfect, and the chairs and tables are very comfortable.  I wish I could come here more often.  Every time I plan a vegas trip, the sure bet is that I will be here.  I loved it, and I think you would too.

GmsLe3yas-GEG0E-EfOQrw.text: This was an experience meal, and totally the right choice for my 30th birthday dinner.  The service was special. Lots of attention to detail, and I left feeling spoiled.  I had the bone-in ribeye, and it was a serious steak. I cook a dry-aged steak from my local butcher pretty well. I'll satisfy any friend of mine with that, and I'm always happy with my work. This steak was just long beyond anything I could have made. Great quality meat, wonderful seasoning, perfect crust, cooked to perfect medium rare.  Their special Mai Tai is really, really good. If you want an appetizer, the heirloom tomato salad we had was amazing, drizzled with balsamic, oil, and mozzarella. Also really enjoyed the parmesan truffle oil chips that our friends ordered.  Expensive, but one of the few meals I've had that can justify this kind of price.

0k9iHvmSs2MG8kwBb9f2Rw.text: Best experience out of all the restaurants in Vegas. The service was 5 star. We felt like royalty. The Salmon and Filet Mignon were amazing. Most impressive dessert I've had, banana pudding with a delicious twist.   Best broccoli wish I knew how they prepared it.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana pudding and ice cream
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

8xkfWTc6KvjwZH6nkMvVDA.text: Steakhouses in Vegas are like Starbucks in the USA... they're everywhere. If you're passing by a nice restaurant in a hotel casino, there's a good chance that it's a steakhouse. Maybe Vegas has figured out that eating an expensive steak will make you feel better despite the fact that you just lost hundreds of dollars...  Some friends and I had lunch at Delmonico's this past weekend and we got there right when it opened for lunch. We were their first customers and spent most of our lunch being the only people in the restaurant. Therefore, I guess it's no surprise why we got such great service. We made small talk with our servers and they were very pleasant and attentive throughout our entire meal.  One friend who has been here before was raving about their lobster bisque and banana creme pie. I got to try their lobster bisque ($16) and thought it was good but I'm no connoisseur of bisque.  The bisque comes with scrumptious pieces of lobster and it was very rich and creamy. I ordered the Filet of Beef Medallions ($21) and they were super tender. Although they were covered in bread crumbs and a mushroom type sauce, the medallions were quite delicious. The entree isn't very big and I was still hungry afterwards so I suggest getting this alongside an appetizer. I got a bite of the Banana Creme Pie and not only did it look amazing, the taste of it was delightful.   Delmonico's is a surprisingly huge restaurant. I hope their dinner draws in a larger crowd that it does for lunch or else much of their space could be put to better use. The lunch menu is rather limited but it's priced right with the most expensive entree being only $21. All in all, pretty good food and extremely good service. You gotta try that Banana Creme Pie!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Salad
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Creme Pie
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet of Beef Medallions

EropXHcE97zioQ17FJ7Hqg.text: Amazing restaurant. Lets start off by saying really goood waiter. Portions were big and very tasty aswell. Will definitely  be coming back

UVUMu_bELdA56Ryfbur-DA.text: Every year a group of us (we had 6 this year) goes to Vegas and tries out the various high end restaurants (and one night it's always a steakhouse).  This year we chose Delmonico's Steakhouse.  We enjoyed a seafood tower to start (fantastic) and for the main courses a few shared the Chateaubriand ("it was unbelievable!") and others had the Ahi Tuna ("excellent!").    In short - it was an excellent meal!  The service was top notch, the food was great and we would all strongly recommend it.

9KEFJt0hZAnKMBcsYyoeDQ.text: Amazing does not explain how great this dinner was!  My wife and I were there to celebrate our anniversary, which eating at a fine dining steakhouse is becoming the annual tradition.    I had made a reservation, and when we arrived, we were greeted numerous times from several different people offering congratulations on our anniversary.  This made everything seem special for my wife, who had no idea we were coming here.  Then we were taken to our table.  We were given a near endless wine list (book!) and expected to decide from there?  No, the sommelier came over and determined our wine for us, and did not pick the most expensive bottle, but one of the best ones we have had, for way less than the next closest we had drank a while back.  The menu is not too over the top, but just right.  I wanted to have the escargot, but my wife cannot bring herself to eat this, so we had the BBQ shrimp.  Being from Texas, we love barbeque, but this was different, and superb.  Four huge shrimp covered in a sauce that I have never had the likes of before.  Our main entree was the Chateaubriand cooked tableside.  I enjoy my steak rare to med-rare, but my wife does not like to see blood in her steak. (I know, I'm working on this)  They were able to cook the same piece of meat to my liking as well as hers and it came out perfect.  Not a thing was left on either of our plates.   We concluded the meal with two desserts, I had Emeril's banana cream pie.  An incredible end to a wonderful meal.  My wife had the creme bruele,  and explained it in details I have never heard her use to explain food.  On top of this, we were given a small sample of sorbet with a happy anniversary not written in chocolate on the plate.  There were so many waiters and helpers taking care of our every need that it was almost impossible to say who was the actual waiter, although the main waiter was superb.  He took over for the cook at our table because he knew exactly how we wanted the steak, and never did he let anything sit out of place, no drink ran low, and not one thing was missed.  Again, amazing can not explain how great this meal was.  We will definitely stop again next time we are in Vegas!  I knew how much it would be before we went, but for the sake of a review, I will say our meal for two was right at $300, but well worth it.  If you are looking for a fine dining restaurant and not wanting to spend this much, then you aren't really looking for fine dining.

Ln5fbFy3usB6T0kOhmnL7w.text: We expected much better. The design of this restaurant is great, the service is great but the steaks are not great. They started us with a complimentary thin slice of cucumber topped with tiny lentils, a tasty tidbit. We then had the lobster bisque which was very good with large chunks of lobster in it. My husband had the bone- in NY strip,medium rare, it was grizzly and very chewy, not worth a price tag of $50. I had the petite Piedmontese filet mignon, 6oz., although extremely small for $50.00 it was very good. We were then given a small scoop of complimentary blood orange sorbet and finished the meal with the pecan pie, good but not memorable. With all the steakhouses in Vegas we have no reason to return here.

78LBnN_A4JW-oZQbrSo56A.text: Delmonico is a Mecca for meat lovers!  From experience as a frequent guest, I can attest to the top the quality of the food and the service. We love the bone-in as well as the foie gras.  Delmonico also has first-rate and premium wine lists that can go from conservatively priced to thousands a bottle.  Go ahead, enjoy the place!

VqBkYDibG1vzdz1hli3i_w.text: This place has the best Filet I have ever eaten. That means a lot because I never thought anything could outdo my taste buds over Hugo's Cellar (which I still love very much). The service was excellent. We had reservations and were seated promptly. I enjoyed the Asparagus with Prosciutto wrapped around it they brought to the table. We must have had 3 different people checking on us. As I stated I had the Filet and Garlic Smashed Potatoes. The Filet melted in my mouth it was just so darn tender and flavorful.  It was almost $55 for my portion and well worth it. I now know why this place wins so many awards for best steaks!

z89C0nH568Oxzlgv-cE7Dw.text: Awesome food!  Got the steak salad for my lunch and it was perfect!!  The steak was prepared very well and i enjoyed very much.  I got to taste the lobster slider which was lovely as well. Wished the portion was larger though. It only comes with two tiny sliders.  The service was quite slow. Getting to be seated and the waiter to show up on the table took a while.

CaPPwowckqgpo8slDVSe1g.text: Had the steak salad. It was amazing. Also had the potato chips as an appetizer and they were incredible.  Wonderful, first class dining experience.

iHP55csZHjPGqOMwIo70qQ.text: Exceptional...exceptional steakhouse!! Ordered ribeye bone out and I've never had such an amazing cut of meat in my life! I died and went to heaven! The service is phenomenal! Had a huge party of about 15 and everyone was well attended too! The sides are superb too! Such a great atmosphere! Sophisticated an chic! Loved loved this place! A MUST when visiting Vegas!

bPV5ArkAOS106QrvRZlb9A.text: Went for restaurant week lunch. Decent cocktails. Great service. Good tomato burrata salad. Banana pudding was okay. Salmon was on point. Burger was perfect.

phStmpXP3O76kWOnaJpTEA.text: We returned to Vegas to celebrate my wife and my 15th wedding anniversary.  We chose to go to Delmonico Steakhouse because when we first began dating our first real date was at Emeril's in Vegas.  We booked a reservation via open table for 5 pm, we arrived around 4:30 and was told they would begin seating at 5 and we could wait in their lounge area.  Our servers were Ryan and Anthony and they did a spectacular job making us feel welcome and catering to our needs.  I had the bone in Rib Eye and my wife ordered the Rack of Lamb both were dialectic and cooked how we ordered them. We also had the creamed spinach and fingerling potatoes.  The creamed spinach was very good.  To top it off because I had mentioned it being our anniversary on OpenTable when I booked the reservation we were surprised to receive a special little tasting to begin our dining experience and a scoup of their chocolate gellato for dessert.  Overall it was a great evening to remember.

faf84PrkSIKh_ub2gem3qQ.text: 5 stars for our waitress. Her service was impeccable.  1 star for the food. 3 of 4 dishes had to be sent back. For an upscale restaurant that's unacceptable.

hmUFaCksF4cfVVQGY-Cihg.text: By far the best steakhouse around. Of course the entire meal was a 5 star,  but the bone in ribeye might be 6 stars.  One of the people we were with had the pork chop and it was phenomenal as well

aFSQDvLzD5t1mf9OV_JdPg.text: Amazing food, wine and service.  One of our top 5 meals ever! The Somalia helped us chose an amazing wine.

azcRjTW0frxhsf85xdK6CA.text: This place had the best appetizer (fried oysters and bone marrow spread) and one of the most perfectly cooked steaks I've had. Went here for New Year's with my family and we definitely enjoyed ourselves. It was a bit dark and formal for my liking but overall was a great culinary experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Hzxst8WjBZuhwoV5GjS1tQ.text: My colleagues and I were in Vegas for one of our fun "day trips" from Silicon Valley and decided to stop by Delmonico Steakhouse, which is located at The Venetian. We were dressed very casually (it was, after all, a day trip) and worried we might be treated differently at an elegant restaurant like Delmonico Steakhouse. We were wrong. From the moment we walked in, we were treated with the best service possible.   The wine list is extensive, as is the dinner menu, which offered great courses for our varying palates. I enjoyed a filet with "Oscar" and it was absolutely fantastic! My colleagues were all very impressed as well.   We were also quite impressed by the staff, who were willing to "rush" things for our table, as two colleagues had an earlier flight back home. Excellent food, service, and ambiance will ensure I come back here next time I'm in town.

qVuttNU618zmzaAwa0Ctpg.text: Hands down the best salmon I've ever had.  Salmon on top of hash with andouille sausage!    Our server was professional and had a great sense of humor.  We had a party of 6 on a Saturday night, and they seated us very quickly.    My wife had the Piedmontese filet mignon.  Cooked to perfection.   The twice baked potato was a great side choice.    It's pricy, but worth every penny.  It's good to splurge every once and a while on good food, and this is the place spend that money.

E5rcA4uUXOesG-knXaEWQQ.text: A friend and I came here a few nights ago, and upon walking in without a reservation we were accommodated immediately. Score! I think we got lucky since it was only 6ish but I recommend making reservations, especially as it was packed when we walked out by 7:30.  Our waiter was incredibly helpful as we sorted through the menu and wine items. I ended up getting the porkchop while my friend got the bone-in ribeye. We also shared the cream corn and garlic smashed potatoes. Our food was served quickly and the red wines we ordered were fantastic - the Tobin James was darker than I usually like it but rich and paired very well with the ribeye. My Meiomi was a bit lighter and fruitier but was a great recommendation for its price.  Be prepared for a BIG meal, the slabs of meat are huge and we barely got through half of our sides. So come hungry! Both the porkchop and ribeye were delicious - flavorful, tender, and juicy. Several waiters came by to check on us which was appreciated.  The only reason I'm docking a star is for the decor - a bit plain and out of the 90s. Lighting is perfectly dim but hopefully they renovate to match the prices. To be clear though, this is not a reason to not come - the dinner will be worth it!

1RR4DEdsbaG8kiS_DF_xVw.text: Love the service here and the food is great. We always come here for family birthdays.

fKfy5TkctJQF02Mz5yYSng.text: I dined at Delmonico's yesterday for lunch.  There was a total of four in the party.  I informed the hostess and server that we were on a time crunch.  That certainly did not matter to the restaurant.  The server was delayed in taking our order, the food took so long that my colleague had to ask the server to check on the status, and then just getting our bill was extremely difficult.  I am not driven to return.  The food was nothing over the top incredible...  especially with the high price tag on the items (Lunch for 4 people was $120+ including tip).

7KYyZx1otld98SusC-paew.text: A great steak dinner in the Venetian/Palazzo resort on a cool desert night on the Las Vegas Boulevard--It does not get any better than this.  Do not miss the gumbo, and tomato salad for starters.  I love the bone in ribeye, and the bone in prime rib.  I have not been to Delmonico's in quite a few years.  As usual Emeril Lagasse's  restaurants never disappoint me, I once again enjoyed my meal.  The ribeye here is beyond compare.  For dessert do not miss Emeril's banana creme pie--my all-time favorite dessert.  BAM!

kHSWmpKcRNhWd3R86DdrgA.text: Screaming toddlers ruined it.   We have been coming here for a couple of years but tonight I couldn't believe that 1) they actually had high chairs and 2) people would be so inconsiderate to bring toddlers to this restaurant.   The food and service was impeccable as always but if you're paying $200+ for a meal you don't want kids banging silverware and having tantrums.   While we love it here we will consider coming much later or somewhere else completely for a nice quiet adult dinner.   Dear parents, don't bring your kids here. Don't bring your kids to a casino. Disneyland is 3 hours a way. Go there instead.

BKBXTJxnrxH2F7ACcooAuA.text: My wife and I came here for our anniversary celebration last week. We had a show to attend at the Wynn so we needed to dine locally; I was debating on dining at CUT again or here but due to the high yelp reviews we decided to give Delmonico's a try.  I made reservations one month in advance online and notated our special occasion.  Upon entry we were both promptly greeted, seated and our anniversary celebration was acknowledged - which was much appreciated. Service was kind, professional and very efficient but unfortunately the food - lacked significantly.   We both began with the recommended BBQ Shrimp appetizer - which was phenomenal, but unfortunately that's where our ecstasy of taste buds had ended.  I ordered my long awaited alleged highly reviewed bone in rib eye with a side of foie gras, mashed potatoes and sauteed mushrooms.   To my unfortunate disappoint - the steak had tasted no different than a steak purchased from your local grocery store. For the price point and most importantly the anticipation I had for their signature steak from the world renowned chef, it DID NOT hit the spot. Although the steak came out at a perfect temperature and presentation was adequate, it did not at all taste like a typical dry aged high grade meat - very bland and mediocre, tasted no seasonings or flavor. We should have gone to Mastros or I would have at least been better off going back to CUT, although I didn't like the fact that CUT brings out their steaks lukewarm (due to resting) or not even on a hot plate - but you definitely get the high end meat quality and the explosion of flavors - hands down by far is 100% better.  My wife had ordered the Mediterranean Sea bass since she wasn't in the mood for steak and as well to her disappointment it was a lackluster, flavorless dish. All in all it was a very disheartening anniversary meal after a month's of high anticipation especially with all of the other fine dining options we had in Vegas.

VL1e4ZrVH_21SfWeuMkMxQ.text: Went here for my husbands 40th birthday last year! They took us in as a last minute reservation, ( we had previously walked up to a restaurant at the Bellagio which were super rude didn't even acknowledge us as we arrived to ask if they had available seating) we were saved by Delmonico they were very kind and welcoming. Excellent service!! We both had the Filet Mignon, medium well it was very tender and tasty. We were saved by this place in having a great birthday dinner and they got us out on time to get to our Circus Soleil show. This place can be loud, they may have seating in a more quiet area of the restaurant, but highly recommended as one of the best of Las Vegas and a delicious dinner is probably a guarantee.

kdxyf09J93EtngBY4cMvoQ.text: What better place to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday and Yelp Spring Break than in Las Vegas! I wanted to surprise my bf so I made reservations through open table for dinner at Delmonico. When we arrived the hostess wished my bf a happy birthday and we were told to have a seat in the waiting room. Wow that waiting room was super nice but also packed! Lucky for us as we turned around to scan for a seat the hostess called my name and said our table was ready.  Upon being seated we were greeted by our server. He also wished my bf happy birthday and took our drink orders. When the waiter returned with our water he also brought some warm, soft, honey rolls the melted in our mouths. We decided to start with the Petite Iceberg Lettuce Wedge salad followed by a Twice Baked Potato ($9) and Rib-eye ($48) for me and Short Rib Special ($35) for my bf. Before our salads came out the waiter brought a small appetizer for us to share- compliments of the chef. I don't remember what exactly it was but it was so delicious!  The wedge salad ($13) was composed with petite iceberg lettuce wedges and topped with apple smoked bacon and red onion with buttermilk blue cheese dressing. There was A LOT of crumbled blue cheese on the salad- almost a little too much for me. It was enough for both of us to share and enjoy before we got our steak knifes and forks ready for what was to come next.  I wish I were hungrier at the time- my rib-eye was HUGE! After the rolls and salad my steak and bf's short rib looked almost impossible to finish and it was quite a challenge. The rib eye was thick, juicy and tender- served with a slice of melting butter on top. Every bite felt so sinful as it tasted so good despite how full I was I couldn't stop indulging in more. I tried my best to eat my half of the twice baked potato. It was really smooth and rich with bacon and Vermont cheddar.  I can't say much about my bf's short rib since I was too busy trying to finish my ribeye. I know he really enjoyed it and the meat was so tender it fell apart with a light brush from his fork.  After dinner the server brought my boyfriend a complementary scoop of banana sorbet for his birthday. He likes bananas but usually doesn't like banana flavored foods. The sorbet was so fresh and smooth he actually really enjoyed it and finished! With a food coma coming on and $115 later we postponed surprise #2 (dessert at Serendipity) and cabbed back to our hotel and called it a night. Who does that in Vegas!?!?   P.S. I can't wait back to try the Creekstone Farms Naturally Raised Angus, Carved Tableside for Two with Asparagus and Garlic Smashed Potatoes. Time to start saving up again...

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twice Baked Potato with bacon and Vermont Cheddar
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Getting ready for some rib eye!!!

6mbyMvge3rQ_mYRzDaxtjg.text: This absolutely by far is my favorite steakhouse in Las Vegas. I went here again on my 29th birthday, and the service was amazing as always. I ordered the ribeye to share along with the best lobster bisque you will ever have. Also the truffle potato chips are to die for. The restaurant is very classy and a bit pricey, however, you get what you pay for. I've tried pretty much all of the restaurants at the Venetian, and I have to stay this one is my absolute favorite. The steaks come out a perfect medium rare cooked to perfection in butter.  Since this is a popular restaurant, I highly recommend making a reservation in advance. It's a nice restaurant to take a date as well as to celebrate a special occasion.

R7KC_7IJKiSgiw90i-HZEQ.text: Had my second visit here recently during a long weekend in Vegas.  The food, service and prices were right on point!  $55 for the bone-in rib eye is a steal.  It is huge and enough to feed two people.  Needless to say, my party of 4 ordered way too much food.  We had two bone-in rib eyes ($55 each, probably about 20 oz. each), the flounder ($40), BBQ salmon ($36), sauteed mushrooms, asparagus and mashed potatoes.  The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the mashed potatoes.  It had a pasty texture to it.  I prefer my mashed potatoes fluffy.  We topped off the night with a slice of the banana cream pie.  OMG -- I had it three years ago on another visit and hadn't stopped thinking about it.  I wish we hadn't ordered so many entrees so I could have had my own slice!  We asked for both steaks to be cooked medium.  It was a PERFECT medium!  I seriously can't wait to go back to Vegas.  Emeril never disappoints so I find myself frequenting all of his establishments in the city.   P.S.  The lobby area is nice.  Lots of seats and big screen TVs.  We topped off the night by watching the end of the USC-Nebraska Holiday Bowl game.  Go Trojans!  We won... barely.  Phew.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Most amazing dessert on earth - banana cream pie.  Please come to LA!  Pleeeeeease.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ salmon
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gulf flounder.  Good.  Nicely seared on one side.

tsfJhrtmwdX2TRR2FY8yPA.text: If you want a 5-star food experience, then follow these simple instructions: Order the bone-in filet mignon, sauteed garlic mushrooms, and truffle parmesan potato chips.... trust me, your mouth will thank me. And yes, the mushrooms and chips will still taste damn good as a post-partying 3am snack. Just use the chips to scoop up the mushrooms and go to town on 'em. Happy Eating & You're Welcome!! Oh, and I think the link on yelp is wrong... try this one: emerils.com/restaurant/5...

ALJJIotZ8Z9e3Ejl-uO1PA.text: This is by far the best steakhouse that I have been too. Maybe I say this due to the lack of high end steakhouses I have been too. But everything to me here blew my mind.   One thing I want to mention is the level of service. I have never had such great service at any other restaurant than here. The food was served exactly at the same time by 4 servers, and they would refold your napkin if you were to step away from the table. I felt like I was treated like royalty.   My steak came out perfect. And all the sides, especially the creamed spinach and mushrooms, were great as well.  I would love to come back to this place again. The steaks are amazing and the service is top notch!

44GFLwLkbojBH39C7k8eeg.text: 5 STAR PERFECTION!  Wow, what a treat. I went there as just one person and was seated in a booth by myself and was still given excellent service and attention as I would expect. I was expertly consulted by a sommelier on my wine choices to go with my $50 filet that was cooked to a perfect medium rare. All in all I had a $120 five course meal with two glasses of wine. Some may think outrageous, but hey its Vegas and I didn't have a problem splurging a little bit. Enjoy yourself - this is 5 star perfection for service.

48vtgYE9xmQEWSysOq497g.text: This was my third time at an Emeril restaurant, and once again I left feeling that paying $85 to eat dinner was perfectly justified.  Appetizer: The traditional New Orleans gumbo.  Smokey, spicy, warm, and comforting.    Entree: Filet mignon, medium.  Crusted with just the right amount of spices, cooked to perfection, and crowned with a healthy pat of herb butter.    Side Dish: Country smashed potatoes.
