wNzPIi8xGGOo58IliBTmtw.text: TL;DR: Decent steakhouse that matches its price tag; what you might expect in 5 star Vegas hotels. Not a bad option if you have $60 to drop on steak.   While this steakhouse might not be anything noteworthy apart from the celebrity status of its owner, Emeril Lagasse, it serves solid food for an albeit expensive price. To be fair, though, we need to recognize that it is located in a 5-star hotel on the Las Vegas strip, one of the most tourist-saturated areas on Earth, where you can expect to be overcharged for everything. That being said, this steakhouse does what every steakhouse should to a fair standard.  The service here is as good as you would expect at a fancy steakhouse. The free bread here is unusual, though; it seems to be a hollow roll formed by a shell of Pillsbury croissant dough, which isn't bad, but isn't especially good either. USDA Prime steaks go for around $50-$60, and are enough to feed 2 people, or one really hungry person. I ordered the steaks medium-rare, and they were cooked to order, maybe a hair closer to a medium. The steaks had a good charred crust, a mark of a good steak and something difficult to achieve at home. They offer two complimentary steak sauces, both of which pair well with the steak. I'm personally a fan of ribeye steaks and recommend that cut above anything else at a steakhouse like this one. Sides are typical, and the asparagus was nothing special but good as it was.   While Emeril may never have set foot in this steakhouse, it certainly does not disappoint. While it may not be as great as some of the most famous steakhouse in NYC, Delmonico does a good job at serving beef in the middle of a touristy destination. While it probably isn't worth more than the effort of a short walk to get to, if you're staying at the Palazzo or Venetian and are looking for a fancy steak dinner, this restaurant is a solid option.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A generous portion to partially justify a $14 side order of asparagus.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Ribeye and Bone in NY Strip medium rare.

L0F94lf0tBZ4m0_-8NRM9Q.text: We have been here many times and have had an incredible experience. I am sad to say that our most recent experience was not up to the standard we have come to expect. The food was delicious which was not the issue. It was the service. Typically there is a feeling of special treatment and a high level of service. The staff normally are gracious and attentive. Everything is orchestrated so beautifully. This time, we had to ask three people for our drink order ( a Diet Pepsi) and the staff came off as indifferent and abrupt. Even the lead appeared rushed and rarely checked on us.  I hope that this is a one time experience. For the amount of money we spend, we do expect more. Perhaps a refresher on service delivery and creating the experience.

ulLsxJBrLZjbc8qPOcqgPg.text: I have a high standard when it comes to the classic Las Vegas steakhouse and this place does not come close to what you should expect for the price. Evey famous chef in town thinks he can just open a steakhouse, slap his name on it and cook a bone in ribeye. The food was ok at best. The table side Caesar was terrible, Costco does a better bag salad. The bone-in ribeye was ok. I would have liked the bone frenched and the cut twice as thick. It was cooked properly but covered with so much butter that was all I could taste. Our sides, creamed spinach and mashed potatoes, were good. Cocktails, wine and expresso were also good. The worst thing about this place, is the sterile atmosphere. It had no personality, we could have been anywhere. We wont be going back.

jR8Xh9MM9kxjD3aNMsKVYg.text: Very average mediocre steakhouse. The ambiance is horrible it's like you are in a huge storage underneath the ground where they store restaurant equipment or supplies. Bland white walls, no fancy decor or priceless works of art here folks.  The steak was okay. Potatoes on the side were so overdone it was as hard as cardboard.  The octopus appetizer was carelessly prepared. Just deep fried octopus which makes it faster and easier to bring to the table rather than grilling it like Greek or Spanish style which takes time.  The Banana cream pie was great so I highly recommend it :)  Service is FANTASTIC :)

dxJs1UoDy5RPzocUjPJCew.text: We extremely enjoyed the meal at Delmonico's Steakhouse.  The service was excellent and the waiters had great recommendations on food to try.  The appetizers, main course and desert was great and we really enjoyed it.

wp_o8_oNVwEOdbJmS6IVOA.text: I have eaten her a few times and every time have had the best service, food, wine and desert.   They really know how to cook a steak and make you feel welcome. I look forward to my next trip to Vegas and my dinner at Delmonico's.   It's a must try.

8Lkdb_TyJDn8knJX0hic0w.text: My buddy booked this place for my bachelor party dinner. We had a group of 10 but the restaurant can only seat parties of 9 at most together at one table.  Since we had 10, they had to put us on two separate tables, which was ok, because they were right next to each other anyway.  Decor:  nothing spectacular.  i thought it was alittle too dim for me.  I like a well lit restaurant for the purpose of really getting to see the different colors of your food and wine.  You can tell a lot about your food by it's color...it's freshness, it's doneness, etc.  Food:  Very good.  I had the filet and it was super tender.  My buddies ordered the bone in rib-eye and almost all said it was amongst the best steaks they ever had.  Everything is a la carte so we shared sides of grilled asparagus (good), garlic smashed potatoes (yummy), sauteed wild mushrooms (yummy), and caesar salad (good).  Service:  Very good also.  Our waiter was very polite even when our rowdy half drunk group couldn't decide on what to order.  He was very helpful with the wine and picked out a nice bottle of merlot that worked with our budget.  Server's were very fast and attentive.  They made sure everything was perfect...which pretty much was.  Price:  Pretty fair and expected of a high end steak house.  bone in 20 oz. rib-eye was about $50 and my 12 oz. filet was around $45.  Sides were around $8-12, and one order feeds 2 people.  Yes, they have an extensive wine list and Yes, they have seafood also.  One last important note:  there isn't a smoking/non-smoking section, so people with kids, and non-smokers beware.

CEP89TU2NBCPt0Htcj32lQ.text: This restaurant is world class. It is one of the top steakhouses that I have been too. I would rate it in better than a ruth chris, ditka's, chop house and in the same category as a shula's or capitol grill.  The service is 5* as they have 3+ waiters taking care of you constantly, but not overbearing. Type of place where you leave to use the washroom and you  come back to the table and with a folded napkin and a refilled water glass.  Love the appetizers, my wife believes it they have the best lobster bisque soup out there.  The steak's are great sizes and range from $42-$50, but you're truly getting what you pay for. For the dolts who dinged this place because of the cost, if you want a piece of grizzle for $20 then go to outback.  Whenever my wife and I come to vegas and we need to celebrate something, this is the restaurant we do it at.

vtm-IYLdsDXRYMEa1aoTKA.text: Best steak in Vegas!!! Service was GREAT! The side mushrooms was bomb!!! It's a must go when in Vegas! Well go back there again!

8v0us8mwYazisIPlUnTtBg.text: Fancy! =)  Well, I must admit that my husband does know how to pick them. We went here for dinner during our weekend getaway and I was not disappointed. The style and ambiance is very simple and chic. If I may add another word - classy. The service was impeccable! The waiters (we had 3), were so welcoming and genuinely interested in how they could make our stay there memorable. So that's always a big plus for me (i do not like snooty waiters).  The food was great! Not the best I've tasted but still up there =). I had the white fish with lump crab and it was delicious! The fish was soft and not chewy at all and the crab definitely complimented the slight saltiness of the fish. Great find! The New orleans bbq shrimp were a tad too salty for my taste, but nevertheless, delicious. I would've definitely ordered dessert, but I was so full that I just couldn't get myself to do it.  In any case, I had a wonderful time and I must implore you to try it if you are ever at the Venetian Hotel in Las Vegas (did that sound classy??? eh i tried). Lol. Bottom line: go for it!

eRbtijt7JVUTa4dadSGkyA.text: I've been to Ruth's, Mastro's, The Palm, & Morton's and I will have to say that the Rib-Eye (not bone-in) I had here was the BEST I have ever had (not that the others were bad).   I may be partial to the spice "rub"/"crust" they put on it which is not traditional for high end steak places which favor only salting their meat, but honestly I wish other places seasoned their meats a little more. It was truly delicious. My brother ordered the NY and my aunt ordered the Filet and they were both in agreement I had the best tasting steak.  The service was exactly what you would expect and demand from a place in this price range and all the sides and appetizers were definitely good (but not great).  Their wine list is literally an encyclopedia of wine so it was a little intimidating and I opted for a glass of Scotch instead.   In comparison to some of the newer & flashier spots like SW & CUT the ambiance is a little muted but its still classy. Like I stated, go here and order the regular Rib Eye.. I highly doubt you will be disappointed.

V2xfDR3y47hRpGZLTr5Bjg.text: I was a bit skeptical as usual to try a tv chef place, such as Emeril. But i wasn't disappointed after all. We started the evening with a pre drink at the bar which is a small but nice and up scale place. Then we both ordered starter and main course. I had the oyster platter and my friend and the shrimp bbq. The oyster were great, especially because it is the small size ones, more flavorful to me. I think the big hit was the shrimp which takes about 12 hours to make that special bbq sauce. Then we were recommended to try to the bone in ribeye as far as steak. We were going there for steaks to start with but this was definitely a hit. Steak was perfectly cooked, dry aged (8 weeks i think) and we had a lovely potato gratin to complement that. I wasn't a big fan of the corn side dish we ordered though. The waiter also suggested a nice red wine to complement that. Service was top notch with 3-4 servers always around you which is very appreciable. If you are in a mood for steak, i think this is one of the best option in Vegas for sure.

rox6JiUb3ifEyxaX178RZA.text: Perfectly prepared red meat drowned in yummy sauce washed down with amazing wine.  Poppy couldn't ask for more.

ppJc3iyDY1T_hz0JoTZw6A.text: Went there for lunch during the week and it was dead, I was a little worried, but the service was great and the fried chicken was unbelievable!

sMCtsFyCj0a3dfFA1GPcsg.text: As you walk in, there's an impressive wine cellar that you can see inside of since there's a glass wall.  It made me wish I was into wine.  I ordered the signature rib-eye with a side of wild mushrooms.  The wife ordered the braised beef ribs.  Atmosphere: The wait-staff was nice and the person takimg our order didn't seem to mind that I asked if they had beer (they do) as opposed to ordering a glass of wine.  Lights weren't bright, a bit dim for my liking, but the area was very spacious.  Food:  The steak was cooked perfectly medium-rare, not under, not over, just right.  Nothing fancy for the seasoning, just good old salt and pepper.  A nice seared crust on the outside, nice and tender on the inside.  However, I wouldn't call it the best steak I've ever had, but it was very good.  The wild mushrooms were excellent, I would order those again for sure.  The braised beef ribs were okay, not great.  A bit too salty, but I guess that's why it was on the Specials menu.  Price:  Well, it's Vegas and it's a nicer restaurant, be prepared to pay.  Frankly, I've paid more for steak, and this wasn't he most expensive steakhouse I've been to.  However, when my wife and I saw the bill, we both said "oh, that's not that bad."  Overall it was a good experience eating there.  If you enjoy steak, you will like this steakhouse.  I'm sure those that enjoy wine with their meals would enjoy this place a bit more than I did though.

MYqf4IV1-OvZi1eKHxA07A.text: Fantastic bone-in ribeye. Perfectly marbled. Delicious cajun rub. Great wine selection. The gumbo was great, but a little too refined...almost like a stew. Ambiance was a bit sterile. But, you're here for the steak... And it's awesome.

8T9FYSqh-E2ncFtJ3p7XMw.text: Ditto on the disappointment.  I would have given D's maybe one more star, but since I paid $120  (well, factoring ~$10 to help pay for our guest of honor).for my dinner, that just really knocked down the rating.  D's ain't worth it.  I was there with a bachelor party, twelve dudes, and the average price was $120+ for each person.  My food: bone in rib eye, medium rare, shared a side of creamed spinach, and no drink.  Yes, all this for $120.  Rib eye: cooked perfectly, huge slab of meat.  I expected a nice marble, maybe a little excess fat, but by the time I was done, maybe a quarter of the original steak was off to the side...all fat and gristle.  I'm also spoiled and used to the 300 degree plate that you get at good ol' Mastro's, and since D's steak is served on a regular plate, the huge steak seemed to get cold pretty damn fast.  Creamed spinach:  I could have gotten something better out of a can.  Got stone cold real fast too.  All this for $120.    Service: Very good and very attentive.  Guess this is where my $120 went.  ...  $120   :(

D_n4AiXHKrbCr81Y0g2_IA.text: Hey everyone - first yelp review. And what better way to kick it off than with the wonderful Delmonico Steakhouse in the Venetian Hotel and Casino. This is my first Emeril's experience and it was a good one.   Disclaimer: A fraternity brother of mine is a manager here and insisted that my group try it!   I was in town for a bachelor party and 8 of us dined here on a Friday night. We had a reservation for 8:30 and were seated promptly. The appetizers included delicious (albeit greasy) chips sprinkled with parmesan cheese and the New Orleans BBQ Shrimp with biscuit. The shrimp were easily the most tasty that I've ever had - my only complaint is that one order ($18 only included 3 shrimp). I wish I had 2 or even three. The biscuit was pointless for this entree (and barely noticeable), It actually went uneaten as our party was preoccupied with the wonderful hot butter rolls that they continued to bring around.  For my entree I had the filet mignon ($48) and it was absolutely fabulous. I order my steaks medium well to well, which could sometimes mean a loss of flavor if it's not done right. In this case, the steak was cooked perfectly and had a ton of flavor. This was easily the best steak I've ever had - and I'm a red meat fan.   Service was excellent, atmosphere was a bit gloomy (although aren't good steak houses supposed to be?) and I was simply too full to try dessert. The rest of the party thoroughly enjoyed their meal. The highlight of the evening may have been seeing Larry Flynt seated just a few feet away from us, enjoying his steak and eggs. Apparently he's a regular.  If you're in Vegas and looking for a sure-fire steakhouse, stop by Emeril's Delmonico. You WON'T be disappointed.

7uhFs69iBN6kKhwVRyn8Dw.text: One of the best steakhouses I have been to.  The petite filet medallions were perfectly cooked with a parmesan crust.  Never was a big fan of this, but it was really well done.  Tender, well seasoned, and cooked exactly right... a perfect combination.  Besides the steak being in the top 3 or 4 all time favorites (Marriott HI Kona and Waikiki tied for #1, chefs are brothers) the sides of scalloped potatoes and mushrooms are fantastic.   The service was exemplary.  Vegas is back!

E4cIn9C7UohhC8fl1sbBLQ.text: Sweet Jesus, is this place overrated. I realize that top shelf restaurants in Las Vegas are pricey, but discriminating judgment should not be thrown out the window completely. Delmonico's is easily in the bottom third of dining options on the Strip, and maybe even that is too generous. There are at least 5 better options in The Venetian alone.   I've had better rib eye steaks for $0.99. Their wine list sucks, too. I expect an upcharge but if I'm going to pay through the nose, at least give me something that wasn't fermented in a toilet.  Skip Delmonico's. Don't spend your winnings at a crappy, over hyped restaurant. And if you're down, why add insult to injury?

h4HUDJqsR2XUgCI_6ZPqbQ.text: Before you digest any of my review it is important to say that I travel to Vegas on business and I find that with very few exceptions the restaurants, even the nice ones, to be poor imitations of what one would find in a city that hasn't been painted into existence.  Nonetheless, the steak I had at Delmonico was excellent and the service refreshing by Vegas standards.  The table-side Caesar salad preparation makes for good show and equally excellent taste.  It's not the quietest or the most interesting interior design, very basic and elegant if perhaps a bit crowded.  If you want a nicely cooked piece of quality meat only slightly on the spendy side this is a recommended option.

fJwyAFl2tZppq1wDdVmOFA.text: Great service and the best cooked steaks my wife and I have had in the US. The cocktails and sides are also delicious. Pricey but worth it

UFBG39zEiwJqmos2p7f55Q.text: Recently had lunch here with my small work crew (3 of us) to celebrate the Holidays. The restaurant was completely dead mid-week so at first I thought maybe we'd made a terrible mistake. My fears were quickly assuaged as our food started arriving. We ordered the lobster sliders as an appetizer to share between two of us, and our other colleague had the lobster bisque. The lobster sliders? Well they are the things dreams are made of, I'm still salivating over them weeks later. Lobster bisque was also apparently outstanding. Fries with old bay, perfectly cooked and tasty. For our entrees, two of us each had the grilled skirt steak sandwich and the other had the steak salad. The steak sandwich and truffle fries were absolutely delicious and I hear the salad was really fantastic. Service was impeccable and obviously we had the restaurant to ourselves, so our every need was catered to perfectly. I definitely will be back.

RQpwOsmDMGJLLtaQLB66gA.text: Food: Definitely one of the best steakhouses I have ever been to....you're getting quality good meat and service here.  I tried the filet mignon which was delicious and tasty. I also tried a side of potatoes and string beans which was also great. Also the soup of the day: black bean and roasted pork was to die for!Tasted just like homemade chili!Also the trio of homemade ice cream was wonderful.  Service: Service here is outstanding. The waiters are very prompt and professional.  Location: Located in the Venetian  Atmosphere: Loved it, very relaxing and intimate.  Price: Expensive, but not too bad considering the quality and quantity of food.

nvC2zrDdRx0E6dhIQpImJA.text: I kinda view the steakhouse experience from several angles. Not just the price, but also the entrees and sides, the pairing with wine, the atmosphere waiting in line.  I personally liked the atmosphere, as it was nice to have dim lighting for a late 9pm dinner. The waiting bar was nice, although the seats are very very low. A nice confidence booster for short folks, but some might find it uncomfortable.   Inside the restaurant, seats are very comfortable. Unlike my counterparts Don and Elmer, I ordered the standard NY bone-in steak. Very good, my only complaint was that it wasn't boneless! The wine was great; the waiter was helpful in selecting a bottle, very tasty but not too pricey for 4 near-thirtysomethings. The side dish of warm spinach salad(which yours truly ordered) was the showstealer of the night. Everyone liked it, so keep it on your radar if you go.   Overall, I thought it was great. I gave it 4 stars, though it would really be 3 and a half stars. If you want a better selection of steaks, probably go to Ruth Chris, NERO or the Bradley Ogden restaurants. In Vegas, the benchmark is BOA, but BOA can get very very pricey. But for the value and overall celebrity restaurant experience, a good experience. Definitely make reservations thru the casino or through opentable. I would go again with a small group or for an intimate dinner with my girlfriend.

pvUWmqqXKccNabepFs05Kw.text: Delicious, delicious, delicious meal. Our original plan was to grab one drink at the bar and then head elsewhere, but after a couple of drinks and enjoying some superb Parmesan-dusted potato chips, we decided to saunter into the dining room. The dining room reminds me of...a white-walled cave? The house from Xanadu? There's a really nice stone wall on one side, but it's far removed from the dining area. It's formal but informal if that makes any sense.  Anyway, you come here for the food and Delmonico didn't disappoint. My bone-in rib eye was by far one of the best steaks I've had - cooked perfectly, a beautiful color inside and out, and a pat of butter that made the steak even better. We selected the potato croquettes for our side and oh man, were they CHEESY and incredibly well-prepared. We ended with the pecan pie and it was a perfect way to end the night. Regarding service, it was impeccable with three different servers who were all fantastic. The next time I'm in Vegas this will be at the top of my "repeat restaurant" list.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pecan pie w/vanilla ice cream
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in Rib Eye A+++
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potatoes, Cheese, YUM

MbX5CiEGsmMzowL6pxBI6Q.text: Excellent service, but the steaks are overcooked. We ordered the Delmonico steak 20oz Ribeye, and the NY Steak. They were both overcooked. The Ribeye also looked like someone had taken a piece off of it already (see picture) maybe it burned too much and they took a charred part out of it. If there's a next time, I would say Med-rare for sure. The NY Streak was Charred. My brother didn't want to send it back though, you know what happens when it goes back. But at $60 they should get the temperature a little more perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is supposed to be the 20oz Delmonico steak, Medium! NOT! And where is that missing part of the steak? Really? VERY DISAPPOINTED

P1ADOPv8yVsUEKqUOjqEPw.text: It was AMAZING! We had the bbq shrimp to start with. Those were the best shrimp I've ever had. Then we had the prime bone in ribeye with garlic mushrooms. It just melted in your mouth! Then we ordered banana cream pie and a pecan pie and those were Wonderful! We never had a want while we were there. My husband did ask a question to Faith. And she was so AMAZING to us. She ended up making our trip to Delmonico's extra special! I can't wait to go back!!!! Thank you for a Wonderful evening!

jeDXqYjWGGqDFaCNfwp7aw.text: Top of the line food and service, of course. 11 drinks, two filet mignons, brussel spouts and home fries, i mean how you could not enjoy this!  Sure the bill was $410 for two people but my SOUL was fulfilled! Inst that what matters anyway? My waitress was a doll who always checked in at the right time.  I love Delmonicos and would recommend to everyone.

etKQb-zhTuQJ1KBwZnzqew.text: Had a great experience here. The BBQ shrimp dish was fabulous and primed us for an amazing dinner. What really set the experience apart was the amazing service. Clint went above and beyond to make it a great experience and he had an amazing sense of humor. We will make this a "must stop" on our next Vegas!

Y4iMdyMIsnAETMMNqr-aQA.text: My family loves to go to Vegas for Thanksgiving and have a steak dinner. Who wants to stay home and cook dry ass turkey when you can gamble, drink, and eat amazing steak? Not me! This year we dined at Delmonico.   Our waiter, I really want to say his name was Frank?? but I don't recall for sure. If it was Frank, he was amazing (props to Frank or whoever you were!!!). Anyway, we were a party of 12 and none of us ever waited or wanted for anything. The entire staff was top notch and took care of us so well.   They were offering a traditional Thanksgiving dinner, which seven people in our party ordered. I did not try it. My brother said it was really good, but others said it was whatever. Why you gonna order that at a steakhouse anyway? Beats me!  The five smart people in my party ordered steak and all the appetizers and sides to go with it. We chose correctly!   First off, our waiter, maybe Frank, helped us select a wine and the one he suggested was amazing. We ended up going through two bottles of the 2015 Cab from Jayson in Napa. I will be looking for that wine and buying it for my collection soon!   So what did we have? We started with the Apple Cured Kurobuta Bone-In Bacon and the Blue Cheese Stuffed La Quercia Prosciutto Wrapped Dates. Both were superb! The "Bacon" was out of this world! My friend also ordered the Heirloom Tomato Soup, and it was great.  For dinner my father, husband, and I all got the Ribeye, my friend had the Filet, and my niece had the Chicken Breast. The Ribeye was amazing, as was the filet, I did not try the chicken, but she liked it. All the steaks were cooked perfectly and seasoned so well.   For sides we had Duck Fat Fingerling Potatoes, Potato Gratin, Creamed Spinach, and Charred Brussels Sprouts with apple bacon. All were fantastic! Especially the gratin and brussels, even though they looked burnt as hell, they were delicious!  Of course no steakhouse meal is complete with dessert, so five of us split the Bananas Foster. We seriously licked that plate clean, it was amazing!  I would not hesitate to dine here again when in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye with sides

AjtUt_LqbRDhKbc0l5rGFA.text: A-OK is the perfect description for Delmonico for me. I went with a big group that ordered a variety of appetizers, sides, and steaks but not a single bite blew me away. The barbecue shrimp was a bit dry, the gumbo was too salty, the salads were standard, and the steaks and sides were just like any other steakhouse. Service was ok but could have been more attentive. The only bite that actually made me smile happened with the pecan pie but I'm just a big dessert person in general so it's not hard. All in all, I don't get the hype from the other reviews and I don't think Delmonico is a must for Vegas eats.

JogsRVP9H7maO_dyKcxAOA.text: Fantastic restaurant if you have some cash to unload. When I went as a group, we had to make reservations way ahead of time. The place was packed.    Most at our table ordered either the rib-eye or the bone-in rib-eye. They were both huge, especially the latter. I'm pretty sure it's enough to share if you've got an average appetite. Mine was cooked to a turn, so there's something to be said about eating at a fine restaurant. It was well-seasoned and very flavorful. The slight char made it especially delightful.    We had some appetizers and sides to share:  Charred octopus:  I liked it because of the char. Octopus doesn't really have much flavor on its own, but the char enhanced it. Someone at our table said that it was like eating a rubber band. Uh, that's kind of what it's supposed to be like!  Truffle/Parmesan chips:  It's like home-made potato chips dried with the truffle oil and had sprinkle chips. Kind of pricey. Plus, I'm not a huge fan of truffle oil.   Potato croquettes:  Kind of like everything you find in a baked potato, except it was formed into croquettes. I liked the bacon, cheese and chives in them. They were pretty good.  Asparagus:  Nothing too fancy. Crisp asparagus with some butter. It was like $15 for not too many.  Creamed spinach:  Really rich. Nicely seasoned.  All in all, the food was excellent. At around $60 per steak and $20-$30 for sides, the extra pounds you would gain *may* just be balanced out by the much lighter wallet.

rnCx4dWSji82_OOIuxgJgQ.text: A wonderful dining experience! Service is very attentive and the staff go out of their way to ensure everyone is satisfied.  I had the Grilled Spanish Octopus as an appetizer. The octopus was coooked to a perfect texture balance of crunchy and chewy. It also has wonderful flavor complemented with olives and small potatoes.  Their specialty, the bone-in ribeye, is marinated well and cooked perfectly. The meat was very tender, juicy, and is topped with warm butter.   Sides are served family-style. The Country Smashed Potatoes was the most minimalist item on the menu but has a good taste of fresh mashed potatoes. The charred Brussels Sprouts had a wonderful texture and is well complemented in flavor with bacon.  For dessert, I had the pecan pie. Warm, comes a la mode, and recommended. Normally I don't order dessert but in this case, all the other dishes were so wonderful I couldn't pass a perfect serving record!  I've dined at Delmonico a couple times before and it is one place I look forward to wherever I am in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pecan pie a la mode
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charred Brussels Sprouts
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Smashed Potatoes

VySaPvdhoiCfTSTPGsTkUQ.text: I stay at the palazzo every time I'm in Vegas, so I'm always eating at Delmonico. I come for my moscato, heirloom tomato, Caesar salad and foie gras. Their steak is decent, not the best but decent for a high end restaurant. Service this past weekend was probably the worst I've experienced. The waiter dripped sauce all over my dad while taking a plate off the table and didn't even apologize, he just looked at the mess he made and hurried off..... wow.... not the type of service I'm looking to get while spending $700 on dinner. I'll start going to other places for dinner from now on

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U-GbaDaJ-9XZ3_wJlYZnkw.text: Been dining here since 2000, shortly after the Venetian opened.  It's an Old School traditional New York style restaurant, a place where you slip the Maitre D' a bill as he directs you to your table.   (Emeril's Delmonico (Vegas) has nothing to do with the original Delmonico's in NYC, but both are traditional similar spirit steak houses.)  This latest visit two of us shared their Seafood Tower (red king crab legs, poached shrimp, lobster tails, oysters on the half shell and tuna tartare with assorted sauces) and the 20 oz bone in Ribeye with a side of creamed spinach.   Really, too much food for two and I ended up eating 2/3 of it with four pieces of their savory Yorkshire pudding-esque hot bread rolls, but everything was excellent.  All the seafood fresh - and then of course the ribeye (20oz Creekstone Farms naturally raised, dry-aged on premises) - probably the best steak in town. (I recall this steak used to be a combination of dry and wet aged but it's now dry aged only.). Had it medium rare, which portions of it looked startlingly on the red side but it wasn't undercooked and was delicious.   The creamed spinach was traditionally prepared and great.  Added some pepper for additional flavor.   Service was fast efficient and friendly. We were seated at a table for four which is the usual way they do it even if you are a party of one - no half sized tables here.   For a calorie rich special occasion, Delmonico is the way to go.

gwAxTPNow_TGFALVz42shA.text: Hands down THE BEST Steakhouse in Vegas!!!!!!   This place deserves 10 stars!!!   Amazing service, best tasting steak EVER!!   Definitely Recommend!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vZZgvIDSlY_ZONroZMOpsA.text: This is a good restaurant if you're in the hotel but it doesn't stand out. The setting is nice and not so noisy you can't have a conversation.  The service was good and the menu had expected choices for a steakhouse. Our group was satisfied with their food but I was hoping for a better food experience.  The Caesar salad for 2 was very basic and hardly had any dressing. I had high expectations that weren't meet. I love salmon at steakhouses because you get a nice sear and moist inside. Here the salmon was just good with no sear and the vegetables around it were cold.  The group order some sides and they met the expectations. The mashed potatoes were outstanding, as were the mushrooms, and creamed spinach.  I think Delmonico's is not keeping up with the higher Vegas competition.

seTg5QsQyOWACLTREJCSiw.text: I spent the first few days of the week in Vegas and ordering steak at a steakhouse was apart of my daily ritual. I came and ordered the 16oz ribeye steak. It was the perfect cut, juicy and buttery. I had it cooked medium rare. Like all steaks, it was a hefty guy but I only ate one meal a day here.  In addition to the butter, you can also request other sauces to go with your steak - bernaise, au poivre, and worcester sauce are offered in the menu. I asked for the au poivre, but I believe I got a brandy sauce instead. Nonetheless, it was an excellent way to add to the juicy buttery flavors of the steak.   The place also gave each patron a single garlic popover, the most delicious light bread you can have at a steakhouse. It's an excellent starter.  And in each meal, I always need some veggies. The garlic sauteed mushrooms were the perfect complements to the steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6BHBrbP1yLhIwPFGToRYdw.text: Hands down the best steak I've ever had!  It was the Ribeye, OMG amazing!!   I ordered it medium and it was fabulous!  So tender and flavorful.  I can't stop thinking about it!!  Lol.   Then for dessert I tried something that has been on my bucket list "to try" for years....banana foster dessert!    I've heard about this dessert years ago when we took a trip to New Orleans.   It's very hard to find restaurants that serve this dessert, as they make it table side - thus me listing it as a bucket list item.  :)  I'm happy to report that Banana Foster is unbelievably amazing!!!!    The waiter brings a rolling table over that contains a hot plate.  He places a Pan on the hot plate and Melts some butter....then he tosses in some brown sugar with maybe some honey as well???....gets that all carmelized,  and then he adds bananas (flipping them over and over in that fabulous sauce).   Really the ingredients are quite simple.  Then he pours something into the dish (not sure what??) and catches the dessert on fire for just a moment (maybe burning off alcohol?).   Once that is done he takes this wonderful dessert and pours it over vanilla Ice cream.    The combination of warm gooey carmelized  bananas on top cold ice cream is the perfect combo!!!    Don't hesitate, get this dessert!  The service is impeccable here!!!    Thoroughly enjoyed having dinner here while at the Venetian.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
