Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aSywNEF9vBF_a4GKPRf5eg.text: Went with the wife for a nice dinner, the restaurant is a solid 4 stars.  We started with a couple of cocktails (New Fashioned and a pear martini) which were great. BBQ Shrimp appetizer, one of their signature dishes, was excellent.  Slightly spicy in a nice Creole type sauce.  We also had the Lobster Bisque, which was great (best dish of the night) - good depth of flavor and lots of delicious lobster.  For dinner, my wife had the 6oz filet and I had the Lamb Chops.  The steak was good, as you would expect.  The Lamb Chops not so great -- I get Lamb Chops often and these were pretty fatty overall.  For sides we had the Smashed Potatoes - excellent and with the Bisque worth coming back for.  Broccoli side was average.  Finished with a Banana Cream Pie, which was A++.  Service was great, ambiance slightly lame.  Overall a solid 4 star experience.

j6wvuwhu1If-8ikq38AXug.text: Went with a party of 6 after tradeshow this week.  We were seated promptly at our reservation and were met by a very attentive and informing staff on drink selections, specials and suggestions.  Our group have a combination of steaks and scallops. Every dish was fantastic.  Drink were never waited for and very tasty.  Appetizers such as the shashito peppers were very tasty.  We ended up with emerils banana cream pie masterpiece.  Awesome meal.  The room does get a bit load as the room got crowded with the acoustics and higher ceilings.

Lvbd6-0_JYzgzkzJ_0CzSQ.text: When in Vegas you have dinner at one restaurant and walk five feet and have dessert at another ! We did just that at Delmonico's. We have heard nothing but wonderful things about the banana cream pie( raving review from (Wolfgang Puck). So we did it ! We ordered the pie and a French press coffee! Already a great start . We sat at the bar (Albert) was the bartender and could not have been any better . So happy to help with our dessert quest and very friendly! Everything came quickly and was soooooo yummy ! This is not your typical banana cream pie, this was more of a custard and not that fake yellow pudding mush ! It is stacked high of whole sliced bananas and what we thought was a cinnamon Graham cracker crust ! Topped mile high with fresh whipped cream and chocolate shavings !!! One word to describe our experience, MMMMMMMMMMMMMM!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Emeril&#39;s Banana Cream Pie

sdBziCS_8CQCa2waxTTfbw.text: This was my first time here. Excellent food and service. I enjoyed everything.  It was a pleasurable experience through the entire meal. Dessert  was the icing on the .  I enjoyed the milk and cookies .

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana cream pie

l542y7n6jS3NLjmtO2Jq2A.text: Ive always wanted to try Delmonico and really looked forward to a tasty lunch that would leave me raving about the place. Unfortunately,  i left unsatisfied with a feeling of disappointment and overall thought it was lackluster. I'd choose Capital Grille, Mastros, or  Lawrys over this place.   To start the popovers they served at the start of the meal were just room temperature. Sometimes you just want a warm piece of bread to start the meal. Well the trend, of luke warm food, continued throughout the service.   The steak medallions were warm and the onion rings tasted day old and warmed over also. Usually you can taste a freshly cooked onion ring but this was just old and sad. For a Creole restaurant the steak medallions lacked seasoning. There was no "BAM", spice, hit of heat, or flavor.  I actually had to put salt on them. Ive never had such bland luke warm steak before. Even Maggianos at Fashion Show Mall has better filet medallions  This dish was garnished with apple wood smoked bacon bits that did NOTHING for the dish.  I was so unimpressed with the whole dish. I should have stuck with the burger or the chicken sandwich.  There wasnt much in the way of appetizers we wanted, because they were overpriced or just lacked general appeal. We opted for the potato croquettes for a starter. They came out less like croquettes and more like mounds of tater tots topped with sour cream, bacon and cheese. They were great but a bit over priced as well.    The only thing we enjoyed was the banana cream pie.   Would I return or bring friends and family here? No! The atmosphere was unimpressive and the food was even more so.  For the price and hassle of getting here Id choose other steakhouses mentioned earlier.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The wonderful banana cream pie. It has less of a cream pie texture and more of a cake texture.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Luke warm filet medallions with barley heated onion rings with blue cheese flakes.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The tater tot mounds aka potato croquettes.

5-HbuAoAklH8vC3EALgp5g.text: I've been here a total of three times.  All great experiences.  Their filet mignon, new york steak, and bone-in rib-eye were all done to perfections!  The cuts were thick yet so soft when you eat them.  Hats off to their chefs.  The steak were done so perfect you really don't need to dip the meat in sauce or butter, etc.  It's so flavorful as is.  Pricey?  Yes very.  Which is the only reason that might keep me from frequenting this restaurant as much as I would like to.  I don't think they have a dress code.  But, I would recommend dressing up a bit when you go here.  Otherwise you would stand out and be embarrass like I was one time.  Happy eating!

i4zl-BywxeKxc7mjxyX-mA.text: The past few visits to the Venetian Hotel I've made it a point to eat at Demonico's. The service is impeccable, waiters remove plates the second you are finished and they are very approachable. The most recent trip I had the braised pork appetizer w/cranberry, creole mustard and basil which was delicious. The entree consisted of the charbroiled bone-in filet mignon with roasted root vegetables, fingerling potatoes and jumbo onion rings. Very fun. Thanks to Hector, my server, everything arrived on time and well prepared.

5ZTwe9S5dIfb7UlFnkS6qg.text: solid experience for dinner. grits were very good as a side as was the tuna and salmon tartare for appetizer. ordered bone in NY strip which was $46. was good, though perhaps a bit more fat than i prefer. wine menu very extensive, like 130 pages long or something.....

Hrds2vlr8BT0grcD5cxPKw.text: i stumbled apon this place my first trip to vegas and been coming back ever since. u can always count on getting a very good meal with some great service.

W_5fgmMXI7sPdVEg1QPiTA.text: Ordered the bone in rib-eye and it was prepared to perfection.  The flavor was amazing. The creamed corn was very delicious as well. I like the atmosphere of the restaurant, not too stuffy.

PhbP5NuL3iofSpkTHzW8YA.text: This place is horribly overrated.  Service was terrible.  They act like they don't want you there.  It took 45 minutes between the first course and the main entree for the food to come out and not once did any waiter come by to check on the table.  Do not go.  Plenty of other great steakhouses in Vegas.

Yn0XJp6Mebk0V5FfJ8sM2w.text: I have traveled all over the world tasting the best foods offered in Paris, Rome, New Zealand, Figi, etc and Delmonico's in Las Vegas remains my favorite restaurant.  The bone-in-ribeye is the best I've ever had -- even better than Mastro's in Beverly Hills and Thousand Oaks.  The service is unbelievable (three designated servers per table) and everything we've ever eaten here has been perfect.  My sister came here after eloping 10 years ago in Vegas.  My husband and I came here 7 years ago after eloping (yeah, my family seems to like eloping in Vegas :)) and we've flown here several times since for the sole purpose of a great meal.  If you're in Vegas, I recommend this restaurant above all others.  But be prepared to spend $100-$150/pp.  I haven't been here in over a year but am going tonight.  I wanted to post this review in advance for the past five times I've been here just in case it's not as great.  Either way, I'll post another review after our most recent dinner tonight.

nxG-5zgg5tTisymru-6Xmg.text: i come here every time i visit vegas. the bone-in ribeye is solid, i usually eat at the bar by myself, servers are friendly and attentive without being intrusive.

SsNhCAhpKjIQYPCbdTFgpA.text: Incredible service! Made a reservation even though it was after 4th of July weekend. I was glad we had one, it was still packed on a monday night! There were eight of us, my friend's daughter brought her new Build A Bear puppy, and the server brought a setting and high chair for the puppy! How cute is that?? we ordered a bunch of appetizers, the fried calamari was light and crisp, bbq shrimp's sauce was thick and sweet but yet savory, shrimp cocktail should be named prawn cocktail, and the squash ravioli - again, it's the sauce that did it, yum. Every time I see lobster bisque, I order it for the kids, they LOVE it - creamy, velvety with chunks of lobsters. Hubby had the ribeye steak, I had the filet mignon, took a bite of my friends' beef medallion and colorado rack of lamb. I think the ribeye steak and lamb came out the winner. Very juicy and tender, with a little bit burnt on the fat, perfection! We shared the banana cream pie, banana pudding, creme brulee for desserts. The pudding was no doubt the winner, the others are good, but if you can only order one, have the pudding. Again, expensive, but money well spent. Will come back again for sure!

hwmEJHtumKQOHqe85-H-iQ.text: my bf and i were totally looking forward to dining at delmonico.  i like fancy dining, he likes meat, put it together and we usually go to a steakhouse.  however, i did look at the menu beforehand, and noticed there were no crab cakes.  i always have crab cakes before a filet!  so that's probably where the problem started.  i made a reservation a couple months in advance on open table, but even then i could only get a 5:30 rez.  i'm not sure of the entire layout, but it seemed like we were seated in a more private room, which was nice.  the areas we passed through were super loud (staff and wedding party of 20).  gorgeous giant leather seats.  we started off with the "creole boiled gulf shrimp cocktail with tomato horseradish sauce and homemade crackers".  there was definitely some BAM in the sauce.  very peppery and lingers.  the crackers were just as spicy, but why are crackers served anyway?  the shrimp itself didn't taste like it was prepared in any special way.  bf had a bone in strip.  i order one of the specials, kobe sirlon.  i'm sorry this had to be my first experience with kobe.  it was TERRIBLE.  pretty on the plate, thinly sliced, with sinewy strands running all through it.  i was mortified with all the chewing.  i partially blame myself.  i knew i should have stuck with my standard filet medium rare.  sigh.  and now i will probably never go back to delmonico.  the sides consisted of overly buttery country smashed potatoes and tiny fried bay scallops (tasted past its prime to me).  we also ordered an additional side of asparagus, also too buttery.  emeril's banana cream pie was good though.  intricately placed bananas seemed to float between layers of banana cheesecake.  the service is decent, but a bit impersonal.  we made a huge stain on the white tablecloth with a piece of dropped meat, and i expected the server to make a joke at least.  total damage, including tip, no drinks, was $195.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. banana cream pie

2O3ebWL8W5xfWxG44XyzHA.text: My family and business associates have visited Delmonico over the past eight years and in the past were delighted with the food (although we did notice some service slippage over the last couple years). However, the last visit in 2010 was a big disappointment. The food was just average and the service was terrible. My steak came to the table sans the melted butter and the server's solution was to bring a pat of butter several minutes later. There are too many outstanding restaurants for us to ever visit this restaurant again.

zBiEZwq2M95CVtI3fw5KKg.text: This place is a solid four star restaurant.  The decor was modern and minimalist.  Our server helpful and attentive.  The food was great.  We started off with Emeril's cajun BBQ shrimp.  They were just enough to hold us over, a little overcooked, but seasoned to perfection.  My girlfriend had a fillet of halibut over a sweet potato risotto and I had the 22 oz bone in steak rib eye.  I had a taste of the sweet potato risotto, and I thought it was delicately sweet with an interesting flavor.  The halibut  was, well, halibut.  My steak, on the other hand, was a real treat.  The bone does weigh the steak down a bit, but it was still thick and juicy.  It also came with three dipping sauces, which were tasty, but also masked the flavor of the beef.  I'd say use them sparingly.  Another complaint about the actual bone was that it kept the steak from being cooked evenly, one side was noticeably bloodier than the other.  In all, our dinner came out to about $150.  I think for a hearty meal with clean presentation accompanied by wine, not a bad deal, but not a home run either.

f6HEkQJ83pRTvI31Tn7RCQ.text: was in vegas for a wedding & did the fancy/smancy thing cuz i love to eat...big fan of the food network & this guys antics on tv...but this place was horrid & over priced~it fits the picture of u receiving a small piece of the main course & paying like $50/plate wit no sides~calamari was watered down...trus me im all about payin the big bucs if its quality....this one wasnt....this was the only party pooper of the sin city trip

0y3Lebd1Optyyy7dG--lQA.text: I came here for work - I am not a big steak eater so if that is the kind of review you are looking for skip it.  Everyone knows the real reason to go to steak houses is for the side dishes and they do have good side dishes.  Our server was also very friendly about our changing party size and I had no problems with the reservations.  I am giving it 4 instead of 5 bc of ambiance- they could have done a little better here.  It is a little boring and white-walled, plus the bar area feels too open to the casino for me.  Plus side though it is right around the corner from the new Barneys so you can buy bags or shoes before/after.

CgAMejWWefRGG2LxKMC79Q.text: I came here for my 20th birthday just recently and I definitely recommend it.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.  The steak I ordered was so tender that it practically melted when I touched it with my knife.  And it tasted even better.  I ordered shrimp with it as well and the each piece of shrimp was the size of my fist.  They, too, were delicious.  I received a small dessert with chocolate gellatto and real whipped cream which was awesome.  The one small misstep was actually the funniest part of the night.  My dad was having a gin and tonic and when he requested our main waiter for another one but with more gin in the drink, the second drink arrived in an even smaller glass.  My dad just sat and stared at the tiny little glass as I sat across the table chuckling for the rest of the evening.  So, it looks like you might not want to criticize the bartender.  Other than the sensitive bartender, the evening went off without a hitch.

rIwd3sRWVrN7d0vxdiLeYA.text: one of the best steaks i've ever had.  amazing waiter, attended to us as if the rest of the restaurant wasn't packed.  having cellars bursting with superb and undrunk wine, my buddies and i BYOBed, and the waiter joined in.

RkBzAKR-y1pG0VFjALAp1w.text: We came to this place in search of good fine dining restaurant, excited with the rating of the place. Can't say anything about the drinks: they were delicious and the ingredients were in perfect balance. Except for the fact that we were charged for a tiny bit of their house made vodka sample (i'd never expect 4.5 stars restaurant compromise its reputation by being so cheap towards the diners). Anyway, then the food came... Soaking in butter, it was impossible to eat (i'm not a big fan of straight melted butter or  heated oil). My pasta was floating in grease. Without exaggeration, it was simply a poor sight. The steak was half fat... I mean, really, it's not like you don't see what you put on the grill... We decided to pass on the desert.. The sizes of the cakes were suspiciously big...( usually, if the desert is delicious and served in fine dining place, they are pretty small. It's not that i complain about the huge delicious piece, but ...) So no, i won't recommend it to anyone.

-Z1sBNercIPYzANVbdUo1A.text: Just got back from Vegas and our second visit to Delmonico. We had the Filet Medallions($48) and they were Heavenly ! They had a carmelized onion,Mushroom mixture with a Parmesan crust that absolutely sent them into Orbit !!!!! Not to mention the Prime Dry Aged Filet that was literally "Cake" tender and had a deep beef flavor. We also had the Jumbo Australian Lobster tail that was sweet and cooked to perfection in a white wine reduction with aromatic veggies/herbs($95).May I also suggest the Bone In Ribeye($55) which is the house specialty....it's to die for !!!!  In regards to attire it seems like a dressy place but folks were showing up with Tommy Bahama Shirts,Shorts and flip flops and were seated without question and some were "dudded up". My wife and I ate for about $200 but it was worth every penny !This a must stop for a special dinner if your a steak lover !!!!   Oh....our table as well as everyone else's had four servers and a host !!!! Exemplary Service

od7GhhNWc7rozO1fyGebTQ.text: this was highly recommanded from a good friend of mine, he said that this is one of the best steakhouses to visit in vegas so we had to give it a try....but this is not a fair review because we dined at cut two night before...

zg2MIN3vFN5anjqHvdr2bQ.text: The menu offered very comforting, rich Southern influenced dishes for the most part, such as seafood chowder, creamed spinach, beef chili with chive sour cream and fried rock shrimp. I chose the beef chili, which was very good, if a tad bit too salty for my taste. The portions were well-sized. The banana cream pie, drizzled with caramel sauce, was the ultimate in banana cream pies. The nice sized slice was overloaded with banana slices and dense banana cream custard, and it was complemented with a fine tender crust, whipped cream, chocolate shavings, and caramel sauce. mmmmmmm...Definitely the best banana cream pie I've ever had, and I've tried quite a few. I look forward to going back when I visit Las Vegas again and trying all the other delicious looking dishes. and their key lime pie! You just have to try the pies! Great restaurant if you like your food robust, unfussy, and rich.

hVT-qDVRF0rIXsL-Fxa0pQ.text: This review is actually an average of two visits.   First visit was back in January of 2013. My friends and I decided to have dinner at delmonicos to spoil ourselves. We were in Vegas for the CES convention so the place was pretty crowded. We had to make reservations in advanced just to make sure we got a table.    So what did we get? Bone-in Rib Eye. It was delicious. It was tender. It was juicy. It was pretty much the best steak I've had so far in my short life. The flavors were amazing and the seasoning was just right..   Then came dessert. I do believe my boyfriend and I had a cheesecake. It was so rich in flavor. While my friends, they had banana cream pies and one had bread pudding. Needless to say, we were very happy. The price was definitely worth it.  Service: N/A Food: A+++++   However, our second visit in August 2013, everything wasn't what we remembered it to be. The steaks were disgustingly different. They were dry. They were rough. I ordered a medium rare and it came out medium. It was NOT tender. It took a lot more effort to chew than it should for something that's $52. There were NO flavor in it and the seasoning was quite lacking.  What the f*ck happened?!?!!!??!!! The steaks tasted like they were fresh steaks versus the dry aged ones that they advertised.   THEIR SERVICE IS FANTASTIC AND IMPECCABLE.   We had brought up the issue with one of the servers and the manager of the location, Doug, took care of us. My friend's steak, and so was mine, was done three times to see if we were happy with the results. My friend's steak was pretty much rare when she ordered medium rare so they tried to correct that for her. They took the steaks off the check and gave us complimentary desserts.   Even though they tried to correct my steak and even though they had amazing service, I'm not sure if their quality control is at work anymore. The quality was a good 180. The piece of meat they gave me was comparable to a $20 steak from Outback or any other random cheap joint versus the $52 price tag. It could be a bad batch, it could be quality control, but I'm not sure if I'd return to the location.  Service: A+++++ Food: F

cWz06Zsw3Cm-bjjVsdjVKw.text: This restaurant is amazing! We started with the BBQ Shrimp & Oysters. Then my husband got the Shrimp & Grits.   But what satisfied me (and had flavors that I will continue to search for) was the Pappardelle Pasta with Wild Mushrooms. It had (and I quote from the menu) Fresh White Italian Truffles, Parmesan Reggiano, Vermont Butter and Local Chives. I can't wait to come back just to get this, but it was a special, so hopefully they will have it!  The staff was great too. Very helpful and not stuffy at all. I told our waiter I was craving pasta (which is limited on their menu) and he said they could make me a shrimp scampi on the fly.  And I thought their digital wine list was so cool!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Pappardelle Pasta with Wild Mushroom. It was a special &amp; an appetizer portion. They would have done it in an entree portion.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters. Briney &amp; amazing!

xFb3p84HK6cvi6fBGTsenA.text: Appetizer: Ahi! Entree: Bone-in ribeye!  Really recommend this place if you want something decent in Vegas.

V0VgYMja12M5Ezf615JchQ.text: I did an all Venetian restaurant tour on my most recent Vegas trip.  I had dinner here the second night of my stay.  We ordered the gnocchi w/ black truffles to start ($25).  For my entree I had a bone-in ribeye w/ foie gras ($72 - $52 for the steak & $20 for the foie gras), my friend had the regular ribeye ($48), and on the side we had haricot vert almondine ($11) & fingerling potatoes ($12).    The gnocchi was very good.  It had a nice crisp and the truffles accented the taste of the potatoes in the gnocchi very well:  4 Stars.  Unfortunately, the steak was not very good.  It was fatty, chewy in some spots and not that flavorful.  The waiter stated that Delmonico's has the best steaks in town.  Sorry, but I have had better steaks at STK and T-Bonz in Summerlin:  2 Stars.  The foie gras was OK.  It was nice to see it on the menu because you can't find it in CA.  However, I was expecting more crisp:  3 Stars.  The haricot vert was just OK too.  The beans were crispy and there were plenty of almonds, but other than that they were nothing to remember:  3 Stars.  Lastly, the fingerling potatoes were too salty, and I am one who generally doesn't notice when dishes are too salty.  The waiter Ken did offer to make a new batch, but the food took a long time to come out and we declined:  2 Stars.  To accompany the meal we had a bottle of COS Pithos Rosso 2008 from Sicily ($85). The winery describes the wine as superbly elegant, subtly meaty w/ a cherry fruit nose.  The palate is profound:  Elegant, pure and mineral with lovely spice and earth notes.  Some complexity, and a bit of tannic structure.  OK, perhaps too much self-promotion, but Delmonico has an extensive wine list at many price points.  The wine was excellent and went very well w/ all the dishes:  5 Stars.  The ambiance was sterile, but there was a good amount of space between the tables.  Unfortunately, the restrooms were lame.  It was quite a walk, there was no valet and only one stall and one urinal.  I had to wait and after I finished, the line was two deep:  2 Stars.  In addition, the service was not very good.  The entrees came at least 35 min after the first course.  Ken, our waiter never stopped by to check on us and let us know it would take a while.  He did redeem himself by agreeing to take the potatoes off the check.  However, he offered us a complimentary dessert and we chose expressos and my friend asked for sambuca also.  We were charged for the sambuca : XXX. If he didn't take the potatoes off the check, I would have given him 1 Star:  2 Stars.  I will not return to Delmonico's the next time I am in Vegas, even though I can walk here from the Venetian where I always stay.  The steak was lousy, the bathroom is lame and the service sucked for an establishment of this caliber.  Word to Emeril:  You need to work on this restaurant - BAM!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnocchi w- black truffle
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in ribeye w/ foie gras (fatty)
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fingerling potatoes

vsJKWSOb_O0_3TV6clgV4w.text: This place is by far the best restaurant for impeccable service and incredible food. From start to finish, EVERYTHING was spot on. Nobody is perfect, but this place... this place is the definition of Perfection. From the smiling hostesses to the personable server, Frank, that not only was warm and welcoming, but even wholeheartedly supported their participation for Restaurant Week. Even explained what Three Square was all about and let us know that the portion of each meal is donated to help the hunger. He genuinely wanted us to participate and even had the RW menu to show us when we sat down. Not like some other steakhouse server *coughcough (Smith&W) that hid this menu unless you mention it and when you do, they treat you cold as winter. Not at this place, you feel like family or a special guest at someone's house. And this is just lunch for crying out loud. Service felt like you're the most important person in the world. Amazing.  Frank was delightful to have as our server. He was informative, attentive, enthusiastic, and just had this kind, easy going presence about him. Getting to know my Father and I throughout our dining experience. It was so nice to have a server that actually wanted to know more about their guests. He was thrilled that we came for Restaurant Week and when I started ordering, he would say.. that's my favorite too love the burrata cheese or after I ordered the Prime hamburgers.. he would say.. that burger is so juicy and delicious, you'll love it. It felt so good that the server is all for it. Even his assistant said thank you each time she took a dish or utensils away. So sweet and kind!  The goods... Everything. There wasn't a single thing that was mediocre. Complimentary bread was like a light croissant mixed with herbs. The appetizers.. My Father had the Heirloom Tomato Soup With Grilled Ricotta Cheese Sandwich, which was so good.. I didn't even get a chance to taste not even one bite of it. He was enjoying it so much that I didn't have the heart to interrupt his food romance. Sh*t. I just wanted one bite!!! *sigh OH well.. I ended up enjoying the Vine-Ripened Heirloom Tomato Salad with my favorite Burrata Cheese, Red onion, Balsamic Vinegar, and Torn Local Basil. It was oh so freshly made. That burrata cheese just makes my day. Loved every single bite of it.  If you come here for RW... a must try.. DELMONICO'S PRIME HAMBURGER. On Toasted Brioche Roll With Fries, Cheddar Cheese, and Bacon. I never in my life had a hamburger like this one. It was first class, first rate, love at first bite. Outstanding flavors. Even the sesame seed bun tasted buttery and oh so soft. So good, so good, unbelievably Deeeeelicious. The size of this burger was enormous. My Father had to cut it up like a steak to eat it. Me, on the other hand ate it like a champ. I was full from eating only half of it, so was my Father. The presentation itself was like art. Even cutting it in half was beautiful. I'll be daydreaming about this burger probably for the rest of my life. My Father kept on laughing, either from the sight of happiness of seeing this magnificent burger or he can't get over how huge this is. Either way, he was enjoying himself and that makes me extremely happy to see. We, both had a splendid time here.   Both desserts were wonderful.  The Banana Cream Pie Parfait with Caramel Sauce, Chocolate Shavings, Whipped Cream, and Graham Crumbs had this cooling effect. It's a great sweet summer treat. Thick cream. The Traditional Bread Pudding With Warm Caramel Pecan Sauce was soothing. Generous amount of pecans. It was a seal deal to a great meal.  After the whole dining experience, this restaurant now tops as one of my favorite places in Vegas. I never had a burger impress me until today. Superb!!! Fantastic service, food, and ambiance. Lovelovelove this place :)

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. RW 2015 Dessert. Banana Cream Pie Parfait - Caramel Sauce, Chocolate Shavings, Whipped Cream, and Graham Crumbs. Sweet cool off.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. RW2015 Dessert. Traditional Bread Pudding - With Warm Caramel Pecan Sauce. Love that fresh whipped cream!
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. RW2015 Delmonico&#39;s Prime Hamburger. The insides.. my oh my. Beautiful :)

kot4mryGkVznop7jGLMCLQ.text: I came for a restaurant week lunch with my two lovelies, Sandra and David and my husband joined before he headed to work. This 3 course was $30.15.  The 3 of us not working that day ordered beverages. This place made my heart sing because they had a Whisky BOOK. To be handed pages upon pages to browse on top of the other spirits, wine menu AND cocktail menus made my damn head spin because I wanted a lot of things. I settled on getting the Scarlet Starlet which had Glenmorangie 10, Tuaca, lime, hibiscus, strawberry and egg whites. It was totally up my alley - very much the scotch shined then the balance of the rest of the ingredients came through. Very much worth the $16 in alcohol and skill in mixing- the bartender Michelle was great.  Appetizer I got VINE-RIPENED HEIRLOOM TOMATO SALAD (With Burrata Cheese, Red onion, Balsamic Vinegar and Torn Local Basil) which was standard, but good because the components were quality and fresh.   Entree I got PAN ROASTED ATLANTIC SALMON( With Sweet Corn & Crab Vinaigrette and Fresh Basil) which was nicely cooked and was very fresh and clean. I liked the large pieces of lump crab mixed in with the corn.   Dessert the hubby and I shared:  BANANA CREAM PIE PARFAIT(Caramel Sauce, Chocolate Shavings, Whipped Cream and Graham Crumbs) was a solid dessert that could convince someone who doesnt like banana cream. The custard in it was creamy while still being light.   TRADITIONAL BREAD PUDDING(With Warm Caramel Pecan Sauce) I love bread pudding and this was good, but average. I do appreciate that the caramel was flavorful while not being saccharine sweet.  I thought it was a solid lunch, but I am coming back for drinks as there's very few places on the strip I've enjoyed the beverage offerings as this. Fantastic beverage program for the libation lover.

Bte61X4PJVPPOXAhGUfo4A.text: I have had steaks @ many great steakhouses the bone in rib eye is by far the best I've ever had. My wife ordered the salmon and it was excellent. We ordered corn and fingerling potatoes as sides. Both were good but wish I would have gotten something other than the fingerling potatoes. Overall great service, amazing steak & salmon highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fingerling potatoes and corn as sides would definitely order the corn again!
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Bone-in Ribeye I have ever had!
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon was awesome!

_oHutTOnuiUPo58iDYz0Hg.text: great place to spurge.  heirloom tomato with burrata was fresh and delicious.  Steak (Ribeye) was cooked to perfection and the seasoning gave it a little extra flavor without overpowering.  Make sure to save room for Emeril's signature banana cream pie.  It was amazing and beautiful.  Each bite was perfectly ripe.  The layering of the pie made it picture worthy.  We also had the lobster bisque and the Bronzino which were good but similar to what I have had at other restaurants.  The highlights were really the steak and banana cream pie. My dirty martini with blue cheese stuffed olives was also spot on. Service was truly exceptional.  Servers worked as a team that was a well oiled machine.  Impressive to see all plates landing at the same time including at the large tables near us.  Ambiance was modern.  Chairs were so comfortable, you can really get comfy and enjoy the meal. To be honest, some meals in Vegas are not always worth the price tag so I was a little skeptical.  I was so happy that this was not the case here and Delmonico's really delivered.

aSCtBiG3quWnsfjYIY9imw.text: Always wanted to try it..... too bad it sucked! Lobster bisque was bland, no seasoning... gumbo was so undercooked the shrimp jumped in my water glass! Absolutely no seasoning, bartender warned me that people complain about it having no spice... that was an understatement... now lets talk about the Lobster rolls... brioche buns are great, but when you pretoast them and leave them under a heat lamp it tends to ruin it. The mixture itself was bland.. again.. seems to be in the normal scheme of things.. anyway, after a monumental disappointing lunch, I'm gonna head to the room for a nap. 3 am came way too early!

DHf0z01tcoIp8oGobjhOEA.text: We had the worst service there. The bread never came until we asked and when we got it, it was cold. The only way the bread can be cold on  a very busy night was the left over from other tables.  The food was good except the Thanksgiving turkey meal was bad! Tasteless, not good at all!! The whole time the server barely came over to check on us and we had to flag him down after so many times of him passing but not looking at us.  Will not recommend and never go back.

QI-fKCAUWHKbRYo-e4rXCQ.text: My first 5 star rating.  I can't think of a single area that deserves less. I'm just gonna leave it at that. Go try it out and you may be lucky enough to have Michael Jackson Jr. as your guide. Yes that's his real name.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pecan pie

61iOwTHzfzm5TANpwKbN9g.text: What an experience! I made reservations for my friend and I. We had dinner at around 6:30pm on a Sunday. We were seated right away.   Three servers were helping us, and they were very attentive throughout the night.   Our meal started off with complimentary bread. It kind of reminded me of yorkshire pudding. It was really light and airy. I liked it because it didn't make me as full.   Both of us ordered the bone-in rib eye cooked medium rare. It was cooked nicely, and it had nice flavors. I didn't realize it while I was eating, but the steak was really salty. I couldn't stop drinking water all night. We also ordered the wild mushroom side dish. This can definitely use less salt. To end our meal, our server gave us a birthday dessert- blueberry sorbet. Because we were so full, we ordered the banana cream pie togo. It was boxed nicely and I was able to enjoy this dessert later that night. It was delicious, but if you don't like bananas, don't get it.   It was an overall pleasant dining experience. I would definitely come back and try other dishes.

o-kwuZo9_4qNZexlXp42MA.text: Delmonico's is located in the Venetian, quite a walk from Valet parking. There is a constant stream of diners through the dining rooms as the restaurant is a popular place. I ate here for the second time and I had an enjoyable meal. We had a wonderful steak dinner here! The Truffle chips were amazing. Our salads were very good (Blue Cheese Wedge & Heirloom tomato), and my bone-in ribeye was fantastic. The Asparagus and creamed Spinach were okay. The food was fresh and tasty.   To finish off the meal, I went with the banana cream pie. I've seen pictures of it for a while, and it was very good, and definitely large enough to share. If you like bourbon or Scotch, they have an extensive collection as well. There are better steak houses in Vegas but this is still one of the better ones.

Kf6i22GceDTbRWmUjtVUaw.text: We had to come back here again on our most recent visit to Vegas. It was as good as we remember it. The lobster bisque, filet, and chocolate souffle did not disappoint. The only minor complaint I have this time is with the cocktails. Too much ice and no garnish. For the type of restaurant it is, it should also not be using regular ice cubes from an ice machine. The drinks should not only taste good, but look delicious as well.  I would not hesitate to come back here.

o4MC6AVm3xEFFEpNQgxlOg.text: Unfortunately the food was so bland considering the bill came out to 200$. Tried the bone in rib eye had a decent char but very bland no salt or seasoning, filet mignon was the only good dish but lacked any presentation just a chunk of meat on an oversized plate, bbq shrimp appetizer sauce was flavorless, fried oyster were breaded too much and the green pistachio sauce tasted and looked like baby food, the truffle potatoe chips eere drowned in oil, banana pie also tasted plain. Overall lack of love in the cooking and I could find more flavor at a home town buffet. Maybe an off night but the service was good at least until the server realized I had a comp :o went from 100 to 0 real quick lmao. Still tipped 50$

OtGt2P7lI3PnyVTCBoKQTQ.text: Favorite steak house. Food is great and good price for a steak in Vegas strip. Have eaten here several times and it is consistently good food. The service is top notch. The restaurant atmosphere allows you to forget you are on the busy strip and enjoy a nice dinner.

wWYCg_D0Vz88qbivoFm8vw.text: Ok, be prepared to shell out some money, not cheap!  The setting and wait staff was very nice.  Wine selection was very good, but typical restaurant pricing.  Food was fantastic,  had the lobster bisque, ribeye with broccoli and baked potato. Everything was cooked just as ordered. A must steak house!

RCXvGjYbFgj6Z3s6s4QLSQ.text: Holy smokes we loved this place!! From the homemade potato chips with truffle oil to the BBQ prawns, oysters, herb fillet, halibut, and desert. This place was absolutely delicious. The service was great also. Merill beat Colicchio hands down....

UVOY7bQH9Z1t6QCW0_g46Q.text: Very impressive service and fine steaks. The wine list is most impressive with some great wines at reasonable prices. Well done

KZZiaSUnmkFvSg426HInHw.text: Great evening at the bar. Tell Lilly or Clint what mood you're in, or style of drink, and they will deliver a bit of perfection. Had appetizers at the bar, and felt like we were eating with old friends. Perfect way to spend time in Vegas!

jTlP9izKAXbF9T91pbP7RA.text: I've eaten here twice, it was better a few years back. The steak wasn't that great quality in general for the steak. The sides and salads were excellent. I'm kind of upset that they share the name with the fantastic steakhouse Emeril owns in New Orleans.

wK5Pp6NH8pfWFcfxqmEMDw.text: Ate at the bar here and had a great experience.  Service was attentive and the food delicious.  Ordered the bone in ribeye --- enjoyed the spice rub and the meat was very tender.  Sides of broccoli and mushrooms were great.  And for a Las Vegas steakhouse, the prices were not obnoxious (a la the nearby Cut).   The banana cream pie is incredible --- great way to end your meal.

sTHM4r9njebk0JFyE04ymQ.text: My companion thought his rib-eye was very good, but nothing to differentiate it from other quality steakhouses. I had the salmon dish that the waiter said was a signature dish on most of Emeri's restaurant menus. My salmon was topped with bbq sauce and had a sausage hash - the salmon was prepared well, but I didn't care for the taste of the dish. Instead of bread, they came by at the beginning of the meal with two oily popovers per person.  The room is unattractive.

sGRVybkrx9rCR-aGKnoeqg.text: This was a dinner for work.. not sure if I'd pay for it on my own dime, but it was excellent! Service was excellent. The sommelier even happily took back a $120 bottle of wine (guess that's cheap by Vegas standards!) when the 2nd bottle smelled corked.   Appetizers: *butternut squash ravioli - recommended if you love duck! Covered in duck confit.. yummy! *BBQ shrimp - sauce was rich, heavy and delish. It was almost a combination of a gumbo base and bbq sauce *foie gras with berry tart (on the daily specials menu) - wow! if you follow my reviews, you know I'm a foie gras lover, but this one was really excellent. The crossed grill marks on it were beautiful  Main course: *Bone in ribeye - 18 oz of buttery tasty goodness. Well seasoned. Not best steak I've had in my life material, but quite good. *Ahi tuna - huge portion! Cooked to perfection, but the enormous slabs were kind of off putting. I guess when you're paying $42 for freaking tuna you should get something substantial. Plus it makes you feel more like your steak eating companions to have this retarded big portion on your plate.  Sides: *just get the truffle chips.. you will thank me later! *grits covered in bacon couldn't get more fatty :) No complaints here  Dessert: *chocolate bread pudding - very chocolatey! *butterscotch pudding - good but honestly the freebie portion at Bradley Ogden is yummier!!

C3yUigxsMXowga1aKoCu4Q.text: AWEFUL bone-in ribeye. AVERAGE/BLAND/DRY au-gratin potatoes. GOOD lobster bisque. Both mine and my husband's rib-eyes were gristly and fatty (neither had marbling that is found in good cuts of meat). About 25% to 30% of our steaks were gristle and fat, which we left on our plates. We both thought the seasoning was boring, but we know that's a matter of preference.  We eat at nice steakhouses (Del Frisco's, Ruth's Chris, Brook's, Morton's, Elway's, Shannahan's) a couple of times a year, so we think we know about quality steak. Our steak and au-gratin potatoes were something a casual dining restaurant like Chili's or Applebee's would serve. Staff was pleasant. Our demogs: mid-40's, professionally employed, live in Colorado.

kuqx7hFWC1GfWKPZZRXTSA.text: Such a disappointment!  Here in Vegas with family, we're all a bit of foodies and selected Delmonicos for its reputation as a great steakhouse.  We've dined at other Emeril restaurants and been very pleased, including another Delmonicos location.  The ambiance of the restaurant was considerably lacking.  You expect a steakhouse to have that rich dark woods atmosphere.  This was very bland and nondescript in a city that does things to an excess..  The steak, a bone in ribeye was good but not OMG.  Barbecue shrimp appetizer and popovers were delicious.  Side dishes including the Au gratin potatoes were fair.  Banana cream pie is a must have.  The freezing cold restaurant added to the disappointment.

a9RUQaht7oqSe132mR2cag.text: We came here on a mission called "20-ounce Bone-In Ribeye". That is all we wanted.  So, we ordered the ribeye with mashed potatoes. We shared both over a few glasses of red wine. The steak is served with a glaze of butter worcestershire, bearnaise and chimichutri sauces. It was huge, beautifully cooked, and tasted good. It was missing one thing for me: SALT! My impression was that it had none. My BF said he liked it as it was. Don't get me wrong, it was a really good steak but it left me wanting more from the flavor spectrum. The potatoes were okay.  Service is always impeccable at Emeril's restaurants.

ir-EVhHyWna7KqYWtj660g.text: Hands down the best meal and service I have ever had! We all did the three course special which was great and the portions were triple the size what I thought they would be! Michael and Drew were awesome waiters and made sure everything was perfect. I know my family will talk about that night for years to come!

6prMgAjp2LZjuxRvmrFDIQ.text: We were seated promptly for our 5:30 p.m. reservation on Monday, 12/29/2014. Front of house service was exceptional. The food took a while to make it to the table, which was a little surprising as the restaurant was not busy. My wife loved her filet. My bone in ribeye was good, but by far not the best I've had. The meat was over fatty. The sides were very tasty, including the asparagus and the twice baked potato. I would go again, but I'd order the filet instead of the ribeye.

LG9zwIc9dtBRJfeM1zGg4w.text: Amazing food, amazing service...loved the yorkshire pudding instead of bread!  Definitely, would recommend this location to anyone in Vegas!

qwpplXG8yNfzmXC8kIneMQ.text: No.  Go to the original in NYC. Food's good but no. Stop.  If you really need to go to a steakhouse that you want to remind yourself of another time and city, try Capitol Grille or Smith and Wolenski.  This? No.   Again, good food, but no.

R9PpudziZf-mJmC0qVAWoQ.text: I came here with 16 other girls and the service was great!  The place had a great decor of course being in the Venetian in Las Vegas and all.  About half our party came early to get the table since we were staying at the Palazzo but they said we had to all be there in order to be seated. Boo!  I ordered the rib eye steak and we all shared to creamed spinach, the smashed potatoes and the sauteed garlic mushrooms.  They were all really good.  The steak was cooked perfectly (medium rare for me). Very tender! I wasn't a fan of the creamed spinach there but the potatoes and the mushrooms were fantastic!  We skipped on the dessert but I did have a great red wine with my dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. rib eye with my sides
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. smashed potatoes and garlic sauteed mushrooms
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. creamed spinach

BCSepkFSm5VLmmx0CSCJLw.text: Our group of 14 was staying at the Venetian and Delmonicos was our pick for a nice fancy dinner. Since we had a night full of drinking ahead of us, we definitely didn't want to over-stuff our stomachs so each couple agreed to share a steak along with lots of appetizers and sides.   To start off, some of us had the salmon and tuna tartare, wedged salad, baked oysters, french escargot, shrimp cocktail, and lobster bisque. They were all quite tasty!   The BF and I shared a Bone-in Ribeye. Asked for medium rare but it came out medium well. I was disappointed since I really hate eating well done meat. Luckily the flavoring itself was pretty delicious or I'd definitely have to have it recooked. I also had an addition of seared Foie Gras as well - which was the absolute BEST part of my meal. The flavoring and texture was perfect and after my last bite, I found myself wanting more still!  Along with our main entree, we had an order of almost every side they had listed on their dinner menu: buttered asparagus, buttered broccoli, creamed spinach, sauteed garlic mushrooms, mash potatoes, creamed corn gratinee, and potato gratin. All the sides are meant to be shared family style and a scoop of each was more than plentiful to compliment your main course. I loved the creamed corn the most.   As full I already was, I saw expresso creme brulee on their dessert menu so of course I couldn't pass up on that. Glad I didn't either bc it was fantastic!  Service was excellent and our three waiters were extremely attentive and helpful throughout our entire meal. Overall, we had a pleasant dining experience.   3.5 stars because my steak came out medium well instead of medium rare, but because the service was superb, 4 stars it is! Next time, get my steak right please =)

rJXMRpA52voq6bE1MIZmcg.text: Been here a couple times, the last one for my birthday in September. Quality and service were phenomenal as always. Ordered the filet mignon with foie gras, mashed potatoes, and their bread pudding. My man ordered the salmon and it was delicious. My friends were very happy with their dishes as well. Even got a complimentary bottle of wine (though I think that was a mistake on their part. Oops!). Needless to say, I'm a fan and will go back whenever I'm in town.

Q261aq7vLasxZYxuTnoEpw.text: I came here to try their extensive Whisky collection and let me tell you, I was not disappointed. They had an entire book of Whisky from all over the world. I was able to try several flights and get a taste of great Whiskys I had never even heard of. My waiter was very knowledgeable and made some great recommendations based on my tastes. I also got the house Rib eye, it was a very good steak i cannot complain. Definitely go, but make sure you have some money ready because it is expensive.

XT9LeMCXUwI96oLbLAt6OA.text: I was (again) lucky enough to have lunch here to participate in an IT seminar for my place of employment.  When has a free steak ever turned me down?  Delmonico was no exception, good food!  I had wanted to try this place before but eating like a king on a pauper's salary just didn't cut it.  Emeril has done a great job with his steakhouse here in Las Vegas.  The presenters for this IT seminar were smart, they decided to make us go though a big chunk of their product presentation BEFORE letting us start to partake in our steak lunch.  That was smooth guys...make us sweat it out!  But the payoff was pretty good.  Our menu was one created by the folks doing the seminar, it was a nice three-course meal.  We started off with Delmonico's Organic Baby Mixed Greens Salad - topped with creole spiced croutons, shaved manchego cheese, teardrop tomatoes, shaved red onions, and a sherry vinaigrette.  Excellent salad, light, tart, salty, and the croutons and red onions (I love them raw if they're sliced really thin) gave it some nice crunch.  Next we had the choice of either a steak or salmon.  Seeing as I was in a steakhouse and that I-like-a-the-beef, I naturally went for a steak.  On the menu was a petite ribeye - which was charbroiled USDA prime aged, creole seasoned, and topped with butter.  Got mine in a nice medium rare.  Boy oh boy, was this a winner!  Tender, succulent, cooked right, a nice kick from the creole seasoning, excellent I say.  I usually like a steak sauce with my steak...but alas, I did not need it!  I sopped up every last bit of the beefy goodness.  The side of Country Smashed Potatoes were good too, but you can guarantee I kept my focus on that lil' slice of heavenly ribeye!  It's up there with one of the most tastiest steaks I've had, and this was only a mini-me of the full size!  I took a look at some of the other diners steaks that weren't in on our seminar, and they were huge!  Delmonico definitely puts out a lot of meat for the money.  We ended the menu with a chocolate tart of some sort, I cannot fully remember it off the top of my head because I really wasted most of my brain power consuming that steak.  But yes, that tart must have been pretty good because I do remember finishing that as well!  Quickly looking at the actual menu, Delmonico is on par with pricing as other steakhouses in the area.  Most steaks are hitting the $40-50 range, sides are around $9 a pop, with desserts around $10.  Not cheap so if you're going here make sure it's a special occasion!  But then again, if you are rich I guess everyday would be a special occasion.

cKMqmXYq7643CF8rao330w.text: This is part of my steak house reviews for Las Vegas. Delmonico's is a premier steak place. The staff is top notch and make you feel at home even though it is a high end steak joint. We were there for a bachelor party.  all of us tried varieties of different cuts. The filet and ribeye were phenomenal. The side selection was not as good as some other steak places I've been too, however it was still good. The only drawback and it was a minor one, was we had a vegan with us. His chef's creation was substandard for a place this cutting edge.

XRjZXPbj2LFaXX-gQL-shQ.text: Fantastic!  Went here with coworkers/industry acquaintances and I can honestly say this was, hands down, one of the best meals of my life.  Not just the food but the amazing conversation.  And I was the youngest one, by at least 20 years.   Ordered a Rib-eye which was stunningly delicious.  My mouth is watering just thinking of it.  Our table ordered several sides, steak tartare, buttered broccoli, au gratin potatoes... all cooked to perfection.    We had wonderful wine with our meal and great inspiring conversations...it was really refreshing to be out to dinner with people who actually enjoy going out to dinner for 3 hours.  I mean for me it's a dream...other people are always rushing me when we're out to eat so this was a blessing!!  Saying that the "Service was impeccable" is an understatement.    This place is truly incredible!

Z7Vv7Opbph8iB_PHAJjyrA.text: Disappointing. I was not pleased with my steak, and I was very cordial about it. The person who I told just said "ok" and walked away. I expected someone to come over and listen to my concerns, but no one ever did. They also did not discount or remove it from my check.  There are far better steakhouses in Las Vegas.

UAmND6hFrXEdidnAqZkevQ.text: Simply perfection. It is an experience well worth the price. Impeccable service, amazing wine list, phenomenal melt in your mouth filet mignon and strip steaks, mouth watering, delectable side dishes. In a city full of fantastic and amazing gastro experiences, THIS gem is in my top ten list rotation. Go, go go, be pampered and leave so satisfied!

gmlAPyBVF0bUj9ZtgNXffw.text: A lovely date spot but otherwise I'd worry it feels slightly too formal/buttoned up for my ideal night out in Vegas - food was pleasant, wait staff was really pro and the banana cream pie is the best I have ever had by a mile

vaRY12TtbvT9LuQzIgLhWw.text: This is our favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.  Our food has always been fantastic and well prepared and the service has been excellent.  We tend to visit this restaurant almost every time we are in town.  Each visit, we have three servers dedicated to our table, and the main waiter always greets us by name.  I've never experienced better service than what I have at Delmonico.  In terms of specific foods, I generally get a filet and it has always been prepared perfectly.  The sides are fantastic too, as is the wine list.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a high quality steakhouse.

u3p4bjkX9TUor40OWjQafQ.text: My brother in law's birthday required steak...so naturally Delmonico Steakhouse sounded like a great option.   Here's the thing, I love steak, but i'm trying to cut back on being a crazed carnivore. I ordered the half roasted duck (yeah i know it's still meat but it's not red meat...get off my back) and my wife had the halibut. What kind of morons go to a well reviewed steakhouse and don't order steak? Well it's nice to meet you.  My duck was ehh... her fish was ehhh  Had a taste of the ribeye (seriously, shut up...How could I realistically NOT try it?) and wow...REALLY good.  But my rating is only 2 stars you say? Yeah, well my experience was kinda lame...the attentive staff was fine, the prices were completely outrageous even for the strip, and our food was just kinda boring. I didn't think much of it to be honest.  You may be saying... "Well moron, you ordered duck and fish at a steakhouse, what did you expect?" I would then reply "Hey, if it's on the menu, it should be held to the same standards as anything else!". So There! :P  If I do want to pay too much for a really good steak, I know where to go...but y'know, I'm a local and that is rare. (get the pun...nudge nudge...get it?)  What I will say is that it's a classy establishment and they appear to cook a fine slab-o-meat. But i'd steer (I keep doing it!) clear of any non-cow based items. Sorry for the puns!  I'm not really sorry.

apAMxXFWAvz6NOXZxCq6mA.text: I went here with a few friends of mine and was BLOWN away. And to think, I almost didn't even go. I was feeling cheap and didn't want to spend a grip on dinner, but boy am I glad that I went and had the wonderful opportunity to eat at this fabulous restaurant with some dear friends of mine.   First off, the ambiance is very simple, understated, and clean. Nothing overly done. In fact, I heard it was on purpose so that you can focus on the food and the people rather than the art and ambiance of the place.  Secondly, service is top-notch. If you're paying the big bucks, it's no wonder. They totally spoil you here and answer all your silly questions!  Thirdly, ANYTHING you order off the menu will be delicious! We each ordered different items and tried each others plates and were blown away. You can't go wrong with anything you order!  Everything was perfectly made and cooked very well and tender. So juicy! So flavorful and so plentiful!  You definitely get what you pay for at this restaurant. I would totally go back either with a significant other or a nice group of close friends. It was such a lovely experience!

tF8eLBFrz6t8UtvLDzvfjA.text: Awesome food with excellent service We shared the BBQ Shrimp which was excellent, the Butternut Ravioli was great & the oysters on the half shell were fresh. We spilt a spinach salad that was good and the Ribeye Steak was to die for. We ended with the Banana Cream Pie that was 5 layers deep  This was truly a WOW dinner

cf7G2Qj0IWKGrbVXFiIlOQ.text: Efficient Service, Quiet and Great Food  It has been 4 years since I ate here and so on my last day in Vegas, I stopped for lunch. The food as usual was excellent. Tried their tuna which was cooked just perfect. My buddy had a burger which he tells me was very tasty.  Love the fact that this place has maintained such great quality over the years.

Wtz0ed8dhIqnMzP4cj1HYA.text: What a beautiful evening!!  The restaurant is very nice - you can get dressed up or be fine in jeans and a jacket.  The staff was unpretentious and welcoming.  The food was delicious and the staff made every attempt to ensure our experience was fantastic.

i4AJLXtgmmyeGiZGNlBTBg.text: The service was great! When our server came, she apologized saying that she thought someone had already taken our order. We didn't even notice, and it didn't feel like we waited long. It could be due to the multiple servers making sure we got our drinks and bread.   We shared the bone-in ribeye (18 ounce) and the butternut squash ravioli and was not disappointed. My partner's only regret is not ordering a ribeye all to himself. Additionally, when we split it, we only had one choice of how we wanted it cooked. I like rare, and my partner likes medium rare. It came out perfect for both of us.   The rib-eye was deliciously slightly crispy on the edges with the perfect amount of fat to make it melt-in-your mouth. The flavor was delicious and makes me want more thinking back to it.   The butternut squash ravioli was very delicious as well and a wonderful surprise. We did not know what to expect of it. My partner loved it. He loved the sweet flavor inside the ravioli. I am personally not a huge fan of the sweet potato genre, and it did taste a great deal like sweet potato with butternut squash texture within a delicious ravioli. It deserves a 10/10, it's just not my preference.

rz8zNFFKGWszjidegS7NHg.text: Oh dear. Our anniversary dinner here was amazing. We shared the oysters Rockefeller, which had this great buttery panko topping. We then had the steak for 2- huge cut! They came with these puff pastry popovers that also had a great buttery spread on it, accompanied by the seared foie grad add-on. Heaven.   Great classic steakhouse.

ckqU5ksLob3wzxbKZKOu7A.text: We went to Delmonico's a few years ago (while I was undecided if I was an Emeril fan or not...turns out, I'm not).  Didn't care for our meal, but the one thing that stood out was the Banana Cream Pie.  When we were back in Vegas we stopped by just for a slice of that pie. A few years later and its as good as I remembered. I'm picky about bananas, not a pie person, and still this pie is amazing.

k50eADWtu570iVl1W9KZ4Q.text: The service was great and the food was delicious!! Make sure you go in hungry, the portions are huge!!

ODZm_A10hL4xLAt49QObSg.text: The service is excellent.  The food quality is good but everything was very salty. We had the lobster, flounder, lobster bisque, tomato salad etc.  All those dishes were salty.

KXPq4WijBXV93xF529uC2w.text: Best pecan pie ever! Shrimp cocktail, good but nothing special, I thought it would be more Cajun. Oysters fresh and the horseradish was so good! Lobster bisque very good. The steak was pretty good I had a filet mignon and my husband had the Ribeye it was huge! Everything was cooked well. I have had a better steak but it was good. The best thing was the dessert of pecan pie. I'm just going to go there for that!

0VcmYUbNnPoSUdR9TRAAeA.text: We visited this past week and were disappointed in the food. Given the restaurant's high rating and prices, my steak was lacking. The steak had a thick salty crust, which I did not care for. The chips and service were very good though!

1BQa5nKXLB3NnrVmGsXH6A.text: if you're looking for a fancy steakhouse in vegas, delmonico is your go to place. not being a huge fan of emeril lagasse's, my prenotions and opinions were turned 180 degrees after one dining experience in this magnificent establishment.  nothing here is shy of a stellar review. the food is PERFECTLY executed, the service is above and beyond, and no detail is left unfinished.  the steaks can be requested with an extra char on the outside, but the center is still a warm medium rare, perfectly juicy and exploding with flavor in every bite. the sides we ordered were also high acheivers and could be main courses in their own right.   the desserts were phenomenal! i've had emeril's banana cream pie from another one of his restaurants at MGM before, but the warm chocolate brioche bread pudding is like your birthday, christmas, new year, all the holidays, the birth of your first child, happiest day of your life in every spoonful. it was so good, i wanted to cry.  if you are ever in vegas and want to have a flawless steak dinner, now you know where to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. warm chocolate bread pudding
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. banana cream pie
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. potato gratin

-j3RhQOGGW-uav1kNKptnQ.text: Everything we had was amazing here.  Great service, great atmosphere and best of all... great food. Truffle Potato Chips... highly recommend.  When I first saw it... was a little skeptical. But.. they are amazing. Vine rippen tomato salad, really good.  cheese was super fresh and the tomatos were very sweet and rip.   Rib Eye - was perfectly cook, medium rare.  perfect crust and was just so good.   I can see why my friends made it a tradition to come here.

3L1yeDOq716KooDuvsUk0g.text: Deserves a zero. I was highly disappointed. We went for my husband's birthday expecting a meal worthy of the $200 we spent.  The food was very bland. I was so upset I didn't even bother to order dessert.  I thought if dessert tastes anything like dinner, I'm not going to bother. Noone bothered to ask how the food was. The chef didn't bother to come to our table,  even though he spoke to individuals at the three other tables surrounding us. Thank God I opted for the indoor gondola ride after dinner which helped to improve my mood for the evening.  I won't be back here or to any of his restaurants. I'm a good person so I still left a very generous tip;  after all it wasn't the waiter's fault the food was just ok.

dIcxp2EISkirAkhdNP5e1A.text: Yummy!  I didn't realize this was an Emeril (the "BAM!!!" guy on the Food Network) restaurant until I looked at the menu.  Cherylynn N. made reservations for a friend's 30th birthday dinner celebration.  Our reservations were at 7pm, but part of our party got lost so we were seated around 7:15-7:30pm.    AMBIANCE: Well lit, but dim which created a "romantic" setting for those looking for a date night.  As we had 9 people in our party, we were set up in the middle in umm...an oddly shaped table (see Cherylynn N's description).  The restaurant was packed, but the noise level wasn't too loud.  SERVICE: GREAT service!  The waitress was very attentive.  When the food was brought out, there were 5 servers which each carried our entrees in each hand and simultaneously placed them in front of each of us at once.  It was truly a sight to see.  FOOD: **Note: Most dishes are ala carte, so you'll probably want to order sides.  Sides are big enough for 2-3 people to share**  -Crab Bisque ($12) - Delicious, creamy, and full of yummy flavor!!  This was on the Chef's special list, therefore I am not sure if they have this on a regular basis.  The bisque soup is the same as the lobster bisque, but instead of lobster pieces, its generous portions of crab.  -Jumbo Lobster Tail ($48/Market Price) - As I am not such a big meat eater, a lobster tail was my alternative.  I didn't expect such a generous sized portion to come out.  It was heaven!!  Delicious!!  Tender!!   -Creamed Spinach Side ($9) - It was good, but didn't have the additional pieces of bacon that most restaurants have.  You could definitely tell the spinach was fresh though.    -Creamed Corn Side ($9) - YUMMMMMMM!!  I must come back especially for this side!! The corn was so sweet with a light crust on top.  Words cannot describe how yummy this side was, definitely a must try!!  So I know this is a steakhouse with steak, of course, being their specialty.  My friend insisted that I try some of his rib eye.  I'm not a meat person, but I will admit that it was tender and full of flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Bisque
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster

RJhE0yEtCdTBhFLw0A7tVQ.text: DO NOT GO UNLESS YOU LOVE SALT!   I took my husband to Delmonico for his birthday last night and we were both VERY disappointed with the food. His filet looked so dry and shriveled, I was surprised they served it. There was no "essence" only a lot of salt. He chocked it down because he didn't want to disappoint me. I had the chicken breast with fingerling potatoes and onion sauce. Someone must have shaked a cup of salt over everything. I couldn't tell what I was eating and after a few bites said  I wanted to save room for dessert. In all fairness, the service was excellent and the decor classy and not over done. The only thing we enjoyed was the chocolate cake with pistachio ice cream. We live here and have had some very good meals at a few restaurants on the Strip, but would NEVER go to another Emril restaurant. He should be embarrassed and ashamed.

LYZW0kN8N1SWjJPHNV52Rw.text: We had a great experience at Delmonico.  Great food, wine and service made for a great meal.  We started with bbq shrimp and ahi tartare.  The bbq shrimp is New Orleans style which is shrimp in gravy rather than a typical bbq and it was very tasty.  The gumbo was good and had a bit of heat, great stuff.  My bone-in ribeye was cooked to medium and had a creole rub that was delicious.  My son had a huge, huge cheeseburger that was very tasty.    The service was prompt, attentive and courteous.  I grew up in Texas, so I know a good steak when I see it.  The bone in ribeye served here is fantastic.  Expect to spend at least $100/person when dining here, you don't get a great meal here on the cheap...

8uDohBge3oaAE68_5RiEUw.text: Had a corporate lunch here, service and food are atbthe top. Do not miss the Famous Emeril banana cream pie for dessert. Thanknyou Delmonico for being on top of my list for lunch in Las Vegas

HqcsvJnf-UrQzRuHsoleAQ.text: I sat at the bar.  Friendly nice atmosphere.  I had the bone in ribeye medium.  It was perfectly prepared.  I followed it with a potato side dish.  And pecan pie.  It was all great!

DBkCapyadDyRl5vQ30Fp9A.text: Came for our 33rd wedding anniversary.  Service was spectacular.  Food was fine.  I had sea bass which was good.  Husband had filet which was tough in places.  Disappointing for a steakhouse.  Flavor was good though.  Creamed corn was good as there are no sides with steak.  No garnish.  Just a steak on a plate. However for our anniversary dessert they gave us a small scoop of sorbet.  With all the delicious desserts and a 5 star restaurant expected more than.  Chili's will give you a whole dessert!   Underwhelming experience for all the hype.  Our server Rene~was great, however not enough to go back.

3q1qYKyOh9rA6ah9Ex2Erw.text: It's been several years since we dined Delmonico's so we decided to revisit.  Emeril's restaurants consistently prepare exceptional food regardless of which city we visit.   Tonight was no exception!  The signature BBQ shrimp and banana cream pie were as awesome as usual,  and the kitchen prepared steak medallions by special request that were amazing.  Service was attentive, courteous and professional.  It's been about five years since we were here and we even received a pleasant "Welcome back!"  Hats off to Emeril and all the staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9IRRVv7qbq1MfQcfDMrYyg.text: Service was thorough and precise, not the friendliest but there were no errors.   Decor, well, ummmm there is none. Lights on a wire cable is the extent of that. Don't expect more, I'm not joking. Not a painting, wall paper, photo, drawing or stitch of color. Anywhere. Plain, off white walls.  The bread was lovely (I always taste the bread) I ate it all, without shame.  Specialty cocktails were all great, we tried 3, all of which I forgot the names of but the gin with Midori was my fave, I may have had 2 possibly 3 lol  Food was above average but not mind blowing  King crab app was okay, didn't taste fresh to me  Table side Cesar salad was good, I liked the dressing and loved the anchovies but the presentation was done behind me so I didn't get to enjoy the show. Note to self-when you return don't sit in a booth.   Bone in ribeye was yummy. We shared, but it wasn't the medium my husband ordered but I wasnt devastated because I prefer medium rare although it was closer to rare. Mushrooms were good, nothing special.  Caramel cake was delish, very sweet but that's the point!   We will be back, it will be awhile since date nights are rare due to a 2.5 year old child beast but we will be back. I look forward to the filet.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amuse
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7Fms0ps89K5RqquOB3es3A.text: The food is easily 4 starts. However, the service is zero stars. We had tickets to a show (at the Mirage across the street) and therefore scheduled our reservation for dinner for at least 2 hours before the showtime. This should have been plenty of time to eat dinner and get to the show on time.  It took us 30 minutes just to get our cocktails and waters. It took us 1.5 hours just to get our food!!!! It was a Thursday night and the restaurant was not even that busy. The sommelier spent more time checking on us than the wait staff! We had to eat in a hurry and couldn't even finish our meal and had to take it to go. We literally had to run across the street to make it to the show on time. The staff was inattentive and unapologetic. What a complete waste of a $350 meal!  I would recommend dining at The Palm instead where the service is far superior.

HxNCVUbrOxyS8kPJBOaHOw.text: I don't come here for special occasions or to celebrate anything. Except my birthday. And it's my birthday!!! Actually everyday is my birthday. Guess that means I dine here everyday. Been dining here well over 15yrs so needless to say, I've seen it, I've ate it, and I've drank it all. And I still keep coming back for more. I invited my friend Anna to join me for this special occasion. So Anna hasn't been to Delmonico before and knew she was in for a treat. My motto is Great Wine, Great Food, Great Company. And I had all three tonight.   I generally bring a couple of bottles of wine from my collection to share with Dillon, the sommelier. This time I brought a 2004 Rubicon 100% Cab Franc and a 1999 Grgich Hill Cabernet. Holy shit the Cabernet was AbFab!!! Perfect in every way.   To start, we had something special from Chef. Then we moved on to the Foie Gras and Oysters. Both Anna and I were trying to play nice and say, "Here, you take the last bite.", but deep down we wanted it all to ourselves!!! Next we ordered the Chateaubriand. All the steaks are exceptional, but there's something about this. I think cause it's French. I love everything French. Perfect in every way. Grilled right in front of you to a Medium Rare perfection. This was also accompanied with asparagus and mashed potatoes (I had them add some truffles to the mashers. Well it is my birthday!!!). And for dessert, the birthday ice cream and two shots of Jager. They actually don't have Jager at the restaurant, so they had to go out and find some for me. That's why I love this place. And will continue to come here.

Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday Ice Cream with two shots of Jäger
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chateaubriand

y0O_LjF1clztXJgUyIB_aA.text: I had salmon dish and it was out of this world and the service was great as well. We always went to this place to dine and wine our customers every time we went to the trade show in Vegas.

mzjml8e9Hx48U3dC0uThIQ.text: Emeril, bigger is not always better. We had your banana pie a few years ago & have bragged it up to so many people. Had it now & it was taller & dry. So not why we came back, won't be back. Shorter with a great graham cracker crust & moist smaller layers is what you should stick to.

UtTItRd-3Wu3fmF9bMTC3w.text: Emeril's gem in The Venetian Hotel in LV. A bit pricey but the food and service make it worthwhile. The manager Mr. Tran is terrific and makes sure every diner is well take care of!

49IU8_w-9EZyZYxjDI8QTg.text: The Delmonico Steak House is a great dining experience just off the hospitality alone.... Make sure you ask for the two Michaels that work there. Both servers are very attentive.

ezRKl2jzWD2bViAR8TjcLw.text: Back to Delmonico three more times for great Louisiana Caviar atop sumptuous Deviled Eggs; light and airy Popovers; mellow Lobster Bisque; traditional black New Orleans Gumbo; fine French Onion Soup; Caesar Salad prepared tableside; buttery medium rare Creekstone Prime Grade Filet Mignon paired with perfectly seasoned Duck Fat Fingerling Potatoes; a nice mix of Garlic Sauteed Mushrooms; coffee prepared with Jamaican coffee beans; amazingly delicious Emeril's Banana Cream Pie with Caramel Sauce, Chocolate Shavings, and Whipped Cream; very memorable Pecan Pie with Oatmeal Shortbread Crust, Vanilla Ice Cream, and Caramel Sauce; and most recently for lunch during Restaurant Week a humongous 15-ounce Prime Grade medium rare Bacon Cheeseburger on a Sesame-Seeded Brioche Bun dressed with tomato slices, lettuce, White Onions, ketchup, and mayo topped by a juicy pickle segment accompanied by very tasty homemade lightly browned French Fries glistening with a sheen of Duck Fat.    Once Diane did not receive her Maitre-D Butter, and her steak arrived with some char and pepper after her specific request not to.  But otherwise food preparation and service were impeccable and working in tandem like a well-oiled machine.  When an apparent miscommunication resulted in receipt of Sauteed Spinach instead of Creamed Spinach, a side of Creamed Spinach was voluntarily and quickly brought to the table as well, without charge.  Both dishes were outstanding.  Our Restaurant Week lunch culminated in a fine finish with a rich Banana Cream Pie Parfait with Caramel Sauce, Chocolate Shavings, Whipped Cream and Graham Crumbs for me; and traditional Bread Pudding with lip-smacking warm Caramel Pecan Sauce for Diane.  For us, based on past experiences, there is every reason to return again for more epicurean delights.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior View of Delmonico&#39;s Prime Bacon Cheeseburger
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A Fistful of Burger
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Attacking Half of a Delmonico&#39;s Prime Bacon Cheeseburger

L3D2JxPQvUeAVMeJ4wcASg.text: Delmonico Steakhouse does not live up to expectations of a high quality steakhouse.  Had read many reviews that were very flattering which helped nudge a reservation from me to ensure picking a high quality establishment to help celebrate a birthday.  My best guess is that the over the top 5 star reviews recently are from people who have not experienced  a real quality steakhouse such as Delmonico's (no connection to this place) in NYC.  My main beef (pardon the pun) is with the quality of ingredients and in particular, the signature steak on their menu (ribeye), which I had.  This is the one thing this restaurant highlights as their specialty, so it should be a safe bet to ensure a great experience; not so!  It was cooked to order at correct temperature so that is not the problem; the meat simply lacked quality as it was tough, not flavorful, and an inferior cut, which does not happen in a quality steakhouse, particularly one that hails it as their signature steak, so there is really no excuse for this.  Bottom line, I paid $60 for meat that simply could not be a prime cut as they advertise.  My spouse thankfully was pleased with the warm spinach salad and really enjoyed the bread which was actually yorkshire pudding, and a nice surprise!  My sides for the steak are not worth mentioning as they were not up to quality standards.  The food service was relatively proficient.  The restaurant ambiance was somewhat sterile and lacking character.  We did receive a single complimentary scoop of sorbet for the birthday acknowledgement so that was the biggest highlight!  I would normally give a restaurant multiple tries but in this case, never again, no point, they are cutting corners on quality, so beware!

SmcUTvp2g1826oi0hmFGzg.text: So Delmonicos inside the Venetian,start with Bbq shrimp and that Gumbo. The rue mmm mmm, Had the New York strip that was succulent with sides of broccoli,mushrooms a must and by all means those potatoes. Dessert  was a quad. I still want some more of that banana cream pie by far the favorite.

JYE_C3PuntG1yC0sWdzfZQ.text: This is the 4th trip. Again, outstanding. Steaks were perfectly done. I prefer mine blue and it was on point. We purposely came here for our 30th anniversary dinner. Heaven on a plate and in a glass. They even had a card and a table. Set for two. Class act.
