f7Ia4cfRMgAap61j8LknWA.text: Absolutely the best steak in Las Vegas!!! The service is amazing and the restaurant is very clean. If your going to spend the money on the strip this is the place!

sNzusclsW_TD-PEMUeutDA.text: Just went there and we had 2 bone in rib eyes that were really bland! Cooked perfectly and really tender just no flavor. The staff first tried to comp the sides, which were tasty. Then went away for a while and came back and finally comped the 2 bad steaks.

GLalm7r7ZkqXmCiH6IR15w.text: I had their dry aged bone-in rib eye, asked for it to be medium and it was instead rare, no problem -- I ate it as I didn't want the steak overcooked.  Service was a bit choppy, I had requested A1 Sauce, and never was it provided -- finished my steak, no big deal without it, but the fact that they never brought it was quite sad service wise. Additionally, the steak just wasn't mind blowing -- truly it was an OK piece of steak, for a table of three the tab was $266 (no big deal) but certainly not worth coming back, or raving about (the STEAK) this is a steakhouse, I expected much more.  The herbed fries are EXCELLENT, very tasty! The fried cauliflower was EXCELLENT!  Also had their fried pork (pigtail) had a little kick to it and no complaints.

NwjwjmqEFCwkaD20tmwlPA.text: I wouldn't call myself fancy. I wouldn't call myself classy. I wouldn't call myself upscale. So when I go restaurants that are fancy, classy and upscale I immediately feel like everyone in there can tell I don't belong. I don't know what fork is for what. I don't know where to put my napkin when I get up from the table and I swear everyone else notices. I also don't venture to fancy, classy and upscale places cause I almost always hate the food. The fancier the words on the menu the less I wanna try it.   This is NOT that kind of place. Yes, it is fancy, classy and upscale. Yes the menu is a bunch of jibberish food.  But somehow I was still able to make out a few key words to order what was Caprese salad and Potato Soup. HOT DAYUM DUDE: Emeril is no joke. The Caprese was so fresh. The tomato tasted like it was picked 15 minutes before it was cut and placed beautifully on my plate. The Potato soup had big chunks of bacon at the bottom and the server poured my soup over it. Then added a junk of Parmesan cheese and yuuum.  In other fancy, classy and upscale joints I feel uncomfortable to even speak to my serious server. Not this guy. Our server was casual yet still very serious about his job. He even cracked a smile a few times.   I cannot rave enough about this place. It was beautiful and elegant, delicious and exciting flavors. I loved every second of Delmonico  My two small complaints 1. The bathroom smells like wet rocks. Its has really cook huge rock walls but since its in a bathroom it smells weird. You know the smell of a dirty lake? That is the smell the bathroom had. 2. This restaurant is inside the Venetian and VERY hard to find. There are no signs. None. Pointing you toward it. So from me to you: If you find the huge LOVE sign for the Beatles show it is directly to the right, almost hidden by the sign and the elevator.

l0qGjzdwE2QRrrgRbePW5g.text: We loved this place! The food was delicious. We started with their special appetizer of the day, avocado lobster toast. Then the filet mignon and the lobster tail. The filet was cooked perfectly. We also got the potato gratin which was delicious.  Our waiter was spot on through the whole service even with a table of 20 coming in half way thru.  I have to say their table/food managers were a sight to behold. These two ladies probably don't get a lot of credit but they kept that large dining room running smoothly. We ended with their German chocolate cake which was divine and a recommended dessert wine which paired perfectly with the cake.

V5rzVV5ZpVSju5f5ZWXdNA.text: If you want a nice and high-end dinner, Delmonico is the place to be!  We went right into dinner entree and had their Chilean Sea Bass - absolutely delish!  We wanted to save room for Emeril's Banana Cream Pie - FABULOUS! and tried their new dessert on their special menu - Purple Yam Cheesecake with Pandan sauce and a Pandan Sorbet.  Reminds us of Singapore and Malaysia and S.E. Asia.    Very professional wait service and very attentive.  We were impressed!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Purple Yam Cheesecake with Pandan Sorbet
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Cream Pie

igqC4Mojfr1VI_crRHlSyw.text: 3 reasons why Delmonica is receiving 3 stars:  1. The service was just, OK. Nobody was rude, but they did lag on getting to our table, which was in a hidden corner of the restaurant. They took long to even bring bread & butter and when they brought the bread, it was a cold and stale croissant. 2. My boyfriend and I ordered the bone-in Ribeye steak and it was OK. It was tender and juicy, just not served hot as a steak should be, which made the steak start getting colder and tough to eat throughout the dinner. 3. The only great tasting thing that we ordered was the potato croquettes. Those are amazing and is definitely a MUST to order!

BjWwEBexJ3K6k6LipQxsgQ.text: I enjoyed my recent trip here.   We showed up a few minutes before our reservation time and were promptly seated.  This is a professionally run steakhouse with attentive staff and the sommelier gave a great recommendation that we enjoyed...twice!  Appetizers were a hit-the bib lettuce salad with chunks of crab and avocado was tasty while the French onion soup was awesome-as cheesy and rich as the photos depict.  My 16 oz. boneless NY strip was cooked perfectly while ordering it Oscar style was well worth the $30-a large amount of terrific crab with just enough Hollandaise and well cooked and sauteed asparagus.   I didn't have room for the sides the table had.  Everyone I was with enjoyed their dinners and the atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16 oz. boneless NY strip (medium) served Oscar style
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French onion soup as served
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bib salad-the white flaky material is crab-just the right start to the meal.

GJrEtsWouvfXsmgqVctIZw.text: We've dined here several times and each occasion has been top-notch!  Their waitstaff is super attentive and their food is absolutely delicious!!  Ask for a cozy booth against the wall as it can get crowded and echoey in the middle of the restaurant.   Very extensive wine list!  You'll be pleasantly surprise with all the impressive bottles of vino and their prices...they seem fair.  All and all an excellent place to celebrate a special meal or just appreciate a nicely cooked steak!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Onion Soup

jQq5wRr5BWGt0zJz4iU4CQ.text: It took one visit, and now I'm a huge fan of this restaurant. The steaks rock, especially the prime bone-in rib eye, which is dry aged on premises, and done perfectly at the right temperature, per your specification - excellent piece of meat.  I complimented my entree with a well crafted Kettle One dirty martini, with two bleu cheese olives.    Service is warm, friendly and unpretentious - server Michael was great!  It felt like we were at an old friend's place.    Make sure you get a few sides, my group enjoyed the apple cured kurubota bone-in bacon, and the Caesar Salad which is prepared tableside.    Attire is business or smart casual (no sleeveless shirts but I think casual shorts are ok especially in the summer). You can find it in The Venetian Resort Hotel Casino and there is access from The Palazzo too.  This was a delicious evening out.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-BblfC-1cjnHK_sAxTb53g.text: Let me preface this by saying, that I had coffee and dessert here only.  I had already eaten dinner earlier, but had time to kill and I wanted some coffee.  I also decided I wanted a piece of Emeril's Famous Banana Creme Pie, so I decided to come here.  It truly is one of the most incredible pies anywhere, and definitely the best banana creme pie, hands down.  And I didn't realize they had French Press Coffee, which is my favourite!   It was the perfect dessert, and I loved it!   I sat in the bar area where they had a great piano player, and the atmosphere was friendly & lively.  My server & the staff were also very friendly.  I look forward to trying their lunch & dinner sometime in the near future, but I can tell you that the next time I want Pie & Coffee, I'm heading back there!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Emeril&#39;s Famous Banana Creme Pie
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Press Coffee

1HZm-4ML95gdEkOd74DNCw.text: Came here for the first time for lunch for Restaurant Week on a Saturday. We had made a reservation for 1230P. Most of us had arrived before the time but one had run late. The hosts in front were very accommodating and were fine with the tardiness. Once the last person had arrived about 15 minutes late, we were promptly sat at the table.   This "seasons" Restaurant Week (06/2019) Lunch menu is as follows:  First Course "Heirloom Tomato Soup" w/ whipped ricotta cheese and fresh basil "Beef Carpaccio" w/ parmesan reggiano, wild arugula, crispy capers, roasted garlic emulsion "Organic Baby Mixed Greens Salad" w/ creole spiced croutons, sherry vinaigrette, shaved Manchego cheese, teardrop tomatoes and red onions  Second Course "Delmonico's Bacon Cheese Burger" on a Brioche bun w/ apple bacon, Wisconsin cheddar, and sea salt fries "Buttermilk Fried Chicken Sandwich" on a Brioche bun w/ deviled egg yolk, heirloom tomato, bibb lettuce, and sea salt fries "Pappardelle Pasta" w/ lemon ricotta, wild mushrooms, white wine butter, english peas, fava greens and basils  Third Course "Banana Cream Pie Parfait" w/ caramel sauce, chocolate shavings, whipped cream, and graham cracker crumbs "Pecan Pie" w/ oatmeal shortbread crust, vanilla ice cream and caramel sauce   All the "first courses" were chosen among the 6 of us. Most picked the "Beef Carpaccio" which was surprisingly large. I'd say its probably the normal size they serve too. Give or take 10 slices but good amount of toppings allowing little "wraps" of carpaccio HEHE. the capers were deep fried adding a nice crisp aspect with the nice flavor of arugula. The roasted garlic emulsion added a nice creamy flavor, binding it all together. Some fresh cracked black pepper on top was a good touch  Originally a lot of people were planning on getting the pappardelle pasta but ended up switching over to the cheeseburger. I had been keeping my eye on Delmonico's for a few years now during Restaurant week, and I feel like this burger stays on the menu every time.   I had gotten my burger cooked medium. It was nice and juicy. Red onions, lettuce, tomatoes on the side. Friend flipped off her red onions, literally... landing on her bread plate Lol. The fries were ok. Not much of a fan of semi-thick fries. Id prefer thinner or like steak fries. This is somewhere in the middle. There's a side cup of mayo and ketchup as well   Finally, the dessert. Most of us got the Banana Cream Pie Parfait whereas one had gotten the Pecan Pie. Huge fan on banana cream pie ever since i was little. These parfaits were in little mason jars w/ graham cracker crumbs on the bottom, banana cream and sliced bananas in the middle, topped with a caramel sauce and chocolate shavings. Overall, decent, but not REALLY good. (maybe cuz i have a banana cream pie at home so im kind of killing the experience lol). Had a bite of the pecan pie as well. Overall, pretty good but really sweet.   Overall, good experience. Service was great ! All items were brought out at the same time by multiple servers, making it a nice experience as well. They split the bill willingly. Took a while though but still a good experience.

Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delmonico&#39;s bacon cheeseburger
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heirloom tomato soup

HUQRU951c2sQOoNcKB7y0Q.text: Open table reservations worked fine, and even though we arrived 30 minutes earlier they easily accommodated us with our reservation.   The restaurant is deceivingly bigger inside and the tables were well spaced out which made a quiet intimate dining experience.  Service was excellent and timely with all the courses, including our wine service.  They have an extensive wine list and full bar menu.  Started out with the French Onion soup, which is highly recommended.  Very deep in flavor and not salty as many  soups can be, we followed this with entrees of the NY  Strip, Colorado Rack of Lamb, and a shared side of Cheddar Grits.  Both entrees were prepared exactly as requested, resulting in very tasty  and tender entrees.  The grits were very  good, but are different with more body to them, which our server explained before we ordered them, that due to the freshness of the grits they will be this texture (much appreciated for the description before ordering them).  Finished the dinner with a selection of Sorbets and a French press coffee.  The only criticisms I would have, is even though service was excellent, it was a little confusing on the many  people helping with our service, and the dining area is a bit dark in spots which makes it difficult to see the menu or the table.  Overall the food and service were excellent and what I would expect for this level of restaurant, and we will definitely be back again in the future.  Hints for your visit: Check out the front pages of the extensive wine list,  there is  a list of recommendations by the restaurant, which makes it easy to select a nice bottle of wine for the novice.  If you like sorbet, the Cherry sorbet was very good and a  great ending to the heavier meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Colorado Rack of Lamb
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorbets
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Onion Soup - Highly recommended

k-5FVoWwhLAwx-6CeRDf6w.text: When you think big-time Vegas steakhouse, Delmonico probably isn't the first place that comes to mind. Don't let them catch you sleeping, though, because these are some fine hunks of beef for a little less than your fancy Vegas steakhouses. Of course, the bone-in's will net you the most flavor, so if you want 20oz of perfectly seared cow, $60 is what it'll cost you. For starters, I highly recommend their charred octopus, which isn't tough in the least. I heard that their barbecue shrimp wasn't as good as New Orleans, but it was not bad at all. Delmonico also has a decent wine list and popovers whenever you want (they really aren't fantastic though). All in all, solid service with lower-than-usual decibel levels and some damn good beef.

F-DZZwR_9kdma5MpLZbmOQ.text: If your looking for a 1st class lunch or dinner Delmonico's is the place.  From the presentation to the flavors you know you made the right choice.  I ordered the Gumbo to start and it was as good as any you will taste. Just enough spice plenty of heat. I know its a steak house however the Tuna tartar is one of my favorites. It was delish just the right amount of seasoning and a nice sauce to compliment it. I would order this again.  What can you say about the service. Other restaurants should follow the one thing they insist on. Everyone is served their main course at the same time.  If you have never dined at Delmonico you need to add it to your bucket list.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Set up plates
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna tartare
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gumbo

J-kYgJJv4KjoJNVEQBqNHA.text: This restaurant is the ticket. If you are looking for a good steakhouse on the strip this is one of the top if not the top place to go. I eat here often when I am in Las Vegas and it is definitely the place to go.   The steak is exactly how you want to eat it. I eat my often rare, but sometimes medium-rare. Either way what you order is what you get. The meat is tender and soft and is seasoned just perfectly. I have never sent anything back when it comes to the steak. I have been with people who order medium rare thinking that this place is like others where you order one thing and get a steak more cooked than you order, but not here!   I recommend a side order of the fingerling potatoes with your steak as they go great hand in hand!!   Just a side note if you order the burger be prepared for a mouthwatering experience. I know many do not order burgers at Steakhouses, but if you do this is the place to do it!   Will be back as I always do!

MTYXkI1OshPRif9mqNtpxA.text: Ever walk through a restaurant full of (mostly) men stuffing their faces with the most delicious looking meats?  If not, then you sure will here.  It's not as though women aren't allowed, it just feels like the girl to guy ratio is about 1/15.  But the steaks are as good as it gets.  We come here every year for the finale of our March Madness trip, and it never fails to impress.  We always order way too much food, yet we always figure out how to stuff it in somehow.  The seafood tower is amazing, tableside caeser a must, and you will never go wrong with a filet here.  As a side note, someone at our table ordered a filet well done (huh?) and it came out thoroughly pink.  I loved that - they basically said "this is the most we are willing to cook this perfect piece of meat for you before ruining it."  You won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That Seafood Tower

6Pdtc7MosW6tb9InBPs--Q.text: At the beginning of this current "Celebrity Chef" era there were few names on Emeril Lagasse's level, and although the Massachusetts native who made his name cooking in Louisiana has slowly faded from television his three Las Vegas Restaurants remain popular destinations with Delmonico Steakhouse having just celebrated its twentieth Birthday.  Now old enough to be considered iconic in a city of constant change, Delmonico's grand-opening coinciding with that of The Venetian where no other space along Restaurant Row remains the same, guests entering the space in 2019 will find little has changed over the last decade or more, even Chef Ronnie Rainwater still at the helm for what may be an unprecedented tenure.  Arranging this visit as a work event, six guests sitting down to a four-course menu with Wine at $125 per person, it was unfortunately late as a result of traffic that things got started at 7:00pm, warm Popovers and Delmonico's signature Potato Chips with Truffle Oil and Cheese delivered quickly, though the latter seemed a bit hurried with some spuds crispy and tan while others were white and flaccid.  Having not requested tthe Wine Pairing, even small pours somewhat wasteful on a group of mostly teetotalers who had to work the next day, it was beginning with Sparkling Rose from Ruinart that creamy Burrata and Apricots were presented, the request for "family-style" service in reality just two menu-sized servings on separate plates with each diner receiving just over a mouthful inclusive of Toast and Salad.   Aware that Chef Rainwater was out on a well-earned family vacation, his second in command presenting each course while Sommelier and servers were polite and professional from beginning to end, course two featured Pan Roasted Sea Bass alongside Spring Vegetables, a plethora of Morels particularly welcome though the Fish's "family style" partitioning limited most to less than three-ounces.  Admittedly impressed by small sips of Chardonnay, Delmonico's continuous recognition by Wine Spectator since 2004 no small feat, course three placed Lamb Chops cooked rare alongside a Grenache-Mourvedre-Syrah blend, the Flesh itself young and minimally gamey but complimented well by both the Wine and minty Peas plus Carrots enlivened by Chimichurri.  Still suggesting "family style" as two menu portions of each dish, the main course of Creekstone Farms house-aged Ribeye accompanied by six wedges of cheesy Potatoes plus Sprouts and Asparagus, it was without other requested sides that plates were cleared, though guests who'd held out for Carbernet were notably praiseful of the selected pairing.  Finally serving True "family-style" for Dessert, though one slice of Emeril's famous Banana Cream Pie divided by six assumes a lot about guests' willingness to share, fans will be happy to know that both Banana and Pecan Pie remain Sin City's best while Cake, Cookies and tiny Donuts a touch heavy with Oil are merely average.  THREE STARS:  It was prior to starting Endoedibles that I first encountered Emeril's food, but at his restaurant in Orlando was probably the first place I ever enjoyed "fine dining" at the grand old age of 21. Only financially able to start traveling years later, it was in Las Vegas that I next crossed paths with the man who made "BAM!" a catchphrase, in 2008, and having now visited a fourth time I'm comfortable saying little has changed at his Steakhouse in terms of Food or service, though in terms of value for the dollar this meal would have been better ordered a la carte.

Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 6/28/19 Delmonico : Popover, Whipped Butter
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 6/28/19 Delmonico : Popover, Whipped Butter

DuKL8xm2K7r2x9MbrPSFxw.text: Big thanks to our server Jennifer for being super attentive,  prompt and accommodating.  It was easier to walk in and get a reservation rather than book online!. The steakhouse is like the Tardis,  bigger on the inside. Definitely manly vibes,  we were the only all girl group. We went straight for the kill though,  truffle oil potato chips,  creamed spinach, filet mignon and salmon.  The truffle chips were amazing.  The spinach so-so, I think the vego sides were underwhelming.  The filet mignon was soft, scrumptious, just seared lightly and delicious. Sadly,  could not partake the salmon as it was cooked together with sausage slices and bits of bacon. SADNESS. Rookie mistake,  I saw salmon and didn't read the fine print. Very satisfying.   There is no ambience but just good solid food and excellent table service.

a44RZ_cWFY7dmdGbMHVStw.text: As a mitigation strategy for rationalizing the relative discomfort of Las Vegas prices, gambling losses, and conspicuous consumption, my dad always says:  "Well, I'm not here for a haircut."  Indeed, Father.  And it's always made me feel better when the Wild Cherry machine quickly eats my $20 bill and gives me nothing but the need to wash my hands again, or the adage, "Everyone's a winner at the Tropicana!" fails the smell-test.  All that to say, when I visit an upscale steakhouse that Yelp describes as "$$$$," there exists a certain level of expectation in terms of service, ambiance, and of course, food quality.  To beleaguer the point, I have specific expectations for a $1.49 Quarter Pound Big Bite hot dog at 7-Eleven.  And when you don't "get what you pay for," the cognitive dissonance weighs on your heart, the opportunity cost of selecting this meal instead of a different option cuts a little. Or a lot.  Our party of ten made an 8 P.M. reservation, celebrating my brother's 40th.  For a first course, I ordered the gumbo.  With visions of Emeril kicking it up a notch, I was hoping for a robust roux, a balance of savory of the thyme and bay, the sweet of the andouille and shrimp, and a little spicy bite of Worcestershire to hold it all together.    The soup was poured from the pan at the table over  rice.  Nice touch....  ... except at first bite, it was a disappointment to me.  First, despite being poured from the pan (which didn't convince me either, but they could have easily faked it for $14 soup) it was cold.  (So was my wife's tomato soup; so was my cousin's lobster bisque.) Second, the few pieces of andouille sausage as well as the shrimp in the gumbo had the consistency of Vienna sausages-- mushy and bland.  Third, the rice it was poured over gave me the impression it was buttered and reheated... but like the soup, not to a temperature that would even be considered warm.  The gumbo was a big miss for me.  The server presented a cheerful amuse bouche: a slice of cucumber with a white bean paste, garnished and drizzled with truffle oil.  Always nice to receive a little something from the chef, but couldn't help but wonder if my gumbo sat somewhere cooling off while the small gift from the chef was prepared.  Can't go wrong with truffle oil, and that's a good thing, as it stays with you for a while.  I ordered the salmon, and Mrs. Picante ordered the shrimp pesto pasta.  I ordered my salmon medium rare, and like the steaks my brothers ordered, it cooked correctly but cool to the touch.  Soft, flavorful and unfishy, the chef was very sparing with seasoning or salt-- which for me, is a good thing, as I enjoy the natural flavor of salmon.  Unfortunately, the salmon was served atop a bed of potato and andouille sausage hash, spicy onion crust and "homemade Worcestershire."  The crunchy onions were good, but I didn't care for them with the salmon; the underbedding of potatoes, sausage, tomatoes and sauce sort of all mixed together and got sort of ketchup-ey.  It was ok, but felt overdetermined for $38 with a Snickers bar-sized piece of salmon.  Baked potato side ($9) was large and cooked well.  My bride's Gulf Shrimp and Torchio pasta arrived lukewarm at best.  The menu described this dish as containing "guanciale, wild mushrooms, white wine butter and toasted bread crumbs"...  She found a mushroom stem in one bite; no mushroomS to speak of, but at least the shrimp were large and "snapped" appropriately when you chewed them. Not enough guanciale in the dish to include it as the first ingredient in the menu... still don't have the heart to tell my bride it's pork, which she doesn't eat.  I have no delusions that a $60 steak is three times better than a $20 steak; I've been intimately affiliated with enough restauranteurs to understand this.  But I also have come to understand that dim lighting, amicable and attentive service, a diverse wine list, and the great panache that must accompany this anchor tenant restaurant in the vaunted halls of the Venetian Las Vegas don't amount to much if the food is anything less than impeccable.   Lest you dismiss me as a poor kid in expensive shoes, I'll simply state, Dear Reader, that I've enjoyed dinners at modest San Felipe fish taco stands with dirt floors, opulent dining in an exclusive three Michelin starred Shanghai restaurant, casual single-plate meals at unassuming brasseries, big messy burgers on fishing boats, and dishes plated with twelve textures, whose drink-pairing doubles the price.  In each of those cases that merited approbation and aplomb, price matched the quality of the food, the ambiance, and the service.  Also, hot food was served hot, so there's that.   Unfortunately, our trip to Delmonico did not rise to that level, which begs the question: based on the range of reviews that accompany mine, was it simply yet sadly an outlier experience at an otherwise fine establishment, or is there truth to Jim Collins' assertion, "Good is the enemy of great"?

3QVean8xzYMfops40sNk7g.text: Not sure I can really go into some drawn out review here. I've eaten here several times over the last ten odd years, and it's always been one of the better steakhouses. Each visit seems to get a little better. Sometimes the sides don't come out exactly like I would prefer, (sounds like a personal problem to me) but the steaks are always cooked and taste pretty damn perfect.  I've been sticking with the filet mignon last couple times, and it's the best one I've had that I can remember. The lobster bisque is really good, with some big chunks of lobster. Last time in we got the duck fat fingerling potatoes, overall didn't care for them, but once again, I was expecting something else. The roasted brussel sprouts, I pretty well hate brussel sprouts, but these were pretty good. The steamed broccoli, which was really good.  Anyway, service is always fantastic. Never a bad choice to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet

D06oicv_j0V1sLuL9z-UrA.text: Dined here Sunday night.  Very nice, service was good but our waiter was a lil pushy.  Food was great but not life changing..and I know steak  would I go back? Sure

fMljyQuWfnvz4U7azX-2SA.text: Dinner June 4   I love this place.  Everything I have ever gotten here has been on point and excellent.  Service is exceptional and they treat you always like you are an old friend.   I am NOT a big Steak fan, but I love their Bone-In Ribeye.  Sides are awesome.  Table side made Caesar is incredible!  You will be hard pressed to find a better Lobster Bisque Soup!   Got the Charred Spanish Octopus - holy smokes - it was out of this world.  3 people with me had never had it and loved it!   This is my favorite steak house in America.

CP0dhldGGKA5QiFUA-ydCg.text: The absolute juiciest steak I have ever put in my mouth! Hands down, the best service I have ever had, ANYWHERE, EVER. Prices are also more than reasonable for the quality and portions you are receiving.  Every staff member we encountered here was a joy. They are all very personable, pleasant, and have a sense of humor while still taking their job seriously. From the host station to the wait staff, the service absolutely blew my mind. It's obvious that they want the customer to have the absolute best experience possible and the staff are clearly  working hard to meet every guests needs, often before we even know we need anything! I truly can't rave about the service enough.  The food was also very good. At our table, we had the french onion soup, lobster bisque, bone-in ribeyes, smashed potatoes, and mushrooms. We would recommend all of them! Honestly though, the food could have been sub-par and I would still go back for the incredible service!   Also of note, the restaurant interior definitely feels upscale, and it seems silly to mention, but the chairs are very comfortable!   I cannot recommend Delmonico Steakhouse enough.

YZMkj5X0GAVZAWTt3Uehpw.text: Second night in Vegas. Last night I said to my husband that we really hasn't been wowed by a restaurant in Vegas in years. Tonight we were wowed. Service was on point. And it was warm and friendly. Food was delicious. Wine and wine service was excellent if I any complaint it was the same as 90% of US restaurants, too large of serving sizes. But I think that's become expected.  We've been lucky enough to eat at some great restaurants in this country and this is one of them.

mh3_giREiX9GJOujthN6ew.text: Excellent service! Our waiter Frank was wonderful! We typically eat at Mastro's...boy 'am I glad we came here! My halibut entree was excellent! The sides were delicious! Highly recommend!

XiRiLQCsfAYFuXGzOmruJA.text: Best food in Las Vegas.  Thanks Chef Ronnie

7JNhOwUFGz4ptEKjMR6zVg.text: My new husband and I just got married in Vegas on the 4th of August, and we went here on the 6th to celebrate during our vacation. We called for reservations on the day of, and they were able to accommodate us. When we arrived early, we sat in the bar area, and we had the most amazing drinks we both had ever had. I had a "green spade" which had cucumber, basil, and some other stuff in it. It was light, not to sweet and delicious. He had a bloody orange, which is a whiskey cocktail, and he loved it equally. I also had a limelight, which was good, and the best was the dark roast....delicious, smooth and incredible. They were about $14 a piece, and worth every damn penny. We were seated 15 minutes early. We told the waiter that this was our first "casual fine dining" experience, and he was more than informative. Made suggestions throughout the meal, and was personable and forthcoming. They had a nice "Our top Picks" for the wine. We chose a mid-price cab sav. They gave us complimentary truffle cream for an app, and then we ordered the tuna to go with it. The tuna was just average, but we live in Cocoa beach, so it's hard to impress us with seafood. The main event was the bone-in ribeye. I have eaten a shit ton of steak in my life....and DEAR GOD. This steak was impeccable. I didn't need a knife, I used my fork to cut it. The seasoning was just right, and I ordered mine rare, and that was how it was. My husbands was just the right medium rare....and perfect. Now, the only negative part of our meal. I ordered fingerling potatoes and asparagus as our sides. I had to send the potatoes back. They were nearly raw, and dry. The asparagus was edible, but boring. At nine dollars a piece, I expect a little zing. We were too full for dessert, but I'm sure it was great. The service was perfect, three waiters to a table. I was impressed with our overall bill total. They gave us cards that detailed where we sat and what waiters we had, so that we could have the same ones next year when we return for our anniversary. I will def be willing to return for another beautiful, whole experience.

B0Y7x5CLQ5PfcDG4ZASfgg.text: One of the best steaks I have ever had.  Everyone at the table thoroughly enjoyed themselves.  This is what life is all about.

6MLYe1Ndg83MkT6ZMcg4qw.text: The best choice for steaks in Las Vegas.  The staff are expert servers.  I have gone here for both intimate dinners and group dining, and all experiences have been beyond our expectations.  Start with the truffled parmesan chips, then the tomato salad, the mushrooms, the filet (black and blue of course), one of the potato specials, and stay for dessert (they sell cigars in the bar) and a glass of scotch to finish off the meal.

D34vgnye7MXD0zdlS7fWJw.text: I'll make this one an easy read.   I have been to this steakhouse 4 times since it has opened. The 1st time being within it's 1st month, the last several weeks ago.  My 1st 2 visits were awesome, great steaks and sides and good service, then something happened on my 3rd trip about 1 1/2 years ago, the food was just o.k. not horrible but nothing that great. Well a few weeks ago we were back at the Venetian.  I was there with my Wife, 2 sons(16 and 5) and my Sister in Law, everyone wanted steak, so we decided why not let's try Delmonico's.  Turns out this was a bad choice and one that will keep me from going back, with all the new crops of good steakhouses(many within the same hallway) that have popped up since this place has opened, Delmonico's needs to get it's act together.  We ordered 3 Rib Eyes, 1 Filet, and my 5 year old got a burger. For sides truffled potato chips, mashed potatoes and corn.  When we were sat, we immediately were served water and our drink orders taken, that was the highlight of the meal. It took about 20 minutes to get our drinks and orders taken. When we asked if they had anything specific for our 5 year old, they suggested the burger, fine he can have that, if not my Wife would have just split some of her filet with him  When our food came about 50 minutes later, mind you the place had just opened and there were no more than 4 other tables occupied. They put all our food down in front of us and they then proceeded to give my son a burger that had to have been at least 12 ounces, we all looked at each other and then commented on how and why would they serve him that.  Mind you, waiter suggested this burger for the 5 yr old.  Back to the other plates, it was just large chunks of flavorless meat, the sides were bland and the truffled chips were soaking in oil. When it was all over and done we had been there almost 2 hours and were out almost $300. I have no problem spending good money for a good meal, but this meal left us feeling like we had wasted our time and our money.  Will not go back.

5WO3WB58jXKnT7SetRk48g.text: We've tried qutie a few steakhouses and restaurants in Las Vegas and I think this is one of our favorite in Vegas.   Their steaks are so much more flavorful, tender, juicy and just cooked perfectly.  We've tried many hyped up ones but they fail to meet our expectations. with Demonico, we were not disappointed at all.   this is off topic but since we are talking about steakhouses, stay away from "the cut" restaurant at palazzo, not good, not worth it. see my review on it if you need to.

kn5F4WLsRJSCGkZ2QTlq4Q.text: Best meal EVER! (also the most expensive...but worth it).  The food was just unbelieveable. We had a special gnocchi/lump crab appetizer, wedge salad, filet & ribeye, roasted potatoes w/garlic, and pecan pie for dessert. Food coma! Everything was absolutely perfect and the service was excellent. Highly recommended for a special occasion.

51EvJcLixkj7Y5liZ114NA.text: Delmonico in Las Vegas by Emeril Lagasse is not as impressive as I would expect it would be. First we are given a really lousy table in the corner as if my husband has been very bad that he deserve to be punished in the corner(considering this is his special day-b-day). Waiters are clueless, they are just standing in the middle but most of the time really doing nothing that in few ocassions I have to pour my own wine in my glass. The head waiter is the only one who seems to be working and who do know what to do here.             We are given a small apetizer courtesy of the chef bec of my husbands b-day which is a good touch, I love this little appetizer (not in the menu, wish it was there because that would be the only highlight of the evening) a concoction of smoke chicken with couscous with a little spices, the taste is all balance and in harmony.            The fried green tomatoes appetizer is bland, whatever coating and sauce they put in there didnt help at all.  The spinach and raddichio salad is soaked on its own dressing which you cannot even tell which dressing it is, salads when presented are supposed to be crisp, so make sure you only put the dressing when it is ready to be eaten, very disappointing since the head weater gladly recommended this dish.           My husband ordered Bone in Ribeye Steak, huge, cooked perfect but no taste or seasoning at all, it would need some sort of sauce to make it appetizing.  Filet mignon is OK, just like any other filet mignon, nothing great about it.          Luckily there's one dish that is worth mentioning, the potato gratin dauphineous, excellent, potato perfectly cooked, not much cream, hint of garlic and toasty top, excellent!         Going back? No way, very expensive and I'm not happy.

2yShEP2192GNOXa1yxJRhQ.text: My husband and I have enjoyed Emeril's restaurants. But when we tried Delmonico's, it was unbelievable. We had the best meal ever. It's worth the money. I think it's the best of all Emeril's restaurants. I have no more words, speachless. You all should to try it.

jhfzwvqzpJ1P1KFdmYR5pg.text: This place is about as bland as vanilla ice cream.... there is no style to the dining room, the service is slow and quiet, the steaks well... I have had much better... the only good is the deserts are very good, and the palce has a great wine list (albeit very pricey)... Vegas can do better (and it does)

5Q09RmRaBYOlFQj33jdNlg.text: Ok, this would have to be one of my favorites!! The food is delicious and wine as well. But seriously, nothing can beat the service at Delmonico's. We had 2 servers and they were both soooo attentive to everything we needed.  Hands down best steakhouse in Vegas, if not best restuarant. Highly, highly recommend reservations.

u5lfFUY4FEHpmzc8K2CWjw.text: We went here while in town for the Halloween weekend. Never even heard of the place, but figured why not give it a shot.  The decor is upscale, but pretty boring actually. No flare at all to it.   Here is what i either ordered or tried:  Lobster bisque - Very good. Creamy and rich, yet the lobster came through right away.  Steak Tartare - Good.Had a bit too much mustard sauce for me, as that was about all i could taste. But the meat had alot of flavor.  Lamb chops - Very well done. The lamb was cooked well(medium rare) and was nice and juicy.   I ordered the ribeye(rare). I thought it was on the verge of medium rare, but totally acceptable. Nice flavor, and good portion. Not the best steak i have had, especially since the waiter said it was both wet and dry aged.   Sauteed spinach - Very good, but i would have preferred a bit more creaminess to it. Although i am not sure if it was supposed to be cream spinach or not, it seems almost like it was halfway between steamed and creamed. either way it was a very good side dish.  Filet - Very well cooked and tender. I found the truffle crust lacking in flavor though, as i could not really taste it at all.  And i want to say halibut, but i could be off. Either way, the special fish entree was probably the best of the night. Cooked just right, and the sauce was excellent.  Overall i liked the dinner alot. For the price though it was nothing all that special.

hwsCcbaviO5v5WsCev-PIw.text: Our favorite steakhouse in town, by far.  Fantastic steak, yummy sides, fabulous service, wonderful dining atmosphere and the best sommelier in town, Kevin Vogt.  And my husband's favorite dessert, the banana cream pie.

O3Lbe9mhTcHUJ9dSGcyYsw.text: Had been here four years ago and the experience was so much better that time. We brought a fine bordeaux for my birthday both times and were aware of the corkage policy. Wine spectator gives them the highest award and complements their corkage policy in fact. It took forever to get the bottle decanted and it really wasn't optimal and the meal was rushed. We even had cocktails  Snotty server, devil may care attitude. Sommelier? Or was he just the one who poured wine?  Not sure as he also offered food recommendations. Gumbo good, tomato soup and grill cheese ap okay but not fine. Avg cream spinach and dried baked potato. Partner had BBQ shrimp and was not overly impressed. Sadly the rib eye was only decent, but not out of this world. I was so looking forward to this night and it was a disappointment. Cavernous restaurant about 70 % filled on a Wednesday but the personal touch and care of a few years ago was gone.

sj_9jrJYdCHEDPKwCFVn9Q.text: One of the best meals.  The steaks are aged and melt in your mouth.   Fast a day prior so you can enjoy an appetizer, salad, entree and dessert.  This place rocks!

I31igxC0ts-DrRxAQzk_Qg.text: Everything I had was great - lobster bisque and filet.  Although all the dishes Could probably be a little less buttery/heavy, I would recommend and return.

xiPRMeiHTtJdz3ZG-K3zWA.text: Comparable to Ruth Chris with a more hip/modern decor and slightly  less expensive menu. The bbq shrimp app was awesome. Steak was cooked well too. Excellent Service.

-YYQZc45YcYa8hk_fkCcRQ.text: Great steaks, awesome service and comfortable settings.  This is a steakhouse, don't expect too much other then steakhouse classics and wonderful desserts.  Food is good, not amazing, would return for sure.

hwQSxm53iPTiJwMOJuGXzg.text: 16 idiots donning wigs came to Delmonico for a bachelor party dinner.  I had called other steakhouses, but since we had a large party, I was told we had to order from a set menu.  Us clods just wanted a delicious slab of steak, some wine and we'd be happy and Delmonico was there to provide.  The only shortcoming was the wait to take our orders, but once our waiter came, it was all good.  The wait staff had a great sense of humor which added to the night's festivities (hell they were serving a bunch of goofballs).  Of course, the best part was the steak.  Most of us at the table had the bone in ribeye steak.  Let me first say I didn't eat much of anything that day in anticipation of this dinner and we didn't have any appetizers or salads and I STILL couldn't finish off that piece of meat!  My steak was perfectly cooked medium rare and was wonderfully seasoned.  Thanks to Delmonico for tolerating the circus sideshow and cooking up some awesome meat..  and sorry to housekeeping that we ordered 4 orders of asparagus!

zMeIDTtd7vWpZWgQGoJwKg.text: Very disappointing.  The worst cocktails I have ever had anywhere.  I tried 3 different drinks and I didn't like any of them.  The lobster cost a whopping $75 and was not that big and was a little tough.  Service was great and the side dishes were good.  However, I love barbequed shrimp and have eaten it in New Orleans many times and it was much better - and this is supposed to be Emeril's signature dish.  The sauce was brown and not that spicy.  The lobster bisque was just ok - I have had better in my town of 150,000 and it usually has sherry in it - not there.  There were nice chunks of lobster in it though.  We expected more from an Emeril restaurant and really didn't feel that it had a Louisiana flair, although apparently it specializes in steaks.  Will not visit again and it has cooled us to the possibility of trying another of Emeril's restaurants in the future.  I cannot emphasize strongly enough how terrible all 3 cocktails were.

AD-MtvgjVk9tbJO5NHQsTw.text: One of best steaks I've had. Definitely a solid 4.5 even better, I dined on lobster bisque, a bone in ribeye  steak w/ smashed potatoes, sauted mushrooms and creamed spinach.   My steak was was cooked to perfection, juicy throughout. not to mention the little things such as the pat of compound butter that added that punch. The lobster bisque was smooth and rich. The sides we're all great as well.   The pricing was fair, it is a la carte steakhouse after all thats what you come to expect at an establishment like this. Service was just right, very attentive but at the same time the wait staff wasnt breathing down our neck. Loved my experience here, hopefully we will back again soon!

IOZeTanf_3GxsbcxAA9uWw.text: I didn't get a chance to eat here but the mojitos were absolutely divine. they make their own rum in house and could easily be the elixir of the gods. worth the time, every time. highly recommend.

xjQWHq9IPzA9Vz--SVz63A.text: My boss reccomended Delmonico's to me in a SERIOUS way, so when I had a chance to go to Vegas with some big foodies, I immediately suggested we try it out. We made reservations for 10:00pm on the Friday we were all scheduled to arrive. We were all coming seperately from different airlines and different cities and planned to meet at the airport and head out. I. WAS. PUMPED. Super damn excited.   And then my flight was delayed. I hate Southwest-- this is what happens when you try to be cheap but still end up paying $250 to fly for half an hour from LA to Vegas. My flight was delayed and delayed and I started to really worry. I worried in the terminal while I nervously sipped my venti coffee. (I swear I had ordered a tall?) I worried for the TWO HOURS I spent sitting on the plane on the runway, trying with much difficulty to bury my face in Harry Potter 7 while I sat next to a really annoying and "overly affectionate" couple. (Seriously... DON'T DO THAT. WTF!? Have you no decency!?! Where the fuck is your mother!??!)  I landed at 10:00, booked it to the cab line, sprinted through the Venetian in heels, and, sweaty, restless, tired, and uncomfortable with my carry-on bag, met my friends at the bar in Delmonico's at 10:20. My entire excursion from my house in Los Angeles to the restaurant in Vegas took 4 hours. I'm pretty sure I could have driven. I wanted to die.  Was it worth it? YES IT WAS.  Grey Goose and tonic: strong enough to keep me from death type of worth it. Beer and cheese fondue with pretzel bread: salty-cheesy goodness type of worth it. Oysters Rockefeller: I don't even like oysters and it was worth it. Truffle parmesan potato chips: the light, crispy, addicting type of worth it. Salad with fresh fried mozzarella: I want to eat this cheese until I gain 400 pounds and have to be air-lifted out of my house type of worth it. Dry Grilled Aged Sirlion a la Oscar with Blue Crab: I was so full at this point I could only eat two bites of this and it was STILL worth it. Three different attentive waiters: I get a little chill when waiters murmur "Pardon my reach" under their breath like it's a secret type of worth it.  The menu looked expensive (around $50 for entrees) but our table, for 4 people with a half bottle of wine, cocktails, entrees for each, soups/slads, and appetizers came out to around $400. It was pretty reasonable for the volume and quality of food we ate, but, really now, $400 is spendy. I won a little bit of money over the weekend, so now I can afford to go back. And I will be back!

XC64r62vBt6G3IuVcKPYWQ.text: If I had to choose between Delmonico or Carnevino Ribeye, the choice is simple. Delmonico. Two amazing restaurants, two different styles, but personal preference would land me at Delmonico.  W-O-W. Flavorful steak, HUGE portions, it was really, really hard to hide my semi while I was tearing into the meat. Great side dishes like garlic mushrooms, amazing peach cobbler for dessert, great red wine, attentive wait staff... pure bliss. Better than wearing my clown suit at an elementary school. Way better. Well... no, that's a bold statement. But it's friggin close.

y3EBG-1zykvZblLdSq_k9g.text: Great service, nice food....  I am a sucker for foies gras and bone in ribeye steak.  Everyone was pleased with how their meat was cooked (that doesn't sound right) but I think the highlight was the bread pudding.  It was amazing.    Frankly, I was impressed with the quality of the food an overall experience.  It also wasn't a grip like Lawry's normally is.  Definitely would consider going back.

OI3ZkpUsEZma9aBira0PTA.text: This is a great steakhouse in Las Vegas.   We started off with a caesar salad made table side. I had the rib eye and my husband had the filet mignon. Both were ordered medium and they both came out perfectly medium and mouthwateringly good! The sides were ok and the desserts were fantastic!  This is a great place to go for a birthday, anniversary or some special occasion. Although if you just have a hankering for a good steak on a Tuesday night, this place is good any time! Definitely make a reservation though because this place is packed!

_Uwp6FO1X-avE9wqTMC59w.text: This place is first class in every way. Lobster Bisque is second to none. Awesome service! Going back in march!!

Wh70o8YgOqgWPoY1VjOMKQ.text: The service here is remarkable, It's unfortunate that one of the reviews I read stated otherwise.  Our wait staff was amazing, we never had to ask for anything the staff of what seemed like four per table was very attentive. Our main waiter could have been the Rock's double  (extra star for having a very cute waiter)  Now on to the great food  Starter: Prime beef and beer cheese fondue homemade sea salt soft pretzels, these were sinful and as good as they sound.  Entree: Grilled chicken, rock Shrimp over linguini,  artichoke hearts, sun-dried tomatoes, toasted pine nuts and vodka cream sauce (decadent sauce, excellent flavor)  Dessert:  Regretfully nothing (no room, no way)  The meal was great, the setting very comfortable, and the staff from the front ot the house to the back, top notch!

x_F6U9yMvl60N7Yk_Fxdjg.text: We tried their French escargot w/ garlic herb butter on toasted baguette. This was our first time trying french-style escargot and we didn't like it. It's not as if it was badly prepared. It's an acquired taste and we were just not big fans of it. Our waiter did notice we didn't finish the dish so he asked if everything was ok. We politely nodded. Surprisingly, they took this item off our bill which was really nice. Service was awesome throughout. My fiance had the bone-in-rib eye. I had their special - lobster pasta. Both were very good. Overall, I thought the food was decent. The experience was excellent.

smXBXSmzMp7c5Jl1t3RPxw.text: Emeril doesn't disappoint!   I always take the time to try new high-end restaurants when in Vegas, as there are so many to choose from. This trip was for my boyfriend's birthday, so I wanted something Italian and steak as he requested. This was by far one of the best dinners we have ever had. The food was amazing from salads to lobster bisque to a book of a wine list to the Chateaubriand Carved Tableside for Two, which was basically a filet for two cut into strips at our table. It was superb! It has been 3 months and we're still talking about it! My only issue was that the green salad was too salty. Besides that, the steak and sides were seasoned to perfection. The atmosphere was quiet and as if in a well furnished dry wine cellar; very romantic.  All in all, it was VERY expensive but worth every penny. I recommend this to anyone looking for a high end romantic steak dinner in Vegas.

fQFMt6aAABIt9NtydYBtgg.text: One of the most all-time memorable dining experiences I've ever had.    Though I am vegetarian now, my mouth *STILL* waters at the thought of the filet mignon I had at Delmonico's.  It was simply unrivaled by any other steak I've ever had and probably any other steak I ever will have.  I sincerely doubt that in my life I will ever -- EVER -- have a better steak.  It was perfectly cooked, and coated with the perfect amount of pepper and spices on all sides.    Secondly, but certainly not any less impressive, was the ceasar salad.  As somebody who orders ceasar salad everywhere she goes, I would venture to say that this was in the top three I've ever had -- I could probably even safely say it was the best.  Served with whole leaves, which I love, and the dressing was made at our table, right in front of our eyes.  Cannot be beat.

x58UezXkG2Z-YxYs4zozSg.text: Three words. De-lic-ious. Ribeye. Yes Please. Great wait staff.  Oysters to start, wedge salad. 'nough said. If Emeril Lagasse put's his name on it...well chances are you'll enjoy it.

GW8UjoJG2PUHHtOOFGelOw.text: This place is excellent.  I would highly recommend it for steak.  I ordered the NY.  I ordered medium rare, but it came out overcooked to a medium well.... I would have complained and asked for another one, had the steak not been so effin' delicious.  even though it was over cooked, by my taste, it still ranked on my top steaks that i've eaten.  that's got to say something.  But I will say that in my groups of 10 friends, the majority of them got their steaks exactly how they ordered it.  The sides are good.  The fresh buns they serve are fantastic.  and they do supply some sauces with the steaks, but man... you just don't want to spoil the taste of these awesome steaks.  This place is pricey, but it's worth it.  they have a great wine selection.  50 page/chaptered wine book selected by their own somoliere.   I'm going back.

fapw2CmTbCl9mzuTXatOUg.text: I was the best man and thus we came to vegas, we saw, and we ate at Delmonico's (among other things).  Table for 13 men out on the town for my friend's bachelor party.  I can't remember what everyone ordered but I can tell you that nobody complained about the food (not drunk yet and therefore enjoyed the food fully).  The bone-in Ribeye was marvelous.  The Calamari was good as was the steak tartare. Side dishes: New Orleans Creamed Spinach, Truffle Parmesan Potato Chips and Sauteed Garlic Mushrooms were all excellent!  The sides are quite large so please share because yeah, we ordered too many.  Total bill for 13 (which included some drinks) was about $1100 which is not bad for a nice high-end place that serves THE BEST RIBEYE.  If you like porterhouse, then go try the porterhouse at Keens steakhouse in NYC.

NcKaR7-IohWKQGTQDDy6TA.text: This is my 2nd Emeril restaurant experience, first is NOLA and I loved it.  It's only getting 4 stars because my lobster was a little too salty.  BUT, the preparation of it has been the best that I have ever had. It was so tender and succulent.  I would definitely order it again, but would remind them to please not salt it so much.  Everything that I ate that night was to perfection.  The salad, the appetizer, filet mignon and lobster.  Our server was also very nice and very on top of servicing our every needs.  The wine that he recommended paired extremely well with our meal.    Yes, the walls are cream colored.  But it's a very clean, fresh feel.  The table are nice and roomy.  The chairs are so big and comfortable, you can sit there for hours enjoying your meal and drinks.  The accent colors in there are a tuscan red, so imagine a nice warm, bright feel.  I really enjoyed it.  Plus it's Vegas, who doesn't hit the lounge or clubs afterwards for the dark, moody ambiance.

rXOCQg0SAnUYFzqOvwgQPQ.text: Emeril knows his steaks!  I went here 2 nights in a row (1) business dinner with clients (2) took my bf out for his bday.  Both times were excellent, did not disappoint.  Well, the business dinner was actually better since I didn't have to pay!  When in Vegas, you must indulge, so why not here - the service is top notch, the food is to die for.  Wonderfully cooked steaks, the sides are awesome.  Dessert was also great.   Funny story - there was a group of about 6 older gentlemen at the table next to us.  We had already paid (I paid) and were just about to leave and they asked me to take their photo.  They said they were on their yearly guys trip, and wanted a photo.  After I took their picture, one of the guys said I did a "good thing" back there when he saw me paying for us :)  He said I was "a good woman."   One gripe - for our business dinner, we had a party of about 16 and they sat us at 2 tables in the main dining area.  That kind of stunk because we wanted to sit all together so we could all chat, but we had to split up, it was a little uncomfortable.

MoZgmok1vMVIibWvZ0BJWA.text: Top notch steaks and one of the best wine lists in Las Vegas. Perfectly seasoned and prepared steaks in the main dining room makes for a great night out, but what makes The Delmonico Steakhouse a DESTINATION is their individually planned and prepared tasting menu, available during an evening at their special Kitchen Table.   They have a glass room with space for 8, connected to the kitchen where you'll enjoy a special tasting menu prepared by the Chef on duty. And when I say special menu, I mean just that. Chefs are passionate about menu planning and specialty food and they'll give you a 6-8 course meal featuring the steak of course, and many other things not available on their menu, finished with a dessert tray to die for, featured every one of the desserts they offer.   This is an Emeril restaurant but you won't see any made for TV dinners here - it's truly an authentic steakhouse with an upscale dining room. For the wine lover, Master sommelier Kevin Vogt will work with the chef to perfectly pair wine with each course. What is special, as of my last visit, is The Delmonico Steakhouse runs independent of the other food services at The Venitian. This means they shop for their own food and manage their own wine collection. So if you enjoy fine wine, perfectly paired with your meal - this is the place for you.   This is my #1 all time favorite restaurant. The food is good enough to stand on its own, and because of the special treatment you get at the kitchen table, I've yet to experience anything so great.  How much? You'll be shocked and surprised to learn this dining experience isn't terribly expensive. For a little more than you'd spend in the dining room, you get a personal dining experience, about $85 for dinner and wine pairing for about $65.  I call this a once in a lifetime experience, even though I've been lucky enough to do it about ten times.

4_QGhAMtBSwfL8wmfu1n2g.text: Superb!  I'm sure people can knock off stars if their steaks didn't come out to their liking (heck I would too), but all four of ours came out exactly as we wanted them to.  I'm not a big fan of Ermiril's show, nor am I a fan of his personality.  Despite having his name associated with this restaurant, I feel that if he's not the one cooking my meal, then it's not really his food.  Whoever the chef was that night sure had his mojo going that's for sure.  The cocktail shrimp appetizer was amazing.  Cocktail shrimp you say?  How different can that be from Bellagio's buffet where you can get like 1000 in one sitting if you wanted?  Well considering you're saving your stomach for more desirable substances, the dish contained eight snicker bar sized prawns drizzled with a fine cocktail sauce that had a nice kick to it.  It was more than enough to satiate us before the main course.  When our meat came out, my buddy and I couldn't stop drooling.  The girls had to laugh as their softball sized fillet's looked more like golf balls in comparison to our full-sized cow bone-in Rib-Eyes.  Literally the size of the plate itself, and at least 1.5 inches thick....Vegans would run in fear at the sheer size of this holy beast.  The rib eyes were cooked perfectly throughout.  Medium-rare, a beautiful mix of pink and red with a perfectly charred (requested) exterior that seared all the juices in and added wonderful flavor to the aged meat.  If this wasn't a proper meal we would've gone to town on the bones like cavemen at the end.  Truly magnificent.  And to think, they were offering a "Generous Cut" Porterhouse on the menu as well.....that might have been size of.....two cows (40-50 ounces per what our waiter quoted)  The sides were just as delightful.  Served family style, the Asparagus was grilled perfectly, the potato fingerlings roasted with a beautiful blend of butter and garlic, and the mushroom medley was bursting with flavor.  I will also add that the dinner rolls are probably some of the best I've ever had.  Soft and fresh hot out of the oven, they had a nice sweetness to them and the fresh churned butter added an exquisite country taste as well.  Dessert consisted of an excellent bread pudding with a scoop or Oreo ice cream, along with a Banana Fosters cream pie.  Both were amazingly good.  I have no idea how we stomached them, but they were a nice finishing touch.  The wine list is extensive and amazing.  They're one of the few restaurants in Vegas that serve one of my favorite wineries wine (Neal).  We had an absolutely dazzling bottle of Cabernet Sauvignon, that we had to order another.  Needless to say, both gentleman slugged down 75% of a bottle each.  : )  The service was excellent.  our waiter was attentive at all times and was very alert to our needs.  The best waiters are those that know what you want without even having to signal or tell them, and our waiter was just that good.  A very elegant setting and located in the walkway connecting the Palazo and Venetian, this is definitely one of the steakhouses in Vegas I will frequent again.

dasxQe5zVeI-mX09OWMyTQ.text: I have been to many steak places in Vegas and had always wanted to go, but it can be hard to get a reservation. This time we planned way in advance so we could eat at a reasonable time.   The food: The food was reasonable but slightly over priced. The steak that I had was good and cooked to how I ordered it, but for $52.00, it could have been better. Since it was served a la carte, I ordered a baked potato, $8.00.  I would suggest the pecan pie for dessert, best I have ever had.  The service: Some of the best service I have every see before. Everything was excellent from the moment our server arrived at our table to the moment we left. Very professional but not to stuffy. All of his suggestions were right on.  I am not sure I would go again, since there are so many places to choose from, but I would suggest it to my friends.

uB8QbRKitwr2yLKO_w0ICg.text: The food was delicious!  Everyone was very sweet and attentive.  Mike and Drew took very good care of us.  Mike knew the menu well and knew all about the various cuts of beef.  I was duly impressed.  Also, thank you to Drew for taking it all in stride.  If he reads this, he will know what I mean.  I would definitely dine there again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D4R4YkIR5yS8swRONQIBkA.text: Had dinner on 6/26/13. This was the second time my wife and I dined at Delmonico Steakhouse. The 1st time I ordered the bone-in-ribeye and was disappointed because it had some gristle and was underwhelming to say the least. On this trip, the wife had the organic baby mixed greens salad and the Filet while I had the shrimp cocktail and once again the bone-in-ribeye. We also shared an order of asparagus.  The Filet was good - tender and nicely seasoned. My ribeye was disappointing, however. It was not very tender and didn't have much flavor for being dry-aged 2-3 weeks as per our waiter.  The service and atmosphere are on par with most of the other high-end steakhouses in Vegas, but the steaks are not as good as those we have had at Craftsteak, Cut, N9ne, Stripsteak, Prime, or even STK. Does not deserve more than 3 stars IMO and even though it wasn't bad, it is not good enough for us to return especially with all the other choices in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in-ribeye

9beG6auaEEOr9-A88hGr6w.text: On our stay at the Venetian, we decided to try this steak house one night. I had the ribeye and my wife went for the filet mignon. Both steaks were absolutely delicious and cooked to perfection. The server was extremely knowledgeable about the menu . For the desert we opted to share the bread pudding,and I have to say it is one of the best I have ever eaten. Very good experience overall!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye @ del monico steak house by Emeril Lagasse

EfhPbuAFycNbV8YhibhtSg.text: We came here for my husbands birthday dinner.  We were a few minutes early so had drinks in the lounge, A Tale Of Two Cherries and Louisiana Hard Tea.  Drinks were good and packed a punch.  We started with Barbecue Shrimp and Fried Green Tomatoes.  Barbecue shrimp was the same as at Emeril's other restaurants.  Delicious.  I only wish you got more then 4 shrimp and 1 tiny biscuit.  The fried green tomatoes were one of the nights specials.  They were topped with lump crap and fried light and crisp.  For our Entrees I got Emeril's Barbecue Salmon, he got Bone In Ribeye.  We chose Twiced Baked Potato and Grits for our sides.  Salmon and steak were both wonderful and cooked perfectly.  The sides were creamy and rich, but very similar in flavor.  We loved them both but probably should have order something with more variety.  We finished with Banana Cream Pie and Caramel Butter Cake for dessert.  The Banana Cream Pie is Emeril's signature dessert that is served in all his restaurants.  Hubby loves it and it's a must order for us.  It was our first time ordering the Caramel Butter Cake and it didn't disappoint.  It was served warm and covered in gooey caramel.  Service started off slow, but got better as the meal went on.  We had incorrect charges on our bill that were quickly corrected when we brought it to our servers attention.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Emeril&#39;s Banana Cream Pie
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel Butter Cake
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Emeril&#39;s BBQ Salmon

lwjZhTFPX-8wHDV6EahG5Q.text: bone in rib eye steak is the popular choice it's corn fed rather than grass fed (piedmontese = italian leaner import).  overall solid with flavor and cooking temp although some were not pleased

kn9TOQ-mX4W5niu_NHUgiw.text: I've eaten here several times in the last 6 years and have always gotten a good meal.  This year was different.  The food was not as good.  My fillet that I ordered medium rare was way over seasoned.  And to finish the meal we always get the banana cream pie.  What a disappointing dessert this time.  You could barely taste the bananas.  Maybe a bad batch of bananas?  Regardless someone should be tasting the food before it leaves the kitchen!

meMUeVcdjQZLJ1d_SUlRAA.text: This place is where  you want to go. The food  is excellent.  I got the dry aged , wet aged bone in ribeye steak. It melts  in your mouth its so tender. The reason I say this is the place  you want to go is because  the service is as good as the meal. Your not stretching your neck  looking  for your server.  Water glasses were always  full and our steaks all landed  at the same time  by 3 servers. They have a seamless flow to the meal. If you haven't  been here please treat yourself

w8N0wFJBoWWXi8z3dqIaEw.text: Be sure to try as many appetizers as you can. I went with the bone in ribeye and it was probably the best steak I've had in a long time. It's right inside the Venetian Hotel and I'm not much for hotel restaurants but when in Vegas this is a must try. We sat at the bar and ate because the games were on and the bartender was fantastic. If you're ordering a cocktail somewhere this is the place to get it!

5wcxVZzbzx7lON97KK-oaw.text: So my buddies wanted to go to a legit steakhouse in Vegas and we decided to try Delmonico.  We shared the seafood platter for an appetizer and how can you go wrong with king crab, oysters, and lobster.  I ordered the gumbo and it was delicious and full of depth and flavor.  The star of this dinner was the bone in Ribeye!  Perfectly charred on the outside and so tender and moist in the inside.  Best piece of steak I have had in my life, so far. Lol  I'm not a fan of fat on steak but the fat on this steak melted in my mouth and was as close to steak butter as there is.  My friends ordered sides but the steak was so big I didn't have room for anything else.  I think we ordered to much food and we had lots of leftovers. I could have shared the steak and I would have felt perfect.  This place is expensive but worth every penny.  If you feel like treating yourself this is a great place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Platter
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aged Bone in Ribeye

kMWkKrJkqHx5SW9sz_JEnw.text: The best service I had was here during my time in Las Vegas. The al a cart sides were large enough to share family style. My filet was overcooked and the server had another one out to me in minutes. The martinis were wonderful in chilled glasses with blue cheese olives. The table settings beautiful.

7fYoPiMa20VwN3mNAa_KMw.text: Steak was very tough. Surprising for $55.00, I had the Ribeye and my son had the NY strip. Both the same. Flavor was unusual. Atmosphere was good roll's were spectacular and twice baked potato was also very good. Overall would not return.

YewX3uDAVnz5-7xtNZTrCg.text: Overall: A great place for steaks and a nice place to take someone special.   Food: We had the king crab legs as a starter. It was OK. The crab legs were cut in half for you so it's easy to eat. The crabs were not as sweet this time. If seafood is your main course I would recommend Aquanox.   We had the wagyu ribeye for our main. It came with roasted grape tomatoes and maitake mushrooms. The ribeye was delicious. Very high fat content so I would recommend cooking it medium. It helps the fat meld with the meat.   For dessert we had the duck egg creme brulee. It was decadent and not too sweet.   Since it was a special birthday. The birthday girl received a complimentary mango sherbet with a lit candle and happy birthday written in chocolate.   Service: The service was good. Mark, Tyke, and Dan took care of us while we were there. Dan also wished the birthday girl happy 21st. While it was her ninth 21st birthday. =)

Vl3vhgR12Q1A2s-HnAU9XQ.text: We're locals so our restaurants standards are pretty high. The restaurant was pleasant but nothing exciting in the decor department. Service was good, the menu pedestrian, seafood and steak. The lobster bisque was average, I've had better, but the wilted spinach salad was exceptional. My Chilean sea bass was okay, but again, not fabulous. My husband's rib eye was below average at best, I've cooked better at home. The twice baked potato was ok, but the shell was dry and hard. The dessert special was cheesecake, which was fine, but the banana cream pie was again, nothing to brag about. At this price point, too many other fine choices to bother with this place again.

azpVRzYO1x2WOzRoy2QmTw.text: Oh good lawwwwd....did someone say STEAKKK?!?!  I recently came to Vegas from DC for a bachelor party and this was our one "nice" meal for the weekend. I decided to eat the Wagyu and it came with mashed sweet potato. It was sooo good. Cooked awesomely by the chef. What made it even better was eating it with the many sides we ordered. Surprisingly I loved the cream of spinach, but my favorite side was the potato gratin. Unfortunately there are so many different places to eat in Vegas...I don't know if I'll ever get to come back here.  Def need to try it at least once!

L8lo5SKXfZRlbn1bpPiC9w.text: Went here for guys weekend. Unbelievable. Ravioli app was so good. The steak was very good too. When getting a good bottle of wine, make sure they decant it for you...had to ask.

rwfKOGeIjRJbyfx-WzwfLA.text: Outside of the steak I ordered being slightly raw by the bone, which the manager notice and resolved. This place was perfection. I normally do not give any place 5 stars but after being here two nights in a row with constant experiences, I am confident in my review.   Only complaint. The ceiling in the main dining room has arched contours, which causes you to be able to hear clear as day the conversation of a table 20 feet away when sitting in the right position. Which apparently I was. I could even hear the sidebar whispers.

OmOw_p07dZRzM3d_kDLuwA.text: I took my best friend to Delmonico Las Vegas last Saturday, January 14, 2017 for her Birthday dinner.  I was very disappointed, the Fried Oyster appetizer dish was cold at the inside, the Creole Shrimps was also cold where these 2 dishes was suppose to be hot.  The Bone-in-Rib eye was fatty and the Pork Chop tasted like Barbecue Pork.  The meal was expensive and I don't mind paying for an expensive meal but it was not worth the money.   Greatly disappointed in the food, the service was wonderful but not the food.

PPIJLo_cL25dLSE5Edm8Jw.text: We have been wanting to check out Delmonico for a while now, and with it being Restaurant Week, it made sense to stop in! They only had a lunch special, but there was a lot of variety, and the food was great! Service was top notch as well, with our glasses never hitting halfway with a smile. Had to hit it with the 4 star, since some of the food was hit and some miss, but overall everything was good and a great value for RW. Started off with a surprise amuse! yelp.com/biz_photos/delm... Then the apps came out...The Heirloom Tomato Soup with Grilled Ricotta Cheese Sandwich was good! yelp.com/biz_photos/delm... The soup itself was a little rich and thick, not very soupy consistency, but it worked well with the delicious Ricotta Cheese sandwich! But I tried a few spoonfuls without the sandwich, and it didn't stand on its own. Vine-Ripened Heirloom Tomato Salad : yelp.com/biz_photos/delm... Consisted of Burrata Cheese, Red Onion, Extra Virgin Olive Oil, Balsamic Vinegar and Torn Local Basil. The company liked it, but since I am not a fan of tomatoes, I didn't bother trying it. On to the entrees! The Grilled Skirt Steak Sandwich was great! yelp.com/biz_photos/delm... It was on Ciabatta with Roasted Mushrooms & Onions, Horseradish Mayonnaise, Spinach and Truffle French Fries! The sandwich itself was great! The steak was a perfect and tender medium rare, with the horseradish mayo adding the perfect blend of awesome! The truffle fries were great as well, but their style of fries are a bit overcooked for my tastes. Seems like they are twice fried here...and everyone's was like this, so I know it wasn't by accident. Still good though! Butternut Squash Ravioli : yelp.com/biz_photos/delm... Consisted of Sage Brown Butter, Toasted Hazelnuts and Parmesan Cheese. Not bad...very creamy though. The desserts were awesome! Emeril's Banana Cream Pie : yelp.com/biz_photos/delm... Had a Caramel Sauce, Chocolate Shavings and Whipped Cream, and it was way to big to finish! Lots of chunks of banana, and the cream pie portion was rich and outstanding. The Pecan Pie : yelp.com/biz_photos/delm... Had an Oatmeal Shortbread Crust, French Vanilla Ice Cream & Caramel Sauce. It was good too! A bit better on the portion control here lol. Anyways, I want to make it back to check out their steak menu! Seems like they are a little less spendy than some of the others on the strip, with prices on aged beef starting in the high $40s.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Emeril&#39;s Banana Cream Pie : Caramel Sauce, Chocolate Shavings and Whipped Cream. Gigantic and very yummy!
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pecan Pie : Oatmeal Shortbread Crust, French Vanilla Ice Cream &amp; Caramel Sauce. Yummy!
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Skirt Steak Sandwich : Ciabatta with Roasted Mushrooms &amp; Onions, Horseradish Mayonnaise, Spinach and Truffle Fries.

HvTdFDnjGAm4EE_CpZoR8Q.text: One of the best meals of my life. Gumbo,  Filet, oliver style was delectable.  A nice 2010 bottle of wine from emerils own collection.  White choco macadamia nut  bread pudding.  Oh and the twice baked potato was like silk!  Service was great too, very attentive.

VETXTwMw6qxzOVDlXfe6Tg.text: went for dinner tonight. Amazing my husband had lobster bisque and the T bone both were delish.I had the French onion soup and the pan seared duck. Cooked to perfection and I'm still raving about the flavor. If you are ever in Vegas this is a must try.

lxLcBvFYm_oimQIdBmIE8g.text: Of all steakhouse experiences, this is the best. I have enjoyed many steaks at Delmonico Steak house. Tonight was perfect.  I enjoyed a New York strip served Piedmontese. My steak was cooked impeccably. Executive Sous Chef Ivan Rojas prepared a meal my wife and I truly appreciated.  We have been customers here for 5 years now.  I was raised in the restaurant industry, and I truly appreciate the effort involved to create our meal.

XoOTP4suNA3PrrbEY23pxg.text: The crab was great, the service was pretty good, the seared ahi tuna special was very good, but unfortunately the Chateaubriand was mediocre at best. One person at the table called similar to "school cafeteria roast beef." We were offered a free dessert to compensate, but the piece of key lime pie they brought was just "okay."

jLdMZNMRbZg_aSGK4EWRbg.text: Do not order the lamb!  It is 70 % fat or better.  They warned me but I just could not imagine that much fat could be on these chops! It was obscene!!     The chips were very good ; and the liquor and wine lists are some of the most complete anywhere .    The servers behind the bar were attentive but it was REALLY obvious that they have a slight touch of  animosity toward the guests.  Perhaps here in Las Vegas the guests are a bit abusive , that may account for the latent attitude .  Mind you , they don't display it to your face , but if You keep your ears and eyes open ,  you can easily pick up on the glares and hushed cross talk between them .
