I chose this restaurant based on rating and expected value.   Ordered the bone-in prime ribeye, a signature dish, asparagus and a glass of house red.   The service was excellent for the entire meal. The table bread was good but in my opinion was really better suited for breakfast or needed gravy like Yorkshire pudding. The house red (a cab) was excellent, sorry forgot what I ordered, but it was the least expensive but was very good.   Was served quickly, if I had clients with me I would hope for a little slower pace but alone the speed was appreciated.   The asparagus was perfect, not over cooked or smothered with too much butter, and very tender. The ribeye however came up very short, lacked taste and was tough, not what you would expect from aged prime ribeye. The waiter respond quickly and offered a new steak, I decided on the filet. I was served as fast as possible, the new steak rectified the problem, perfectly charbroiled, taste and texture as expected. Also served fresh asparagus.   Dessert, ordered the pecan tart and a cap. Both very good. The pecan very tasteful, the filling was not too runny or too sweet and the pecans were fresh with a deep southern taste. The crust was very favorable and went well with the Carmel and house made ice cream and whipping cream.   Other notes, good lighting and I liked the architectural ceiling. Chairs are stylist and very comfortable. I recommend adjusting the traffic flow, two much weaving required and not ideal for guest seated in wrong location. Never like sitting near restroom entrance, which I was; as much as I like most people watching I would of asked to be moved if with clients or my spouse. Lastly white sugar cubes, really?

oWS_tUv6QUzVpf6Yrd6nTA.text: I really enjoyed the medium-rare rib eye as it was seasoned and cooked to perfection, but what I enjoyed even more were the pork chops!  Bone in tender chops cooked barely pink covered in a delicious, light sauce.  I'm getting moist just thinking about it.

mAxYEq76A8JGcVPglbpd5A.text: I'm so sad that my boyfriend and I were foolish enough to eat a huge lunch leaving us unprepared for the awesomeness of this place. We were staying in The Venetian with a group of friends and decided on a good steak dinner. As mentioned, my boyfriend and I were still stuffed from lunch so we went for the Cesar salad for two and each got a potato on the side. The salad was so fresh and delicious, and made right at the table. The potatoes were almost too big but delightful. Everyone at the table had what looked to be an amazing steak, the one bite I stole was heaven.

TlUYCqqZtZuSWQw5nEd3Gg.text: Im from Los Angeles, we get way better steaks for better prices and less snotty service.

29Z-uyWPDh-saHLCh7OzhA.text: Another great meal here. I try to dine here when I visit Vegas. I always get the ribeye steak. The sides are all good. Great service

UNVbhL2aCfoyOPttKlF2ng.text: Solid.  Still serving up all the flavor, fat, and syrupy opulence one expects from the Emeril Lagasse empire.  Oh, it happens to serve some great steaks.  Lunch is straight forward.  Salads, gumbo, and an INCREDIBLE STEAK SANDWICH.  A juicy skirt steak is topped with loads of roasted mushrooms, onions, wilted spinach and a pungent horseradish mayo on a warm ciabatta roll with a side of crispy truffle fries.  A great deal for under $20.  Dinner brings out the best.  For starters its hard to pass on the truffle parm potato chips (you weren't expecting that huh).  Crispy, earthy, just good eats and so perfect with any cocktail or wine.  The roasted heirloom tomato soup with  grilled ricotta cheese sandwich, creamy and acidic, comforting goodness.  The steaks are all great quality USDA prime.  Well trimmed and dry aged on site.  Unfortunately, the selection of cuts is limited.   The bone in strip, dense beefy goodness and stands up well to the Creole seasoning (used on all their steaks).  Dry aged steak purist will balk at its use as it destroys the umame goodness.  The bone in rib is more tender and makes the perfect base for "Oscar" style prep (topped with a generous heaping of jumbo lump crab meat, asparagus, and a very rich and tangy bearnaise that blends perfectly with the creole seasoning). Win!  It's not all about the steaks.  The apple smoked kurobuta ham chop with grits and cider reduction is outstanding.  Pure simplicity.  Natural, tender ham packing  deep "hammy" flavor whose richness and saltiness is balanced perfectly by the acidity and sweetness of hard cider reduction.  Holiday ham on steroids!  Friendly and efficient service.  Very good wine list.  Vegas resort prices.  BAM! BAM! BAM! BAM! (Four stars; yeah I couldn't resist).

UxO0GqeOg0RQo29SFqsmjA.text: By far the BEST filet!  My girlfriend and I have dined here three times in the last year and as recently as last Saturday night.  I am a creature of habit so I have ordered the same items during my three visits.  Those items (which I highly recommend) included their mixed green salad, filet mignon, twice baked potato and a few Ketel & Sodas.  Their filet is the best steak I have ever had.  Definitely worth the $52.    Call them early in the week to make a reservation If you are planning to dine there on a Friday or Saturday night to guarantee a table.  We spontaneously stopped in for dinner without a reservation and were quoted 1 1/2 hours for a table.  Fortunately, we were able to find two seats at the bar.    Our bill for the two of us, with cocktails came in around $270 with a generous tip for the great service.  Well worth the money and is on our "Must eat at list."

mDGtk-ZVFD6ly07Nw0ksjw.text: Everything about this place was amazing.  The food, the service, the ambiance, it couldn't have been better.  We began our meal with bbq shrimp, bone-in bacon, and lobster bisque, all of which were delicious.  Now on to the steaks. We ordered bone-in ribeyes and this was by far the best steak I've ever had. It was perfectly prepared and the flavor was out of this world. For our sides we ordered sauteed mushrooms and grits, both of which were equally delicious.  We finished our meal with dessert and we ended up with two, the pecan pie and the caramel butter cake, both of which were, you guessed it, delicious!  Let's talk about the staff and the service.  From the host that greeted us when we walked in, to the gentleman that walked us to our seats, to the three gentlemen that served us, everything and everyone was absolutely delightful.  The three gentlemen serving us were Rene, Brian, and David, and they ran like a well oiled machine.  They were very attentive and very pleasant people, and they helped make our dining experience so wonderful.   The ambiance was perfect for our early xmas dinner.  We had a table where we were able to comfortably eat dinner, have a conversation without screaming at each other, and we weren't wedged between other people being forced to share our dining experience with strangers.   Definitely a five star establishment with five star food and five star service. We will definitely be back.

t5KKYFNI1od-C5UTbE6E9w.text: Fantastic meal. Great price on the summer three course special. I would definitely come back here. Great service as well.

DDre6A1SgAqSuiuD8md7Rg.text: Came here for a bachelor party. The day of (busy Saturday) I made a reservation for 20 and they accommodated us with a smile. We even got two tables of 10 next to each other! Excellent service! The food was good but did not stand out from most of the other vegas steakhouses or normal steakhouses in general. I would recommend just based on service we received.

7aj1xcFBYiH1Jg_OX6ZMhg.text: Ohhh where to being....maybe I should start from the judgment from the host? Probably not a good idea to rudely look at people when they enter. Or maybe you shouldn't have a server who asked a personal question about my tattoos? Or maybe when he tried to get me and the 5 other girls to go to his part time job at TAO, then proceeded to ask me if I had another shirt because "I don't think they'd let you get in with a wife beater," because I'm wearing a tank top that isn't up to your personal standards. Hmmmm as an ex server there is NO WAY IN HELL I WOULD EVER TALK TO ANYONE LIKE THAT. Maybe in this gentlemans mind I am not good enough to be at his job, where he works to get paid, to probably help raise his family. Let everyone know beforehand that their is a prerequisite to even be acceptable in this restaurant. Yes I can wear tank tops, and yes I'm a woman I have breasts but to be stared down and then judge how I'm dressed is ABSOLUTELY UNACCEPTABLE.  My entire dining experience was ruined. Why would I want to spend $134 on some wine and food just to be judged? For that I leave the server no tip and I promise I will never tell anyone about this restaurant based on experience alone. My friends told me how great it was and after 10 minutes I was embarrassed and self conscious. Thanks for wasting my money, time and what could have been a good experience. I cannot fathom how these people get trained...

am5ALjSFFaGF76oPQj1ztg.text: bone in rib eye is amazing.... everything else is pedestrian..

0c78qW-v15_AmHP2e7fQPQ.text: i have to admit, i had a bad experience at this steakhouse from the service being so-so to the food being o.k. the biggest disappointment is that my girlfriends steak and my steak were both cooked incorrectly. i ordered my steak medium rare, my gal medium well. at first i thought the waiter got us mixed up regarding how we wanted our steaks cooked because mines was well done and my girl friends was on the rare side. so when our waiter came back and asked us how everything was, i asked him, "how did i order my steak?" he replied, medium rare. i got my steak knife and cut right down the middle of my steak and showed it to the waiter and he glanced at it and replied, looks like it was over cooked slightly. my girlfriend and i both noticed that our waiter was not exactly polite after we pointed out our steaks were cooked incorrectly and didn't offer to bring us new steaks knowingly that the cook blew it by a long shot with the beef. my steak was honestly cooked all the way through. no red and not even any pink. not the end of the world. though this was our saturday night dinner in vegas and we have heard sooo many good things about this restaurant. so we were quite disappointed when we had a somewhat rude waiter and food which was cooked incorrectly. we are going to try this place one more time and give them another shot. i think we just got unlucky. irregardless i have to give the rating in which they provided. sorry delmonico, maybe next time.

IVaecbrKKXBXOjryvExQXA.text: was there this past weekend with a group of 7 people... not a disappointed person in the party. the staff was super friendly and accomodating (we had children with us). i had mushroom crusted filet medallions. so good. we got sides of grits, corn and steamed broccoli... all three were great. we also ordered a few desserts, the banana cream pie was outrageous. so fresh and tasty. i didnt have the wine but my friends really enjoyed the bottle that was recommended to them.

isNriefeJMt-Jn9pj0C2dg.text: During a recent visit to Las Vegas, Delmonico Steakhouse was one of our top priorities. We had heard wonderful things about the food and this review was echoed when our driver commented that Delmonico was "one of the best steakhouses in the world." Upon arriving we felt like VIP guests. The bar was sleek and high class. We were there to celebrate and friend's upcoming move and this was the perfect setting. The dining room was tastefully decorated and the minimalistic style allowed us to focus on the delicious food and good company. Among the appetizers we tried our favorites were the Foie Gras and Crabcakes. The appetizers set the tone for what would be an incredible dining experience. I suppose it should go without saying but the next course was STEAK! Filets and Bone-in Ribeyes were the popular picks with the guest of honor going for the Filet Oscar (a filet topped with jumbo crab meat), which was the group's favorite. The steaks lived up to their reputation. The sides were a la carte and were great for sharing. And it was all tied together with a Sineann Pinot Noir from the expansive wine list. We enjoyed the meal so much we did not get a chance to try the dessert menu. Service was outstanding. Our server, Michael, was very attentive and enhanced the entire experience. Everyone ranked our evening at Delmonico amongst their favorite dining experiences. The food, drinks and service were top-notch and it was the perfect send-off for a good friend.

cfe_IsSmE-NBFksEp79Aqw.text: I was so impressed with the sister restaurant in New Orleans that I opted to make a reservation here for hubby's bday.  We arrived an hour early for our reservation and they were able to seat us.  They sent over a complimentary amuse bouche of steak sate that wowed us while we enjoyed an outstanding Pomegranite Martini and Key Lime Martini.  For people who love wine, the menu is extensive and expensive.  Overall, the food was good (don't order the creamed spinach, it tastes like Birds' Eye frozen), and the service was excellent (thanks, George!).  Pricey, but knew that heading in, and the cuts of meat and preparation met were worth the $$$$ price.  The special salad that evening (mixed baby greens with lavendar and baby brie turnovers and candied pecans was much better than my proscioutto (chewy slab, not shaved) and mozzarella.  A nice place for a special dinner.  Overall I have to say I enjoyed the food at the NOLA location but liked the sophisticated atmosphere and vibe of this Venetian restaurant better.  Glad we went but next time I'm in Vegas not sure I wouldn't head back without trying another similar restaurant first.

XD65YzsY2AQhXykpZljCDQ.text: this is my favorite steak house ever and iv tried all the steakhouses in oc/la... I always get the bone in rib eye (big enough to share) and a few sides...Emerill's signiture banana cream pie is dayam good too...gotta get the side of muchrooms and finger link potatoes...once in a while they with serve their special pork chops and i highly recommend you get it. its THAT good. i luv this place and cant leave Vegas with out dining at this restaurant! Thanks Emrill!

G7WrN6YDhBYLLfSHUfUV7w.text: First off I love Emeril I think his food is old school and sloppy, but I love him and don't doubt his food is delicous! So I was excited to go there. I am a chef, and a succesful one I've ran restaurants and now I am a private chef, so I know food and service! I was with my girlfriend and another couple, from the start we were treated like we didn't belong there. They forgot to bring us our wine for like 20 minutes. The table beside us arrived after us and recieved their wine and food before us! They recieved excellent service, getting a amuse bouch, and all served at the same time! We were treated like dishwashers. I thought the food was ok, crabcake was decent but lacked simple seasoning salt and pepper! I thought they would at least make there own bread, but no. The ribeyes were charred black and had no seasoning, filet was ok but lacked seasoning. Gnocchi was great but a little salty. All in all food lacked seasoning, waiter was a asshole, all though the manager was cool I will never step foot in there again!!!!!!!!

_hojHl9tq9AJaM49fsimBg.text: Boyfriend and I came here with two other friends as an early bday celebration!  The restaurant is right next to the passageway to the Palazzo Hotel and it sits right in front of the Blue Man theater. The ambience was nice except I took off a star for the boring cream colored walls.   The food was great! I had a filet mignon while the other three all had a bone in ribeye. Ohmigosh...i couldn't believe how big these things were! They were ginormous! Anyway, the sides were yummy! We had the garlic mushrooms, steamed asparagus, baked potatoes, potato chips, and spinach! Geez...i know we couldn't even get to all of them!  Their famous banana cream pie was delicious! It was a little frozen...I prefer it to be a bit more thawed...but it was still good!  Their dinner rolls..ok...this is so Filipino but damn..it tasted like hot pan-de-sal! It was so good! Hahaha...seriously. Emeril's gotta be stealing Goldilock's or Valerio's pandesal recipe!   $400 for the 4 of us....it's alright...step outside and play roulette! Make sure you put it all on red!

7JpbT3G1M9nrESkggEjtMw.text: I ate here way before I actually knew what fine dining was and when I would laugh over getting two tiny crab cakes for $12. In retrospect, it's a delicious gourmet establishment with a small menu that features a lot of variety - which I find to be extremely rare.   The service was excellent and the staff was patient with us asking questions about the food. The environment was very relaxed and there was plenty of space between each table so you felt like you had a bubble around your table.   They don't allow flip flops! but they didnt say anything to me...its just on the bottom of their business card :)

YrLt9zTnbRBzWE-lLtEVGg.text: Intro: As is the case with most (if not all) steakhouses, don't fuss with too many appetizers.  Go straight for the beef.  Food: Chateaubriand, carved tableside with seasonal vegetables - it was hearty, it was tasty.  Very simple presentation - there is nothing between you and the food.  Sauteed Garlic Mushrooms - The sauce left a funny, stingy, slighty charred aftertaste.  Not a fan.  Wine List:  Seriously lacking.  What's this of not having ANY Chateauneuf Du Pape?  Ambiance: Elegant, modern, simple, and warm.  I wouldn't mind living in this place.  Service: He did his best, but it was quite apparent that he was tired.  The poor guy.  When asked for a suggestion on a Red, he immediately suggested that there was a sommelier onsite.  C'mon buddy, you gotta try just a little, even if it is bulldoohicky!   Overall: Be warned - you're paying for the ambiance and the Emeril name.  The food was delicious, but really not uberrifically succulent and extraordinary and memorable and, and....need I go on.

-jj-I7ZilRY184XucCX_8g.text: The Bone-in ribeye was excellent.   The apps and the wine were great, and the service was prompt and friendly.    I will recommend this as a great place to go for a steak in Vegas!

mZyhlQxyIPuJJz5MGwkkTQ.text: As I have been to the Emeril Delmonico restaurant in New Orleans and enjoyed it immensely, I decided to have dinner at the Delmonico Steakhouse located in the Venetian Resort Hotel & Casino where I was attending the Phantom of the Opera later that evening (incredible show by the way!).  What you'll find is a variety of food selections with Creole influences.   First the menu prices are expensive ($$$$) but you are there for the intimate and fine dining experience and should be expecting to pay those prices.  What I didn't expect was to be dressed up and have an individual in shorts, sandals, and a Baltimore Colts jersey seated at an adjacent table to me.  Kind of lowered my view of this establishment being world class if you know what I mean.  I started with the Lobster Bisque which was just superb but did lack the "Creole" twist I was expecting (The BAM factor).  Only thing that was a little of an inconvenience was the lobster pieces were quite large and were hard to cut with my spoon.  The wife selected the Organic Baby Mixed Greens Salad Creole Spiced Croutons, Sherry Vinaigrette, Shaved Manchego Cheese Roasted Teardrop Tomatoes and Shaved Red Onion.  I had a taste and it was very good.  The different flavors were unique and distinctive.  The main course I selected a Pinot Noir wine that to go along with my Ribeye Steak and selected the Roasted Fingerling Potatoes and Whole Garlic with Fresh Herbs.  The wine was fantastic with a rich and bold body and floral aroma.  Wasn't dry and complimented the Ribeye Steak very well.  The Ribeye has Emeril's classic touch written all over it with the blackened spice rub with a pat of herb butter on top.  The cut was 1-1/2 inches thick, lean, and very large portion.  The potato dish was okay, didn't impress me in any way.  The wife also had the Pinot Noir and selected the Filet Mignon.  The cut had to be nearly 2 inches thick, lean, and a normal portion size.  I recommend selecting your Ribeye to be cooked medium rare (I do not recommend medium) and your Filet Mignon medium rare or at the most medium.    Sorry to say we were extremely full when we finished and couldn't partake of dessert.  The meal described above with tip was roughly $210.

VazgeXVEcRImzFXUPWMBJA.text: Really good steakhouse! We went there for our friend's birthday. The environment is nice but maybe a tiny bit noisier as I expected. My boyfriend and I ordered a Lobster Bisque to share, which was good but not especially exciting. He ordered a Filet Mignon, I believe, and was fantastic! It literally melted in my mouth and we were able to cut it with a butter knife.. so tender! I ordered a season entree - Grilled halibut on a bed of lumbcrab meat w/ some kind of aioli. It was alright... the crab was tasty but the fish was a bit dry...   Our friend ordered the Tournedos au Poivre and his girlfriend ordered the Ribeye. The Ribeye was huge for the price! We also ordered a couple of sides to share - New Orleans Creamed Spinach, Sauteed Garlic Mushrooms and Truffle Parmesan Potato Chips. I have to say the mushrooms was really good! Didn't really care for the creamed spinach because it was too heavy for me. The chips was good, too, but I wanted to compare it to Alexander's Truffle oil fries... That's one of my future plans =P  Overall, I think the steaks are worth the price. Other stuff are good but not extremely exciting.... I guess you should always go for the steaks at a steakhouse!

MQjZjpGdSMv6Wpr1CeOSaQ.text: Went there with co-workers because one of them had a craving for steak. We should've gone to just a whatever steakhouse that you could have for less than $20.  Their bone-in steak ran about $48. Their appetizer salad special of the day (which I had as an entree) was $20. Don't believe what the vegas tourist book says. It said it's "$$", where in actuality was more like "$$$$". I don't think I'd go there again. My friend said his lobster bisque soup was just "okay" and not as good as another, less expensive place. He said it was bland and not much flavor to it. Their twice-baked potato was pretty good, but I can imagine how unhealthy it is for you.   Their setting is nice though - dimly lit in some parts of the restaurant. Great for couples or dates. And if you want to go there, make sure it's something special like a birthday or anniversary. That's probably the only time I'd go back IF I ever went back.

0qcKB_82XfPMVuBs6pZ9Yg.text: This place is a good place to go with your significant other but the seats are really close so it's difficult to have an intimate conversation....  Really good food but the service is just OK.  The only thing that I would go here for is Gumbo and Chocolate Souffle.

UzY8An_QcWx5UzHqgzfq7Q.text: This is the 3rd time we've been to Delmonico & honestly, it keeps getting better! The service is top notch.  Our servers were on top of everything but not intrusive & the manager, Rene, was friendly  & knowledgeable about all aspects of the restaurant.  For our appetizers, we had oysters on the 1/2 shell, wilted spinach salad & heirloom tomato soup.  All were yummy.  We've come to realize that splitting a steak between 3 people is the way to go.  In the past, half our steak would go to waste as these steaks are huge!  We split a bone in ribeye and there was still a couple of pieces left over. The reason you get so full is because the sides at Delmonico are out of this world! This time around we had the potatoes au gratin, creamed spinach & creamed corn.  I could make a meal on Delmonico side dishes alone - they're that good!  While they've served up delicious desserts in the past (what? No more bread pudding?), we just didn't have room for dessert this time.  I can't wait until we are back in Vegas again & have the time to stop by this gem of a restaurant.  It's True culinary bliss!

JRaPWIxfR6kvTtZX6ojlmA.text: Second time dining at DelMonico.  Food was great service was on Point. A must when in Las Vegas

UlGQHLHn8WphxIAmVRP5-A.text: Had a reservation for 5 o'clock  and was kept waiting  in the lobby. ..was told by the hostess that it would be a few minutes and they would be begin seating shortly. At this point I'm wondering why make a reservation...but alas once we got past the snippet at the front desk I enjoyed one of my best dining experiences. The wait staff is attentive but not overbearing,my husband had the ribeye and I had the petit filet.  Perfection. The understated elegance  is exhibited from start to finish... Don't miss the pecan pie.  Costly...absolutely. But there are times when your pleasure is priceless.

6gP4H1CD7kjCaQLwuh-EgA.text: We started out with a cheese and prime rib fondue with pretzels which was outstanding.  The portion seemed small, but was very filling for an appetizer.    I ordered the NY Strip and ordered the potato cakes with onions as a side.  The steak was nicely cooked but really lacked flavor.  The best part of the meal was the potato cakes with onions.  I honestly was hoping for a little more BAM.  Dessert was a disappointment for me.  I ordered the chocolate cake and it was more like a fudge.  I only ate a few bites.  My wife loved her dessert, I just can't remember what she got!    Service was ok... but seeing the service other people got made us realize it was probably just our waitstaff that was lacking.  Other tables actually heard the specials and their waiter made suggestions.  They received sauces with their steaks, we did not.  When I asked our waiter for a dessert recommendation, he basically read the menu.

ea5drCpBfGD9qV2IQ5uqhg.text: Fab bistro! I'm usually one to choose light dining over a big steak, i must say this is one steak house i want to go back.  The services was great! We were lucky enough to have "Vinnie" to help us selecting the right wine for both the rib eye steak and the fish dish. Will definitely go back when in Vegas.

BkC2tQ9vKei0Osn01BsI8Q.text: I really enjoyed my experience in here. Its an expensive place so save it for a special night out, unless you're wealthy, than feel free to splurge all you want.   From the outside, the restaurant seems small, but once you walk in you'll see its a lot bigger and most of their clients are seated there instead. Spacious seating and dim lighting, everyone is dressed up.  My party tried out:  Appetizer: Emeril's shrimp, it wasn't bad. I was delicious, but not necessarily memorable or jaw dropping. Our waiter recommended it to us and it wasn't a bad choice.  Soup: Lobster bisque, delicious!!! This is the best lobster bisque I've had in recent memory. A lot of the bisques I've had always added too much wine into so the wine flavor killed the lobster's, but this one was well balanced! Kudos!  Entrees: BBQ Salmon, genuinely surprised at how delicious this was. Moist, flavorful, but not overbearing. Potato hash and onion strips went well with it. I ordered a side of mashed potatoes too, which was great. The waiter warned me that I had a lot of potatoes, but I don't mind. Plus, I shared my mash with my party. Other members in my party had the filet mignon and ribeye. I'm not a particular fan of ribeye because of its texture, but they managed to make me like it.   We didn't order any dessert, but we did have a few cups of Blue Mountain to end the evening. Soothing, relaxing, and it was a perfect ending to a nice meal.  The service was great, our waiter was very efficient, honest, and attentive. No snobby elitist attitude, which is always appreciated. The price is expensive, but what do you expect? Its Vegas! You're going to be spending a lot if you want to have a good time here.

2JMNkEMI0UpyKTWEehJ-yA.text: I really wanted to love this - I had very high expectations going in...unfortunatly, well, maybe I caught them on an off night..  Let's start with the wine list - the night in question they were out of the slightly over $100 (inexpensive for the restaurant) bottle of Cab that I selected,  Not really a problem - found one that cost just a little more.  However, later in the meal one of the waiters informed me of another Cab (not on the list) that cost about the same as the one I originally selected but was much better than the one I ended up with. Why not inform me of this BEFORE I selected another bottle?  Strike one.  It was a Sunday night and I was informed that they were out of the special of the day - some sort of fish. Again not a problem as we came in for BEEF.  Just thought I would mention it...  The wedge salad - the bacon bits served with it were cold, greasy, and very tough.  Not good. The salad itself was fine - good blue cheese and nice and crisp- but for what you are paying the bacon should have been as well. Strike two.  Now on to the steak.- the "signature" bone in rib eye. It was good. Very good in fact. - a huge cut cook just as I orded. But...it was kind of bland. Not totally lacking in flavor but still kind of bland.  Not bad, but not the best steak I had ever eaten.  My friend's filet was also very good - an excellent cut cooked as ordered but still a bit - shall we say?- unseasoned?  Call this half a strike.  Now on to the pecan pie and ice cream thingy - yummy. Best part of the meal!  All in all, Emeril's Delmonico is not bad.  Just that I was expecting more...

icuKSlMOzMcdfMQ88UOMVw.text: We took my mother here for her birthday and we were all really excited as we are fans of Emeril. The food was good, not great and we had a minor slip up -- which at a fancy restaurant, such as this...there should not be slip ups....here's what happened:  My sister was chewing her steak and then started crunching on somehting hard -- it was the plastic tab they put in steaks to mark 'how to cook it.' So you think 'oops, they just forgot to take it out, right?' Well, when you think about dining at such a nice place, a steakhouse at that, with famous chefs and executive chefs and the sort....should they even need to have to use the little plastic things to tell when or how a steak should be cooked?   Since it was my mother's birthday they brought her out a free scoop of sorbet. ....yes it could have been nothing, but a scoop of sorbet at a fancy restaurant??? - a baked slice of cake or something made by a pastry chef would have been a little more appropriate and suiting.   The atmosphere too was very cold and there was no warmth or decor to the place.   The service was, however, excellent! Very professional and nice. They did take care of the 'slip up,' but I must say, "with all the places in Vegas, I will not be dining there again."

qSi8cZVMs-6UIhkZgCBx6A.text: My brother and I decided to get a good steak dinner and Delmonico Steakhouse did not disappoint.  One of the better steak houses in Vegas.  A bit old time atmosphere but I did enjoy that. Old time service and great piece of steak. Everything I wanted.

OXf3hUGy7TG-9MnwHxkjJg.text: One of my real first fine dining trips in Las Vegas and I was not disappointed!  Let's start out by saying Delmonico was very accommodating despite showing up late the staff was really nice with the exception of the blonde chick that seated us. Decor very simple ambiance very romantic but still a lively and fun place to have dinner with friends.   Food Appetizers - Jumbo Crab Cake - SOOOOO YUMMY I think this is the best I've had so far! The pieces of crab was huge! Appetizers - Truffle Potato Chip Things - OHHH This is potato chips on steroids ohh soooo yum.  Entree - I had the filet mignon was good perfectly cooked and marinated I asked for the house sauce but realize I didn't need it. My friend had the Rib eye and boy did that blow my mind. One bite and I fell in love with it. I would have eaten his whole steak but realized I had mine to finish.  Sides - Mushrooms - Ehh Sides - Potato Gratin - So So So  Dessert - Banana Cream Pie and Creme Brulee by dessert I was pretty stuffed but I managed to get my dessert down it was pretty damn good.   I would definitely come back here again

9VMj8C4GjFyhaLQNRzj7iQ.text: Just ate at Delmonico's for dinner tonight. I was really in the mood for a good steak, and this place did not disappoint AT ALL!! The pappardelle mushroom pasta appetizer was not quite as flavorful a dish as I anticipated, but very good none the less. Also had the truffle and Parmesan potato chips, which are a MUST HAVE!!  The Bone in New York Strip was quite possibly the most flavorful steak I have had in a long time if not ever. The Service was spot on and the atmosphere was relaxed. My wife and I visit Vegas once a year and we will be sure to make it to Delmonico's at least once per trip from now on.

fqYJ53gZY2cZDuexhl58Sw.text: If you are going to pay $52 dollars for the most expensive meet cut, you expect high quality meat.  Instead I got a piece of meat that was 1/3 filled with fat, fat!! Come-on this is what you expect when you are eating at a college kid barbeque party.  While my gf order the shrimp pasta and that was unbelievably oily if you are going to cook with sausage one knows hit has natural oil so you dont need to fill up the frying pan with extra oil, someone needs to question the cooks they got.  Baked oyster was alright it was tasty, but buttery and oily as well, but still flavorful.   The only thing good about this place is the service.  The main waiter was very helpful when choosing a cocktail.  The servers where very friendly as well.   Bottom line: This place can cost over $150 person, depends what and quantity of order, skip the food at this place just come for cocktails.  This place got two stars for service and cocktails.  Would have gotten four if I was describing a lounge or bar.

onICvCwxLI_c4Ut59Rc_sg.text: A fancy steakhouse with minimal decor, Delmonico's was recommended as the best place for steak in Vegas by several people.  Everything was very tasty and well seasoned, but we didn't find the food to be spectacular as expected.  Not sure if it was all the alcohol we have been consuming the past 2 days, but none of us could finish out 16 ounce steak - which was a damn disgrace in our books.  Though overall the experience was good, we doubt we would return anytime soon because there are just so many other steakhouses in the city to try out.

A-AV4eNe3T3TWdJXEOdkhQ.text: The best steak and the best service.  I just wish there was a Delmonico around where I live.  My boyfriend and I travel to Las Vegas just for Delmonico.  We absolutely love it!

VbaTl0_kBb1mz8tQvDz9Qg.text: My hubby and I had date night here before seeing Zumanity- This was one of the best steaks I have ever had. We are from Texas, so we know good steak. I got mine crusted with Blue Cheese. We had the garlic mushrooms and 2x baked potato. The atmosphere is great and the dessert was AMAZNG. We had the Banana cream pie. To die for!!! We booked online!!!

Z2XhriaGHGdgDB9D3YuexQ.text: One of the best restaurants from Emeril.  A group of us dined here while in Vegas.  I ordered the ahi tuna/salmon tartare as an appetizer.  It was amazing!  The ahi and salmon tasted very fresh.  The fish is divied by a small amount of seaweed salad.  It's served with wonton chips, cucumber/onion "salad", and a trio of wasabi sauces.  For dinner I ordered the ribeye steak.  It was HUGE.  I was expecting small portions since it's the case at most fancy restaurants. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to finish my steak.  And most hotels in Vegas do not have a fridge or microwave in the room.  So, I couldn't take it with me.  For dessert, the group shared the bread pudding with butter pecan ice cream, chocolate cake, and pecan pie.  And these were not your typical "pecan pie" or "chocolate cake".  They were all delicious and decadent! You have to try them to really understand.  Overall, my dining experience was wonderful.  The service is impeccable and the restaurant has a warm ambiance to it.  Yes, it's pricey, but you are going to a famous chef's restaurant.

qs1w3hRzQgEUBTElkvhdsw.text: interesting cave like setting.  busy, but way overpriced for what it is.  nothing special or memorable about the steaks or sides. average quality food. average service, nothing special to stand out from any other restaurant. hyped name.  professional host greeting.

1LdNJCyZ6HVZV1zyieIy-A.text: My Husband took me here for our anniversary dinner. We arrived early at five because we had theatre tickets and had made dinner reservations accordingly.  The restaurant is beautiful with cream walls, rock wood and glass throughout with romantic lighting the evening was looking good. We ordered starters Crab Cakes for my husband nice crispy well seasoned crab I love a crab cake that is more crab then filler and this one was that. I ordered the steak tartar because I've never had it and wanted to be daring. I have to say I was scared lol but it was so worth it. Wonderful crisp toasted baguettes with rich beef capers oil and seasoning and spicy mustard sauce  this has got to be one of the best dishes I've ever eaten and a must try. We then followed this with Lobster bisque  rich warm and creamy with plenty of lobster one of my favorite lobsters bisques definitely.  I had the petite iceberg lettuce wedges a nice take on the classic salad with Wisconsin blue cheese buttermilk dressing homemade apple wood bacon and just the right amount of red onion really tangy. For our entree we had chosen to go with the  Chateaubriand for two. They carve it tableside and serve it with asparagus and garlic potatoes The sides were actually very good but the meat was just ok nothing special and more red then I care for We had also ordered a side of sauteed garlic wild mushrooms which were also just ok I've had better versions of both these dishes. On to dessert we were bad and ordered two. The Chocolate root beer float which was not that great I guess we just didn't care for the ginger and chocolate flavors together so we didn't finish this one but the banana cream pie was like biting into heaven little shavings of chocolate rich sweet whipped cream bananas and sweet rich caramel sauce make up this dish and it's worth every calorie that's probably packed into it. So splurge and have it it's amazing. The wait staff was amazing making sure you never wanted for anything and that everything went smoothly and the wine selection and service was top notch. Definitely worth the splurge

7URvy5Ea2dMZAPOlkRb6FA.text: We were disappointed. Went there for anniversary dinner... There was no Bam, no kicking it up a notch, just kind of taste-free. Although we had three people assigned to the table the service was slow. After dropping the menus it took a while to take our drink order, and then a while longer to get them. but then we got the food before we finished the cocktail. OK. The main complaint is that the food just wasn't that good. Foie gras to start was OK, the wife had the filet and I had buffalo ribeye.  I knew buffalo is iffy, whether you get meat or gristle, but the waiter assured me it was not gamey. Well, this one didn't change my mind--the center was good but I had to do a lot of chewing to get to it. The filet was chewy and really had no taste to it. Creamed spinach had a definite cream taste, but where was the BAM? Same thing with twice baked potatoes--too liquid. To finish we had the espresso creme brulee, which was good, but too cold; with chocolate madelines that were not warm, and again, tasteless.  Just not worth the price we paid at all. I mean I've had better steak at Outback. Sorry Emeril.

-IC2GPJC-lOtcYQ_s1e8Cw.text: Food quality disappointing. Not the best steak in Vegas.  Three of us enjoyed two ribeyes ($52) and one filet ($46). Waiter told us their ribeye is the best steak in Vegas, but don't believe it. They were cooked correctly. The rub was rather bland and the crusting on the filet was hard. On a scale of one to ten, my ribeye overall was a 7. I've had 10's before in Vegas, so the competition is tough! But just claiming you have the best steak doesn't make it so.  The sides ($9 each) were disappointing. We ordered four. Creamed spinach, always a favorite of mine and recommended by the waiter, was just odd and bland - didn't taste interesting or flavorful at all. The best side was the asparagus, but honestly, how hard is it to steam asparagus?  Desert, as it often is at these kind of places where desert is an afterthought, was disappointing and ended the overall experience on a "blah" note.  Wine list was excellent.  With so many great places in Vegas, you can do much better. Everything else was top notch, but the food is the core of the experience and Delmonicos is just average, unfortunately.

pg2KJCg1stKrexSzg9lzng.text: Based on prior reviews, we tried the Chateaubriand cooked tableside for two. We were definitely not disappointed and the meat melted in my mouth. But the best part of this place is the impeccable service. Several different people attended to us throughout the night and topped it all off with a complimentary dessert to celebrate our honeymoon!

He1MijYelqA7uZxH0jG6bQ.text: This place was really great.  There was no wait when my girlfriend and i went here, we have reservations anyway.  We never really had to wait long for anything because we had 3 waiters helping us.  They had really good bread to start off with and they made the best tasting whisky sour i've ever had from their bar.  I got the new york strip steak and it filled me up and tasted great.  it was a very quiet place too, most of the people there were older and drinking wine.  i'd go back if i ran into a lot of money, but i'm content with $12 steak.

rprzcFOPGEDAEodgdho38g.text: Great restaurant in the tradition of great steakhouses.  Loved the understated decor.  Food was excellent, staff great.  Another definite must in Vegas - it's getting harder and harder to figure out where to go with so many great choices.  Expensive - of course.

Ah1YoTkWfknL05Pgxd3HAA.text: I liked this place a lot and would probably go here again next time I'm in Vegas.  They have a nice bar/lounge to hang out in if you have to wait for a table.  Very good food and very professional staff.  The presentation when you order an expensive bottle of wine is pretty amazing.  Not quite 5 stars though.

-CKRAQEMJGP6nj9SOwossw.text: So I was in town again and felt like having steak since we ate at Tao the previous night. My friend suggested that I dine here. I liked the mood and settings of the restaurant. We got a quiet cozy corner. Order a few glasses of read wine to go with the filet I ordered. Overall, it was a good experience. Nothing spectacularly special. Food was above average.

Z9Suypkw_zdglBF94fwtvg.text: One of the best meals we've ever had.  the staff was very friendly, the prices a bit high but worth it.  We got the chicken, the shrimp pasta and the the petite beef medallions.  The chicken tasted a little gamey to me but the shrimp pasta and the beef medallions were great.  the portions were also reasonable.  We didn't drink or order any appetizers but 3 entrees and the meal was about $150 total.  Not bad for a wonderful meal for 3 ppl.  One of the best meals I've ever had and I've been to a lot of Emeril's places and this is the best by far.  Gotta go.

F4LhnmM2egQzpqApJAnVLg.text: This is a good steak place but not like the best steak ever, it's owned by Emeril, so most of the dishes has this unique Creole / Louisianna taste...If your staying at the Venetian this is a good place to get your steak fix =)...

DP1CYxeDDlaLu1gMYSA9cQ.text: About 2 years ago, I had dreamed of eating steak at Delmonico's.  The reputation of this place exceeds my expectations; and, as such, is my dilemma with this place.  Delmonico's is Emeril lagasse's steak house.  It is his prime choice, so-to-speak, and it has one of the prime locations between the Palazzo and the Venetian, right in front of the Blue Man Group entrance, across from V-bar, B&B, and next door to Aquaknox.  I've walked by this place numerous times and always wanted to eat there.  Suffice to say, in the past two years, I have.  In short, I have eaten at Delmonico's 6 times.  Not bad for someone that gives this place 3-stars.    Pros:  Wine list is expansive and can be very intimidating.  However, I question the knowledge of one of the staff when they recommended a pinot for our bone-in ribeye.  I know a little bit about wine, well, who I am I kidding, I pretend to know a lot.  Enough to the point that I didn't think I'd want a pinot.  However, it was his recommendation and I thought I would go with it.  It was definitely a pinot.  Very disappointed since the body of it didn't fit right with our bone-in ribeye (which was my concern to begin with). The steak is choice (to steal my favorite John Hughes film). Can sit large groups fairly easily. Will sit a table fairly late (almost 11pm on a Friday night). Excellent sides. They are fairly attentive with the service. The scotch list is reasonable.  However, I do usually get a vodka martini with blue cheese stuffed olives (and they hit it pretty good).   They do have a chef's table near the kitchen.  For a heavy trafficked weekend, I believe you have to book well into 3-months in advance (numbers change based on availability).  I am interested in trying this because I think it would be a blast to have a bunch of friends, drinking out of a magnum, and eating some good steak (but I'm not that organized nor do I have an event to do that with).  Well, who am I kidding, I don't even have that many friends.  Ha!  Anyways...  Cons:  I always get the bone-in ribeye and each time I've eaten it, the seasoning (which I believe is a cajun based creole seasoning) is slightly different each time.  In some cases the seasoning can be too much and in others, its not enough.  There just isn't any consistency. All but one time I've eaten here someone has gotten the ribeye too rare or too well-done.  The fact that they can't get this right concerns me.  You are a steakhouse; get it right; its what you are supposed to be good at! The decor is more monastery like.    The first time I ate here, I gave it 4-stars (my meal was great, my girlfriends meal wasn't cooked right).  If they clean up their act and make things tight and organized, I think Delmonico's is a 4-star steakhouse.  The steak is pretty tasty.  Its perfectly okay to pick up the bone and start gnawin on it.  Well, within reason of course.  However, it has too much inconsistency between day to day operations and meals.  To be fair, I'd still come and eat here (cause I believe the steak is an excellent quality of meat) but with the competition being so tight in Vegas, I've started to venture out.

T4Q7lLvwhN-VuHGUiIMUmg.text: The food was very good here. Very-overpriced and the ambience left a little to be desired. We were seated and served promptly and professionally at this restaurant. However, there was a screaming child immediately next to us. This child was so loud the other diners gasped in disbelief. The maitre 'd did not offer any apologies other than to say "we are serving them quickly so they will leave".  He did not seem overly concerned with our satisfaction. The food was good but not worth the expense. There are many other restaurants in Las Vegas. This one was not worth it. We're not going back.

l6vwYPrwIyAWPsjjkyjSiQ.text: I blame my father for my inordinate love of all things gourmet. Thankfully, I appreciate a good burrito as much as I appreciate a good steak, but I will definitely seize every opportunity to dine in style as much as I can.  Thanks to a family trip to Vegas, I got to eat at Emeril's, once more partaking our family's favorite pasttime: eating. We had eaten at the original location in New Orleans when I lived there, and it was one of my top 5 dining experiences of all time. This one definitely tied that experience.  As other people have said, if you're not going to eat steak in some form when you come here, you're wasting your time. The steak is truly a peak experience for meat lovers. We all ate our  steaks in silence, save for the "OMG!" and "MMMM!" and "wow.wow.wow."  They all had the filet mignon, and I had the bone-in dry aged ribeye: the best steak I have ever eaten in my life. It came on a bed of perfectly creamy garlic mashed potatoes and foie gras butter just melting into it.   Have you ever had lightly tempura battered asparagus? It's worth coming here just to try them.   Even the sides- delicious spinach he made without cream that was STILL good (shocking, I know), and broccoli cooked to perfection...we all kept remarking how absolutely everything was just perfect.  The other thing that distinguishes restaurants like this is the service.  Places like this are in a whole other league- waiters who seem to read your mind, appearing and disappearing before you even realized you needed something - never interrupting conversation, never hovering, always classy and helpful. Our waiter chose the perfect wine for us with with the vague descriptions of what we were looking for, and it truly was the best complement to our meals ever.   The design of the room is also a refreshing breath of fresh air from all the gaudy glitz and obnoxious 'bigness' of Vegas; simple, clean lines and understated elegance and chairs that make it seem like your table is totally self-contained and isolated from the other tables. Great to have that feeling of privacy.  We lingered for hours just basking in the glow of such perfection and decadence.

YhruDiHr4swTg4XqM9JzFA.text: We were in town for our 1 year wedding anniversary and wanted to eat somewhere nice before seeing Phantom of the Opera so my wife made reservations here.  The service was excellent and the food was good.  I was a little under the weather that day (allergies!) so I couldn't taste my food as well as I could have.  But for being sick, it still was very good.  My wife said the wine list was overwhelming so our hostess suggested a nice cab from Napa (I forget the name).  We had a relatively quiet meal; not too loud compared to other steakhouses I've frequented.  We will have a go at that place again next time we are in Vegas; hopefully I won't be sick so I can enjoy my meal!

2vt7WljElh2iifOD7B4H9A.text: Awesome Steaks! I have never seen a piece of prime rib so big! Nothing jumped out  at  me as exceptional but over all it was very tasty. Waiter was very knowedgable about the wine list which was a plus!

gEVCm4_RYUu-bmY7eK8ToA.text: We ordered a boneless ribeye. Our waiter brought a boneless strip. It initially seemed to me to be a perfectly understandable, routine mistake.  But our waitstaff insisted that the strip was a ribeye.   At the conclusion of the meal, I asked for the manager at the front desk and the host stated he was one of the managers. He was polite, offered to educate the waitstaff, but did not ask who my waiter was. He obviously didn't really care beyond being polite.  I had a few good cocktails, potatoes, and a distinctly different cut of meat than I ordered ... with no offer to bring me even a taste of ribeye. The manager admitted that they were not out of ribeye and that it should have been remedied immediately. Why didn't it happen? Since almost anyone can cook a good steak, going to a steakhouse is about service, about the experience. It is INSULTING to be ignored.

fdnUX0FkTyIjtKQw24PRWw.text: Amazing filet! The bbq app was amazing. Bread was perfect. The lobster bisque... meh, needs citrus and sprinkle some herb of some sort on it... everything else was perfect! Service is always top notch. Key lime and coffee were very fresh! Bisque gets a C- the rest A

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c8lo86VuPuqXs-U8DvmdOA.text: This has to be the best steakhouse i have ever been to in my life. I would recommend anybody who is dining at the strip to try this once. This is a great steakhouse, reservations are a must as we went at 5pm on a Thursday and they were pretty much full and they open at 5.   The restaurant is right next to the theaters in between the Venetian and palazzo. The place is huge and the service is excellent.  We ordered the chateaubriand steak for two which was 18oz and they carved the steak and cooked it to perfection right on tableside. We also got the mashed potatoes along with creamy spinach for the sides but just the steak alone was so tasty you don't really bother with the sides even though we did.   The server was super professional and from start to finish they crushed it and made sure we enjoyed the dinner.  5 stars all the way. This is the restaurant which deserves more as lots of places get the 5 star rating. Delmonico should open up a place in South Florida so i don't have to go to Vegas just to enjoy a steak, just a suggestion.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VE6LgMGd35y0_yACyeXn0Q.text: This was our group's 2nd Vegas visit in a row going to Delmonico Steakhouse, and I can only imagine we'll be trying a new steakhouse next time.   In our previous visit, the meal was perfect.  However this time, the two of us who ordered the Bone-In NY Strip Steak felt that our steaks were poor quality.  The meat was very tough and chewy, and although I'd ask for my steak to be cooked medium rare, it was definitely rare if not undercooked in the middle.  I didn't want to send it back, but the meat was so inedible I couldn't justify not saying something and hoping for the best.  The waiter was responsive enough to offer a new steak, but I opted for cooking it more.  And when it came back, it appeared that someone in the kitchen was offended and took it out on the steak by leaving it in there until parts of it were black.    Overall the best part of the meal was the caesar salad.  But that's not why anyone goes to a steakhouse, so perhaps it's on to the next steakhouse.

6eUT3IwwWPP3CZkAhxqOIw.text: One word my friends: tableside!!! Yes, tableside carving of your steak chateaubriand for two/Creekstone farm steaks never disappoints. One of the best dinners I had this year for sure.  I would recommend Delmonico restaurant in Vegas who ever goes to Vegas or lives there.    Delmonico is settled within the Venetian hotel and with a 5 pm dinner reservation , they were pretty busy by 6 pm. I'm assuming people want to eat good streak before different shows and other entertainment in Vegas. Service was impeccable with the server and assistant both working harmoniously together.  The restaurant is not overly pretentious or glamorous looking.  I liked the overall atmosphere with the white walls/crisp white tablecloths on the tables with dim lighting.    The service starts with the complimentary brioche bread and butter which were decadently heavenly.  Then they entice and educate you about their wine list etc but I don't drink so I was ready to order some steak, steak, steak! I did the chateaubriand steak for two carved for us.  It was a 18oz steak but really my 9 oz share was big but so yummy so yes I was able to finish my portion.  The garlic smashed potatoes were delicious.  The creamed spinach was just ok, a bit of a let down.   Other than that I enjoyed every minute of my dinner before my red eye flight back to Florida.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chandelier in the front of the restaurant
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Part of the menu/chateaubriand did not disappoint
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary bread and water, delicious

wksY6Li2iJyf0-axIpHeug.text: Wonderful experience here.  Service was great.  Steak was great.  Ambience was great.  Food was great.  Get the corn

yignW1qeHjcO3CAMnMTRPQ.text: Weekend 3 Course Lunch:  Chose: Beef Carpaccio, Steak Burger, Banana Cream Triffle Chose: Heirloom Tomato Salad, Tenderloin Sandwich, Philo Pecan Dessert Delmonico's does a great job of giving you the best version of comfort food. Each course was delicious. Honestly could have spent $38 pp at any of the other Venetian restaurants so felt this course experience was worth it.  The one thing that seemed odd was the interior decor...it's pretty stark. Plain white walls, little to nothing as far as decor, devoid of personality (just seemed oddly stuffy for a chef with as much personality as Emeril).

i-AMxIXc5oH41wfL95lTVA.text: Six of us in February 2019 ate here for dinner and it was delicious and the ambiance was right on. This restaurant has impeccable service and I cannot say enough about the food, wine and desserts. Expect to pay $150 upward per person if you're ordering all of the above.

ACu0E0nfEkak3UUtJHizMg.text: Celebrated our Valentines Day here at Delmonico last year. My goodness the food here was delicious!! Me and my fiance loveeeed the Caesar salad (prepared table side) and steaks were cooked perfectly as requested. The inside interior was very upscale and nicely appointed. Receptionist was very friendly! Our server somewhat was ok he seem to stiff and needs to smile more lol but overall we had a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BkkHsbRxQiHimbzXDfU7cw.text: Great food & great time with friends. I will definitely visit again. You must try the tower. Great seafood

b-fhB3yQLaBayeaAhGN74g.text: Delicious! Real class act. Fine establishment for many years now. This joint won't disappoint. Nice atmosphere.

NK3XAT6K2fYZDJQuG1BTwg.text: Hands down one of my favorite steakhouses in Las Vegas! You have to try their bacon wrapped dates and beer jerky! I've never had an under or over cooked steak here either. Prices may be high but worth the experience and service.

ZY1C34a9RPY7UJo5mbBIwQ.text: I really enjoyed my Vegas trip here and this spot was one of the reasons.  Its an older looking restaurant and by that I don't mean decor but class.  I should have said its more of a matured restaurant.  The spot is elegant and classy. From the hostess to the waitress, this spot screams fancy.  We had a lovely dinner here during our Vegas trip.   Before dinner we grabbed a few drinks.  They were really solid.  I guess in Vegas I can be a bit more loose.  Located inside the Venetian, it was actually my second time visiting this hotel.  Its an incredible spot. I love everything about it.  We were seated and given a menu.  After about a few minutes were decided to run with the bone in ribeye.  Boy was I in for a treat, tasty treat.  The meat was super juicy.  The juices flowed through with every bite.  Cooked to perfection, this piece of steak is highly recommended in my books.   To be honest, when it arrived I wasn't sure if I was gonna be able to finish it but after several bites, I kept at it, wanting more.    Overall this was actually one of my favorite restaurants.  I caught a glimpse of this spot a few years back and had been wanting to give it a try ever since.  Finally I was able to and it was worth it.  The bone in ribeye is definitely my favorite for about 55 bucks.  The filet was solid too I'm told by my counterpart, but no regrets on my end.  We had a lovely time.  Chances of returning are very high.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-Yu7Dj58noyM1mO4P0E4iA.text: Meh. That's the best word I can think of.  Nothing (except for one of the sides) was actively bad, but for a restaurant with Emeril's name on it and the reputation Delmonico has, I was sorely disappointed.  Least impressive restaurant we tried on this trip to Vegas, and far and away the most expensive.  I don't think I'll be going back  Started out with the BBQ shrimp, as our server recommended.  They were okay.  Certainly nothing to complain about, but nothing spectacular.  I had the bone-in ribeye, another server suggestion. It was, again, okay.  Far from the best steak I've ever had, but very tasty.  The char on the meat was a little bit overdone, in my opinion (I got a clear taste of 'burnt' with a few bites).  For some reason I decided to order fries with my steak (which the waiter was more than a little bit condescending about) and they were terrible. The key lime pie is a solid dessert.  On the whole, this place is resoundingly meh.  Which wouldn't bother me nearly as much if it weren't for the reputation and cost.  I was let down.

bgKXpVT25v8sNQqtVdYWGg.text: Fantastic food.  Great ambiance, service, and whole vibe of the restaurant.  Unbelievably Delmonico was open for lunch and it was quite crowded at noon on a random weekday.  Prices are typical of a business lunch environment with appetizers around $15 and entrees $17-24, for the most part.    First off, the popovers are addictive.  You get 2 to begin and I imagine I could've put back 5 if given the chance.  The lobster bisque and lobster sliders were fresh and completely satisfied my shellfish craving.  The bisque at lunch was $13 ($18 at dinner, so a great deal).  The sliders were $24 and came with 2, lobster-filled sandwiches with Cajun-seasoned fries.  The bisque was creamy and an insanely good compliment for the dipping powers of the popovers.  The sliders were a little bland as far as the totality of the dish, since it was simply tasty bread and lobster, but still fresh and meaty. The bisque comes highly recommended - one of the best soups I've had in Vegas.  The meal came out quickly and we were in and out in less than an hour - perfect for a business meal.  Delmonico is one of the best business lunch locales in Vegas.  Well done Emeril.  Full and satisfied, knowing you put back some great food, is the perfect feeling walking out after a nice lunch.

NYG9z-whhsV99RbDR4KPWQ.text: Just had one of the best dinners ever at Delmonico's.  Filet special. Wedge salad.  Butter cake for dessert.  Service was exceptional.  Thanks to Jason for stopping by twice and visiting with us.  Don't waste time anywhere else in Vegas for a steak.

XP8fju8C8vCx6Pf9bCa-Ug.text: While this restaurant has a nice ambiance and attentive staff you come for the food.  The shrimp appetizer was chewy and the ribeye was a large piece of fat.  While ribeyes are fatty cuts , there should be a potion of meat as well. Brought to the managers attention but unfortunately she didn't seem to care.  Very disappointing for any meal, especially for a meal over $100 per person.

14tBa-RMPWBP93y6KcOyQQ.text: First time here at Delmonico. We came for my b/d birthday as he loves Emeril. Already disappointed by the delay of service. I had to call a server to order bottle of wine and it was explained to us we had to give waitress a number! As we waiting I could observe they tailor more quickly to the larger groups of guests! I hope the food is better than the service. Update: 11/3/18- back in Vegas. Amazing that no one from management ever acknowledged our review shows how much they DONT CARE about guest feedback !!

M62FVaiYvflXcHB0XLNhvg.text: This place totally lives up to its hype. I had the best rib eye of my life here (with the added poivre sauce). The octopus appetizer was also fantastic. It had the perfect crispness on the outside but soft and chewy on the inside. Service and ambiance was great as well, it's not super quiet and intimate like many other steakhouses. I can't wait to come back here again one day to have that mouth watering steak!

NF8r2lbSpKbnB6oWSsce3Q.text: We ordered the New York strip and the bone in ribeye. I personally loved the New York strip. So flavorful and cooked to perfection. The brussel sprouts and mashed potatoes were delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WLCPxr_Buk-hMLX9tvaN8A.text: I came here for lunch, and it was great. The bread that showed up before the meal was light and fluffy. We had the fried chicken and a grilled ricotta cheese and basil sandwich with tomato bisque. This was the best fried chicken ever!! It was extra extra crispy. The ricotta sandwich was also very good, but not as good as the chicken.

pa4MASGD-2EFoR_rGDZILw.text: "WOW!!!" that's what she said... literally! lol, actually that's what we all said after we took our first bite into the appetizer (bbq shrimp). Let me back track a little bit though. I made a reservation for four on open table... we were running a little late so I called and to let them know. They were very friendly and accommodating with our late arrival. As soon as we get there, they said "You must be Jason, party of 4 correct?" Very nice touch for a first impression. We were greeted by our main server, followed by the assistants. Our server made good conversation and awesome recommendations. We never felt bugged, rushed, or belittled (since we all look pretty young). Even with the huge wine list, we were scratching our heads and our server recommended a VERY good syrah that fitted within our budget.  Between the 4 of us, we ordered the bbq shrimp, filet mignons, lobster tail, and I ordered the rib eye. Seriously, every bite was WOW! Cooked to exactly the way you ask!!! You have to try it for yourself and you'll understand the WOW factor this restaurant has!  While making my reservations, I noted that it was a special dinner for me and my wife, along with my friend and his wife (our anniversaries of dating). lol...anyways, when we were about to ask for our check, the staff came out with two bowls of fresh strawberry sherbert/sorbet with a candle in it, followed by the words "Happy Anniversary to you both and Thank You for coming to Delmonicos"! I wanted to stand and applaud! hahahah Our server then went on to take our digital camera's and take a couple pics of us.  If you're looking for a restaurant with that WOW factor (and you love meat), I highly recommend visiting Delmonico's.

dCGICz131j5eZqQAcgoCjA.text: I chose this place for my birthday and it ended up to be the perfect choice.  Service and ambiance were marvelous and I was really happy!   This is what we ordered:  Jumbo Lump Crab Cake: all crab meat with hardly any filler. AMAZING   Lobster Bisque: Not a bisque person but it was so delicious here. yummy!!!   White cheddar & bacon grits: creamy and cheesy, oh so good!   Wild sauteed mushrooms: Perfectly cooked and well seasoned. Pair with steak very well.  Bone in rib eye: Nice big piece of steak with a bit of fat, which is the way I like my steak.   Chateaubriand: 2 big pieces of fillet Mignon that also comes with a side of steamed asparagus and mashed potatoes finished at table side for two people. Fillet was SO tender and juicy, probably one of the best I've had! Not an asparagus person so it was bleh. Mashed potatoes were ok.   I would love to go back again with my boyfriend and have a romantic dinner.

1YRqH6CnV53z-hCS_MEPXw.text: Truffle chips were so delicious.  Caesar isn't really worth it.  Steak was ok, needed more flavor in my opinion.  So happy to see foie gras on their menu but it was just ok - I've had better.  The scalloped potatoes were under cooked so we had to send it back - boo boo.  Everything else was ok.  Great service.

4hbuxx1fWtJRCVNPKn6LKA.text: Great service, great decor and ambiance, but food was weak.  Wedge salad had undercooked, fatty bacon on top. Roast duck was over-done, not juicy, but skin was rubbery.  Lots of folks do it better than Delmonico, keep looking.

RCdloIkpmW8uj6LMos0_AQ.text: I didn't come here for the steak...but the fish was just as good! Plus, this was one of the few restaurants that was still seating at like 10pm on a Monday night.   A must try is the lobster potato gnocchi appetizer. It is heavenly! I want to order like 5 of these and make it into my entree! The gnocchi is prepared in my favorite way- toasted and a bit crispy on the outside. Yum! And of course, there was a hefty serving of lobster knuckle meat!  For my main dish, I had the sturgeon with crab lumps in a lemon butter sauce. Again, I was impressed! Lots of crab meat and everything was full of flavor. I also tried some of the bone-in ribeye, which was huuuuge. If you're super hungry, order a steak from here and you won't be disappointed. For dessert, I had the chocolate bread pudding, which was good...but a bit too rich and chocolate-y. I would've preferred a traditional bread pudding.  I should take off one star for the strand of hair I found baked into my bread...but the rest of my meal made up for it, so it didn't bother me too much!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chocolate bread pudding
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bone-in ribeye
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sturgeon

OaRMJKI6S7LAoa8xoEaqPg.text: I feel like Twitter is pretty useless so far; I have an ok amount of followers I guess, but I feel like they're all following so many people that anything I say gets lost in the mess of their feed. I could tweet all day and get very little response to anything aside from a couple loyal folks on there. And it was one such reader that led me to Delmonico recently for what he claimed to be an excellent burger. He's a food writer in town so he should know what he's talking about, right?  Delmonico is located in the small restaurant row of the Venetian right by another great burger spot, although most people would not come here for their burger. The interior is nothing too fancy in either the bar area or more traditional area in the back. I did notice while sitting at the bar that they have an amazing bourbon selection, but since I was there during a lunch break I'll have to go back some time when I'm not on the clock. The lunch and dinner menus are a bit different, with the lunch menu featuring more sandwiches and things, so maybe the comment I just made about people not coming for a burger is wrong. Either way, this restaurant is pretty fancy and features quite a number of great sounding items aside from what I came there for.  The Delmonico Prime Hamburger comes on a toasted brioche roll with fries, cheddar cheese and bacon. The meat had excellent flavor from the first bite, but I noticed right away that it was way overcooked and dry. It started off extremely juicy but that faded way too fast and by the end it was very dry. The cheese was melted and had great flavor, but the bun was a tiny bit dry as well and a little too thick. The heirloom tomatoes were fantastic, but maybe a bit off-putting at first due to their green color. The bacon also had good flavor, but was a tiny bit undercooked and soggy in parts. Overall it was still decent, but could have been well beyond that if the meat had been cooked properly.  Luckily the fries were great. Some of them were almost a bit too hard and crunchy, but they were very tasty and a welcome change to the 'typical' fries I often get around town. Something I found to be quite funny was when I asked for ketchup I was brought an insanely large bowl of it, more than probably a table full of people could have used.  The online menu lists the burger at $15, so I was a little surprised to see the $18 listed on the menu when I made my order. I think if it was cooked properly I would still be ok with this price given the chef, the location, etc, but because of this price I seriously frown on the fact that they couldn't cook my burger properly. If you're willing to risk this inconsistency and are ok with the cost, I think it's a good burger to check out, and has the potential to be really great, but if you're at the Venetian and are craving a guaranteed good burger for a similar cost I suggest you go next door.

ibwAR9YaiGK2KGQlumKy4A.text: I think this is the first time I went to a higher end restaurant in Las Vegas and walked out thinking...it's worth the price.    Our server was pretty awesome in my mind. Took great care of us and explain the specials thoroughly.  Also helped gave us the idea that the last person at the table should take care of the tab. =)  Their whole menu sounds tasty....good selection of meats and a lot of sides/appetizers to accommodate your needs.  I ordered the Truffle Oil & Parmesan Potato Chips for my appetizer. OMG....it tasted so good.  Best chips I've ever had!!!  It's crunchy...tasty...and best of all...it's cheesy!  For my entree....I stucked with their Bone-in Rib Eye with a side of corn. I always like my steak medium rare and they cooked it to perfection.  Steak was super tender and juicy.  Dash some horse-radish on the side and I'm happy.  My buddy Eugene ordered their "Tomahawk" which is basically a 32 oz. Ribeye with a big ass rib to boot.  He topped it off....of course....with some foie gras.    Most of the table ordered their own rib eye steak....and ordered a lot of different sides to mix it up.  I'll say my favorite was the Wild Mushrooms and the Grits.  Overall, pretty good...will definitely come back to give this place a second spin.
