6ZeLaj4cuxJ6mp6RAd1Xcw.text: I'll start with this: I'm not a fan of Emeril Lagasse.  Why? I don't know. I've never really been a fan. When Food Network showed actual shows instead of Guy Fieri and his 90's hair, Emeril, Bobby Flay, Tyler Florence, and Giada ruled the network. Oh, and Michael Chiarello, but I've been to his restaurant and that was phenomenal. That aside, BAM! was the most popular saying in the food world, people flipped their shit over it, and now Emeril has his face on every cheaply made saucepan and spice around grocery stores for twice the markup. I always thought he was off-putting.  That being said, this is a seafood/steakhouse, and it's upscale. I've been to CUT, so I know that Wolfgang Puck is better than his canned soups. There's a chance Emeril would live up to the (very pricey) hype.  The drinks were good - a cab and a pinot noir were actually quite nice, and the cocktails looked amazing. Maybe your bar staff can teach your kitchen staff a little something about pride in their product.  First up: the vine-ripened heirloom tomato salad with burrata. Am I supposed to eat through the thick, rock hard center of this tomato? Are you serious? I paid $20+ for a salad that consisted of five slices of heirloom tomato and a dollop of burrata on top, and you're going to give me several slices that were pure unripened tomato? Fuckin hell. I was disappointed. Okay? So disappointed. Come on, how fucking hard is it to serve a RIPE tomato?  For the entree we ordered the wagyu ribeye and the ahi tuna. The tuna was fine - it was tuna. I'd opt for two pieces, as pepper crusted seared ahi for me can get overwhelming after a while (nigiri is a totally different situation). The battered mushrooms were a nice touch, as well as the sauce.  But the wagyu. Okay, look. You're paying $90 for a fucking steak. For a steak that ISN'T KOBE - please, for the love of god, don't confuse the two. And it's not big, it's small. Is it wonderfully marbled with fat? Yes! To me, it was great! I thought it was wonderful! But this is why my review just went down a star while writing this:  When you pay $90 for a goddamn steak, you'd better bring it out hot. Like, searing hot. Like on a 400F plate like Mastros, hot. RIGHT off the goddamn pan hot. When it comes out just barely hot anymore, and then slips right into lukewarm, what the fuck? What kind of $90 experience is that? The cow has given it's life, with the production of so many people trying to make it wonderful, and you RUIN the experience. Plus it was a little too salty.  You're probably thinking, "Jesus Jaime, you're a bit of a prick, and a snob. I can see your brain from how high you're holding your nose from here."  Yeah, alright. I'll give you that. But you know what? I'm not going to pay fucking $90 for a goddamn steak if it isn't treated PERFECTLY. I can get a $25 steak that's handled better than that, I don't give a fuck if it hasn't been drinking beer all its life.  Then, to top off the evening of great disappointments, I ordered dessert. How HARD is it to fuck this up? When you have a great meal, you want to finish it with a bang, right? So you have the one thing on the menu people like (apparently the banana cream pie), and then fuck it to the rest of the dessert menu, right? For fucks sake people, GREAT dessert isn't that hard! It's SO EASY. Even worse, it's the biggest profit maker! If you call that Chocolate Truffle Cake a CAKE when it's drier than the Sahara desert, and that Strawberry Shortcake as such when there was barely any actual shortcake, AND the strawberries were mostly unripened with green parts on them, with a dollop of whipped cream on the side of the plate...then you should send your Pastry Chef back to school because clearly they need a kick in the ass.  This is an expensive meal where they prey off the idea that the people who come don't have any appreciation for the things they serve, so their level of care goes right out the 37th floor window of any hotel on the Strip.

0yRmLiXyEwftEnPbVip-fg.text: This is my go to spot when I have a steak craving and money to burn. My last birthday was spent here and it was worth. My son and I went, he's 11, and there wasn't any down grade to the service despite it being only 2 of us. I have had this happen in other high end places where they see a kid and think small check. This was some of the best carpaccio around, the drinks were awesome and the steaks cooked perfect;y.

IKqscSMGEw1v4omzytfKeA.text: I went here for my friend's bachelor party's dinner.  I am not a steak person but after reading all the reviews here about the bone in rib eye and then hearing the waiter's description I was in for one.  I ordered it Medium Well.  When it came to the table I was expecting it to be tough, chewy, small, etc... When it arrived at the table it was a pretty big slab of meat and  when I cut into it and had my first slice it was totally opposite of what I was expecting.  It was soft, flavorful, and melted in your mouth.  I should have expected that instead since it was priced $52.  Best damn cooked to order piece of steak I have ever had to this day =)

jAW9qCn81SdgIy4NKJ9rSw.text: How could anyone give this place less than 5 stars.  The food is great.  Everything went perfectly.  I wish I could eat here everyday...  I usually split the Chateaubriand with a friend.  I would recommend Delmonico to everyone that wants an amazing experience with great food.  Regards,  Adam

uhYcMATHqXyFtu0dV7ycyg.text: Initial visit:  Love the bone-in-rib eye.  Tasty and huge.  I could only finish half.  Probably one the best tasting steaks I've had.  I've been to a lot of high end steakhouses and this is one of the few places that really stood out and make me want to return.  Second visit:  Second time was a disappointment.  Steak was too buttery and oily.  Was not as memorable as the first time to make me want to come back again with so many other options in Vegas.  The ambiance is nice.  Service impeccable.

5mU1S9Z6iyGMZbgo4acH5g.text: The service here is great and so is their steak!  I had the ribeye steak here and it was SOOO good!  There was so much flavor in it and i havent tasted a steak like this in a lonnng time.  It was really cooked to perfection the way it was cooked.... words cannot even describe.  I wished I could have steaks like this more often.   The waiters were also so nice.  We had a show to catch and they made sure we got outta there on time.

O4L5VEBmdCKJgarMWmquOA.text: Delmonico's is a very good steak house. We had an excellent meal and the bone-in ribeye was huge and pretty flavorful. The filet was tender and delicious. The sides were very good (really loved the mushrooms) and leave room for the banana cream pie.   Great service, staff willing to help you with their extensive wine list and the bar served great drinks.   I did think it was pricey though - there are many other excellent steak houses in Vegas so it' really doesn't stand out. Not to damn them with faint praise of course.

mAzobkZpvkMZx9ZHhpoHPg.text: Wow, I can't believe this place getting 4 stars. BAM to POOF to me. First off the bread ... if you do not know now to make a simple bread ... how hard it is ... even my homemade bread taste better than that hard piece of rock they served.  Maybe it was just a bad day for me. But it cannot be that bad right. nooo ... but sorry to say ... it is a yes for me. Waiter ... service ... zero! rude and didn't ask if we are done and took everything away ... but the food was bad anyways take it away as fast as you can. Jumbo shrimp and petite fiilet mignon ... non fresh shrimp made for bad combo plus ... I ordered medium rare and it came out well done. hmm ... either the waiter doesn't know how to write his order or the head chef or whoever is cooking is just as bad as emeril lagasse himself.  Then to coffee ... argh ... disgusting ... and we were like complaining and the waiter came by and asked ... we can brew a fresh one for you??? ... i was like WTF ... this was not a fresh brew to began with ... argh disgusting and chills all over my body ... so time to get out pronto!!!  The only good thing that came out of this is the wine we ordered ... they have an extensive selection and kudos for that ...   But I am never going back ... $55 for the entree ... I rather go to McD and I know what I am getting for $5.50.  Thank you Dad who said that my cooking with a costco steak is better than whatever they whipped up at demonic ... haa haa.

A6iQKnF0Bqu0ThzsZG-X4A.text: Came here with friends for our high end streak meal during a recent week in Vegas. It did not disappoint. For drinks, I ordered a High West rye Manhattan and it arrived perfectly mixed; maybe the smoothest Manhattan I've ever imbibed. Ceaser salad very good, but no anchovies. Two of us split chateaubriand and it was perfect, although presentation was somewhat boring. The potatos and asparagus were good but not spectacular. Another friend got the fillet and it was so tender she started cutting it with get butter knife and didn't even notice! The wine list is overwhelming. 93 pages. It's better to know what you want and see  if it's there than to try and choose. The decor is somewhat vanilla, but nice.  Also, the place is huge - much larger inside than what you see when you walk in off Restaurant Row in The Palazzo.  The crowd made for pretty fun people watching; there seemd to be a lot of middle aged men with their much younger "dates."  Maybe it was "take your niece to dinner" night.  But overall, a very nice, entertaining  evening out, but spendy.

YR6ZsRSGaLiokAS6Xbn3FQ.text: Maybe it's the media hyped downturned economy or maybe D's was having a bad Friday night but......this isn't the same Delmonico's I've experienced for many years prior (pre-yelp and post-yelp).    12 people again dined as we do every year at Delmonico's around the same time of the year and everyone I think felt it was not entirely the same restaurant.     Service: Great service as always but noticeably reduced in staff size, not as sharp (forgot my Voss that I ordered with my meal - $20 water you better remember it)  Ambiance: Not a lot of people in the restaurant for a prime hour on a Friday night.  Everyone seemed a little sullen.   Wine: Malbec recommended by Sommelier... not good, expensive, tasting notes didn't match the True flavor... the server had to notice nobody drinking it.  Food:  Truffled Chips:  They were good, truffle oil evident and tastey Amuse Bouche:  Flank Steak + peanut oil, a little overcooked, free Wedge:  Watery blue cheese dressing, salty... had better Lobster Bisque Soup:  Fishy, thick, sub-par  Bone In Ribeye:  Didn't taste anything like the previous years, possible downgraded steaks?  No earthy taste to the palate, thinner chop than normal.  Foie Gras served over steak made the steak better and could of eaten the FG by itself.   Filet:  good, again tasted downgraded, maybe Choice + Oscar side:  good and very tastey Lobster:  not recommended by waiter but it was good, actually the better of the entrees....strange right? Desserts (we eat a lot of this)  Birthday cake.... the fudge frosting was good but the cake sucked Blueberry Cobbler:  awesome!!  this is always good Banana Cream Pie:  ehh....only half eaten Key Lime Tart:  overly sugary and made my teeth hurt, it had a strange sugar taste...didn't remind me of key lime anything... sent back.  Last 4-5 years I gave 5 stars and would of given 6 if possible... this year was a 3, nothing memorable but an expensive bill.  I hope this economy turns around or what ever it is and I can enjoy my Delmonicos next year at what I've known it to be.

Pja6PwX2uR5dIaWffBqOkg.text: Awesome steak and great service. Sometimes in Vegas you get the snobby attitude and mediocre food. Here I got an unreal steak and great service. It is pricey, but it's Vegas! Everything is pricey!!

DS-IF1_66--__j64T1HVFg.text: Simply put; The finest Steakhouse in the country.  The food is always mind-blowing and the service is exceptional.  Bring your wallet cause you pay for the BEST.

PxKF-IOj2kloklLpBfkKhA.text: Ate at kitchen table for 40th birthday. Great experience. The sous chef was a little nervous but the sommelier was great. Definitely get the wine pairing. Filet mignon with mushrooms and foie gras was a great combination of flavors. Desserts are amazing. Thanks Delmonico!

Z9oBn1SfRQTGyG5I1yd9Ww.text: tl;dr - You can do much much better.    I was actually kind of shocked by this place.  I had heard good things, but was disappointed at virtually every turn:  Appearance - the place is falling apart.  tiles falling out of walls, holes in walls, dirty bathrooms, uncomfortable and awkward seating.  Service - mediocre.  Had to ask repeatedly for items, waiter disappeared for 20+ minutes at a time.    Food - decent; worthy of a 3 star, but the rest drags the rating down.  My filet was cooked to order and seasoned well.  When I ask for anchovies for my caesar salad though, I don't mean 'the anchovy paste you use in the dressing is adequate.'  It means I would like actual anchovies.  This isn't rocket surgery, delmonico.  All in all, anywhere else this would have rated a 3 star experience, but given both the price (in general, and relative to other steakhouses in vegas), and the sheer overabundance of steakhouses per capita in LV, there's no way this should rate highly on anyone's list.   Bad form, Delmonico.

Jw6-OaFIsSb7dh0vJ-o0vg.text: Had a steak and mushrooms, both were very good. Escargot was OK, but I have had much better. I would go here again.

4dr-N7avMSrWefd918i5nw.text: Everything on the menu is made with a little bit of heaven, a pinch of happiness, and two cups of love. Must try the lobster bisque !!! It's so amazing I considered asking the chef to have my children.

YA-J8BljyLmexb2seusENA.text: Second time I have been here. The strip steak here goes down as the best steak overall I have ever had. God the creamed corn is heavenly as well. This place is not afraid of butter, yay! Will be back

uMFWIgueNxJu-aj8pXfnuA.text: the best meal ive ever had hands down. cooked perfectly high quality you get what you pay for and wont be disappointed

mCZRSFrNPif1UO0RPcStEw.text: Great meal, would be excellent but I had to send my steak back for a little more cooking (I said medium to well and it was more on the medium side - I am a bit picky with that).  The service was perfect, however. Didn't have to wait long for anything, and I really like that the whole table is served at the same time, it's a nice subtle touch. Very attentive and friendly service.  I enjoyed the experience and was not disappointed even going in with a high expectation.

KlKi94paRHv0hulSbH9nRg.text: The BEST steakhouse ever. The perfect amount of seasoning/flavor and a nice huge cut of perfectly cooked bone-in ribeye earns this establishment a 5 from me. every time I eat at a different steakhouse I always compare it to Delmonico's. Some other steakhouses in LV might hold a higher rating from "professional reviewers", but seriously, they don't hold a candle to this joint.

jcQL_4-gGh7QgJNvxxuokA.text: The excellent: 1) Waiter Frank was very helpful and personable and was dead-on with food recommendations! 2) the barbeque shrimp was the highlight of the meal; its sauce was so flavorful and a definite must-get item! 3) very nice touch of congratulatory dish written in chocolate and complementary dessert! The bad: we received NY strips instead of rib-eyes and steak not impressive at all; did not taste like it was a prime cut - too lean and very little flavor, although foie gras was cooked perfectly. Restaurant touts of 7 week aged beef but couldn't tell - have had more flavorful steaks from Costco. Won't go here again because of the unimpressive steak quality, even though service, ambiance, and appetizer was excellent.

hS2VB_wu9kJO3HCrv5erng.text: Steakhouses are a dime a dozen in Las Vegas- every resort has one, and with a few exceptions, they're generally pretty good.   My experience at Delmonico was one of those exceptions.  Three of us celebrating St Patrick's Day, March Madness, and 40th birthdays all rolled into one weekend, decided to enjoy a dinner at Delmonico's.    From the moment we checked in, fantastic service.  Our server, Michael, was gracious, professional, funny, and more than willing to tolerate and participate in our banter, but never in an obtrusive way.  The food was outstanding- the ribeye was perfectly cooked, and the creamed corn gratin was downright amazing.   Great wine selection, excellent service (have I mentioned the service), and a great pecan pie with some glasses of port.  This was a great dinner, and an experience I will appreciate for a long time, and worth every penny of the $200 per head that we paid.

cTXbvM1CjxqS0c9HHaiEVA.text: When I was looking for a place for dinner for my birthday celebration weekend, this place wasn't really high on my list. When it comes to purses, shoes and sometimes clothes, I'll put down a pretty penny or hundred for nice stuff. But when it comes to food, I think to myself, "Is it really worth the cost to put something in only to have it come out?"   In this case, "Yes!" Okay... Sort of...   I ordered the boneless Ribeye and a side of broccoli. Ribeye was good - just enough flavor and not too salty. Being the carnivore that I am, I was shocked that I really enjoyed the broccoli too. It was as perfect as steamed vegetables could get. It was bright green from top to bottom and crispy, not mushy.   My sister had pasta with shrimp. I must say, though there was shrimp on her plate, they were not "shrimp" at all! They were huge!! Seriously, Delmonico must get their produce, seafood and meat from "Food Heaven R Us" or something.   Although the food was good, I would say the service is what gives Delmonico 4-stars. Again, I'm not a frequent fine diner. So, to have my water glass filled up every time it gets low to having another (delicious) roll magically appear on my plate just as I suck in the last mouthful is fantastic! I'd even go so far as to say they'd probably spray the air around me with something fragrant once the broccoli hit you know where.   Now I can see why it's worth it to pay at least $50 for dinner. Thanks Emeril!

VyFafjFXHW6M0oWDcHbc1g.text: Our experience at Delmonico's was good but just a tad bit disappointing so I can't give them 5 stars.    It's not that service was bad, in fact, it was better than most other restaurants but it was not up to the standards that I've come to expect from Emeril's server teams.  The food was wonderful, as always, and we'll definitely be back for another visit.     The banana cream pie alone is worth a visit - it's ruined us for eating it anywhere else, ever!

E12bnNfr8idDbgPo3DCdrw.text: Delicious- from the cocktails to the steaks! Apps: We tried the oysters and bbq shrimp (holy yum!). Entrees: Our party of 6 had all steaks (filet, ribeye and bone-in ribeye) which were all cooked to perfection. One ribeye was very fatty but that's to be expected with that cut and the portion size of the steaks is so that there was plenty to be found that was free of fat- seriously, these steaks are HUGE, definitely share-worthy. Sides: Creamed Corn (VERY yum!), Sauteed Mushrooms (yum), Mashed potatoes (how can you go wrong) and a Twice Baked Potato (a little over done on the bottom but still good regardless). We enjoyed the service and the experience overall. Would highly recommend!

O0vBGYAdIfVZxKMGtzfQJw.text: Good for the management to reach out and connect with me.  I hope they are sincere in making an effort to make this establishment a better experience for everyone.

lhXqFfnvnTdPxeTayyqiGg.text: I have been a big fan of emeril so I was excited to go... But I really wouldn't go back unless it was free. The best thing there was the service. The team that waits on your table is awesome. But for the food... The foie gras was good... The Caesar salad was okay, too much dressing but good flavor, the creamed corn tasted good but had too much breeding, the grits are not  grits... More like risotto. My husbands ribeye was only okay and for the price it should have been better. The macnut bread pudding and the banana cram pie... Stay away they are NOT good. And I think the most disappointing thing was the gumbo... It tasted like crap. I have been to the south and expected better gumbo from him.

yx6q6A3Xrrc7QOT3irg1Sw.text: Just went last night. Still THE BEST steak any of our party had ever enjoyed...and it's consistently at that level. excellent service; just a GREAT way to enjoy a vegas evening before hitting the clubs, tables or whatever else is on the agenda.

UxFpgng8dPMWOj99653k5Q.text: Truly Fantastic!  Best Steak ever. Service was awesome and timely. They knew right when you needed something. The root beer float for dessert was great.

fkKOOm_Mv9W5GOfvuGSlIg.text: Been wanting to come here , and outta all the times i been to vegas, finally i get here.  Escargot was DELICIOUS ceasar salad was also good Stuffed crabs were small but very good  Halibut was not oily andbuttery but tasty Ribeye with foie gras on top was to die for Filet was very tasty! loved it  Sides: the mushrooms were amazing! garlic and butter   DESSERTTT ... banana cream pie , i almost licked the plate  Also a bottle of syrah  Total 2 couples.. 600+ after 20% grad.  Great ambiance and service was impeccable  Def coming back

mtSrdmqTm1aLguFNjpN6kg.text: while in vegas attending my employer conference -  myself, my business partner and our clients ate here for dinner.   - ambiance is "right on" - service is "awesome" - food is "Oh My Gosh" (alaskan halibut w/ mash potato)  need i say more?

zvf1ZY3biqkAWJGSL0lYIg.text: One of the better steaks I've had. Crispy on the outside and soft and juicy on the inside. Very pricey.

0oCD8Z7gzCFngBceN4_9VQ.text: Overall, I thought Delmonico was unimpressive given its rep and price point. I would suggest SW Steakhouse or Gordon Ramsay instead.   Here's the salient-  Service The Staff was friendly enough but nothing special. There was a LOUD diner (really loud as I'm from NYC and used to noisy restaurants) and, despite my request, my server did not ask the guy to take it down a notch.   Food - The popovers, to start, were good but I was disappointed that no other bread was offered, which is usually the case with steakhouses. - The word that comes to mind when describing the quality of the filet is mediocre. It looked like it had been pulverized with a meat mallet. Pretty bland and not juicy at all. - My friend did enjoy his pork chop and it looked much better than my steak.  - The twice baked potato was a big disappointment given that the bottom of it felt rock hard and the whipped potato on top was bland. - The fried apple pies were adequate. My friend really liked the pecan pie.

RzGWoJReZ9Y6maHDmPvIoA.text: 4.5 out of 5 Stars.  Being an Emeril Lagasse restaurant, you had to expect the best.    One of my previous reviews of an expensive steakhouse stated that I could not imagine paying outrageous prices for a steak considering there are only so many ways that you can prepare it.  With that being said I still believe that is True, however I did not pay for my dinner this night since it was for Business :).    Delmonico's is located in The Venetian Resort and Casino right across from the Mirage.  I have always thought the Venetian was one of the more classy places to go in Vegas and Delmonico's was no different.  We called ahead to put our names in for an 8:00pm reso but we got there early at 7.  Some of us were dressed in shorts and flip flops, but since it was Vegas I think thats why we got away with it.  After checking in they said they could seat us early and to take a seat at the bar to relax.  After ordering a few drinks, we were seated promptly by a very friendly hostess.  (On a side note, they have an extensive Scotch list which includes some very rare 100 yr old Scotch's for $150-200 a pop).  We sat down towards the kitchen and was greeted by a stunning blonde waitress...I believe her name was Dale, but I could be mistaken.    We took a look at the menu and this place is not cheap.  You are looking at around 50 bucks for a steak.  Most of us ordered the Ribeye which is my favorite cut of meat and you can either get it bone-in or not bone-in...22oz or 16oz respectively. We started off with BBQ shrimp which is what they are known for and Ahi Tuna and Salmon Tartare.  Both of these were fantastic.  Our steaks came out quickly and they were cooked perfectly.  The sides here are a la carte and each could easily feed at least 4 people.  We got the garlic mashed potatoes and it too was quite delicious.  All in all this place was amazing....They have a team of people, 3 to a table, to make sure your water is always filled, bread is on your plate, and that you have everything you would need.    I was mesmerized by our waitress and was inspired to tell her that she was stunningly beautiful.  She was an excellent waitress too haha.    If you are looking for a good restaurant in Vegas I would definitely give this one a try.  Be prepared to spend some money, but it was well worth it.

gbN8eRzhwqekomiI-bj0Eg.text: The wife wanted to go to a celebrity chef restaurant so I decided on this place from a past good experience. We had a real good time.    I had the Pisco Sour as my cocktail, the petite lettuce wedges, filet and mash potatoes. All where freak'n delicious!   My wife still talks about the filet at this place.You cannot go wrong with this place unless you are vegetarian.  Another great place at the Venetian is Bouchon.

NBqsaGxofbz6VxVUT7o2Aw.text: Good food.  Horrible service.  Had dinner in early March with a friend and the service was horrendous.  No one took are drink order for over 15 minutes even though the restaurant was only half full on a Thursday night - many people who were seated after us were already having their second drink and getting their appetizers.  Eventually after trying to get the waiters attention as he repeatedly walked by I ended up just having to get up and walk across the restaurant to have some one take our order which led to a waiter taking our drink and food order in a couple minutes....  But even then the service was lackluster and not a bit apologetic about the wait.  If you are spending $300 for dinner for two you expect decent service.  This place was a big fail.

J9PxPvvXUPYaDWlHOvk2Sw.text: Celebrated hubby's birthday here.  The whole experience was top notch from the service, the food, and the attention to detail.  The moment we walked into the restaurant, the host greeted us by saying "Happy Birthday" to my hubby, which started the night great for us.  For once, I didn't get a side eye or a raised eyebrow when I asked my steak to be well-done; there was no snobby attitude from our server, and all the food we ordered was cooked to perfection.  Hubby ordered the bone-in ribeye (medium), I ordered regular ribeye, and we shared twice baked potato.  Their portions were so generous that we had no room for dessert.  Specialty cocktails didn't live up to my expectation and was a bit of a let down, but deceptively strong so worth the money.  Over all, really great first time experience here.  Oh, and a shoutout to our server Dale, who was nice, witty, and took care of us.

soO-Wo27njLoJdY_Duuy_Q.text: I decided to take my wife to Las Vegas for our first anniversary.  She'd never been to Las Vegas, but had always wanted to go.  She asked me if we could get dressed up and go somewhere nice one of the nights we were there.  So after doing a little bit of research I stumbled upon Delmonico.  With a name like Emeril Lagasse associated with the place it had to be good right? I went to the website and looked over their menu.  The prices can be very intimidating to someone not used to a fine dining experience.  I really appreciated that the prices were on the menu on the website, because I would not have planned ahead otherwise, and might have choked when I saw them.  However, we only have one first anniversary so I decided we should go for it.    I called and made a reservation about 5 days in advance, the person on the phone was extremely courteous and helpful.  She asked me if we were celebrating a special occasion.  After I explained it was our first anniversary, she said that she would note it on the reservation.    We arrived at Delmonico at about 7:55pm, we had reservations for 8pm.  We were greeted at the front desk by a young woman.  She immediately said "Happy Anniversary" and asked us to have a seat in the lounge.  At about 8:05pm our name was called and we were led back to our table.  A table for four quickly became a table for two.  All the extra silverware, plates, and glasses were whisked away.  The serving staff was beyond courteous, even offering us black napkins due to our clothes being black.    Drink orders were taken and suddenly a plate was placed in front of us. "Courtesy of the chef, for your anniversary." said the server.  It was a crostini, with slightly cooked piece of beef, some blue cheese dressing, and chives topped with olive oil.  I hate blue cheese but I ate it anyway, and it was quite good.    The server asked my wife about wine, and my wife said she liked it but was not very familiar with the types of wine.  The server asked my wife a few questions and came back with a glass of wine my wife loved, and a sample of another kind of wine she might like to have in the future, my wife loved the sample as well.    When it came time to order, my wife order the heirloom tomato appetizer that they have.  It basically sliced heirloom tomatoes with cheese and red onions, drizzled with oil and balsamic.  She loved it.  She also got the Filet Mignon, and buttered asparagus.  Her steak was amazing, I tried a bite of it.  It was cooked perfectly.  It had a little spice to it from the seasoning, all around it was the best Filet Mignon I've ever experienced.  The asparagus was cooked perfectly.    I ordered the Delmonico signature cut, a bone in Ribeye.  Ribeye is my favorite cut of steak by far.  I've been eating primarily Ribeye for so long it's hard to believe that I was ever happy with other cuts.  I also ordered their take on creamed corn.  The Ribeye was worth the whole trip, it was the by far the best Ribeye I have ever encountered and probably ever will.  It was cooked perfectly.  It had the proper amount of fat that should be expected with a Ribeye.  It was amazing.  The corn was really good also.  Our server then brought us another complimentary dish from the kitchen, cherry sorbet.  Written in chocolate around the outside of the bowl was "Happy Anniversary".  It was pretty good, I'm not a big sorbet person, however please remember, it was free.    Even with the complimentary dessert my wife and I couldn't pass up a chance to try one of the menu dessert items.  We chose butterscotch Creme Brulee.  It came with 3 butterscotch/chocolate chip cookies on the side.  It was amazing, and probably our new standard for Creme Brulee.  All in all our experience was awesome.  The food was outstanding and the service was great.  My glass never got empty.  Every time I finished a dinner roll another roll was promptly placed on the plate in it's place.  After the 2nd or 3rd roll, I looked over towards my wife, grinning.  The server saw this and quietly said with a smile on her face, "You know that is going to keep happening." I told my wife that when I was over the rolls, I probably needed to leave a bite on the plate to avoid a new roll. It was funny.    I would recommend Delmonico to anyone who is in Vegas and looking for a great place to go.  I would encourage anyone who does go to go with the expectation or a fantastic meal.  I think if you go in with the idea of being critical, you will probably find something to complain about, as the couple at the next table did.  They had multiple issues, and sent a few things back to the kitchen.  Remember that food preparation is an art not a science, and enjoy.

APnMYCYCi1zMOk5S_dXXqw.text: Our bad experience started with the lady who answered when I called to set a resv. She sounded like she wasn't very happy and didn't make me feel good about planning to go to Delmonicos.   We get there and the hostess simply said "follow me" she did not make eye contact or even ask "how's your evening?" She walked so fast to our table it was hard to keep up.  She sat us, gave us a napkin, said nothing at all, and walked away.  (Also they only have white napkins.. I'm used to fine dining where your napkin, either white or black, be offered to go with your ensemble.) Next, our server(s), didn't seem to care that we were dining there.  Not sure if they judged based on skin color, age, and style of clothes, but it felt like they did.  After offering us drinks and giving us menus, it was about an 8 to 10 minute wait to see our server again.. Mind you that we'd chosen what we'd have for dinner and had our menus closed a majority of that time. Overall for service from beginning til end was way below par for such a place.  We did not feel welcomed nor that they gave 2 funks about us. FOOD: My bone in rib eye was ordered medium and came out medium well, which made it particularly dry and tough.  My spouses bone in rib eye was cooked correctly (medium), but was nothing to call home about. I ordered my steak Oscar style.  The asparagus was the highlight of our dinner and the crab seemed a but overlooked and dry. We also had a lobster tail each, which came de-shelled and on top of the rib eye.  Drawn butter was brought out but lemon was not, nor offered. We had the New Orleans style creamed spinach.. The only "new Orleans" about it was the name.  The spinach tasted fresh but it was about a 3.5/5 on overall taste and quality. For the price there are many better options in Las Vegas (Mastro's ocean club; the capital grille, del frisco's..).   We will surely never return.

eCJObv4SZupXH5TKWaUhSg.text: Very busy and noisy restaurant. Asparagas was cooked perfectly, however quite flavorless. The mashed potatoes were tasty.   For the price, the spinach should have been fresh and the cream sauce needs improvement.  My organic filet was good and nicely cooked to medium rare, however not near as tasty as other organic beef I have had for half the price. The New Orleans gumbo was a tad too salty.  The yorkshire style buns were average and were cold.   The key lime pie was average.  The tartness was lacking.  The apple pie was a disappointment, with a doughy flavoured crust. Another thing that  high end restaurants need to learn is how to choose great coffees like good wines.  I asked where the beans were from and they had no idea.  I would expect excellence in all areas of my food consumption and yes, even with my coffee. The espresso was extremely poor. This is a restaurant that is way overpriced for average to good tasting food.  Nothing was outstanding or excellent. So I can only give it a rating of 2 combining value and flavour.

Lf-3Gi1sIMd1MwcPFYeuYQ.text: My wife & I dined here while we were in Vegas for a conference. With so many places to choose from we decided on Delmonico because it was in our hotel & we figured we couldn't go wrong at one of Emeril's restaurants. The dining area was very spacious & well decorated. The staff was very friendly and attentive to all our needs. I started with the wedge salad which was excellent. The bacon had a great smokey flavor & was crispy. The blue cheese was some of the best I ever had. My wife had the lobster bisque which was excellent as well. We the decided to try the Chateaubriand dinner for 2 which came with garlic mashed potatoes & asparagus. The meal is brought out and the meat is served table side. We ordered it medium rare & it was perfect for me. It had excellent flavor and was extremely tender. My wife would have preferred it to be a little more cooked in the center but she ate the outer pieces which for a little more well down but still tender & tasty. The potatoes & asparagus were both  perfectly cooked with great flavor. We passed on dessert because we were too full to eat anything else. I would highly recommend this restaurant & would eat there again when in Vegas!

p7jL5hPfoIPtPW2S6ptInQ.text: Fantastic food, great wine and amazing service, what more can you ask for. Frank, our server, was top notch, knowledgeable and friendly. Steaks were exceptional and don't miss the BBQ shrimp appetizer.

I4Ch7Do2NjjChoWlNRqGJw.text: Great meal!  Went for lunch and had the truffle potato chips, Caesar salad, lobster sliders, filet medallions and prime burger.  Topped it off with the pecan pie (spectacular) and peppermint chocolate layer cake.  Service was outstanding as well - what a great group from start to finish.  And thanks so much for the surprise pop-overs in our to-go bag!

W8LVNRWAEg7ZKnGd2bI1eQ.text: Decided we'd give this a try as we frequent many of Houston's steak joints regularly.  Definitely did not disappoint.  Prices were a little higher then I think they should have been, but suitable given the restaurant and area.  Maybe Houston's just a better value for food, I don't know.  Doesn't matter anyway..  We started with an heirloom tomato salad which was quite good.  Truffle and parm chips were delicious as well and certainly something I've looked to duplicate at home.  Buffalo ribeye was a good change of pace as well from the typical Texas steak house offerings.  Really enjoyed the wine reduction with that.  Also sampled the filet which was pretty standard, well done however.  Wine selection was also fairly reasonable with options for everyone.

kjhk2-OENBAP55Y3KfbpyA.text: In Vegas a few nights seeking a great steak dinner. The petit filet mignon was yummy! Also a great individual portion, anything else simply too large. Dinner rolls the best !! Also the truffle pasta appetizer is a must try! Waiters provided good service too.

2dEEIG900VokryMXxiR6uw.text: We had drinks in the bar followed by dinner. The drinks were fine but the bar atmosphere is stark. The chairs are not comfortable and it just isn't very inviting. Our meal was excellent! We had bone-in NY and bone-in ribeye. The truffle potato chips are a must. Our wait staff was very good too..professional and helpful. Again, not impressed with the atmosphere. It has a big dining hall feel. Emeril often makes gluten free modifications but there aren't any here.

DQ4bI0zM-CFR6rpiwOB01A.text: Took my fiance here for our 5 year anniversary since he is such a fan of steak.  To be honest, I always felt that if you've been to one steakhouse, you've been to them all.  But that doesn't mean the food was any less delicious.    The truffle chips were crunchy and packed with flavor and the salmon tartare was delicious!  We also ordered the bone in filet, which was a little on the salty side but the meat was perfectly tender...but what I was extremely excited about was the foie gras (banned in California).  The order of foie gras was plentiful and just heaven paired with the steak.    The service was impeccable, I never once felt forgotten.  Sigh, I guess I'll need to take that 4 hour drive everytime I'm craving foie gras.....

-AfWnumxLUcgx69eN1WmIQ.text: I came here with some girlfriends during my Bachelorette weekend in Vegas. We had a reservation for 7 girls, and were very promptly sat at our reservation hour.  The service here is spectacular, and the food is equally enjoyable. My girls and I shared our entrees and side dishes, so that we could each have a taste of a little bit of everything.  Entrees: - FILET MIGNON - 9 oz, and absolutely melt-in-your-mouth yummy. This cut was like BUTTER. - EMERIL'S BBQ SALMON - Also melted like butter with every bite. It was amazing how tender, yet well-cooked the fish was. The hash side dish that came with the meal was very complimentary! - GRILLED MARINATED ORGANIC CHICKEN BREAST - Mostly juicy (a teeny bit dry), but great flavors. The fingerling potatoes were pretty standard, and the wild mushrooms weren't very tasty to me. - BONE IN RIBEYE - 20 oz, and great for sharing! Our waiter even cut the steak for our girls so that each could have medium rare/well. - AMERICAN RED SNAPPER - the sides didn't seem as appealing at first for my friend who had this dish, but she ended up enjoying them!  Sides: - CREAMED CORN GRATINEE - delicious. A great combination of that sweet and salty flavor. Texture was right on point! - BUTTERED FRESH ASPARAGUS - fabulous crunch, and not so much flavor added to cover up the natural enjoyable flavor of the veggie  All in all, a great experience. We weren't too full at the end of the meal, and didn't have to worry about wasting any food or taking back any leftovers.  Highly recommended!

CzlTmnVYWeU_UzUEr2yHZQ.text: Delmonico is the definition of fine dining.  Delicious food and excellent service.  It was like the serving staff were magicians.  Always there when you needed them, and even when you didn't know you needed them.    Food was delicious - steaks perfectly cooked.   Decor was minimal but classy.  Music was quiet, and the whole setting was very serene.    Definitely would recommend this!  Thank you Delmonico for a wonderful anniversary dinner!

T0cLSCfQ4Ujl-YkxLwfgcA.text: Bam!  Great service!   Top notch service, amazing service, service, service, service.  They even asked us for a business card so they can write us a thank you card in the mail.    Food:  -Bbq shrimp-4 pcs, very tasty, amazing sauce.   -Spinach salad was delicious, candied bacon...well like candy!  -Red snapper was perfectly cooked.  I could have used more lentils but heh it's cool.  -Bone in ribeye was, as everyone else says, amazing.   -Pineapple mojitos, really refreshing but also very strong.    Sadly, no room for dessert.  Would have loved the Jamaican Blue Mountain Coffee but the $20.00 price tag was a bit over zealous.    I would totally go back, but maybe for lunch so I have more room for their dessert!

TiudagtIhbTA9iEBXiwaiQ.text: Service is excellent. I had the Fillet and it was cooked perfect. My Brother-in-law had the Ribeye and ordered it medium rare. It looked more medium and before he said anything, our waiter came by and noticed. Then he asked to take it back for a new one. The new ribeye came out in less than 2mins. Salads are excellent as well as the cocktails. Second time I've I've eaten there.

AB6H0u48pLChL6XsVQQMcg.text: Had the chateau Breon and pride mountain Cabernet for dinner....wow! That was absolutely delicious food.  The tables were a little cramped and loud but still worth the trip. Pricey but still worth it.

UraIsWitrhrD8--DwLzI7Q.text: We had lunch at Delmonico Steakhouse in the Venetian on Saturday. When we arrived around 1:15 PM there were only two other tables occupied by diners, so we got plenty of attention from Adriana, who was very professional and helped to create a wonderful lunch experience for us.  As starters we ordered the Buttered Fresh Asparagus and Sauteed Wild Garlic Mushrooms The asparagus was delicious and the mushrooms were simply incredible. If you are a garlic lover you must try these mushrooms; we are and we believe we would make a return trip to the Delmonico just to order these again.  We then split a Grilled Skirt Steak Sandwich which featured wonderfully marinated, expertly cooked steak with a horseradish mayo that perfectly complemented the meat. The sandwich was outstanding, and there was no extra charge for splitting it and serving us each half on own own plate.   We then decided to go for it and split a piece of Emeril's famous Banana Cream Pie. This turned out to be not your ordinary banana cream pie in that there seemed to be no cream filling with the bananas. It looked like a vast number of differently shaped banana slices had been stacked on the crust in a kind of patchwork design, and yet they had done something to these bananas to make them deliciously sweet. There was a substantial amount of whipped cream on top of the slice which had been dusted with chocolate and drizzled with caramel. This pie was definitely a winner, and we regretted that we had no more room to sample some of their other desserts.   We are already planning a return visit to Delmonico Steakhouse next time we are in Vegas to further explore their menu and other items. Based on our lunch experience there we know we will be in for some fabulous flavors.

2tji6m94yh8mG7MCP05gvg.text: Our party of six dined at Delmonico for my 50th birthday celebration.   In short, the service was outstanding!  Our head waiter was Michael and the manager on the floor was Vincent.   We also had at least two others who served us.  All were very professional and patient. Our party was not the eaisiest to serve that night, but what happens in Vegas...!  Obviously food tastes are very subjective.  My bone in ribeye and twice baked potato were great.  I did not care too much for the chicken and waffle dish my wife had... neither did she.  The shrimp appetizer was a 10, as was the crab dish.   The desserts... Creme Brulee, banana creme pie and chocolate cake were very good also.  Overall, a very nice experience.  We will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana cream pie, chocolate cake and creme brulee!

jRX8fzW5ZTCvhGMNCQgq-g.text: Didn't eat.  Sat at bar and had wine.  Pretty reasonably priced considering it's vegas.  Wine by glass list well above average.  Very competent bartender.  Would return.

DHO975G0ZTCI9pPCSVmjRw.text: Let's be honest: steakhouses are a dime-a-dozen in Las Vegas. Every which way you look, there's some place that's being advertised as "The Best Steakhouse in Nevada!" or "THE Las Vegas Steakhouse" or "If Elvis Were Alive, He Would Eat Here!"  Not all steakhouses are created equal -- Delmonico is proof of that.  Situated in between the Palazzo and the Venetian, Delmonico is unassuming from the outside. It looks simple and classy. Once you step inside, however, you realize that comfort is their highest priority. The chairs are deep and made of the most comfortable leather. You won't want to get up when you're finished with your meal.   This was our second visit (our first for lunch), and I must say that the service was just as attentive and cordial as they had been the first time. Both of our servers were named Peter (which turned out to be quite humorous when we called out for one and they both came running), and they were extremely pleasant. They had absolutely no problem recommending dishes or letting us know their personal favorites.   For my appetizer, I had the heirloom tomato salad. The tomatoes were ripe, juicy, and delicious. The accompanying cheese was a perfect pair to offset the acidity of the tomatoes. Thin slivers of onions covered the perimeter of the plate, which were also very nice.  I chose the fillet of beef medallions for my entree, and I was impressed with how absolutely wonderful they were. About a half-dollar in diameter and an inch tall, they were perfectly cooked, not to mention topped in Parmesan cheese and drizzled with homemade Worcestershire sauce.   Delmonico doesn't need to be one of those places that wears people out with advertising. They know how good they are, and they aren't afraid to knock your socks off. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a relaxing way to enjoy an evening with good people and great food.

xQD84mrOXdbn61tXT4fTLA.text: Two words, food and service.  The service is top notch.  The food came timely, and everyone made sure my dining experience was exceptional.  The food, excellent without a doubt.  I had the fillet and it was very good.  Without a doubt I will definitely eat here again whenever in Las Vegas.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone.   I finished with the banana cream pie, it was a very large piece of pie.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana cream pie.

6YNPXoq41qTMZ2TEi0BYUA.text: The food was decent, but the service was definitely sub par (especially for the price!).It took 15-20 minutes for the server to acknowledge us  just so that we order drinks. Our dinner was good but I have to say that I was disappointed that they did nothing to acknowledge my birthday celebration. We chose this restaurant over STK & CUT to celebrate the occasion and I wish we hadn't. They did nothing to acknowledge our occasion which was sad. I will not be going back to this restaurant again.

J4TjJPwt1ZhFyu-HX9STiQ.text: Let the 5 star rating speak for itself. Absolutely delicious mind blowing steaks served here. The bone-in ribeye was grilled to perfection. Topped with butter. Seriously, could you ask for anything more. I had tears welling up in my eyes it was so good. I was having a moment. Tender beyond belief. The cajun rub did not taste cajun. It tasted like seasoned perfection.  Excellent sides and appetizers. Wine list, extensive. Decor wasn't my style but very simple - nothing to write home about. The staff was very attentive, helpful, and courteous.   Again. Mind blowing!

qadtYfh4US1WH6dD0u1LTw.text: Came here for lunch during restaurant week with a few other Yelpers. It's located in the Venetian, but it's easier if you self park at Palazzo to find it. If you self park, you have to walk through the entire hotel to get to restaurant row, which is where Delmonico's is located. I was the first to arrive so I sat in the bar area, which was very cozy. Before long, we were seated at our table. The restaurant had a few others dining in there but it wasn't busy at all. There were 3 waiters servicing our table. One for water, one to clear and one to serve. Maybe not specifically, but it seemed that way.  The chef sent over a complimentary appetizer for the table; lemon ricotta served over thinly sliced red apple and bruschetta with tapenade and pesto. (I think a green apple would have been much better. I dont care for the texture nor the taste of red apples) The appetizer was very nice. The soup followed and I didnt care for that one bit. It tasted like warm ketchup. Ew. Ew, ew, ew. So not a fan. Thankfully, that was the only dish I didn't care for. The grilled cheese that accompanied the soup was very good. I enjoyed that quite a bit. The tomato salad and the house green salad that others ordered looked absolutely delicious. Every one finished everything, so I guess they liked it too. The salmon entree was delicious. I asked for it cooked well done and it came back, cooked fantastically! It wasn't medium at all and it was so juicy. Even Christina who likes hers cooked much less, said it was very good. I tried her butternut squash ravioli. It was OK. The flavor in the ravioli was good, but it 1. should have been warmer and 2. the pasta was too soft. It should have been al dente.  The dessert was good as well. Your choice between banana cream pie or pecan pie. I opted for the pecan. It was served with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. It was good too. I tried Christina's banana cream pie, and it tasted good, although I didn't care for the look of it, with all those squares of banana.  The service was very good, they didn't add the 18% automatically (I prefer when places do that, honestly). The food was good, not great, but good. The price, $30.13 for 3 courses was OK. It was "pricey" for lunch, however, the quality of the food and the portions were generous. I dont really see myself going back there. There are a lot of other places I'd like to try and places that I love already that I will return to. It was a great time with great people!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pecan pie
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon with crab and corn salsa
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomatoe soup with ricotta grilled cheese

aVor8Ttm0RT3JBvv6DOWAQ.text: Delmonico is a terrific steakhouse, with great food and ambiance. We are from NY and have been to a lot of top notch steakhouses, so were really impressed by this restaurant.  Tom Baker made it even more memorable, great maitre d/waiter! I highly recommended Emeril's BBQ salmon and the bone-in fillet.  The real surprise were the truffle and parmesan potato chips - delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Emeril&#39;d BBQ Salmon
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Smashed Potatoes
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in Fillet

W5XaPL9jg3ILQwFkRcR89w.text: This is solely for the Chef's Table experience.  The bar area, dining room, and professional wait service is on par with spendy steakhouses. The vibe is casual, yet classy and not stuffy or pretentious, but imma talk more about this other thing going on near the kitchen.   If you want to catch a glimpse of the restaurant's inner sanctum, with a backstage-VIP-behind-the-scene view of organized chaos that is a proper kitchen service (and willing to pay for the private room setting), then prepare for a premium dinner. Anyone with an unbent iPhone 6+ can snap selfies and food pics these days, but you need just a little more than reservations for this opportunity.   Our group was ushered through the dining room and towards the kitchen door, then guided into a side room that was separated from the dining room area. Glass panels allowed us to see the various kitchen workstations. In this fishbowl room, it was cramped quarters, like dudes crammed into a submarine mess hall, but you kinda just get used to it and settle in for the experience. Battle stations!  The food (photos uploaded) was brought in by a team of waiters and chefs and placed in front of us in unison at every course. Each tasting was beautifully plated and delicious. Course after course was brought in, and they even paused mid-service to allow diners to return from their nicotine break before bringing in the next round of plates.  After all these dinner courses, there isn't much room left in the tummy for dessert. I was expecting maybe something light and sweet to cleanse the palate. Suddenly, these giant platters of everything from the dessert menu appeared! It wasn't just one or two items. So much decadence and it was a surprisingly wonderful grand finale to a spectacular meal.  For the amount $$$$pent, we could've went for bottle service, made it rain, or get swindled at a rub-n-tug joint, but we indulged on a magical evening of delightful food pr0n. Would go again if I hit a Vegas jackpot.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lamb, chimichurri, green onion spaetzle
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp, lemon butter, pea purée. There was also a veal meatball
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad greens, beet purée, proiscutto, smoked blue cheese, peach purée

el9DmIAJ_WXQsRTdfvYS7g.text: We arrived 20 mins late to our reservation and were so thankful they were accommodating. The bone-in ribeye, beef tartar, and every other appetizer we ordered was delicious. The meat didn't have too much fat which was the best part. Other steakhouses will serve your steak with bigger chunks of fat, so I felt like I was getting my money's worth here. The service was okay. Dress code tip: It's a nice restaurant but not extremely fancy.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JjtJN_FIIatBJvxuSYAq0Q.text: Excellent steakhouse. Well designed to be classy with some modern touches but not too modern you don't feel like you aren't in an old fashioned steakhouse.  The filet mignon done au poive was superb (5/5). Not necessarily the most traditional prep but the cajun seasoning combined with the crusted pepper and very tender beef made for an awesome bite.  The bone in rib eye (5/5) was also cooked expertly and one of the most flavorful and not too fatty pieces of steak I've had.  The shrimp cocktail (3.5/5) was nice but I thought standard cocktail sauce would have been better. The slice of avocado and sprig of microgreens made it nice.  Service was on point and very professional.   Would come back here again. Thought it was better than Cut Steakhouse in the Venetian.

Qi__WyWO0kLxWBxqOo_PKw.text: I've always had a fantastic time at Delmonico. We typically stay at the Venetian or Palazzo and always make sure to visit this steakhouse. The service is ALWAYS phenomenal and the food has is second to none in The Venetian/Palazzo. It's honestly not all that pricey for the quality of food and service you receive. They have a fantastic wine list and the restaurant is large enough to have a main dining room and a private event happening at the same time. The restaurant itself has kind of an.....empty feel to it? There's not really any artwork, but the restaurant has great architectural points that - in a way- are the artwork. I tell everyone I know about the filet.

74M4K8vsZHiDj4IX0CuMtg.text: This was the steakhouse we decided to grub after my half marathon on the strip. I was concerned that my race attire didn't suit the ambiance and when we entered, we were welcomed. COOL!   The staff was outstanding and very informative of the menu. We were led to a private corner booth which made our dinner even more special. We were offered menus and an iPad for our wine selections. I ordered a champagne to celebrate my last race of the year, and the fiancee ordered a glass of Justin cab (one of his faves).  -We were offered comped bread (popover) and butter. LOVE THE SOFT BUTTER!!!  -Lobster bisque to share ($16) -Bone-in ribeye ($55) -Bone-in NY Strip ($50) -Twice Baked Potato ($9) -Duck Egg Creme Brulee ($11)  Steaks had a great rub on it and was topped with butter. YUP butter... Because I had the rib-eye, there was a lot of fat! YUM!!! I was only able to eat half my steak since it was so huge!!! The fiancee finished his NY. The potato was average and came with all the fixings on the side. I just wanted extra butter. Dinner was great.  The dessert was a bit disappointing. We ordered the duck egg creme brulee since it was unique and highly recommended. At first the dessert was good, but after eating a couple more bites, the dessert started tasting a bit funny. It was so rich and I think the weird taste was getting to our tastebuds! Too bad there wasn't a molten lava cake!  Service and ambiance was superb. Love walking through the Palazzo to get this restaurant! Beautiful!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popover and butter
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque

HYRyl_R4s9jq-E2eitYQlg.text: I've been wanting to come here for years. My husband and I like to try steak houses around Las Vegas and this one had been on our list for a while. He decided to take me for Mother's Day this year. It actually wasn't as great as I expected.  I heard so many great things about this place but I would give it an "OK."  It's good, but we have been to better steak houses. I ordered the bone in ribeye. It was cooked perfectly though. Kudos to the chef. The best part was dessert!  The pecan pie was delish!! I probably wouldn't come back here again, though. There's other places that I enjoy much more for the same price.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary appetizer.. This was delish!
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Orleans style BBQ shrimp and biscuit.. Sorta salty. Also had a shell when I bit into it.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary bread

uTQa89pwnNTH9mXN86Z0nA.text: The food was outstanding. Beautifully cooked steak and perfect baked potatoes. Best meal in Vegas and the atmosphere was classy.

x17S7t9nydRapodtJSrHAg.text: The service was amazing - arrived at the reservation time and was seated right away .. Our waiter was great gave recommendation about the meals .. The food was amazing I normally crush a ribeye.. This was perfect I took my time and just savored every bit- I will go back every time I am in Vegas hands down best meal I had the entire week

bGvgnQQ9iBgP_q-iVNBhQg.text: I travel for work quite a bit.  In those travels I go to a large number of steakhouses, many are wonderful, some are unimpressive, a few, well a few are just unbelievable.  Service is never the biggest scale tipper for me, but I understand it is very important for some people.  The service at Delmonico is impeccable.  Dishes are cleared away quickly, menu items are explained in necessary detail, drinks are always full, and complaints are addressed quickly and quietly.  Decor generally means little to my review.  I appreciate aesthetics as much as the next 30-something, but a bare room with nothing on the walls isn't going to change my number of stars, and to be honest, I couldn't even tell you what Delmonico looks like on the inside, I don't care, the only thing that matters is those steaks.  I prefer my steak in the form of a ribeye.  Bone-in or boneless, I don't really care.  I order it rare+ with a hard sear (some may call it Pittsbugh, sometimes I do).  At Delmonico I got myself the boneless ribeye, rare+ with a hard sear, and they brought it to me rare+ with a hard sear.  This was one of the best pieces of meat I've ever eaten in my life.  It reminded me of the first time I ate at a real steakhouse when I was in my early 20s, it caused this awakening inside of me, of what I may have been missing in the world.  There was a crunch as you cut into it, and then a soft slide through buttery, perfectly cooked meat, with a hint of salt once you put it in your mouth.  I'll eat at Delmonico every time I go back to Las Vegas.  There were sides too.  I don't remember what they were.  I don't care.

gvvuzwPWHuRdKVv-P6OTRw.text: We were served chicken skewers, prosciutto, and potstickers for appetizers. They were all delicious!   Next we were served a delicious light salad!  I was never disappointed by the service or food! Truly a five star restaurant

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rodney Strong wine
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cabernet Sauvignon &amp; a French Martini
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye Steak - it was rare

dL3GG-U9hbe5mnVXP50XNg.text: Want a True VIP experience? Try the chef's table here. We had the greatest experience here for my birthday. Chef came to the table and explained each course he had specially prepared for us. We brought our own wine and champagne but I believe you can order it there as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras with fresh fruit and baby greens
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sherbet... Mmmm
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two more to die for desserts

iBzBKf0EnBxNNfCe9QjTrA.text: We went here with a large group (12 or so) a few years ago, celebrating a bunch of birthdays.  Everything was magnificent.  The rolls to start, the entrees, the wine, & the dessert.  We left stuffed and still talk about that dinner years later.  It was definitely pricey, but we expected that.  The service was great too.  They treated us very well and it just enhanced what was already a very fun, special night.

FIbRWb3oYVuak6KvBl4nCA.text: I love a good steak. Filets are my favorite. I have to say that the Filet I had at the Delmonico Steakhouse was one of the best I've ever had. Maybe even the best. The char on it was perfect, the inside a perfect medium. If I had one complaint - it'd be that I didn't order two of them.  The side dishes and dessert were also delicious, and the service was amazing as well. Of course, the price was expensive, but I would hope no one going to this restaurant would be surprised by the price. You get what you pay for.  I'm keeping the review short - if you don't mind paying good money for a great meal, then go here. You will not regret it.

M_a9DTvu_V0k8QIP-EvQlg.text: We were invited to dinner here as part of a work office getaway in LV. Prior to arrival, I had whisked thru the menu as well as some reviews. I was actually expecting to be disappointed. I assumed that the prices might sway the opinions of many.  Man, was I wrong. We walked in to this modern but simply decorated establishment on time and our party of 11 were immediately seated. Michael was our head server and he made sure we received water, a wine list and our menus.  I had noticed that a summer trio for $65 was available so that is the angle I decided to take. I felt a little guilty that our employer was eating this tab so I wanted to be fair. I ordered the Mini Wedge, the Petite Rib-Eye and a Caramel Butter Cake a la mode. Most went this route although some selected the STRIP. You think Vegas had something to do with that?  My salad was good but I thought the Bleu Cheese on the plate was a bit understated. I do like Bleu Cheese with some POP. My Rib-Eye was called petite but it was still a plentiful portion. It was prepared PERFECTLY and the Chimichurri applied on top had the old taste buds doing somersaults.    The dessert which is offered by itself was upgraded with a scoop of ice cream with Michael's recommendation. His idea was spot on. All in all, everyone enjoyed their FABULOUS meals. We laughed, conversed and immersed ourselves in each other. We definitely had a relaxing dinner.   The evening would not have been as grand without the service we received. Michael and his staff performed impeccably. The service was orchestrated and attentive. Make sure to stroll in one evening and ask if Michael can take care of you. You will not regret it.

0b9neQ_wNoYiBW6oTp9FFA.text: The fact that we were able to change our reservation for 8 people, three different times on a very crowded Mothers Day weekend should've been my first clue that this wasn't going to be a great meal. The steaks had absolutely NO flavor, the options weren't good and the ahi salad with a whopping 3 small pieces of tuna was far from worth the cost. I come to the Venetian very often as an invited guest and have never had such a sub-par dining experience. With so many other great options don't bother with this one....

PUKPs2fSq-EWRGV3ySpdnQ.text: Hard to write this review because I will say my rib eye steak was done to perfection. Well-seasoned, cooked perfectly. Tender and flavorful meat. That's where the compliments stop. We also ordered a side of broccoli to share and some au gratin potatoes. The broccoli at $9 was just horrifying. It's all the reasons that children don't want to eat their vegetables. I think it started with an awful product. The broccoli itself was not only lacking in freshness, it was limp and flavorless. It could not have been good broccoli to begin with. It seemed as if it was frozen and then heated up slightly as it was mushy. It was also underwhelming with seasoning of any sort. Surprising from a restaurant of this caliber. Why bother selling broccoli when it was so disgusting. The au gratin potatoes were good. These at least had salt and were not overly cheesy. I give them a B.  As for service, it was OK. I realize hard to do good service with large parties. I will tell you that even though the server made up for it in the end, there was a big problem. I ordered a side of foie gras. It appeared on the table in front of me and then at some point in the service, someone from the wait staff came over and took it away from me so quickly, I didn't even have a chance to ask about it. Perplexed, I asked our server. He apologized and tried to get a new order on my table asap and he took it off the bill.  Unfortunately, I cannot recommend the foie that came to me. It was cold in the middle and uninteresting. Let me tell you that cold foie is not good. Disappointing on all fronts.

Xi4yQUShkjrPnqJVq1rFQg.text: Was Excellent! Everything from the salad, through the oysters, and the lobster bisque was fabulous, and the surf and turf perfect! The service was fantastic. New management, sure shows, Thank you Delmonico's and our great waiter, Vince!

SbqUH1wLMCI9c9OMMDbgBg.text: Great food, service, and ambiance. Steak was delicious as was the lobster bisque. The servers stopped by frequently and we were never without a fresh drink.

lV5IaExJ5INs5p6YLpGgiw.text: Dang!!! Had the Kobe filet, worth every bit of the $120 it was. The service wasn't the best but I was at the bar so I'm not expecting much there. Best steak I've had in Vegas, better than Cut.

mugxsuUzFj8DJdDP13-b5A.text: Excellent dining experience!  The food was just wonderful as well as the service. We ordered: Shrimp cocktail  Tuna and salmon tartare French onion soup Wilted spinach salad Shared bone in rib eye Twice baked potato Mushrooms Pecan pie The standouts were the spinach salad the poached egg made is awesome and the tartare superb.  For the sides highly recommend the twice baked potato, so cheesy, yum! The crust on the pecan pie was so flaky and light and delicious, I would order it every time!  The restaurant is beautiful and I would definitely return again.

nbc22gABkOtitApekoATmA.text: One of the best meals I've ever had. The staff couldn't be anymore accommodating and the food . Our party was lucky enough to secure the "kitchen table" meaning we were seated in a private room with windows overlooking the cooks line. It gets really interesting when the restaurant gets busy and several covers come in at once. It's something that every foodie should experience at least once in their lifetime. The French Onion soup is to die for. Thank you Chef Rainwater for an evening that I will cherish forever.

GCYDjasUBd-ARPgtoU8zFQ.text: Class.. That is the word I will use to describe my overall experience with the staff here. Very proper and very confident in their menu recommendations. They know their wine, they know their meat.. if you ask any one of them to decide between two items they will hit you with their favorite with a solid reason behind it.  The food here is done very well and the way the food is presented on the plates were beautiful.   Vegetarian? No problem.. though not listed or displayed on any of their menus, they made us a plate of pasta mixed with lots of veggies and a sauce of things... yes... things.. delicious.. There was a platter of cheese.. it was cheesy.. so boom. The Caesar salad was... green.. and delicious.. I guess I mainly wanted to write this review for the fact that they made us vegetarian meals because we came in with people who are big meat eaters. Successful evening.

QuoJ9TW9fylW4sam8RF3jw.text: We had our daughters Twenty first birthday dinner here while in Vegas. It was absolutely delicious.  Every dish from fish to steaks were perfect.  The staff was very attentive and helpful with menu and wine selections.  They made our daughter feel so special!

FVmgCnzIgkz8pIpn14dmBQ.text: Steak and Cesar salad were absolutely delicious! We got the steak for two served and sliced table side and the Cesar salad was made table side. We were surprised at the end with an anniversary sorbet.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cesar salad. Excellent!
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak prepared medium. Perfection.

yyUbDe_v697M5re_FFC4OQ.text: Wow!!! I love steak and I'm extremely particular about steakhouses and this one did not disappoint. We switched our reservation last minute to eat at DelMonico and I'm so happy we did.   We started off with the truffle Parmesan chips which were phenomenal, the dates (I could have done without, but they were good), and a tomato salad. Honestly, could have done without every thing except the amazing fries. Ah yes...I forgot to mention that they start the meal by bringing you an insanely delicious popover.   We all got steak and everyone was happy with their choice and preparation. I am never happy with the temperature on my filet and the medium rare was exactly how I like it. We got the Brussels sprouts as a side (served family style) and again, they were just how I like them. They were very charred, which I prefer, but if you don't like a bit of a burn on your Brussels, I'd go for one of the potato options.   Overall, this was one of the best meals I've had in a long time. Our server was insanely friendly and personable, yet, didn't need to know all our of personal information. This was the perfect Sunday night out!!!

BvPfUYKwBC-pe2gLGEll0w.text: Decided to celebrate V Day here as we haven't been but we remembered that we enjoyed Emeril's at MGM years ago. Creole food is packed with flavor and that's exactly what we were looking for.   The restaurant is gorgeous. Minimalism at its finest. All white with natural touches and I appreciated the layout not seating you on top of each other like so many restaurants make the mistake of doing nowadays. Felt like you were underground in a cave-like setting in some foreign country far away from the city...  We were warmly greeted by fresh popovers still hot from the oven and luxurious creamy butter. Great intro to what else was in store for the evening.   Couldn't pass up the table-side caesar for two and I loved that they rubbed a lemon wedge around the entire plate which enhanced the flavors. Stealing this idea for anytime I make a caesar at home.   My bbq salmon was delicious with very light fried onion rings and mushrooms instead of the sausage hash (just wasn't in the mood for meat) and they had no problem with my request. Very appreciative. My man ordered a filet with a crazy amount of foie gras to top it off and loved every bite.  Sides are meant for sharing so we tried the creamed corn packed with spices and the ultra cheesy potato gratin. I recommend you try both.   Drinks were STRONG! There wasn't any room left for sweets so we'll just have to come back.

Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamed corn &amp; potato&#39;s gratin
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq salmon ~ mushrooms substituted for sausage

-RUgZxcdq7cr2pjlQgIhoA.text: Nice steakhouse but too loud in here. The lighting is dim. A bit pricey. The table side Cesar Salad was good. The Mash potatoes were also yummy. You can bring your own bottle of wine and they charge you $35 cork fee.
