rgDtBEmMVQ5Fw3VsEXM9eA.text: Excellent service and food. I had the Scottish salmon and it was very good. I let the kitchen staff know about my food allergy and they were very careful to take care of that. The service was very attentive, never ran out of tea or water. I would go back and try the steak.

q9UxAfcD4E7Sl4_CSRtpWw.text: Spot on. We have dined here twice as part of a group of 8 and have enjoyed every bite and sip.

ziHU707US0LdlcqAm9XqCg.text: If you're on the fence as to which steakhouse you should choose for a special dinner while in Las Vegas, look no further.    We've been were twice.  Once before Yelp was born, and again on the 4th a few days ago.  I know of what I speak. Delmonico's is the bomb.   Take the time to have a drink at the bar before dinner.  Try a Turbodog Brown Ale made in Louisiana.  They also make the best Lemon Drop Martini I've ever had.    It smells great in there like a good steakhouse should.  The dinning room is comfortable yet still classy.  The host and hostess that night were both very nice.  The wait staff work together in harmony.  Very professional, yet still making you feel your a guest and not just another customer.    My GF (The Queen of Reseda) and my usual MO is to split a salad, sides, and a big cut of beef.    The rolls they bring are like little pillowy clouds.  They kept bringing them so I kept eating them.  Petite Iceberg Lettuce Wedges Wisconsin Buttermilk Blue Cheese Dressing, Homemade Apple Smoked Bacon and Red Onion.  Loved the Buttermilk Blue Cheese Dressing.  Great!    Bone In Ribeye, Medium Rare U.S.D.A. Prime, Dry-aged. Our waiter split it for us table side. I resisted the temptation to order A1 in a place like this and ordered some of Emeril's Worcestershire Sauce.  Good call Neanderthal man. Exceptional!  Roasted Maine Lobster Tail Grilled Lemon and Clarified Butter. About 12 oz. to 14 oz.  Expensive but good!  Buttered Fresh Asparagus Hey, this is kinda healthy and green.  Better order some Bearnaise sauce.  There's not too much butter in that right?  Creamed Corn Gratinee Get it, it's awesome.  Emeril's Banana Cream Pie Caramel Sauce, Chocolate Shavings and Whipped Cream. I asked if we could just get a half slice knowing I wasn't going to get much help from the Queen of Reseda.  I was politely told no can do.  Bring it anyway!  It's all you fat boy!  A cup of freshly brewed coffee and that Banana Cream Pie was a very nice way to end what can only be described as a wonderful dinner from start to finish.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Emeril&#39;s Banana Cream Pie.  Had to do it. Great way to end an awesome dinner.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bearnaise and Emeril&#39;s Worcestershire Sauce.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My half of the Bone in Ribeye and half a lobster tail.  Joy.

2ScmNmNW5hVKANVGN2tCSA.text: Was excited to celebrate my anniversary here. Meal started off lovely in which the waiter hands me a hand written card wishing us a happy anniversary. Nice touch. We start the meal with the truffled chips which are a must order and the french onion soup. I order the NY strip medium which is my favorite cut and my husband the house special ribeye medium rare. The meal progression is long. Although we knew we would have several waiters and main waiter whom gave me the card never made his way back to out table to check on us. We had to flag down the other waiters, even to pay our bill. Finally steaks arrive. Mine was cooked medium rare. Although not my desired temperature it did have flavor and seasoning. My husband's ribeye had an encrusted char on the outside cooked medium well on the inside and lacked any kind of seasoning. Did not taste like a steak that was aged for whatever amount of days. I would even go as far as to say the steak tasted burnt on the outside. Sides ordered with steaks were all OK, nothing memorable. I was completely disappointed with the service and quality of food.

ek0AU7mHYv-BUxE2LoSgKQ.text: Had the pleasure of having lunch here this week, it was absolutely delightful!  Service was absolutely excellent and Lobster Bisque was exquisite perfection, the steak Salad was excellent!  I look forward to visiting this place the next time i am i  Vegas!!!

6vpOJFy0ehAJR1fzAhPDLw.text: We had a memorable dinner celebrating our anniversary at Delmonico Steakhouse having our usual classic choices plus some signature Emeril dishes. The service was everything that you would expect from an Emeril restaurant plus more with Chef Rainwater and staff rolling out the red carpet making the night special for my wife and I.  Greeted with congratulations on our anniversary at the host stand, we were seated immediately for our Thursday night 8 PM reservation along the wall in the classy main dining room. A nice touch that we noticed toward the end of the meal was that although the restaurant was almost at capacity, no diners were sat at any adjacent table leaving us secluded for the entire meal. We had a few bonus tastings added to our meal including two complimentary celebratory desserts. And at the end of the meal, the friendly manager who was overseeing our entire meal, escorted us to the kitchen where we had a brief word with Chef Rainwater and photo op.  If you're looking for a cocktail, check out their creative list which some of the drinks looked very interesting, but I just stayed with my Irish whiskey. The wine list is also extensive enough that they carried a couple of choices for my picky wife. Emeril mainstays such as the barbecue shrimp and banana cream pie are items that you should try at least once. The poached main lobster was a special for the night that did not disappoint. The highlight for my meal was the bone in ribeye with Creole seasoning topped with maitre d' butter. I savored every bite of the dry aged beef and I don't think there's much doubt that I could have eaten another one.  The tab was just over two bills which I had no problem with the splurge and felt it was well worth it with the gracious hospitality we received. You'll find your classic steakhouse dishes at Delmonico but you'll also see some twists with Creole influence. You'll also be assured that the service will uphold the Emeril standard.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halibut
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary dessert
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue point oysters- ver jus mignonette

FDCTeYBrFiCIeeWP6a5VhQ.text: The thing about fine dining establishments is that there's a heck of a chance you'll leave without having had your fill, so you're encouraged to empty your wallet even more for all the trimmings.  Don't make that mistake at Delmonico Steakhouse, even if everything looks and is delicious.  Almost everything at Emeril's restaurant here is sharable.  I was here for a couple friends' birthdays, and everybody at my table ordered one appetizer to go with the steaks we ordered.  As good as everything was, we just ended up staring at our food 20 minutes after being served.  As for the food, as I stated, it's all terrific.  The complimentary bread is some of the best I've ever had.  They're delicate to the touch, and when you bite into it, the texture is flakier than a croissant.  I didn't even know that was possible with a roll.    I had the lobster bisque as an appetizer, which was creamy and some decent chunks of lobster in it.  For the record, I actually finished it.  Another person at our table ordered the seafood tower which is something you should get on a big baller budget, but everything from the oysters, to the lobster, and crab claws were scrumptious.  The country smashed potatoes, sauteed garlic mushrooms, truffle parmesan potato chips, and duck fat fingerling potatoes?  All amazing.  Now, the steak.  Most of them are dry-aged, so we're talking $$$ here, but like my fellow Yelper Ferdinand L. said, do not attempt to have a steak without the foie gras on top.  If you've never had foie gras before, this is the time to do it.  The result is something you'll simply salivate over.  Now it wasn't the best steak I ever had, but it was one of those situations where after eating here, I know most things after will be a disappointment, so choose your next meal wisely.  My whole table had the meat stares, and only one person at the table finished their entree.  Just a great dining experience.

GHIX90dVoU958aa87Srjbw.text: Great food and service.  Best steak in Vegas ... had the rib eye, it was excellent.  The gumbo was on point. We had a large party and they all had a great time.

y-KX_NwYNmCEE6mwrilYtg.text: This is one of my favorite steakhouses special you want to visit Vegas the service is incredible I would give it 100* their menu is very unique and exciting it's a very pretty place and Equipment restaurant

ZZ1Q3LeT8QjiRegoT8iq4g.text: Booooring and underwhelming.   Food was fine, but overpriced. Nothing blew me away. Good quality cuts of meat, but nothing not well seasoned, not imaginative, and not steak house portion sizes. I prefer smaller portions most of the time, but only when the food is really outstanding. Otherwise, at least put enough lettuce in the salad to count for a serving of vegetables!

7nXoVr-WYcn9WaHUn2VRuw.text: Delicious ribeye steak!! My husband and I came here to celebrate our anniversary (we had the BEST service when we came to celebrate our anniversary last year that we came back). Micheal Jackson helped us again-it was nice to see a friendly, familiar face. :)  Service was fantastic again. We both got the ribeye. I didn't say bone in loud enough so mine wasn't  :( but that's ok-it was still delicious and perfectly cooked-medium rare. I got mine with a red wine sauce. We also got the grits and creamed corn and special 3-chocolate cake that they're adding to the menu soon. We got a nice anniversary dessert and card. It was a great celebration. Definitely coming back.

lrrUPF0op46ct7Br3uxn3w.text: Amazing food and the lunch special is one to be recognized! Best food in town! Carpaccio is to die for and I can go on from the shrimp to the chicken sandwich! I am a repeat customer and out of towner and I can't get over the amazing service -Clint is the best in the biz and makes a mean margarita! I highly recommend checking it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LEzphAnz0vKE32PUCbjLgQ.text: One of the top steak places I've had in Vegas aside from STK and CraftSteak!   My friends and I started off with the steak tartare and truffle chips which were on point! It was shareable between the four of us and held us over until our steaks! They gave us complimentary bread that was so warm and slightly crispy....it was heavenly!   I ordered the NYS, medium well and it came out perfectly cooked with garlic butter on top. The steak was huge and I was able to eat 3/4!! Honestly, all top steak places in Vegas taste the same to me due to the high quality meats they use but what I look for in these restaurants are the quality and taste in the sides and appetizers!   The sauteed mushrooms were seasoned perfectly and very tasty. The smashed potatoes were creamy and complimented the steaks very well!  The service was excellent; I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in Ribeye; their specialty
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sautéed mushrooms and smashed potatoes

oHzKKLN0DsXX6mzMBJ2atA.text: OH MY GOSH! Whenever someone brings up food and Vegas, I always have to mention this place. It's so freaking awesome. The services is awesome, my friend dropped a spoon and before she could pick it up, she was handed a new one already. Then when dishes arrived, everyone got their plates at the exact same time. They had like 5 servers placing a dish in front of each person. We also got free crabcakes which was really nice of them. Now the food. Man yes it's expensive but SO WORTH IT! I mean you get a lot of food and the food is so freaking good. I have never tasted a ribeye steak greater than this one. It like melted in your mouth, even though meat isn't suppose to do that, I meant that it was so tender OH MY GOSH! I'm so going back next time I'm in Vegas. Their drinks are really good too. Man no complaints at all about this place!

a4KynIToW122TSHvXN-nEw.text: I thought it was good, but not $300 good for a couple.  Service was good, my steak was good, and the little grilled cheese were good, but I honestly expected to be blown away.  It is Emeril after all!!!  I would have been just as content spending a hundred bucks less at any number of other great restaurants in Vegas

XBPsr3PGgdQIwUXTxeeHPQ.text: Really good service and food.  I loved the mozzarella bruschetta we had, it had amazingly good flavor (garlic, shallots, tomatoes) drizzled lightly with either a balsamic reduction or really well aged balsamic vinegar, and on a toast point that wasn't hard and crusty.  Their soup special was pumpkin soup, creamy and seasoned nicely.  My husband I both got salads, I got the spinach salad with bacon and he got the fresh baby greens.  Both were good.  Too bad we came to a steakhouse and only ordered vegetarian dishes, we were just overwhelmed by all the heavy food we've been eating since we arrived in Vegas.  Next time, we'll try their seafood or meat dishes.  We finished off our meal with dessert, the fruit cobbler topped with caramel ice cream was YUM!

nXWgy1RHDzCKc8-pYC6JuA.text: It's been a long time since I been to Delmonico's. I used to be a big fan of Emeril. I'm sure I had some pork dish and something wrap i bacon. Just make sure you make reservation WAY in advance.

AHUm1Hj-M4MteZ8ghUZOVQ.text: I gave this five stars because I feel it is the best steakhouse in Las Vegas. I have been to CUT, SW, Craft, and Del Frisco's, but Delmonico's takes the cake. We went in a large (all male) group so I wont describe each dish, but simply give a brief overview. The service and decor are both wonderful. You were given a relatively large amount of space, at least for a steakhouse. The appetizers, steaks, sides, and desserts are great! A must go to for those looking for an upscale, but great steak dinner. In terms of price, it is average for a Vegas steakhouse.

rVbZbF3simRKJWyciYxl-A.text: The traditional New Orleans Gumbo was tasteless, the lobster bisque was too salty, the jumbo lump crab salad was anything but fresh, the BBQ shrimp was swimming in BBQ sauce......, we were amazed by the poor quality of food this restaurant serves, we ordered great wine and that's the only thing we finished, service was O.K.  I would skip this restaurant altogether.

eZRDEAMUe6jc-qYjdv3hfQ.text: Emril Lagasi's snazzy steak house at the Venetian.  The big brown leather chairs have stuck in my mind.  Filet was cooked to perfection.  Service was very attentive.  We left happy.  Will probably head back after experiencing some more of what Vegas has to offer.  So much to see... so little time!  I would give it 4.5 stars if I could, but I am going to have to agree about the ambiance - a bit on the bright side (sights n'sound).  In the end, Delmonico's seemed to be a consistent and classic dining experience.

RhAuyVDDr8anNS2pg9DxOA.text: This is the second Emerill Lagasse restaurant I've been to and it was just as amazing as the first one (the fish house at MGM).  Two completely different types of cuisines but both restaurants had amazing food and outstanding service.  My friends ordered the bone in rib eye and the rib eye and thought it was one of the best steaks they've had.  I ordered the pork loin which came with two pieces of pork belly as well and it was cooked to perfection...very tender and moist.  And I must emphasize that service was top notch at all levels...starting from the host to the bartenders to our server to the staff!  A must try when you're in Sin City!

SCcn4jYoEzHHJOHIH1c1cw.text: One of the top steak houses on the strip. Nice quite place, great for a date of a nice night out. The food is awesome!!

yr0Y_4eaxQFRH6QTf1Nzgg.text: Great atmosphere, very good food, great service...get the creamed corn side dish!!!

VtbKUCPk57gI7XQ5EhpMCQ.text: We went for lunch.  And we were super early, the first ones there.  So maybe that contributed to the lack of enthusiasm that we started out with.  Our waiter was very nice but he didn't quite seem all there at first.  He asked me if I wanted a side of potatoes after I order a burger that comes with fries.  He walked away before we could order drinks and we had to call him back.  But after the initial turbulence, everyone settled in and we had a good meal.  I started with the gumbo which was perfectly fine, but it lacked a little soul for me.  For my entree I ordered the burger, as mentioned.  I just wasn't in the mood for steak for lunch or any of the other entrees for that matter.    The burger was freakin' awesome.  It didn't have any weird toppings, just the standard lettuce, tomato, mayo maybe, whatever.  But this thing was a MONSTER.  That burger must have been about 3/4 of a pound.  It stood about 8 inches high and was delivered with a steak knife plunged into it to keep it all put together.  There was no way I was eating this thing with my hands.  This was a knife-and-forker all the way.  It was so much fun digging into that sexy hot beefy mama.  The fries were awesome too.  It's not often that I find a burger that I fall in love with but this is one that I will cherish forever.  5 star burger all the way.  Who needs a steak when you've got one of these babies.

epkM_GbuKe4LsjlnNeyP7A.text: Great steaks, great service and the banana cream pie was over the top.

4P3cSgHjWB41_fgbRfncMQ.text: I really don't get why so many people think this place is that great.    If you remove the Emeril-factor, It seems like a place in the midwest where guys go w/ thier buddies after a day on the course.     Servers really know how to push the signature dishes.

q0yaG-rnOmr7L0tLa1wugA.text: Big portion, and that's pretty much it. Incosistent service, and doubtful seafood quality.

s6k_jPtPctLCZ51uF6zbUg.text: Outstanding Restaurant   Amazing FOOD from start to finish  Amazing SERVICE  Well Done - after going here I have tremendous respect for Emril and I must admit I did not before - BAM BAM

gKOk9HAfnIs5C98UA5Z0yQ.text: The man has done it again!: On a recent trip to Vegas our casino host suggested we dine at the Delmonico for a nice steak in a fabulous environment. WOW! The atmosphere was cool & hip but not fake or stuffy as sometimes happens in upscale establishments. It was romantic & relaxed. We felt right at home. The service was top notch....friendly & efficient as one would hope. Our servers were always a nod away & ready to tend to all of our needs. The meal was simply fantastic. Our salads were crisp & fresh. We ordered the Chateaubriand for two & were blown away at the quality of beef & flavor. A nice touch was the final searing & butterfly filleting table side. Coffee was good. Dessert was shared as no room was left after the meal. We enjoyed every savory bite. The whole dinning experience has been one of our favorites to date.

tTKKDJUhqCcMmGE89QC97A.text: This is still a GOOD PLACE for steaks...  Since my last review, I've finally taken my boyfriend here for his birthday on May 21st, even though it was a day late, and he thought it was really good.  Given we had a lot of extra food, it was still a good dinner...  He loved the sides we had, and his cut of meat was perfect, as was mine as well...  Wish we could afford coming here ALL THE TIME, but I guess we'll have to see where our jobs will lead us...  Otherwise we may actually have to PAY to come to Vegas...  Still, to enjoy Emeril's steaks and his awesome food, it's most definitely worth it...  One day we'll try his fish house in MGM...

blPKWCRQq1fz9LE2f40bRQ.text: Delmonico's has good steak and appetizers. The atmosphere is okay and the interior design needs to be improved, but the food is delicious. The bread and butter was both cold.boo. The lobster soup was salty.eh. The barbecue shrimp is good. The rib-eye was really fatty. eh. The strip steak was yummy! The portions are big too. I wouldn't mind going back for the food, but I wasn't into their scene.

CCiNR_3notWMI-gq5sPrIg.text: delicious! but i was way too full from eating the days before to completely enjoy this place.  we started out with calamari and crab cakes. im not that into calamari but i thought the crab cakes were wonderful. the lobster bisque was super rich and creamy. yum. and it comes with what i thought was bread, but when you stir it into the soup, the bread somehow melts into great big chunks of lobster.  everybody got steak and i went with the ahi tuna, cuz i figured i could just get a taste of their steak. that didn't really go to plan cuz i just ended up eating everyone else's steak, especially my friend's bone in rib steak (med rare). hehe. but the tuna was still very good.  ended dessert with the bread pudding and creme brulee. i liked the bread pudding more because it was hot and it was topped off nicely with ice cream.

o-AbvwGoiIlSfgXysGxYJg.text: came here with a group of 16 for the fiance's 30th birthday weekend -- 14 adults plus 2 little kiddos (ages 4 and 6).  the service was outstanding!!!  our group of 16 had to be split into 2 circular tables next to each other which made it really difficult to socialize w/each other.  however i really really appreciated how attentive the waiters were, and they treated my little nephews really well too.  i was pleasantly surprised when they offered the boys kids meals consisting of grilled cheese sandwiches and french fries :)  now...for the food review.  first off i must clarify, i do not eat beef so my review is for the lamb chop.  lamb is usually a gamble for me because i only like it if its cooked right and does not smell lamb-ey.  my lamb chop was ehhhh.  the meat portion was HUGE, but only the outside was tasty.  the entire inside of my meal was verrrrry gamey -- which i do not like.  we ordered the creamed spinach, potatoes, and mushrooms to share.  they tasted like --- creamed spinach, potatoes, and mushrooms.  really nothing special.  everyone else seemed to enjoy their steaks, but if there's a next time maybe i'll try the pork chop instead.

Xo-GWN11HdhwUzlID2okxQ.text: By far the best steak I have ever had. We had dinner here to celebrate a friend's birthday. They met a few requirement we needed, a late reservation and corkage. Most places in Vegas don't do corkage and he was super attached to the wine that he brought.      The service was incredible. They were so attentive and well versed when it came to the menu. Out of the 6 people we had with us 5 were or are in the food industry. The man was an executive chef and the rest are fine dinning servers. Our servers kept them very happy.     The man and I shared the Cesar salad for two prepared table side. I had the Fillet Oscar style. It was honestly the best steak I had ever had. They were very generous with the crab and asparagus. The rest of our party dinned on rib eye, pork chop and the day's specials. It was all amazing. We finished off the meal with a banana creme pie. I don't really like banana cream. This was outstanding. Real sliced bananas with fresh creme, my god!     When the bill came were pleasantly surprised at how reasonable it was. A little over $500 for 6 people and 3 bottles of wine.   I can't wait to go back!

n8-fqAzbTWUeV1GRsq0UZA.text: Perhaps one of the best meals I have had! Service was excellent and very attentive. The petite rib-eye with bacon wrapped shrimp, garlic mashed potatoes with a sweet tomato reduction was more than excellent! The appetizer of ahi tuna and salmon tar tar was very tasty as well. My husband had told them that we were celebrating my birthday prior to our arrival. They didn't make a big fuss, but greeted us with a yummy mini-mushroom tart to start our meal and ended it with a creamy cheese cake and wished me a happy birthday in a very descrete way :-)  -- I'm not one for loud signing and being the center of attention.  Delmonico's is a very nice, classy place. We will be back for sure!

LplK-b2Hg_Mot4F8eCpVJg.text: Enjoyed the service typically expected for a nice Vegas restaurant.  I ate the rib eye steak cooked medium and was mouth watering.  The portion was big which I had to take home.  The environment is great for a dinner party, but may be loud for a date (we dined on a Wed night).

GNS3neAvwW_ogxyPO4kB8g.text: The best steak I ever had in Vegas!! I have been here three times and they have never disappointed. Every steak I have had has been perfectly cooked and seasoned. Caesar salad was perfect and the sides were tasty as well. Service is always friendly and ambiance is nice. With many choices, Emeril never seems to disappoint  and I'm truly a fan.

I1QgsrXl1TBp8doA2kjH6Q.text: in a nutshell:  -best service I've ever received in a restaurant.  They treat you like you are the owner, totally personal and attentive without ever being intrusive.  The wait team is on the ball with every facet of service  -Food was fantastic of course.  Got the bone-in filet (10oz) which was cooked perfectly, the missus got the filet medallions, which was a bit misleading as these were small steaks, not "medallions"!! Lot of food.  The side dishes are quite large, suitable for 3 or 4, so a party of 2 will have more than enough ordering just 1 side dish.    -The room is very nice. Uber minimal, nothing on the walls, just nicely sculptured archways and ceilings.  Very nice environment for a phenomenal meal.   The prices are high, esp considering side dishes are all a la carte, but nothing astronomical.  Figure around $100/person for a starter, entree, non-alcoholic drink, dessert, tax and 20% tip.

TCQr3nOIjWuM1_rwGuk43w.text: One of the worst dining experiences I have ever had.  The strip steak was sooooo bad, I finally asked to have it taken away and removed from my bill after the kitchen made2 efforts to correct it. My wifes salmon was dry. I also found it very poorly managed - had to walk among rows of extra chairs in the corridor (which needed cleaning and a fresh coat of paint) on my way to the restroom. DON'T BOTHER.

jl9bvijsu-UluPOJ9ZNmmA.text: Finally made it here after wanting to go for so many years.  From the moment we got there we were greeted by the hosting area and whisked away to our table.  They pulled the chairs out for me and my guest and made sure we were comfortable.  They even asked if I wanted my jacket placed on the empty seat next to me, wow.  Head waiter came over and introduced himself and his team that were going to serve us for the night.  Sommelier came over and asked if I need any help picking out a wine.  being the wine geek that I am I had no problem browsing thru the incredible list/book and picked out a delicious red burgundy.  We ordered the truffled potato chips and boy were they good, yummo.  We skipped on a big appetizer because we didn't want to get too full.  We both ordered the Bone In RIb Eye and it was one of the best steaks I have ever eaten that I was sucking the tasty bone with no shame.  One incredible meal and one of the best I have had in Vegas.  This is the place and I will be back for sure...

k4Jo3PHT_NjCP_-oRSBoCw.text: Outstanding service, an intimidating large wine list and great steaks.

bUJ7-Q6jzcJsI6o-o72Q7w.text: The steakhouse is like most traditional steakhouses. The decor was very clean and contemporary. The hostesses weren't all that attractive and would rate about a 5-6 in my scale of looks and their demeanor looked as if they did not really care to be there at all.   The dining area is half filled with patrons and business people alike chatting away about their day and how excellent the steak was prepared The beautiful burgundy high leather chairs is a nice touch and their seating area is plush and soft. The booth seating is a high suede sofa like seating and the tables were all lined with clean white linens and set in standard of most fine dining establishments.   I took my seat and I was greeted by the waiter and the captain and was asked about my choice of entree. I decided to go with their Filet Mignon and go with my good instincts that this would be the best choice. The chef prepared all the appetizers for a sampling. Classic jumbo shrimp cocktail, Parmesan truffle chips, classic Caesar salad, fried calamari, and mixed green salad.   The classic jumbo shrimp cocktail with a extremely spicy cocktail sauce wasn't as good as I expected. The shrimp were cooked well and the shrimp were presented beautifully, however, the spicy cocktail sauce did not please my taste buds or my nostrils for that matter. The sauce was like eating a handful of Wasabi.   The extremely addicting truffle Parmesan chips were EXCELLENT and should be ordered every time any patron enters this restaurant. The chips were drizzled with truffle oils and shaved Parmesan cheese and each individual chip melted as you put them in your mouth.   The classic Caesar salad had much to desire. The way the salad was prepared was not my idea of a good salad. It was literally a huge chunk of romaine lettuce with the heart in tact served with a plain and unappealing Caesar dressing. I don't like how fancy restaurants can slap a big chunk of romaine lettuce on a plate and call it a classic Caesar salad just to be different. Don't mess with a good thing!  The fried calamari was ok at best, not my favorite but definitely worth a taste. The mixed green salad was a way a salad should be prepared and had just the right amount of dressing. The waiter was attentive and knew what drinks were ordered. The plates were cleared but seemed like sometimes dead plates were left around. Not a good sign of service.   The entree finally came and the presentation could have been better but the Filet was ammmmazing. The steak knife cut through the Filet like a butter knife through room temperature butter. The steak was cooked to medium rare perfectly and encrusted with some New Orleans style spices. I truly enjoyed the Filet till the very last bite. One thing I do have to mention is the dessert. I would highly recommend the famous Emeril's banana cake. This thing was pure heaven and was absolutely delicious. I could not even describe it in words if I even tried so I won't! So you will have to try it for yourself.   Overall the experience was good, food was good but not the best I have tried, and the service was ok by my standards, but my standards can be high. My favorite parts were the Filet and the dessert, the appetizers once again could have been better with the exception of the truffle chips, mmm! delicious! I would recommend this place for dinner or lunch, however, the price can be a little daunting. I was calculating the totals of a appetizer, entree, and dessert and was estimating about 70-100 dollars a person with tip. That can look a little scary for some people, but for the meal and experience I'd say that was definitely worth it! Many thanks for reading. Till next time.

NZQ82r46ZKYITpiGtuOJ0w.text: Wonderful experience, food was fantastic and our Waiter, Lamont was top notch.

WtIWqoHjAruu__QYtBdtMA.text: So Mr Food Network himself Emeril has his own steak house.  One thing I know - is my steaks. Mmmmm Dry aged bone in rib eye....here just waiting to enter my watering mouth and be consumed by my emotional grinding of my mandibles. How can I forget - Truffle oil potato chips.  Popping my truffle oil cherry....Yum Ok I've never had fancy schmancy gumbo. But here it was very pleasant and chic. I mean come on - GUMBO - I WANT PIECES OF MEAT AND SEAFOOD AND OKRA..... Bone in RIB EYE - no more done than medium rare. Doesn't need any extra spices or sauces give me my meat plain. If I wanted it coated with jism. Well I can do it myself :) Steamed or grilled asparagus with hollandaise...Mmmmm I ate a lot...So I didn't have dessert like everyone else did. If I could I would have sucked on the bones. But that would have been a culinary faux paus. Bad Myke No sucking.....So How do they make the thick steak so dark and perfectly medium rare? Hmm...It's gotta be Keebler Elves performing magic. The service is impeccable. I went to the bathroom and put my napkin on my chair - just to find it folded neatly on my table.  Can we say Fancy Feast?

mZLHa9NCCX8WrKY1F1cmfA.text: I was in Las Vegas for work, so was dining alone. I had no reservation but was able to eat at the bar. I had the rib-eye steak medium rare with a side of asparagus. The rib-eye  was amazing. It had a beautiful char and was delicious. Service was excellent and attentive.   Definitely one of the best dining options in Vegas.

rZR4ohRh6QcClOwpEgwtFg.text: My boyfriend and I decided to eat one expensive meal in Vegas and chose Delmonico Steakhouse based on the Yelp reviews.  Yelpers know what they are talking about...the food was amazing!!!  We made reservations using OpenTable and when we arrived, they seated us towards the back of the restaurant and had already removed the extra 2 chairs at our table.  I was impressed!!  Most of the time, even if you make reservations, the restaurant still has to move the chairs and get the table ready.  Not Delmonico!  They were ready for us.  We ordered a bottle of white wine (even though I was having steak).  I don't remember what wine we had but it was good, even though it was a cheaper bottle.  For dinner, we started with the Caesar salad that they make tableside.  I'm not much of a Caesar salad fan but the boyfriend loves it.  The Caesar salad from Delmonico was amazing!  It tasted so fresh and crisp and the 'homemade' dressing was so good!  For entrees, the boyfriend ordered the pork chops and I ordered the filet mignon medallions.  We also shared a side of asparagus.  All of our food was excellent!    Just as an FYI, the pork chops were served with a side of mashed sweet potatoes (which I love!) but that wasn't mentioned on the menu.  The boyfriend kindly gave me the sweet potatoes in exchange for 1/2 of one of my filet medallions.  Speaking of the medallions, one of the top 5 steaks of my life!  I grew up in Oklahoma on a ranch where we had our own personal meat locker...so for me to say that Delmonico's filet medallions are one of the best I've ever tasted, that's definitely saying something!  Unfortunately, we were too full for dessert but thoroughly enjoyed our meal at Delmonico.  Just as a side note, the rolls before dinner are real dinner rolls with yeast!  I hate restaurants that serve dry, crusty rolls.

yNNyq2ahGbkv7hDPpQPMLg.text: I went in with high expectations.   The service was what I had expected, they were very attentive and were on top of our needs throughout our meal.  Our waiters were great!  We sat down, water was brought over very quickly, as did the little "wonton" topped with kalamata olives and proscuitto thing.  I wasn't very impressed by it, I guzzled my water.  By the time I looked up again, my water had been refilled.  WOW!  The waiter brought our bread and explained the menu.  Then she let us be to ponder upon her words.  I chose the scallops with creamed corn sauce.  They scallops were cooked perfectly and the corn chower had lobster in it!  It was 7 minutes in HEAVEN!  The mister and I both opted for steak.  He has the filet mignon and I had the bone-in NY strip.  We decided to share a twice baked potato with cheese and bacon.  His filet was just a filet.  My NY was HUGE!  If I had known it was going to be so large, I would have gotten a filet too.  I was only able to eat half of mine and was not able to have any potato.  The mister finished his steak and all the potato plus his bread which I didn't touch.  The steaks were cooked med-rare perfectly and seasoned.  I could have done without any seasoning on it but hey, that's how they came.  It wasn't ovewhemling in spices but enough that I didn't need any sauces besides the delicious butter just melting so erotically on the plate.  I was stuffed full of steak but I needed to satiate my sweet tooth.  We shared a pecan pie which came with a mound of ice cream.  The crust was absolutely fantastic and the pecans were not burnt.  We had no wine because we were just too dehydrated from the heat, water was all we needed.  I think the mister was slightly disappointed that his filet mignon wasn't as tender as the kobe steaks he is used to.  OH WELL!  I enjoyed my steak and I enjoyed being tended to like a princess.  I had a great night, it would have been better if the darn tables weren't' so close together.  I would have given it 5 stars, I just didn't like being able to hear what the people next to me were whispering about.  The prices were fairly reasonable for Vegas, we've spent double at Yamashiro's and Redondo Beach pier, plenty of times.  Don't let the dress code fool you too much.  There were so many people in there wearing jeans and shorts, I felt a bit over dressed in a cocktail dress and he was wearing a dress shirt and slacks.  The restaurant looked semi-formal, the people there were looking mighty touristy so the ambiance was slightly off.

xeQuks1wAs5GU-BZno1vgA.text: all i can say is WOW! I was in Vegas for many reasons and I wont get into them here, but this restaurant was amazing. the food was outstanding the the service was the best I've ever had. The atmosphere was very relaxing, and non pretentious. The appetizer that we had was fantastic! GO PRAWNS! and the steak was to die for. The several waiters that attended to us were extremely knowledgeable and the sommelie was top notch. If you ever get a chance to visit this place i highly recommend it! Emerile did a great job with this one.

iTj2iW1NLosW9VTAkmCFVA.text: Delmonico's is an interesting venue for dining.  My first impression was that the decor was very understated for a "quality dining"experience. As we waited a short time for our table to be prepared, we were invited to the lounge and bar - it was not impressive. The table selection, at first seemed unimpressive, but after a short while we began to appreciate our location. We were seated near the entrance to the dining room, but were hoping for a table deep into the interior. Asthe evening proceeded, we found that we could have a very fine conversation, while those dining well into the room had to raise the level of their conversation just to be heard over the din coming from  the remainder of the room.   The first component of the five star trating came with the extensive wine list. The wine list will amaze anyone. A selection for every taste .....   The service is also five star. Any need you have will be well attended at Delmonico's. I have a hard time believing that I went to one of the very best steakhouses in Las Vegas and ordered Salmon. I thought if Emeril Lagasse is associated with this steakhouse then the fish selections would be first rate. I was not wrong ! I enjoyed the crabcake appetizer -  it was just supurb. The BBQ Salmon was astoundingly good and cooked to perfection.  A wealth of flavor in every bite.  The steaks ordered by the rest of the table were huge and exceedingly good. The table shared a chocolate blackberry cake for desert and it was the perfect pair for a fine selection of tawny Port. Once again, the service provided by the staff was excellent throughout the meal.  Simply an amazing dining experience. First class all the way ...........

eH_zDrWgT1pm1bVH4LnXAQ.text: This has been the first time I've been disappointed going to a steakhouse in Vegas. We had a reservation for 8 and Delmonicos and everyone almost hated their steak or fish. I myself had a halibut, but also shared the ribeye. I also had a taste of the lobster bisque. the bisque was very good and could recommend that. but as for the halibut and steak, they were very salty. our whole table said the same thing about the steak and fish. we were very surprised that we were disappointed at an emeril restaurant. maybe the chef in the back had a bad day. in the end, you wont see me here again.

RRUbeX2hjNmszwZRBe_AzA.text: Service is to die for! Ambiance not so much. Floor molding and walls were dirty. Its filet mignon is very basic and if you expect flavor its not for you. Lastly, theyre white truffle chips and bbq shrimp appetizers are worth the price tag. I probably wont go back.

ywGTENpALoqFj9BrJWkmEg.text: We had lunch here. BBQ shrimp and salmon, both excellent. Emeril's food is fairly heavy so you will be filled. Everything was great. Lunch is cheaper than dinner and many of the same items are available.

tCpIO0BO1f916-Ch9nwewQ.text: A really great steak house. I've been told they have other things on the menu but I can never pull myself away from their steaks. If you love a good steak (I've heard the other food is very good too) then this is THE place in Vegas. The atmosphere is classy but relaxed. You can feel comfortable in jeans. It's pricey - it's Vegas. The service is very good to excellent. I wouldn't recommend this place for small children. And who cares about parking? It's Vegas, baby!

8wT-ZtmOIUT8kOPpOrAZkA.text: 4 Star for the whole experience and 5 stars for the stake. This is the best Steak I have, beating every restaurant by a mile.   For appetizer, we ordered Classic Steak Tartare, it came with bread and dip too, it just vaporized in our mouth. And ordered antipasto for the table to get us warmed up. The presentation of each item deserves a standing applause.   We were four of us, but we ordered plenty of items to pamper ourselves.  For Main entre, we ordered Ribeye, Filet Mignon, ROASTED HEIRLOOM TOMATO RAVIOLI, Truffle and Parmesan Potato chips and for the desert Caramel Butter Cake and DUCK EGG CREME BRULEE, WOW.   We had a Vegetarian friend, the choices are too less and for that choice, the quantity was too little. They had to ordered two main entre along with appetizers to fill the tummy.  Wiating might be a problem to visit on a rush day, but we were lucky. Ambience is very sophesticted, formal dressing would be nice.  Also we ordered couple of wine bottles, one was cahors wine clos la coutale, the other was too hazy to remember.   Overall, this place is just worth to visit for their medium rare Steak, Yumm

-u3bctty_2OucZGaHsRxQA.text: OMG, it is exquisite dining. All steak are around 60$. But we got 20z angus beef steak for two with preparation at side table for 150$. It was very nice setup and presentation, worth every penny. I recommend getting at least one appetizer or entry that has side table preparation. The steak was so delicious one the best we have across the globe. Do not go more than medium on steak, because the meat was tender and beautiful. Enjoy. It has also very romantic ambiance.

XcpvkInG2YhKbxIBs4Vg-Q.text: Lord... this place is amazing!!!! Every time I come to Vegas I make sure to eat here. The salmon is cooked so well! Lobster bisque is my new favorite. Definitely worth the price and the flight to Vegas

mVHmiYzyKOLNuHlZjHDvHQ.text: Had a nice bday party for a friend here.  There was a mishap with one of our friends who were dining with us but the staff was extra accommodating as a result.  I got this extremely tender 16 ounce steak-- charred on the outside but cooked a perfect medium on the inside.  Good place to wow some guests while in Vegas. Emeril is my favorite celebrity chef.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16 ounce prime steak with a side of mash potatoes.  Great!

9AJWnGLnl10VymDHR3zsxA.text: Came here for a small business meeting while out in Vegas for a trade show.  The meal was arranged by our hosts, or else we might've not picked it.  However, I'm happy to say we had a very enjoyable visit with good food and good company.  We started off with the seafood tower.  Yummy shrimp for me and crab legs, lobster tail, tuna tartare and oysters for everyone else.  A fun appetizer for a group.  Everything was fresh and tasty!  I wasn't overly hungry when I went, so I kept my meal pretty light with the ravioli appetizer.  This was very good; perfect for something small but filling.  Hubby decided on the sea bass, which he gets a lot at various restaurants.  He really enjoyed it and said it was cooked perfectly.  The whole table split some sides:  creamed spinach (not overly creamy but still tasty), creamed corn (the BEST!) and fingerling potatoes (nothing special but liked them).  And of course, dessert could not be missed even though I was verging on miserable.  Churros were stinking good and the key lime pie might very well be the best I'd ever tasted.  Overall, a good meal.  An A-OK visit.  I will admit once I discovered this was an Emeril restaurant, I expected to be wowed on like 17 different levels. I wasn't, but I still enjoyed it all the same.

z7aRhy2BIAGeoA9jFxqWIw.text: A completely unremarkable experience. Let's be clear, most of us aren't going to this kind of place just for a $60 steak - we're going for the experience of an upscale steakhouse.  This restaurant doesn't know what it wants to be. It's not old-school enough to be a classic steakhouse, and it's not contemporary enough to be cool. It feels very much like a hotel restaurant, lacking any distinct character.  It was a little disappointing to arrive for our reservation, and to have the hostess simply say "your table will be ready in a few minutes". No invitation to sit in the lounge, or to get a drink at the bar. We kind of stood awkwardly in the foyer area until we were called after a couple of minutes.   After that, the service was pretty great. The head waiter and waiter were friendly and attentive, and would fit well in a classic steakhouse that doesn't take itself overly seriously. Please excuse the snobby words you are about to read, but, to go back to expectations of an establishment like this - I found it a bit of a miss that my beer bottle and glass were brought to the table but not poured, and that the crumbs were not cleared from the table between our soup/salad/popover starters and the main course.  For dinner, we had the 16 oz ribeye, filet mignon, and sides of potato gratin and asparagus. The potato was easily the star of the meal - absolutely delicious and served in a hot serving dish - and the asparagus was well prepared. The meat itself was fine, prepared as ordered, but unexceptional. The ribeye's seasoning was ordinary (no Creole uniqueness), and the filet was almost over-seasoned which detracted from the cut itself.  Overall, if you're seeking an upscale steak dinner, look elsewhere. This is an average experience and not at all on par with other establishments. Since it is probably the most inexpensive of the steakhouses in the Strip area, I imagine it would be good for a larger group that wants a steakhouse outing.

SI3mNlsgG4K4t_Z-UmqjQA.text: Wow! Just have to say this place was amazing! Worth every penny! Michael our server was the best! Food was fantastic! Not one bad thing... thank you so much and I will be back :)

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uC9PNle2FLPLahdIMUFJNw.text: What's not fun about a birthday in Vegas! Steakhouses are a dime a dozen in Sin City so like anything you have to choose carefully. My friend took over the reigns this evening having dined here before but soon become too ill to even enjoy his dinner. That's what a day of drinking will do to someone. The restaurant itself is nice but super quiet and more of a older crowd. I personally prefer a more upbeat energetic vibe when I am out in Vegas. The food was nothing special, my filet was prepared medium rare but lacked anything spectacular. Service was also so so our server changed maybe three times and the best part about the dinner was when we got the check. I'm sure it was an off night but the restaurant wasn't busy and maybe that says something as well.

h3jD50RO1WY15IB2BH2sAA.text: Looking back, the two star I gave it was too generous. You go to a steak house for the food. The ambiance and hospitality is second. Went to Maestros Ocean club last weekend for our one year anniversary and Morton's for my birthday just to remind me what a disappointment Delmonicos was. Should be ashamed of themselves.

d10nvqOFJhVr5CQy2vo9dg.text: The appetizers are where it is at. Barbecue shrimp is divine. Popover bread is excellent. Truffle chips, shrimp cocktail all great. Service is great.   Let's talk about meat. For the prices this meat should be perfection. Nope. Tough, overcooked and flavorless.   My mom and sister ordered the ribeye medium rare and it came out tough and overcooked. My sister NEVER complains. She hates it. And even she said something. The manager came over and spoke to her and said "so you're sending half back?" And walked away almost rolling his eyes. My mom and sister split the steak. My sister was hungry and powered through. My mom could not. And his attitude was just gross.   Two stars for apps and service of the main waitress. The rest docked for sub sub sub par steaks and an jerk manager with nasty 'tude.

zg-p_uPzGBYmw2SB1wXP7g.text: I try to make this a regular stop on my annual work trip to Vegas and for the last three years I've succeeded! Delmonico never disappoints, from the salmon special I had 3 years ago, to the angus beef medallions two years ago and the angus tenderloin salad I had this year. Every meal has been cooked, seasoned and presented to perfection. My only complaint is they should give an entire basket of the "puffy air bread" dinner rolls, instead of just one (they're delicious. I'm sure they would if asked but I don't want to be THAT guy, even tho I guess I am now).

iXSThRI4WjglF2yULx5XbA.text: We have dined here several times and always loved it but tonight was especially good.   Michael Jackson Jr. was our Captain, he and his team made sure EVERY SINGLE DETAIL was covered!  We had The Heirloom Tomato Salad, Truffle and Parmesan Potato Chips, and Lobster Bisque to start. Entrees followed with a perfectly cooked Filet, Grits, Asparagus, and Carpaccio. The food was spectacular and so was the service.   We ended with a birthday card for my husband with delicious desserts to finish off our meal.   It was just a perfect evening!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Rl9BsqyAiOUlGAw2Ezxhsg.text: Went here for our anniversary and it was amazing!  The service was on point. We were taken care of by multiple people. We ordered the scallop special appetizer she my husband tried the gumbo. Both were delicious! The scallops were cooked perfectly. The steaks were cooked to perfection and the sides ( smashed potatoes) were great. The banana cream pie was to die for. I will dream of this pie. They gave us a complimentary banana sorbet to go with it and it was perfect. I'd go back in a heartbeat and next time I won't make the mistake of eating lunch beforehand!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana cream pie and banana sorbet

-w8T39KtxQuHtreIE1R0yA.text: Returning customer to a restaurant with many delicious eats. After sampling a few different appetizers: Oysters, BBQ Shrimp, Truffle Potato Chips.... the Oysters trumped ALL! A petite filet with side options of brussel sprouts, creamed spinach, mushrooms, and mashed potatoes were filling and all done quite well.  To end the dinner with an Emril BAM, go for only the GOLD, with the pecan pie. Delmonico's you definitely did not disappoint! Thank you!

Yb7zeJIHD9C2ZZEkTd9L3w.text: Was excited to come here but while the food was fine there weren't any standouts. Started with French onion soup, the Caesar salad and deviled eggs. The eggs were the best of the three. The Caesar was kind of disappointing once it was prepared tableside. Lacked flavor.   My husband had the surf and turf special. He ordered it well done but it came out red so we sent it back. I got the bone in ribeye which was fine but nothing special. The baked potato was also only mediocre.   Dessert was probably the highlight. The butterscotch pudding was excellent.   Even though the food didn't stack up to my expectations the service was excellent. Very attentive and accommodating.

pYJc_cXoqbOF70gSjRsPuw.text: It was late when we arrived and no reservations, but it was no problem to get a table. The place was full and the server was fantastic. When ask what was the best on the menu he gave us a couple of great recommendations. We went with the 22 oz bone in ribeye. It was to die for, and the sides were great. We will go there again in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zNJX_aIZybDYpmDzSa0B8A.text: The ribeye here is consistently delicious and there is a very nice upscale vibe here. We enjoy paying a visit here anytime we are in town.

DyC1raEnz0-jwiWRkSDTgw.text: The bread starter was nice. It's more of a popover than a piece of bread. The truffle chips were ok, I'm taking my parties vote here since I can't stand truffle oil. The creekstone angus sandwhich was awesome. Like a cross between focaccia and ciabatta bread filled with tender pieces of nicely salted steak, roasted mushrooms and onions, and a very fitting horseradish mayo. I liked it so much I almost ordered a second but it was very filling. The onion rings were not special but the sandwich more than made up for it. The banana creme parfait was also good and lightly sweet which I prefer. The rest of the party enjoyed the duck egg creme brulee. Pretty classy place overall and we were lucky it was the end of lunch so we had the place to ourselves.

Gwj-j_6rE6AyVLMtkY1prw.text: Excellent! They serve the most wonderful popovers with butter while waiting for your food. We had the scallops for appetizer and they were perfectly seared with the most delicious gnocchi on the side. The steaks are amazing and perfectly cooked. Absolutely delicious. The creamed spinach was excellent and had a unique flavor. We discovered that they used nutmeg in it which sounds interesting. Great service and amazing food. Pricey but not too formal.

1fSChY8o-8OWojBxexEraw.text: Delmonico is owned by Emeril, I think. I would not bet my life on that, but I am pretty sure it is. No matter, it is some the best steak you will ever have in your life. If you are there for a special occasion let them know in advance. Maybe they will give you a yummy desert. They have a gumbo that is just so wonderful, it is hard to describe, it it thick, but not so thick you are so full you can't eat anything else. All of the steaks are the best and cooked to perfection. Know, that if you order it rare, that is what you will get. They know exactly how to make a steak. All of the appetizers are great. The wine list is over priced, like most of Las Vegas, so have it if you must, but maybe just a drink is better. The deserts are so tasty. You will love Delmonico's and you want to return. Enjoy.

OEAoQnu7qt9zhxh6hUAlRQ.text: Every single bite was a feast in my mouth! Great service, lovely ambiance and food was Extraordinary! Thank you!

5bNXzHNMO8lI_sJj-ilUEA.text: Classic a la cart steakhouse. Had dinner with three business guests. Excellent service and excellent steaks. I recommend the mouth watering fillet. So tender, It could be eaten without a knife! Get reservations for this place, it can get busy.

DqmGICsMu16YttevGUZCjg.text: My boyfriend and I recently dined at Delmonico Steakhouse while on vacation in Las Vegas. We really enjoyed our experience. First and foremost, the service was exceptional. The staff was professional and attentive. Just a couple minutes before our entrees had arrived, my boyfriend stepped away from the table. Our server brought plate covers to keep our food warm while I waited for him to return. I noticed that our server was lingering within eye-shot of our table so that he could remove the warmers when my boyfriend returned to the table. I was very impressed. The food was also amazing. I got the lobster bisque to start and the filet Oscar style as my entree. The lobster bisque was the best I have ever had. The filet was really flavorful and tender. The crab was wonderful and the bearnaise was exceptional. My boyfriend got the baby iceberg lettuce salad to start and the Wagyu ribeye as his entree. We also got the broccoli as a side. He liked the salad pretty well and his ribeye was wonderful. We would definitely eat here again.

RQvZLCH3SMRhV4GRRL8Yvg.text: This was my best meal of the week during a week of great meals in Las Vegas.  Delmonico's is Emeril LaGasse's take on a modern American steakhouse.  For my money, Emeril nails it.  The service here was excellent.  The atmosphere was American classic.  The noise level was moderate.  We were able to have a very good conversation where the whole table of 6 was engaged the entire time.  The cocktail menu was imaginative and the Old Fashioned's tasted nearly as good as mine.  The wine list was interesting and navigated well by one of my work colleagues.  The popovers to start as the bread option was a nice touch.  Popovers were "a thing" in my youth, my Mom loved them, and for me it's always sweet to have them in a restaurant.  For my entree I had the filet mignon and it was perfect.  Others in our party had the bone in rib eye and the bone in sirloin ... all were happy.  We ordered 3/4 of the sides on the menu and all were well done.   We all ordered dessert and 1/2 the table went with the banana cream pie and the other 1/2 with key lime, both were good, but the key lime was the winner.  The net-net for this Yelper is that I would be happy to go back here anytime.  Delmonico rates 5 stars and two thumbs up.

tTD3wegtsiHOjVTLgsb7FA.text: On yelp 5 stars = Woohoo! as good as it gets! Delmonico's Steak was perfect. I got the 9oz filet mignon and the inside was perfectly cooked and the outside was perfectly charred. The rest of my dinner party got the boneless ribeye and the waygu ribeye and I got to tried both and they were both very good. For sides - creamed spinich, mushrooms and brussels sprouts - 5 stars. The food did take longer than I expected to arrive and I did not love the decor but I would definitely go back.

osEYrKbh_SI4WGZ9EsAwZQ.text: I'm hardly ever in Vegas, and when I am here it's #rage before #forage (hah, hah), so I must admit that I've only tried a handful of Vegas' steakhouses.   However, what I can tell you is that Delmonico's BONE IN RIBEYE ($55) is absolutely divine. One of the best ribeyes I've ever had, LA and Vegas combined.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana cream pie to end the meal. So awesomely dense
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in aged rib eye. SOOOOO GOOD
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared foie gras toast. SO AMAZING

jF5o9G-bSLpy3W-tJmFfRw.text: I think this place can serve bologna sandwiches and still get a 5-star rating solely based on how good their customer service and wait staff is here! We started out with the fried oysters and the petite wedge salads. The oysters were incredibly fresh and crispy. Do the pro move and ask the waiter to bring out some crystals hot sauce to put on the top if you really want to make it Cajun, also smeared some blue cheese on top of mine from my wife salad which made it over the top good. For the main course we split the Chateaubriand and the cut was really  nice and seasoned and came with a side of asparagus and Lebanese potatoes. On our next visit I think we will stick with getting just the bone in ribeye as it looked a little better and then ordering our sides ala carte. For dessert we had the banana cream pie which was not overly sweet and the contrast  with the chocolate shavings on top giving it that slight bitter taste mixing with that creamy goodness.  The cappuccino was very good and was the excellent end cap to an extraordinary meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana cream pie
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chataubriand!
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite wedge salad

hx7yzmPni5b3utlwy-jQfA.text: Five waiters for our table.  Table service was flawless, anticipatory and executed exemplarily.  Fresh cut flowers.  Immaculate white linens.  Excellent wine list--featuring Reds and Bordeaux in particular.  Every course was impeccably good.    The bone-in Rib Eye steak and Filet mignon were truly succulent.  The Creme Brulee was unparalleled.  I recommend this restaurant with highest regard.

2-HINIDSLboIvxkpw_m7Yw.text: I've walked by Delmonico and stopped to look at the menu many times as I've gone through restaurant row on my way to/from the parking garage at the Palazzo.  With a show later, I made an early reservation for Delmonico.  I was promptly greeted and seated.  I knew the steaks were large unless I got a petit filet (not my favorite cut of steak) so I ordered a bone in ribeye, a side of cheesy grits with bacon, and then bread pudding for dessert. I had a trio of servers who took good care of service.    I ordered the steak cooked blue and it was close to that but a bit beyond.  The steak was quite average.  The steak was pre-seasoned and it was OK.  The star of dinner was the cheesy grits with bacon.  They were very good!  The bread pudding was white chocolate macadamia nut with creme Anglaise.  It was OK, too.  The dinner never had any wow factor to merit the prices charged.  Things were average except the grits.  I thought the dried branches on the poinsettia on the wall by my table reflected the lack of attention to detail one would expect of a high end restaurant like Delmonico.    Service was very good and the servers were friendly but I left feeling somewhat disappointed.  Well, at least there'll be no need to stop and peruse the menu anymore.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread pudding.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesy grits with bacon.
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry aged bone in rib eye.

_-DnG-Uf800EVtvgEPqtvw.text: Had an amazing experience here. Went for my boyfriends birthday and received amazing customer service from Todd and Israel (?). They really made this night special for the both of us. We had the lobster bisque to start which was sooo mouthwatering. My bf had their bone in prime rib that he loved. I too was picking off his plate half the time because of how good it was. I had the sliders but they were nothing special. Get the mashed potatoes! All their sides were big enough to share. All in all we definitely got our money's worth and will make dining here a habit every time we visit Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thank you for the birthday card!

bzE8K5bnI3QrVCJfzYCmWg.text: Food and service spectacular.    Food was perfectly prepared.  Restaurant is pricey but well worth it and happy to spend the money there. Ask for Nicole, very nice sever.  Caesar Salad made table-side the proper way.  Haven't seen it down correctly in many years

ohkJtNRJqIp_iLAQyOHfDQ.text: I was really excited to eat here!  The food was pretty good but nothing special.  The waiter was kind of a jerk to my boyfriend over his choice of beer which apparently wasn't up to the waiter's standards.  And it just continued.  It made the night not very comfortable and we didn't stick around long.  I don't think I'll be back again.

q4275NVw9p_iiyr-WDlubQ.text: I hear about all these places that is voted number one for this reason or that reason. Some have titles as "the best steak house on the north end of town". Any time a variable is add to the title I usually questions it. But when I found we had seats at This place I went to google.   "Best steakhouse in Vegas" I read with no extra words to misled the public. Now I'm ready.   First thing i noticed is the low lighting and Elegant atmosphere. First glance you would think this place is strictly for high rollers with a private jet parked across the street. However it wasn't a strict dress code.  I saw customers with  tailored suits as we'll as shorts and polo shirts. My suggestion would be to step it up a little bit simply because you are in Vegas.   I will not talk about the price of the meal because when I used Yelp to checking I got a high rollers badge. That means his place is very expensive. Let's just say it was 12 of us and the bill was over $1200 dollars.   I ordered a drink called "THE BRONTE SISTERS" that came to the table in a mid Evil looking copper glass. Then I order another and another. Best drink I've ever had. Beware there isn't any prices on the drink menu but these babies run about 16 bucks. Yikes (disclaimer: I had a good day at the crap tables so I could splurge a bit)   For started I ordered an Emeril Lagasse BBQ Shrimp with fresh baked Rosemary biscuit. The biscuits was very small but so freaking tasteful. After all the shrimp was devoured I was left with this amazing sauce on the bottom of the plate. If I didn't care if people looked at me like a homeless man with his first meal I would've licked the plate. No lie it was that good.  When the waiter took my plate with all that sauce left I felt like i violated a crime in flavor town.   Now the real reason I'm writing this review THE BONE IN DRY AGED RIBEYE. lord have mercy on my taste buds. Best steak ever.  All that needs to be said.  This is the drop the mic moment and walk off stage.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry age bone-in ribeye.  Best steak ever

6D-KwWsfVd25r4EYaRyWrw.text: TexasTripletMom's Best Burger in America List - Ranking Honorable Mention  The service was exceptional. The food was great. What i'm specifically ranking is their burger.   Ladies and Gentlemen, I am a well reputed burger aficionado. I'm a burger snob. Be it greasy spoon or gourmet i'm on a perpetual hunt of the best burger in America. That illusive cheeseburger is my Moby Dick.   You must understand, to be top ten worthy -- a burger really must impress. It must cause unmitigated joy - a giant grin - and compulsive participation in what I call "The happy burger dance". While Del Monico makes a delicious burger, I aspire to something simply ONE step above where this burger stands.   There's nothing wrong with it really. The ingredients are top notch. Kudos for the richest REDDEST, fully Flavorful tomatoes I have EVER seen served on a burger in America. We're talking tomatoes a southerner with a home garden would be proud of. We're not talking those waxy pink tomatoes most ppl use. Or the red ones without flavor. We're talking picked from the vine still warm from the sun ripe.  The steak burger is two fisted burger. Juicy 'slutty' beef (any burger that'll soak my fries with juices is fondly known as a slutty burger) sadly the meat was without remarkable flavor, mildly seasoned. A purist burger, sesame seed bun. Melty cheddar bacon good flavor not great -- no crisp.   The Fries fried in bacon fat, crispy not dirty. Low flavor still good. Purist fries .  Soft bread and butter pickle chunk atop a good clean pure burger without sass.   Huge.  So big I wasn't sure if I ate it or it ate me. Honestly, this was the biggest burger I've ever tried to eat on my own. I think I made it halfway through. *LOL*  Good plain burger, well executed. A purist burger. Exceptional quality ingredients with nice flavor only it lacks the artful symphony of flavors I need to happy dance. I did cracked a smile but no happy dance. And that's why this burger only ranks *Honorable Mention* (about #11 on my list)  Put some seasoning on that meat. Add a little garlic powder to that salt and pepper. Bring your A game and give that burger some sass, we know you know how to bring the sass Emeril!

Xp3ppynEvVu1KxDHQ3ae8w.text: Delmonico Steakhouse is a steakhouse owned by Emeril Lagasse, located inside the Venetian/Palazzo Hotel & Casino. They are known for steaks.   We started our meal with the Seafood Tower. The Tower has lobster, shrimp, tuna, oysters, Alaskan king crab. Wow, talk about a carnival in your mouth! The Seafood is fresh and sweet.  I ordered the bone-in ribeye. It was a very large cut! It could have easily been shared. The steak comes a la carte so you have to also order side dishes. The sides are mostly vegetables as options (broccoli, scalloped potatoes, creamed spinach, asparagus, mushrooms). The steak was cooked perfectly and it was perfectly seasoned too. The sides were delicious too.  At Dessert time, You must try Emeril's signature Banana Cream Pie. It is nice and light. Not sweet, light, just right. It is my most favorite dish at Emeril's restaurants! A must try!  Delmonico's is pricey but delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel butter cake
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. German chocolate cake
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Famous Banana Cream Pie.

5Im_64tPce7troYcJQv_Qw.text: We recently came here for our second time for our anniversary. We were craving a seafood tower and we had liked this place before and we were in the Venetian.   We sat in the bar and had a wonderful server. Very personable, accommodating and very nice. The atmosphere is still the same great upbeat, fun and relaxing (yes all at the same time). The drinks were good as well.  The thing that lacked was the seafood tower. The highlight of the meal, the thing we were looking forward to the most, what we were drooling for. A couple of the dipping sauces were delicious but their substitute for cocktail sauce tasted like marinara sauce. Overly sweet and not a good mix with shrimp. Maybe I am biased because I love the kick of horseradish in my cocktail sauce. The biggest complaint though, was the seafood felt dry or freezer burned. We still ate it because I wasn't going to let them waste the food and was in too much of a good mood to complain, but for the $, maybe I should have.   So this trip was a love hate. We got way better service but the food lacked and isn't that what should rock my world at a restaurant of this caliber?

tUMhtFFSZyOazeC5Mwro5g.text: After a quick drink at Public House, I was feeling pretty good, and hungry, and a little buzzed. Here's how my conversation with our waiter began:  Me: "What kind of bread is this?" Waiter: "They're popovers sir." Me: "Has anyone ever commented that they're shaped like dicks?"  Waiter: "Haha, no sir, very good observation sir."   Yup, their popovers were pretty much shaped like dicks. They were a bit cold, oily, and combined with the refrigerated butter (one of my pet peeves at restaurants), a big disappointment. Despite the phallic start to dinner, the rest of the meal and service was excellent.   The recommended lobster bisque was a great way to cleanse my palate of that bread. There were big chunks of lobster meat and the bisque was well-seasoned without going overboard with the salt. Delmonico is known for their bone-in ribeye so I ordered that medium-rare. The steak was more on the medium side, but no complaints here as it was just as juicy and tender. No steak is complete without a side of creamed spinach, which was done well. All sides are portioned to be shared. Despite a misstep with my friend's order (bone-in NY strip instead of boneless), service was spot on.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popovers shaped like what you&#39;re thinking
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamed spinach
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in ribeye

qt_eHK0-ibTaisVby6L-PA.text: Hands down the best Ribeye I have ever had!! I've been to a lot of steak houses in Vegas and this place definitely know their steak!   I went here for my birthday with my family. We started off with the cheese assortment! Great! A perfect blend of cows milk, sheep's milk and goats milk cheeses from mild to sharp! The almonds and honey rounded the dish off nice. For the main course We each had a different cut of meat. That was so we could "share experiences" and explore the menu. It was a great idea. I had Ribeye, my husband had the bone in ribeye, my brother had the filet and my mother had the filet prime special. Omg! All was juice, perfectly cooked and promptly brought to the table! Our sides were delectable!! Creamed corn and potatoes gratin accompanied the steaks perfectly. Honestly, the only thing lacking in my opinion was the overly simple decor! Other than that I'd return in a heartbeat!

jJtuLt-u5ImZ4xbXpLsj-Q.text: This was a fabulous meal with tremendous service. If you are going to splurge while in town this is the place!  I had the Piedmontese steak. The. Best. Steak.  Unbelievable flavor - I had no idea steak could taste this good. It was served with roasted garlic in the clove - a personal favorite!!  My husband and I shared the Caesar salad for two (made tableside). The salad was great- the tableside experience was neat.   The service was spot on. Perfect execution.

2Ebi2fyQYAC1Evn8JZg2DA.text: After three years of waiting, I finally found myself back to Delmonico Steakhouse. Why did I come here out of all the other excellent steak houses on the Las Vegas strip?  1 reason: Truffle Parmesan potato chips. they are like crack, you simply can't stop eating them :)  I ordered the Certified Piedmontese steak, NY Strip steak ($60), grilled in olive oil, sea salt, roasted garlic and rosemary. At 16 ounces, each tender bite was worth every dollar.  Girlfriend ordered the grilled cheese sandwich with tomato soup and said it was very good.  Service is impeccable with a three person staff dedicated to your table and they make your experience worth the high price tag that is at Delmoncio!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Compliments of the  chef,  since  I am  a regular here  :) Slice  cucumber  with  salsa  and fresh  mozzarella  cheese  on top
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1RODVHSTQ3C5T7j7YVreBg.text: Wide whiskey selection, excellent bartenders. I'm assuming the food was good, but even though I came four days in a row I never made it past the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nrd5fF6lirgivpY1ywwidA.text: I had such a delicious dinner at this restaurant!! First it was the only restaurant that I could find on OpenTable that would accommodate a party of eight.   That was very helpful since we were all in Vegas for a race the next day.  Our lead server, Tom, was spectacular!  He was truly helpful in giving us recommendations and extremely knowledgeable about the menu.    I got the barbecue shrimp which was phenomenal. The shrimp was done to perfection and the sauce was delicious. The biscuit was a little bit hard but not as important as everything else.  They also served popovers on the table instead of bread. The popovers were chewy and gummy and I would've preferred some other type of bread on the table. Maybe they're not fantastic at making bread.   I got the special of a bone in filet mignon cooked rare. The rare was done perfectly! I was very impressed.  I also got the grits and the creamed corn for side dishes. Their grits were a little bit grainy for my taste although the flavor was good. The creamed corn was fabulous!  Our table pretty much ordered one of every dessert. I ordered the banana cream pie based on a friend's recommendation. I have to say that was not my favorite but that's because I don't care for bananas in my dessert. My bad since I knew that. The banana cream pie was extremely dense with bananas. However I traded with another friend who got the pecan pie in the oatmeal cookie crust. Oh my gosh that was heaven!!    The dinner was superb and the service was excellent! I would return here again in the future and I would recommend it to anyone visiting Vegas.

vs01LhR4gPeCt-z1ZKF4Pg.text: Went here with friends at 1030 p.m. following the marathon and amazed that they let my husband in while wearing his running attire as this is truly fine dining and he looked extraordinarily out of place.  After losing an undisclosed amount of money, I wasn't really in the mood to eat yet another expensive meal; however...  I was prepared for high prices and adequate food but my oh my was I in for a pleasant surprise... at least on 50% of the expectations.  Food Fabulous and Prices were indeed expensive but I have to say worth the full experience.  My husband shared the Chateaubriand Carved Tableside for Two, Asparagus and Garlic Smashed Potatoes for  $110 - Same as the Filet however, it comes with sides and costs less.  It was prepared PERFECTLY and was delicious from the first bite to the last bite.    Other sides folks had and loved were: New Orleans Creamed Spinach;  Twice Baked Potato with Bacon and Vermont Cheddar The wine we chose (we asked for a med-full bodied red with a smooth finish and complex aromas that didn't cost more than $100 or $1000 (see photo of wine prices)  He actually suggested something for around $60 or so and it was exquisite!   Chappellet Mountain Cuvee 2009.  Add this to your to do list in Vegas and go hungry!!  Don't be shy to ask for a wine within your price range... they don't carry any bad wines so why pay a thousand bucks for wine?  LOVED THIS RESTAURANT!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bAjDQn9n_A0Y1XWRBh6k3w.text: Disappointed. Steak overdone while waiter have come 4 times to ask everything okay. Well will not come next time.

HgYoMSehtggmKi6ivKxkdA.text: Couldn't possibly begin to describe the incredible everything about this restaurant.  It is not for the cheque shy but the service was excellent and the food was better.  Don't skip the crazy expensive but devine Cesar salad; sounds silly even as I add to my review.

q2QMGl113WFDNo_r1g5xlQ.text: Celebrated our anniversary with a staycation at the Palazzo. We went here for dinner and had eaten here before. It impressed us again. I asked them to make us Parmesan steak fries cooked in truffle oil. They went iron chef on us and obliged without a question! Great meal all the way around!

photos.caption: Photo of Delmonico Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Custom made steak fries!

NwwrPp43EDR7Ok_veujnEw.text: I recently entertained clients here.  I made my reservation over Open Table.  Originally I had made for 4 people, then wanted to add one more guest.  They told me several times that there was no way they could fit another chair at the table.  Ok.  We get there, and there is a private party going on - but in the lobby/bar/wait area.  What?  That's a bit disturbing.  They sat us in the lounge area and we ordered drinks (which never came).  Then our "table" was ready.  Well this was the end table which basically was in the lounge area.  So we moved over one table.   The wine list is very in depth and almost overwhelming.  Just give me a good red with my meat is not the way to go here.  No simplicity.
