I order my steak Med Rare (even though I like it bloody) because I've found in the past nicer steakhouses tend to cook on the rare side. True to form, it was cooked amazingly well. Very pink, and extremely tender. Every bite seemed to remind me of a fillet which is unusual for that cut of meat, it just melted in your mouth then, after my date made sure I wouldn't offend anyone by asking if they minded me chewing on the bone like a dog with table scraps ;) - I did just that   I'd also like to mention that if you have a choice, I would ask for Todd to be your server, he was a delight to talk to, and payed us a lot of attention - which is more than I can say for the staff at Stack inside the Mirage :(   Our entire bill was only $110 and we were both full and satisfied. I would go back to Delmonico's again in a heartbeat.

pKJoYreuDM6iHCQT-UXoaQ.text: This place is consistently spectacular in terms of food and service. Polished and professional, the service is hard to fault. The wonderful table side caesars salad to the gumbo to the perfectly cooked steaks, they know what they are doing.  Delmonico has been around quietly for a long time. It has always been and still is a great restaurant.

LiRLUFtSrDMO8Vb76bOwVA.text: Outstanding lobster bisque and gumbo. Got a bit loud at times with large groups, but we enjoyed a delicious ribeye and filet. Both are good choices.

iXUtnkAS3-tFp0qaw1sRuQ.text: Took my girlfriend to Vegas for her birthday (and secretly, to propose), and was planning to take her to a nice dinner.  Went to Delmonico on a suggestion from a trusted friend, and damn, glad I did.  He may be annoyingly over the top on TV, but Emeril and company know what they're doing.  Right from the beginning wait to be seated, until the ending dessert and coffee, we had a great time with great food.  In a "that is so Vegas" twist, our waiter looked like Wayne Newton.  They were great on recommending drinks and pick of entrees, and answered all questions off the menu.  Service was even to such a level that they helped my lady with her seat, which is good, since the chairs are heavy.   As to the food. . . *glarg* *drool*  Sorry, I get moisture in my mouth thinking about it.  Shrimp the size of my thumb after I hit it with a hammer covered in a fantastic spicy cream sauce, steak that you could cut with a spoon, a portion of the most tender venison I've ever had, that was just as good when cold the next day (because I couldn't eat all of it), a martini that made it harder to walk out of there than the amount of food I ate, incredible desserts, and well, an espresso menu that involved such quality coffee I had no idea coffee that good existed.  I don't eat at high caliber steakhouses on a weekly basis or anything, but I've been to a few, and it's not like DC has a shortage of them given the wealth there.  Vegas is the same sort of way -- artificial city with lots of money -- and damn if Delmonico didn't top anything I've had so far when it comes to high caliber steak places.    And in case you're wondering -- she said yes.  I'm sure that was in part due to this dinner. ;)  ~EEE~

5vXHxbEE_a-A_fRcAfmGuA.text: Not worth the money. It was not that great, food was just plain. I had Rib Steak and New York. It wasn't cooked the way a wanted. I had to send it back. They recooked the same piece. And it came up dry with a big slab of unmelted butter on top to cover up. Almost made me sick. Not worth the money not even close

UTTDA3FVTs037eyiqX3xRw.text: Love their cream corn & BBQ shrimp! Service was top-notch, friendly and attentive. You can split the bone-in rib eye if you plan on ordering appetizers, sides & dessert, plenty of food for two! The only thing was, it was a little hard to locate inside The Venetian.

BOaqIje27ZaQ7ymbEaMPGQ.text: This is my 3rd visit to Delmonico and unfortunately I have to lowered my rating.  This is mainly for the service. You would imagine a fine dining establishment like Delmonico would give you top notch service when you're there, it was average at best.  I ordered a glass of wine, the bone in rib eye, the bone in new york, cream of corn, and a twice baked potato. The server kept insisting we add an appetizer and a half bottle of wine to our order. I know its their job to encourage customers to order more, but I had a sense the server felt like I wasn't spending enough to justify exceptional service.  This may be a pet-peeve of mine, but I hate it when the server doesn't bring you the bill nor does he bring you back the bill after you paid. The runner did this. The runner also was the one who asked if I would like dessert. I know its a busy restaurant, but the server could have brought back the bill and asked if I enjoyed everything (what if something was wrong?). Again this is a pet-peeve of mine.  Ratings for the food:  Bone in Rib Eye: 5/5 stars Bone in New York: 4/5 stars Cream of Corn: 5 stars Twice Baked Potato: 4/5 stars Regular Idaho Potato (from a previous stay): 3/5 stars Calamari (from a previous stay): 3/5 stars Dinner Rolls: 5/5 stars

x932oEL3clx0yokhhDlH7w.text: Ambiance is zilch -- honestly I don't know how the decor could be more plain and completely un-styled.  Sommelier unfamiliar with the wine we picked.  Steak was cooked correctly, but thin (for a premium steakhouse) and presentation was poor -- cooled and congealed greasy sauce/butter.  I am skeptical of the USDA Prime rating for this steak -- it was nowhere near as high quality as other Prime steaks I've had.  Creamed spinach was oddly tough and chewy -- I don't even know how that is possible but it was.  On the plus side, the lighting is effective and the whisky and bourbon selection is great.  Service felt very scripted and impersonal.  I can't believe the reputation this place has.  I guess it is Vegas, and when people pay top dollar they put on their rose tinted glasses and fail to see that the emperor has no clothes.  If it was not for the price and reputation, i would say it was a decent meal.  But it was so not even in the same ballpark as meals I've had for the same price at El Gaucho, the Metropolitan Grill, Wolfgang's in Manhattan, and steaks in Brazil and Argentina.

Oft_sgwnvATEMneGlif58w.text: My husband brought me here for my birthday. I have nothing but good to say about all the staff here. The food was fantastic! I ordered the bone in rib eye.. well done and it was perfect, They where courteous and got our order right! Loved it we will be coming back again.

CtY4X03JHPkFJruevadkDg.text: This was the best steak dinner I have had in Vegas hands down.  The portions are HUGE so you will leave very full.  The caprese salad was really good and the steak was amazing.  I was not so impressed with their dessert menu.  I would definitely come back.  My only complaint was that a meal takes a while at this place so be prepared for a leisurely dinner here.

YD40zorYXCEw8c28SvtLIg.text: Had the most amazing dinner here with my wife the other night.  Very fancy restaurant, but gives off a warm ambiance.  We were looking for a great meal to spend $150-200 on, and we hit it out of the park with this place located in the Venetian shoppes.    Quick rundown:  Food was absolutely amazing.  My wife had the BBQ Salmon and she is still talking about it days later.  I had the rib-eye and I have to say that it was on par with any other steak I have had, including my fav Maestro's.    Service was what you would expect from an establishment like this, impeccable.  Constant checking in and recommendations that were absolutely perfect!  Was impressed when I asked for a wine recommendation with my steak I was not told the most expensive bottle they had, rather the one that went best with the meal.  Overall if you are in Vegas and looking for a classy and elegant dinner that will cost you, give this place a try.  I don't believe you will be disappointed.
